Hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֗י אַֽחֲרֵי֙ מ֣וֹת שָׁא֔וּל וְדָוִ֣ד שָׁ֔ב מֵהַכּ֖וֹת אֶת־הָעֲמָלֵ֑ק וַיֵּ֧שֶׁב דָּוִ֛ד בְּצִֽקְלָ֖ג יָמִ֥ים שְׁנָֽיִם׃
Translated: After the death of Saul—David had already returned from defeating the Amalekites—David stayed two days in Ziklag.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey mvot shaul vedavid shav mehakhvot et-haamalek vayeshev david vetsikelag yamiym shenayiim

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֗י וְהִנֵּה֩ אִ֨ישׁ בָּ֤א מִן־הַֽמַּחֲנֶה֙ מֵעִ֣ם שָׁא֔וּל וּבְגָדָ֣יו קְרֻעִ֔ים וַאֲדָמָ֖ה עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וַֽיְהִי֙ בְּבֹא֣וֹ אֶל־דָּוִ֔ד וַיִּפֹּ֥ל אַ֖רְצָה וַיִּשְׁתָּֽחוּ׃
Translated: On the third day, a man came from Saul’s camp, with his clothes rent and earth on his head; and as he approached David, he flung himself to the ground and bowed low.
Transliteration: vayehiy vayyvom hasheliyshiy vehineh iysh va min-hamachaneh meim shaul uvegadayv keruiym vaadamah al-roshvo vayehiy vevovo el-david vayifol aretsah vayishetachu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ דָּוִ֔ד אֵ֥י מִזֶּ֖ה תָּב֑וֹא וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו מִמַּחֲנֵ֥ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל נִמְלָֽטְתִּי׃
Translated: David said to him, “Where are you coming from?” He answered, “I have just escaped from the camp of Israel.”
Transliteration: vayomer lvo david ey mizeh tavvo vayomer elayv mimachaneh yisherael nimelatetiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֥יו דָּוִ֛ד מֶה־הָיָ֥ה הַדָּבָ֖ר הַגֶּד־נָ֣א לִ֑י וַ֠יֹּ֠אמֶר אֲשֶׁר־נָ֨ס הָעָ֜ם מִן־הַמִּלְחָמָ֗ה וְגַם־הַרְבֵּ֞ה נָפַ֤ל מִן־הָעָם֙ וַיָּמֻ֔תוּ וְגַ֗ם שָׁא֛וּל וִיהוֹנָתָ֥ן בְּנ֖וֹ מֵֽתוּ׃
Translated: “What happened?” asked David. “Tell me!” And he told him how the troops had fled the battlefield, and that, moreover, many of the troops had fallen and died; also that Saul and his son Jonathan were dead.
Transliteration: vayomer elayv david meh-hayah hadavar haged-na liy vayomer asher-nas haam min-hamilechamah vegam-hareveh nafal min-haam vayamutu vegam shaul viyhvonatan venvo metu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֔ד אֶל־הַנַּ֖עַר הַמַּגִּ֣יד ל֑וֹ אֵ֣יךְ יָדַ֔עְתָּ כִּֽי־מֵ֥ת שָׁא֖וּל וִיהוֹנָתָ֥ן בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: “How do you know,” David asked the young man who brought him the news, “that Saul and his son Jonathan are dead?”
Transliteration: vayomer david el-hanaar hamagiyd lvo eykhe yadaeta khiy-met shaul viyhvonatan venvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֜אמֶר הַנַּ֣עַר ׀ הַמַּגִּ֣יד ל֗וֹ נִקְרֹ֤א נִקְרֵ֙יתִי֙ בְּהַ֣ר הַגִּלְבֹּ֔עַ וְהִנֵּ֥ה שָׁא֖וּל נִשְׁעָ֣ן עַל־חֲנִית֑וֹ וְהִנֵּ֥ה הָרֶ֛כֶב וּבַעֲלֵ֥י הַפָּרָשִׁ֖ים הִדְבִּקֻֽהוּ׃
Translated: The young man who brought him the news answered, “I happened to be at Mount Gilboa, and I saw Saul leaning on his spear, and the chariots and riders closing in on him.
Transliteration: vayomer hanaar hamagiyd lvo nikero nikereytiy vehar hagilevoa vehineh shaul nishean al-chaniytvo vehineh harekhev uvaaley hafarashiym hidevikuhu

Hebrew: וַיִּ֥פֶן אַחֲרָ֖יו וַיִּרְאֵ֑נִי וַיִּקְרָ֣א אֵלַ֔י וָאֹמַ֖ר הִנֵּֽנִי׃
Translated: He looked around and saw me, and he called to me. When I responded, ‘At your service,’
Transliteration: vayifen acharayv vayireeniy vayikera elay vaomar hineniy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר לִ֖י מִי־אָ֑תָּה (ויאמר) [וָאֹמַ֣ר] אֵלָ֔יו עֲמָלֵקִ֖י אָנֹֽכִי׃
Translated: he asked me, ‘Who are you?’ And I told him that I was an Amalekite.
Transliteration: vayomer liy miy-atah (vymr) [vaomar] elayv amalekiy anokhiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלַ֗י עֲמׇד־נָ֤א עָלַי֙ וּמֹ֣תְתֵ֔נִי כִּ֥י אֲחָזַ֖נִי הַשָּׁבָ֑ץ כִּֽי־כׇל־ע֥וֹד נַפְשִׁ֖י בִּֽי׃
Translated: Then he said to me, ‘Stand over me, and finish me off, for I am in agony and am barely alive.’
Transliteration: vayomer elay amׇd-na alay umoteteniy khiy achazaniy hashavats khiy-khׇl-vod nafeshiy viy

Hebrew: וָאֶעֱמֹ֤ד עָלָיו֙ וַאֲמֹ֣תְתֵ֔הוּ כִּ֣י יָדַ֔עְתִּי כִּ֛י לֹ֥א יִֽחְיֶ֖ה אַחֲרֵ֣י נִפְל֑וֹ וָאֶקַּ֞ח הַנֵּ֣זֶר ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־רֹאשׁ֗וֹ וְאֶצְעָדָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־זְרֹע֔וֹ וָאֲבִיאֵ֥ם אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֖י הֵֽנָּה׃
Translated: So I stood over him and finished him off, for I knew that he would never rise from where he was lying. Then I took the crown from his head and the armlet from his arm, and I have brought them here to my lord.”
Transliteration: vaeemod alayv vaamotetehu khiy yadaetiy khiy lo yicheyeh acharey nifelvo vaekach hanezer asher al-roshvo veetseadah asher al-zerovo vaaviyem el-adoniy henah

Hebrew: וַיַּחֲזֵ֥ק דָּוִ֛ד בִּבְגָדָ֖ו וַיִּקְרָעֵ֑ם וְגַ֥ם כׇּל־הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: David took hold of his clothes and rent them, and so did all the men with him.
Transliteration: vayachazek david vivegadav vayikeraem vegam khׇl-haanashiym asher itvo

Hebrew: וַֽיִּסְפְּדוּ֙ וַיִּבְכּ֔וּ וַיָּצֻ֖מוּ עַד־הָעָ֑רֶב עַל־שָׁא֞וּל וְעַל־יְהוֹנָתָ֣ן בְּנ֗וֹ וְעַל־עַ֤ם יְהֹוָה֙ וְעַל־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֥י נָפְל֖וּ בֶּחָֽרֶב׃ {פ}
Translated: They lamented and wept, and they fasted until evening for Saul and his son Jonathan, and for the soldiers of G<small>OD</small> and the House of Israel who had fallen by the sword.
Transliteration: vayisefedu vayivekhu vayatsumu ad-haarev al-shaul veal-yehvonatan venvo veal-am yehovah veal-veyt yisherael khiy nafelu vecharev {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֗ד אֶל־הַנַּ֙עַר֙ הַמַּגִּ֣יד ל֔וֹ אֵ֥י מִזֶּ֖ה אָ֑תָּה וַיֹּ֕אמֶר בֶּן־אִ֛ישׁ גֵּ֥ר עֲמָלֵקִ֖י אָנֹֽכִי׃
Translated: David said to the young man who had brought him the news, “Where are you from?” He replied, “I am the son of a resident alien, an Amalekite.”
Transliteration: vayomer david el-hanaar hamagiyd lvo ey mizeh atah vayomer ven-iysh ger amalekiy anokhiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו דָּוִ֑ד אֵ֚יךְ לֹ֣א יָרֵ֔אתָ לִשְׁלֹ֙חַ֙ יָֽדְךָ֔ לְשַׁחֵ֖ת אֶת־מְשִׁ֥יחַ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: “How did you dare,” David said to him, “to lift your hand and kill G<small>OD</small>’s anointed?”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv david eykhe lo yareta lishelocha yadekha leshachet et-meshiycha yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א דָוִ֗ד לְאַחַד֙ מֵֽהַנְּעָרִ֔ים וַיֹּ֖אמֶר גַּ֣שׁ פְּגַע־בּ֑וֹ וַיַּכֵּ֖הוּ וַיָּמֹֽת׃
Translated: Thereupon David called one of the attendants and said to him, “Come over and strike him!” He struck him down and he died.
Transliteration: vayikera david leachad mehaneariym vayomer gash fega-vvo vayakhehu vayamot

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ דָּוִ֔ד (דמיך) [דָּמְךָ֖] עַל־רֹאשֶׁ֑ךָ כִּ֣י פִ֗יךָ עָנָ֤ה בְךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אָנֹכִ֥י מֹתַ֖תִּי אֶת־מְשִׁ֥יחַ יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: And David said to him, “Your blood be on your own head! Your own mouth testified against you when you said, ‘I put G<small>OD</small>’s anointed to death.’”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv david (dmykh) [damekha] al-roshekha khiy fiykha anah vekha lemor anokhiy motatiy et-meshiycha yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְקֹנֵ֣ן דָּוִ֔ד אֶת־הַקִּינָ֖ה הַזֹּ֑את עַל־שָׁא֖וּל וְעַל־יְהוֹנָתָ֥ן בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: And David intoned this dirge over Saul and his son Jonathan—
Transliteration: vayekonen david et-hakiynah hazot al-shaul veal-yehvonatan venvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר לְלַמֵּ֥ד בְּנֵֽי־יְהוּדָ֖ה קָ֑שֶׁת הִנֵּ֥ה כְתוּבָ֖ה עַל־סֵ֥פֶר הַיָּשָֽׁר׃
Translated: He ordered the Judahites to be taught [The Song of the] Bow. It is recorded in the Book of Jashar.
Transliteration: vayomer lelamed veney-yehudah kashet hineh khetuvah al-sefer hayashar

Hebrew: הַצְּבִי֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עַל־בָּמוֹתֶ֖יךָ חָלָ֑ל אֵ֖יךְ נָפְל֥וּ גִבּוֹרִֽים׃
Translated:
Your glory, O Israel,
Lies slain on your heights;
How have the mighty fallen!
Transliteration: hatseviy yisherael al-vamvoteykha chalal eykhe nafelu givvoriym

Hebrew: אַל־תַּגִּ֣ידֽוּ בְגַ֔ת אַֽל־תְּבַשְּׂר֖וּ בְּחוּצֹ֣ת אַשְׁקְל֑וֹן פֶּן־תִּשְׂמַ֙חְנָה֙ בְּנ֣וֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים פֶּֽן־תַּעֲלֹ֖זְנָה בְּנ֥וֹת הָעֲרֵלִֽים׃
Translated:
Tell it not in Gath,
Do not proclaim it in the streets of Ashkelon,
Lest the daughters of the Philistine rejoice,
Lest the daughters of the uncircumcised exult.
Transliteration: al-tagiydu vegat al-tevasheru vechutsot ashekelvon fen-tishemachenah venvot felishetiym fen-taalozenah venvot haareliym

Hebrew: הָרֵ֣י בַגִּלְבֹּ֗עַ אַל־טַ֧ל וְאַל־מָטָ֛ר עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם וּשְׂדֵ֣י תְרוּמֹ֑ת כִּ֣י שָׁ֤ם נִגְעַל֙ מָגֵ֣ן גִּבּוֹרִ֔ים מָגֵ֣ן שָׁא֔וּל בְּלִ֖י מָשִׁ֥יחַ בַּשָּֽׁמֶן׃
Translated:
O hills of Gilboa—
Let there be no dew or rain on you,
Or bountiful fields,
For there the shield of warriors lay rejected,
The shield of Saul,
Polished with oil no more.
Transliteration: harey vagilevoa al-tal veal-matar aleykhem ushedey terumot khiy sham nigeal magen givvoriym magen shaul veliy mashiycha vashamen

Hebrew: מִדַּ֣ם חֲלָלִ֗ים מֵחֵ֙לֶב֙ גִּבּוֹרִ֔ים קֶ֚שֶׁת יְה֣וֹנָתָ֔ן לֹ֥א נָשׂ֖וֹג אָח֑וֹר וְחֶ֣רֶב שָׁא֔וּל לֹ֥א תָשׁ֖וּב רֵיקָֽם׃
Translated:
From the blood of slain,
From the fat of warriors—
The bow of Jonathan
Never turned back;
The sword of Saul
Never withdrew empty.
Transliteration: midam chalaliym mechelev givvoriym keshet yehvonatan lo nashvog achvor vecherev shaul lo tashuv reykam

Hebrew: שָׁא֣וּל וִיהוֹנָתָ֗ן הַנֶּאֱהָבִ֤ים וְהַנְּעִימִם֙ בְּחַיֵּיהֶ֔ם וּבְמוֹתָ֖ם לֹ֣א נִפְרָ֑דוּ מִנְּשָׁרִ֣ים קַ֔לּוּ מֵאֲרָי֖וֹת גָּבֵֽרוּ׃
Translated:
Saul and Jonathan,
Beloved and cherished,
Never parted
In life or in death!
They were swifter than eagles,
They were stronger than lions!
Transliteration: shaul viyhvonatan haneehaviym vehaneiymim vechayeyhem uvemvotam lo niferadu mineshariym kalu mearayvot gaveru

Hebrew: בְּנוֹת֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶל־שָׁא֖וּל בְּכֶ֑ינָה הַמַּלְבִּֽשְׁכֶ֤ם שָׁנִי֙ עִם־עֲדָנִ֔ים הַֽמַּעֲלֶה֙ עֲדִ֣י זָהָ֔ב עַ֖ל לְבוּשְׁכֶֽן׃
Translated:
Daughters of Israel,
Weep over Saul,
Who clothed you in crimson and finery,
Who decked your robes with jewels of gold.
Transliteration: venvot yisherael el-shaul vekheynah hamalevishekhem shaniy im-adaniym hamaaleh adiy zahav al levushekhen

Hebrew: אֵ֚יךְ נָפְל֣וּ גִבֹּרִ֔ים בְּת֖וֹךְ הַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה יְה֣וֹנָתָ֔ן עַל־בָּמוֹתֶ֖יךָ חָלָֽל׃
Translated:
How have the mighty fallen
In the thick of battle—
Jonathan, slain on your heights!
Transliteration: eykhe nafelu givoriym vetvokhe hamilechamah yehvonatan al-vamvoteykha chalal

Hebrew: צַר־לִ֣י עָלֶ֗יךָ אָחִי֙ יְה֣וֹנָתָ֔ן נָעַ֥מְתָּ לִּ֖י מְאֹ֑ד נִפְלְאַ֤תָה אַהֲבָֽתְךָ֙ לִ֔י מֵאַהֲבַ֖ת נָשִֽׁים׃
Translated:
I grieve for you,
My brother Jonathan,
You were most dear to me.
Your love was wonderful to me
More than the love of women.
Transliteration: tsar-liy aleykha achiy yehvonatan naameta liy meod nifeleatah ahavatekha liy meahavat nashiym

Hebrew: אֵ֚יךְ נָפְל֣וּ גִבּוֹרִ֔ים וַיֹּאבְד֖וּ כְּלֵ֥י מִלְחָמָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
How have the mighty fallen,
The weapons of war perished!
Transliteration: eykhe nafelu givvoriym vayovedu kheley milechamah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י אַחֲרֵי־כֵ֗ן וַיִּשְׁאַל֩ דָּוִ֨ד בַּיהֹוָ֤ה <small>׀</small> לֵאמֹר֙ הַאֶֽעֱלֶ֗ה בְּאַחַת֙ עָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֵלָ֖יו עֲלֵ֑ה וַיֹּ֧אמֶר דָּוִ֛ד אָ֥נָה אֶעֱלֶ֖ה וַיֹּ֥אמֶר חֶבְרֹֽנָה׃
Translated: Sometime afterward, David inquired of G<small>OD</small>, “Shall I go up to one of the towns of Judah?” G<small>OD</small> answered, “Yes.” David further asked, “Which one shall I go up to?” And G<small>OD</small> replied, “To Hebron.”
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey-khen vayisheal david vayhovah <small></small> lemor haeeleh veachat arey yehudah vayomer yehovah elayv aleh vayomer david anah eeleh vayomer cheveronah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַל שָׁם֙ דָּוִ֔ד וְגַ֖ם שְׁתֵּ֣י נָשָׁ֑יו אֲחִינֹ֙עַם֙ הַיִּזְרְעֵלִ֔ית וַאֲבִיגַ֕יִל אֵ֖שֶׁת נָבָ֥ל הַֽכַּרְמְלִֽי׃
Translated: So David went up there, along with his two wives, Ahinoam of Jezreel and Abigail wife of Nabal the Carmelite.
Transliteration: vayaal sham david vegam shetey nashayv achiynoam hayizereeliyt vaaviygayiil eshet naval hakharemeliy

Hebrew: וַאֲנָשָׁ֧יו אֲשֶׁר־עִמּ֛וֹ הֶעֱלָ֥ה דָוִ֖ד אִ֣ישׁ וּבֵית֑וֹ וַיֵּשְׁב֖וּ בְּעָרֵ֥י חֶבְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: David also took the men who were with him, each with his family, and they settled in the towns about Hebron.
Transliteration: vaanashayv asher-imvo heelah david iysh uveytvo vayeshevu vearey chevervon

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ אַנְשֵׁ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וַיִּמְשְׁחוּ־שָׁ֧ם אֶת־דָּוִ֛ד לְמֶ֖לֶךְ עַל־בֵּ֣ית יְהוּדָ֑ה וַיַּגִּ֤דוּ לְדָוִד֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אַנְשֵׁי֙ יָבֵ֣ישׁ גִּלְעָ֔ד אֲשֶׁ֥ר קָבְר֖וּ אֶת־שָׁאֽוּל׃ {ס}
Translated:
The people of Judah came and there they anointed David king over the House of Judah.
David was told about the agents of Jabesh-gilead who buried Saul.
Transliteration: vayavou aneshey yehudah vayimeshechu-sham et-david lemelekhe al-veyt yehudah vayagidu ledavid lemor aneshey yaveysh gilead asher kaveru et-shaul {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח דָּוִד֙ מַלְאָכִ֔ים אֶל־אַנְשֵׁ֖י יָבֵ֣ישׁ גִּלְעָ֑ד וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם בְּרֻכִ֤ים אַתֶּם֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר עֲשִׂיתֶ֜ם הַחֶ֣סֶד הַזֶּ֗ה עִם־אֲדֹֽנֵיכֶם֙ עִם־שָׁא֔וּל וַֽתִּקְבְּר֖וּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: So David sent messengers to the people of Jabesh-gilead and said to them, “May you be blessed of G<small>OD</small> because you performed this act of faithfulness to your lord Saul and buried him.
Transliteration: vayishelach david maleakhiym el-aneshey yaveysh gilead vayomer aleyhem verukhiym atem layhovah asher ashiytem hachesed hazeh im-adoneykhem im-shaul vatikeveru otvo

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה יַעַשׂ־יְהֹוָ֥ה עִמָּכֶ֖ם חֶ֣סֶד וֶאֱמֶ֑ת וְגַ֣ם אָנֹכִ֗י אֶעֱשֶׂ֤ה אִתְּכֶם֙ הַטּוֹבָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את אֲשֶׁ֥ר עֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: May G<small>OD</small> in turn show you true faithfulness; and I too will reward you generously because you performed this act.
Transliteration: veatah yaash-yehovah imakhem chesed veemet vegam anokhiy eesheh itekhem hatvovah hazot asher ashiytem hadavar hazeh

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה ׀ תֶּחֱזַ֣קְנָה יְדֵיכֶ֗ם וִֽהְיוּ֙ לִבְנֵי־חַ֔יִל כִּי־מֵ֖ת אֲדֹנֵיכֶ֣ם שָׁא֑וּל וְגַם־אֹתִ֗י מָשְׁח֧וּ בֵית־יְהוּדָ֛ה לְמֶ֖לֶךְ עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Now take courage and be brave; for your lord Saul is dead and the House of Judah have already anointed me king over them.”
Transliteration: veatah techezakenah yedeykhem viheyu liveney-chayiil khiy-met adoneykhem shaul vegam-otiy mashechu veyt-yehudah lemelekhe aleyhem {f}

Hebrew: וְאַבְנֵ֣ר בֶּן־נֵ֔ר שַׂר־צָבָ֖א אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְשָׁא֑וּל לָקַ֗ח אֶת־אִ֥ישׁ בֹּ֙שֶׁת֙ בֶּן־שָׁא֔וּל וַיַּעֲבִרֵ֖הוּ מַחֲנָֽיִם׃
Translated: But Abner son of Ner, Saul’s army commander, had taken Ish-bosheth son of Saul and brought him across to Mahanaim
Transliteration: veavener ven-ner shar-tsava asher leshaul lakach et-iysh voshet ven-shaul vayaavirehu machanayiim

Hebrew: וַיַּמְלִכֵ֙הוּ֙ אֶל־הַגִּלְעָ֔ד וְאֶל־הָאֲשׁוּרִ֖י וְאֶֽל־יִזְרְעֶ֑אל וְעַל־אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ וְעַל־בִּנְיָמִ֔ן וְעַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כֻּלֹּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: and made him king over Gilead, the Ashurites, Jezreel, Ephraim, and Benjamin—over all Israel.
Transliteration: vayamelikhehu el-hagilead veel-haashuriy veel-yizereel veal-eferayiim veal-vineyamin veal-yisherael khuloh {f}

Hebrew: בֶּן־אַרְבָּעִ֨ים שָׁנָ֜ה אִֽישׁ־בֹּ֣שֶׁת בֶּן־שָׁא֗וּל בְּמׇלְכוֹ֙ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וּשְׁתַּ֥יִם שָׁנִ֖ים מָלָ֑ךְ אַ֚ךְ בֵּ֣ית יְהוּדָ֔ה הָי֖וּ אַחֲרֵ֥י דָוִֽד׃
Translated: Ish-bosheth son of Saul was forty years old when he became king of Israel, and he reigned two years. But the House of Judah supported David.
Transliteration: ven-arevaiym shanah iysh-voshet ven-shaul vemׇlekhvo al-yisherael ushetayiim shaniym malakhe akhe veyt yehudah hayu acharey david

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ מִסְפַּ֣ר הַיָּמִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר֩ הָיָ֨ה דָוִ֥ד מֶ֛לֶךְ בְּחֶבְר֖וֹן עַל־בֵּ֣ית יְהוּדָ֑ה שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִ֖ים וְשִׁשָּׁ֥ה חֳדָשִֽׁים׃ {ס}
Translated: The length of time that David reigned in Hebron over the House of Judah was seven years and six months.
Transliteration: vayehiy misefar hayamiym asher hayah david melekhe vechevervon al-veyt yehudah sheva shaniym veshishah chodashiym {s}

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא֙ אַבְנֵ֣ר בֶּן־נֵ֔ר וְעַבְדֵ֖י אִֽישׁ־בֹּ֣שֶׁת בֶּן־שָׁא֑וּל מִֽמַּחֲנַ֖יִם גִּבְעֽוֹנָה׃
Translated: Once Abner son of Ner and the soldiers of Ish-bosheth son of Saul marched out from Mahanaim to Gibeon,
Transliteration: vayetse avener ven-ner veavedey iysh-voshet ven-shaul mimachanayiim givevonah

Hebrew: וְיוֹאָ֨ב בֶּן־צְרוּיָ֜ה וְעַבְדֵ֤י דָוִד֙ יָֽצְא֔וּ וַֽיִּפְגְּשׁ֛וּם עַל־בְּרֵכַ֥ת גִּבְע֖וֹן יַחְדָּ֑ו וַיֵּ֨שְׁב֜וּ אֵ֤לֶּה עַל־הַבְּרֵכָה֙ מִזֶּ֔ה וְאֵ֥לֶּה עַל־הַבְּרֵכָ֖ה מִזֶּֽה׃
Translated: and Joab son of Zeruiah and the soldiers of David [also] came out. They confronted one another at the pool of Gibeon: one group sat on one side of the pool, and the other group on the other side of the pool.
Transliteration: veyvoav ven-tseruyah veavedey david yatseu vayifegeshum al-verekhat givevon yachedav vayeshevu eleh al-haverekhah mizeh veeleh al-haverekhah mizeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אַבְנֵר֙ אֶל־יוֹאָ֔ב יָק֤וּמוּ נָא֙ הַנְּעָרִ֔ים וִישַׂחֲק֖וּ לְפָנֵ֑ינוּ וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יוֹאָ֖ב יָקֻֽמוּ׃
Translated: Abner said to Joab, “Let the young men come forward and sport before us.” “Yes, let them,” Joab answered.
Transliteration: vayomer avener el-yvoav yakumu na haneariym viyshachaku lefaneynu vayomer yvoav yakumu

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֖מוּ וַיַּעַבְר֣וּ בְמִסְפָּ֑ר שְׁנֵ֧ים עָשָׂ֣ר לְבִנְיָמִ֗ן וּלְאִ֥ישׁ בֹּ֙שֶׁת֙ בֶּן־שָׁא֔וּל וּשְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר מֵעַבְדֵ֥י דָוִֽד׃
Translated: They came forward and were counted off, twelve for Benjamin and Ish-bosheth son of Saul, and twelve of David’s soldiers.
Transliteration: vayakumu vayaaveru vemisefar sheneym ashar levineyamin uleiysh voshet ven-shaul usheneym ashar meavedey david

Hebrew: וַֽיַּחֲזִ֜קוּ אִ֣ישׁ ׀ בְּרֹ֣אשׁ רֵעֵ֗הוּ וְחַרְבּוֹ֙ בְּצַ֣ד רֵעֵ֔הוּ וַֽיִּפְּל֖וּ יַחְדָּ֑ו וַיִּקְרָא֙ לַמָּק֣וֹם הַה֔וּא חֶלְקַ֥ת הַצֻּרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּגִבְעֽוֹן׃
Translated: Each one grasped his opponent’s head [and thrust] his dagger into his opponent’s side; thus they fell together. That place, which is in Gibeon, was called Helkath-hazzurim.
Transliteration: vayachaziku iysh verosh reehu vecharevvo vetsad reehu vayifelu yachedav vayikera lamakvom hahu chelekat hatsuriym asher vegivevon

Hebrew: וַתְּהִ֧י הַמִּלְחָמָ֛ה קָשָׁ֥ה עַד־מְאֹ֖ד בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וַיִּנָּ֤גֶף אַבְנֵר֙ וְאַנְשֵׁ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לִפְנֵ֖י עַבְדֵ֥י דָוִֽד׃
Translated: A fierce battle ensued that day, and Abner and the men of Israel were routed by David’s soldiers.
Transliteration: vatehiy hamilechamah kashah ad-meod vayyvom hahu vayinagef avener veaneshey yisherael lifeney avedey david

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ־שָׁ֗ם שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ בְּנֵ֣י צְרוּיָ֔ה יוֹאָ֥ב וַאֲבִישַׁ֖י וַעֲשָׂהאֵ֑ל וַֽעֲשָׂהאֵל֙ קַ֣ל בְּרַגְלָ֔יו כְּאַחַ֥ד הַצְּבָיִ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated: The three sons of Zeruiah were there—Joab, Abishai, and Asahel. Asahel was swift of foot, like a gazelle in the open field.
Transliteration: vayiheyu-sham sheloshah veney tseruyah yvoav vaaviyshay vaashahel vaashahel kal veragelayv kheachad hatsevayim asher vashadeh

Hebrew: וַיִּרְדֹּ֥ף עֲשָׂהאֵ֖ל אַחֲרֵ֣י אַבְנֵ֑ר וְלֹא־נָטָ֣ה לָלֶ֗כֶת עַל־הַיָּמִין֙ וְעַֽל־הַשְּׂמֹ֔אול מֵאַחֲרֵ֖י אַבְנֵֽר׃
Translated: And Asahel ran after Abner, swerving neither right nor left in his pursuit of Abner.
Transliteration: vayiredof ashahel acharey avener velo-natah lalekhet al-hayamiyn veal-hashemovl meacharey avener

Hebrew: וַיִּ֤פֶן אַבְנֵר֙ אַֽחֲרָ֔יו וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הַאַתָּ֥ה זֶ֖ה עֲשָׂהאֵ֑ל וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אָנֹֽכִי׃
Translated: Abner looked back and shouted, “Is that you, Asahel?” “Yes, it is,” he called back.
Transliteration: vayifen avener acharayv vayomer haatah zeh ashahel vayomer anokhiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר ל֣וֹ אַבְנֵ֗ר נְטֵ֤ה לְךָ֙ עַל־יְמִֽינְךָ֙ א֣וֹ עַל־שְׂמֹאלֶ֔ךָ וֶאֱחֹ֣ז לְךָ֗ אֶחָד֙ מֵֽהַנְּעָרִ֔ים וְקַח־לְךָ֖ אֶת־חֲלִצָת֑וֹ וְלֹא־אָבָ֣ה עֲשָׂהאֵ֔ל לָס֖וּר מֵאַחֲרָֽיו׃
Translated: Abner said to him, “Turn to the right or to the left, and seize one of our boys and strip off his tunic.” But Asahel would not leave off.
Transliteration: vayomer lvo avener neteh lekha al-yemiynekha vo al-shemolekha veechoz lekha echad mehaneariym vekach-lekha et-chalitsatvo velo-avah ashahel lasur meacharayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧סֶף ע֣וֹד אַבְנֵ֗ר לֵאמֹר֙ אֶל־עֲשָׂהאֵ֔ל ס֥וּר לְךָ֖ מֵאַֽחֲרָ֑י לָ֤מָּה אַכֶּ֙כָּה֙ אַ֔רְצָה וְאֵיךְ֙ אֶשָּׂ֣א פָנַ֔י אֶל־יוֹאָ֖ב אָחִֽיךָ׃
Translated: Abner again begged Asahel, “Stop pursuing me, or I’ll have to strike you down. How will I look your brother Joab in the face?”
Transliteration: vayosef vod avener lemor el-ashahel sur lekha meacharay lamah akhekhah aretsah veeykhe esha fanay el-yvoav achiykha

Hebrew: וַיְמָאֵ֣ן לָס֗וּר וַיַּכֵּ֣הוּ אַבְנֵר֩ בְּאַחֲרֵ֨י הַחֲנִ֜ית אֶל־הַחֹ֗מֶשׁ וַתֵּצֵ֤א הַֽחֲנִית֙ מֵֽאַחֲרָ֔יו וַיִּפׇּל־שָׁ֖ם וַיָּ֣מׇת תַּחְתָּ֑ו וַיְהִ֡י כׇּל־הַבָּ֣א אֶל־הַמָּקוֹם֩ אֲשֶׁר־נָ֨פַל שָׁ֧ם עֲשָׂהאֵ֛ל וַיָּמֹ֖ת וַֽיַּעֲמֹֽדוּ׃
Translated: When he refused to desist, Abner struck him in the belly with a backward thrust of his spear and the spear protruded from his back. He fell there and died on the spot. And all who came to the place where Asahel fell and died halted;
Transliteration: vayemaen lasur vayakhehu avener veacharey hachaniyt el-hachomesh vatetse hachaniyt meacharayv vayifׇl-sham vayamׇt tachetav vayehiy khׇl-hava el-hamakvom asher-nafal sham ashahel vayamot vayaamodu

Hebrew: וַֽיִּרְדְּפ֛וּ יוֹאָ֥ב וַאֲבִישַׁ֖י אַחֲרֵ֣י אַבְנֵ֑ר וְהַשֶּׁ֣מֶשׁ בָּ֔אָה וְהֵ֗מָּה בָּ֚אוּ עַד־גִּבְעַ֣ת אַמָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־פְּנֵי־גִ֔יחַ דֶּ֖רֶךְ מִדְבַּ֥ר גִּבְעֽוֹן׃
Translated: but Joab and Abishai continued to pursue Abner. And the sun was setting as they reached the hill of Ammah, which faces Giah on the road to the wilderness of Gibeon.
Transliteration: vayiredefu yvoav vaaviyshay acharey avener vehashemesh vaah vehemah vau ad-giveat amah asher al-feney-giycha derekhe midevar givevon

Hebrew: וַיִּֽתְקַבְּצ֤וּ בְנֵֽי־בִנְיָמִן֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י אַבְנֵ֔ר וַיִּהְי֖וּ לַאֲגֻדָּ֣ה אֶחָ֑ת וַיַּ֣עַמְד֔וּ עַ֥ל רֹאשׁ־גִּבְעָ֖ה אֶחָֽת׃
Translated: The Benjaminites rallied behind Abner, forming a single company; and they took up a position on the top of a hill.
Transliteration: vayitekavetsu veney-vineyamin acharey avener vayiheyu laagudah echat vayaamedu al rosh-giveah echat

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֨א אַבְנֵ֜ר אֶל־יוֹאָ֗ב וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הֲלָנֶ֙צַח֙ תֹּ֣אכַל חֶ֔רֶב הֲל֣וֹא יָדַ֔עְתָּה כִּי־מָרָ֥ה תִֽהְיֶ֖ה בָּאַֽחֲרוֹנָ֑ה וְעַד־מָתַי֙ לֹא־תֹאמַ֣ר לָעָ֔ם לָשׁ֖וּב מֵאַחֲרֵ֥י אֲחֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Abner then called out to Joab, “Must the sword devour forever? You know how bitterly it’s going to end! How long will you delay ordering your troops to stop the pursuit of their own kindred?”
Transliteration: vayikera avener el-yvoav vayomer halanetsach tokhal cherev halvo yadaetah khiy-marah tiheyeh vaacharvonah vead-matay lo-tomar laam lashuv meacharey acheyhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יוֹאָ֔ב חַ֚י הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים כִּ֥י לוּלֵ֖א דִּבַּ֑רְתָּ כִּ֣י אָ֤ז מֵהַבֹּ֙קֶר֙ נַעֲלָ֣ה הָעָ֔ם אִ֖ישׁ מֵאַחֲרֵ֥י אָחִֽיו׃
Translated: And Joab replied, “As God lives, if you hadn’t spoken up, the troops would have given up the pursuit of their kindred only the next morning.”
Transliteration: vayomer yvoav chay haElohim khiy lule divareta khiy az mehavoker naalah haam iysh meacharey achiyv

Hebrew: וַיִּתְקַ֤ע יוֹאָב֙ בַּשּׁוֹפָ֔ר וַיַּֽעַמְדוּ֙ כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם וְלֹא־יִרְדְּפ֥וּ ע֖וֹד אַחֲרֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלֹא־יָסְפ֥וּ ע֖וֹד לְהִלָּחֵֽם׃
Translated: Joab then sounded the horn, and all the troops halted; they ceased their pursuit of Israel and stopped the fighting.
Transliteration: vayiteka yvoav vashvofar vayaamedu khׇl-haam velo-yiredefu vod acharey yisherael velo-yasefu vod lehilachem

Hebrew: וְאַבְנֵ֣ר וַאֲנָשָׁ֗יו הָֽלְכוּ֙ בָּעֲרָבָ֔ה כֹּ֖ל הַלַּ֣יְלָה הַה֑וּא וַיַּעַבְר֣וּ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֗ן וַיֵּֽלְכוּ֙ כׇּל־הַבִּתְר֔וֹן וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ מַחֲנָֽיִם׃
Translated: Abner and his men marched through the Arabah all that night and, after crossing the Jordan, they marched through all of Bithron until they came to Mahanaim.
Transliteration: veavener vaanashayv halekhu vaaravah khol halayelah hahu vayaaveru et-hayareden vayelekhu khׇl-havitervon vayavou machanayiim

Hebrew: וְיוֹאָ֗ב שָׁ֚ב מֵאַחֲרֵ֣י אַבְנֵ֔ר וַיִּקְבֹּ֖ץ אֶת־כׇּל־הָעָ֑ם וַיִּפָּ֨קְד֜וּ מֵעַבְדֵ֥י דָוִ֛ד תִּשְׁעָה־עָשָׂ֥ר אִ֖ישׁ וַעֲשָׂהאֵֽל׃
Translated: After Joab gave up the pursuit of Abner, he assembled all the troops and found nineteen of David’s soldiers missing, besides Asahel.
Transliteration: veyvoav shav meacharey avener vayikevots et-khׇl-haam vayifakedu meavedey david tisheah-ashar iysh vaashahel

Hebrew: וְעַבְדֵ֣י דָוִ֗ד הִכּוּ֙ מִבִּנְיָמִ֔ן וּבְאַנְשֵׁ֖י אַבְנֵ֑ר שְׁלֹשׁ־מֵא֧וֹת וְשִׁשִּׁ֛ים אִ֖ישׁ מֵֽתוּ׃
Translated: David’s soldiers, on the other hand, defeated the Benjaminites and the men under Abner and killed three hundred and sixty of them.
Transliteration: veavedey david hikhu mivineyamin uveaneshey avener shelosh-mevot veshishiym iysh metu

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂאוּ֙ אֶת־עֲשָׂהאֵ֔ל וַֽיִּקְבְּרֻ֙הוּ֙ בְּקֶ֣בֶר אָבִ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֖ר בֵּ֣ית לָ֑חֶם וַיֵּלְכ֣וּ כׇל־הַלַּ֗יְלָה יוֹאָב֙ וַאֲנָשָׁ֔יו וַיֵּאֹ֥ר לָהֶ֖ם בְּחֶבְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: They bore Asahel away and buried him in his father’s tomb in Bethlehem. Then Joab and his men marched all night; day broke upon them in Hebron.
Transliteration: vayisheu et-ashahel vayikeveruhu vekever aviyv asher veyt lachem vayelekhu khׇl-halayelah yvoav vaanashayv vayeor lahem vechevervon

Hebrew: וַתְּהִ֤י הַמִּלְחָמָה֙ אֲרֻכָּ֔ה בֵּ֚ין בֵּ֣ית שָׁא֔וּל וּבֵ֖ין בֵּ֣ית דָּוִ֑ד וְדָוִד֙ הֹלֵ֣ךְ וְחָזֵ֔ק וּבֵ֥ית שָׁא֖וּל הֹלְכִ֥ים וְדַלִּֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: The war between the House of Saul and the House of David was long-drawn-out; but David kept growing stronger, while the House of Saul grew weaker.
Transliteration: vatehiy hamilechamah arukhah veyn veyt shaul uveyn veyt david vedavid holekhe vechazek uveyt shaul holekhiym vedaliym {s}

Hebrew: (וילדו) [וַיִּוָּלְד֧וּ] לְדָוִ֛ד בָּנִ֖ים בְּחֶבְר֑וֹן וַיְהִ֤י בְכוֹרוֹ֙ אַמְנ֔וֹן לַאֲחִינֹ֖עַם הַיִּזְרְעֵאלִֽת׃
Translated: Sons were born to David in Hebron: His first-born was Amnon, by Ahinoam of Jezreel;
Transliteration: (vyldv) [vayivaledu] ledavid vaniym vechevervon vayehiy vekhvorvo amenvon laachiynoam hayizereelit

Hebrew: וּמִשְׁנֵ֣הוּ כִלְאָ֔ב (לאביגל) [לַאֲבִיגַ֕יִל] אֵ֖שֶׁת נָבָ֣ל הַֽכַּרְמְלִ֑י וְהַשְּׁלִשִׁי֙ אַבְשָׁל֣וֹם בֶּֽן־מַעֲכָ֔ה בַּת־תַּלְמַ֖י מֶ֥לֶךְ גְּשֽׁוּר׃
Translated: his second was Chileab, by Abigail wife of Nabal the Carmelite; the third was Absalom son of Maacah, daughter of King Talmai of Geshur;
Transliteration: umishenehu khileav (lvygl) [laaviygayiil] eshet naval hakharemeliy vehashelishiy aveshalvom ven-maakhah vat-talemay melekhe geshur

Hebrew: וְהָרְבִיעִ֖י אֲדֹנִיָּ֣ה בֶן־חַגִּ֑ית וְהַחֲמִישִׁ֖י שְׁפַטְיָ֥ה בֶן־אֲבִיטָֽל׃
Translated: the fourth was Adonijah son of Haggith; the fifth was Shephatiah son of Abital;
Transliteration: vehareviyiy adoniyah ven-chagiyt vehachamiyshiy shefateyah ven-aviytal

Hebrew: וְהַשִּׁשִּׁ֣י יִתְרְעָ֔ם לְעֶגְלָ֖ה אֵ֣שֶׁת דָּוִ֑ד אֵ֛לֶּה יֻלְּד֥וּ לְדָוִ֖ד בְּחֶבְרֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated: and the sixth was Ithream, by David’s wife Eglah. These were born to David in Hebron.
Transliteration: vehashishiy yiteream leegelah eshet david eleh yuledu ledavid vechevervon {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בִּֽהְיוֹת֙ הַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה בֵּ֚ין בֵּ֣ית שָׁא֔וּל וּבֵ֖ין בֵּ֣ית דָּוִ֑ד וְאַבְנֵ֛ר הָיָ֥ה מִתְחַזֵּ֖ק בְּבֵ֥ית שָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: During the war between the House of Saul and the House of David, Abner supported the House of Saul.
Transliteration: vayehiy viheyvot hamilechamah veyn veyt shaul uveyn veyt david veavener hayah mitechazek veveyt shaul

Hebrew: וּלְשָׁא֣וּל פִּלֶ֔גֶשׁ וּשְׁמָ֖הּ רִצְפָּ֣ה בַת־אַיָּ֑ה וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־אַבְנֵ֔ר מַדּ֥וּעַ בָּ֖אתָה אֶל־פִּילֶ֥גֶשׁ אָבִֽי׃
Translated: Now Saul had a concubine named Rizpah, daughter of Aiah; and [Ish-bosheth] said to Abner, “Why have you lain with my father’s concubine?”
Transliteration: uleshaul filegesh ushemah ritsefah vat-ayah vayomer el-avener madua vatah el-fiylegesh aviy

Hebrew: וַיִּ֩חַר֩ לְאַבְנֵ֨ר מְאֹ֜ד עַל־דִּבְרֵ֣י אִֽישׁ־בֹּ֗שֶׁת וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הֲרֹ֨אשׁ כֶּ֥לֶב אָנֹ֘כִי֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לִֽיהוּדָה֒ הַיּ֨וֹם אֶעֱשֶׂה־חֶ֜סֶד עִם־בֵּ֣ית ׀ שָׁא֣וּל אָבִ֗יךָ אֶל־אֶחָיו֙ וְאֶל־מֵ֣רֵעֵ֔הוּ וְלֹ֥א הִמְצִיתִ֖ךָ בְּיַד־דָּוִ֑ד וַתִּפְקֹ֥ד עָלַ֛י עֲוֺ֥ן הָאִשָּׁ֖ה הַיּֽוֹם׃ {ס}
Translated: Abner was very upset by what Ish-bosheth said, and he replied, “Am I a dog’s head from Judah? Here I have been loyally serving the House of your father Saul and his kin and friends, and I have not betrayed you into the hands of David; yet this day—over this woman—you reproach me!
Transliteration: vayichar leavener meod al-diverey iysh-voshet vayomer harosh khelev anokhiy asher liyhudah hayyvom eesheh-chesed im-veyt shaul aviykha el-echayv veel-mereehu velo himetsiytikha veyad-david vatifekod alay avon haishah hayyvom {s}

Hebrew: כֹּֽה־יַעֲשֶׂ֤ה אֱלֹהִים֙ לְאַבְנֵ֔ר וְכֹ֖ה יֹסִ֣יף ל֑וֹ כִּ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֤ע יְהֹוָה֙ לְדָוִ֔ד כִּי־כֵ֖ן אֶעֱשֶׂה־לּֽוֹ׃
Translated: May God do thus and more to Abner if I do not do for David as G<small>OD</small> swore to him—
Transliteration: khoh-yaasheh Elohim leavener vekhoh yosiyf lvo khiy khaasher nisheva yehovah ledavid khiy-khen eesheh-lvo

Hebrew: לְהַעֲבִ֥יר הַמַּמְלָכָ֖ה מִבֵּ֣ית שָׁא֑וּל וּלְהָקִ֞ים אֶת־כִּסֵּ֣א דָוִ֗ד עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְעַל־יְהוּדָ֔ה מִדָּ֖ן וְעַד־בְּאֵ֥ר שָֽׁבַע׃
Translated: to transfer the kingship from the House of Saul, and to establish the throne of David over Israel and Judah from Dan to Beer-sheba.”
Transliteration: lehaaviyr hamamelakhah miveyt shaul ulehakiym et-khise david al-yisherael veal-yehudah midan vead-veer shava

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יָכֹ֣ל ע֔וֹד לְהָשִׁ֥יב אֶת־אַבְנֵ֖ר דָּבָ֑ר מִיִּרְאָת֖וֹ אֹתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: [Ish-bosheth] could say nothing more in reply to Abner, because he was afraid of him.
Transliteration: velo-yakhol vod lehashiyv et-avener davar miyireatvo otvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֩ אַבְנֵ֨ר מַלְאָכִ֧ים <small>׀</small> אֶל־דָּוִ֛ד תַּחְתָּ֥ו לֵאמֹ֖ר לְמִי־אָ֑רֶץ לֵאמֹ֗ר כׇּרְתָ֤ה בְרִֽיתְךָ֙ אִתִּ֔י וְהִנֵּה֙ יָדִ֣י עִמָּ֔ךְ לְהָסֵ֥ב אֵלֶ֖יךָ אֶת־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Abner immediately sent messengers to David, saying, “To whom shall the land belong?” and to say [further], “Make a pact with me, and I will help you and bring all Israel over to your side.”
Transliteration: vayishelach avener maleakhiym <small></small> el-david tachetav lemor lemiy-arets lemor khׇretah veriytekha itiy vehineh yadiy imakhe lehasev eleykha et-khׇl-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ט֔וֹב אֲנִ֕י אֶכְרֹ֥ת אִתְּךָ֖ בְּרִ֑ית אַ֣ךְ דָּבָ֣ר אֶחָ֡ד אָנֹכִי֩ שֹׁאֵ֨ל מֵאִתְּךָ֤ לֵאמֹר֙ לֹא־תִרְאֶ֣ה אֶת־פָּנַ֔י כִּ֣י ׀ אִם־לִפְנֵ֣י הֱבִיאֲךָ֗ אֵ֚ת מִיכַ֣ל בַּת־שָׁא֔וּל בְּבֹאֲךָ֖ לִרְא֥וֹת אֶת־פָּנָֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: He replied, “Good; I will make a pact with you. But I make one demand upon you: Do not appear before me unless you bring Michal daughter of Saul when you come before me.”
Transliteration: vayomer tvov aniy ekherot itekha veriyt akhe davar echad anokhiy shoel meitekha lemor lo-tireeh et-fanay khiy im-lifeney heviyakha et miykhal vat-shaul vevoakha lirevot et-fanay {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח דָּוִד֙ מַלְאָכִ֔ים אֶל־אִֽישׁ־בֹּ֥שֶׁת בֶּן־שָׁא֖וּל לֵאמֹ֑ר תְּנָ֤ה אֶת־אִשְׁתִּי֙ אֶת־מִיכַ֔ל אֲשֶׁר֙ אֵרַ֣שְׂתִּי לִ֔י בְּמֵאָ֖ה עׇרְל֥וֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: David also sent messengers to Ish-bosheth son of Saul, to say, “Give me my wife Michal, for whom I paid the bride-price of one hundred Philistine foreskins.”
Transliteration: vayishelach david maleakhiym el-iysh-voshet ven-shaul lemor tenah et-ishetiy et-miykhal asher erashetiy liy vemeah ׇrelvot felishetiym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֙ אִ֣ישׁ בֹּ֔שֶׁת וַיִּקָּחֶ֖הָ מֵ֣עִֽם אִ֑ישׁ מֵעִ֖ם פַּלְטִיאֵ֥ל בֶּן־[לָֽיִשׁ] (לוש)׃
Translated: So Ish-bosheth sent and had her taken away from [her] husband, Paltiel son of Laish.
Transliteration: vayishelach iysh voshet vayikacheha meim iysh meim faletiyel ven-[layiish] (lvsh)

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ אִתָּ֜הּ אִישָׁ֗הּ הָל֧וֹךְ וּבָכֹ֛ה אַחֲרֶ֖יהָ עַד־בַּחֻרִ֑ים וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֥יו אַבְנֵ֛ר לֵ֥ךְ שׁ֖וּב וַיָּשֹֽׁב׃
Translated: Her husband walked with her as far as Bahurim, weeping as he followed her; then Abner ordered him to turn back, and he went back.
Transliteration: vayelekhe itah iyshah halvokhe uvakhoh achareyha ad-vachuriym vayomer elayv avener lekhe shuv vayashov

Hebrew: וּדְבַר־אַבְנֵ֣ר הָיָ֔ה עִם־זִקְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר גַּם־תְּמוֹל֙ גַּם־שִׁלְשֹׁ֔ם הֱיִיתֶ֞ם מְבַקְשִׁ֧ים אֶת־דָּוִ֛ד לְמֶ֖לֶךְ עֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Abner had conferred with the elders of Israel, saying, “You have wanted David to be king over you all along.
Transliteration: udevar-avener hayah im-zikeney yisherael lemor gam-temvol gam-shileshom heyiytem mevakeshiym et-david lemelekhe aleykhem

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֖ה עֲשׂ֑וּ כִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה אָמַ֤ר אֶל־דָּוִד֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בְּיַ֣ד ׀ דָּוִ֣ד עַבְדִּ֗י הוֹשִׁ֜יעַ אֶת־עַמִּ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִיַּ֣ד פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וּמִיַּ֖ד כׇּל־אֹיְבֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Now act! For G<small>OD</small> has said concerning David: I will deliver My people Israel from the hands of the Philistines and all its other enemies through My servant David.”
Transliteration: veatah ashu khiy yehovah amar el-david lemor veyad david avediy hvoshiya et-amiy yisherael miyad felishetiym umiyad khׇl-oyeveyhem

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר גַּם־אַבְנֵ֖ר בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֑ין וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ גַּם־אַבְנֵ֗ר לְדַבֵּ֞ר בְּאׇזְנֵ֤י דָוִד֙ בְּחֶבְר֔וֹן אֵ֤ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־טוֹב֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וּבְעֵינֵ֖י כׇּל־בֵּ֥ית בִּנְיָמִֽן׃
Translated: Abner also talked with the Benjaminites; then Abner went and informed David in Hebron of all the wishes of Israel and of the whole House of Benjamin.
Transliteration: vayedaver gam-avener veׇzeney vineyamiyn vayelekhe gam-avener ledaver veׇzeney david vechevervon et khׇl-asher-tvov veeyney yisherael uveeyney khׇl-veyt vineyamin

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א אַבְנֵ֤ר אֶל־דָּוִד֙ חֶבְר֔וֹן וְאִתּ֖וֹ עֶשְׂרִ֣ים אֲנָשִׁ֑ים וַיַּ֨עַשׂ דָּוִ֧ד לְאַבְנֵ֛ר וְלַאֲנָשִׁ֥ים אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֖וֹ מִשְׁתֶּֽה׃
Translated: When Abner came to David in Hebron, accompanied by twenty men, David made a feast for Abner and the men with him.
Transliteration: vayavo avener el-david chevervon veitvo esheriym anashiym vayaash david leavener velaanashiym asher-itvo misheteh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אַבְנֵ֣ר אֶל־דָּוִ֡ד אָק֣וּמָה <small>׀</small> וְֽאֵלֵ֡כָה וְאֶקְבְּצָה֩ אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֨י הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אֶת־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְיִכְרְת֤וּ אִתְּךָ֙ בְּרִ֔ית וּמָ֣לַכְתָּ֔ בְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־תְּאַוֶּ֖ה נַפְשֶׁ֑ךָ וַיְשַׁלַּ֥ח דָּוִ֛ד אֶת־אַבְנֵ֖ר וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ בְּשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: Abner said to David, “Now I will go and rally all Israel to Your Majesty. They will make a pact with you, and you can reign over all that your heart desires.” And David dismissed Abner, who went away unharmed.
Transliteration: vayomer avener el-david akumah <small></small> veelekhah veekevetsah el-adoniy hamelekhe et-khׇl-yisherael veyikheretu itekha veriyt umalakheta vekhol asher-teaveh nafeshekha vayeshalach david et-avener vayelekhe veshalvom

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּה֩ עַבְדֵ֨י דָוִ֤ד וְיוֹאָב֙ בָּ֣א מֵֽהַגְּד֔וּד וְשָׁלָ֥ל רָ֖ב עִמָּ֣ם הֵבִ֑יאוּ וְאַבְנֵ֗ר אֵינֶ֤נּוּ עִם־דָּוִד֙ בְּחֶבְר֔וֹן כִּ֥י שִׁלְּח֖וֹ וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ בְּשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: Just then David’s soldiers and Joab returned from a raid, bringing much plunder with them; Abner was no longer with David in Hebron, for he had been dismissed and had gone away unharmed.
Transliteration: vehineh avedey david veyvoav va mehagedud veshalal rav imam heviyu veavener eynenu im-david vechevervon khiy shilechvo vayelekhe veshalvom

Hebrew: וְיוֹאָ֛ב וְכׇל־הַצָּבָ֥א אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֖וֹ בָּ֑אוּ וַיַּגִּ֤דוּ לְיוֹאָב֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בָּֽא־אַבְנֵ֤ר בֶּן־נֵר֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֵ֖הוּ וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ בְּשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: When Joab and the whole force with him arrived, Joab was told that Abner son of Ner had come to the king, had been dismissed by him, and had gone away unharmed.
Transliteration: veyvoav vekhׇl-hatsava asher-itvo vau vayagidu leyvoav lemor va-avener ven-ner el-hamelekhe vayeshalechehu vayelekhe veshalvom

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א יוֹאָב֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מֶ֣ה עָשִׂ֑יתָה הִנֵּה־בָ֤א אַבְנֵר֙ אֵלֶ֔יךָ לָמָּה־זֶּ֥ה שִׁלַּחְתּ֖וֹ וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ הָלֽוֹךְ׃
Translated: Joab went to the king and said, “What have you done? Here Abner came to you; why did you let him go? Now he has gotten away!
Transliteration: vayavo yvoav el-hamelekhe vayomer meh ashiytah hineh-va avener eleykha lamah-zeh shilachetvo vayelekhe halvokhe

Hebrew: יָדַ֙עְתָּ֙ אֶת־אַבְנֵ֣ר בֶּן־נֵ֔ר כִּ֥י לְפַתֹּתְךָ֖ בָּ֑א וְלָדַ֜עַת אֶת־מוֹצָֽאֲךָ֙ וְאֶת־[מ֣וֹבָאֶ֔ךָ] (מבואך) וְלָדַ֕עַת אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתָּ֖ה עֹשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: Don’t you know that Abner son of Ner came only to deceive you, to learn your comings and goings and to find out all that you are planning?”
Transliteration: yadaeta et-avener ven-ner khiy lefatotekha va veladaat et-mvotsaakha veet-[mvovaekha] (mvvkh) veladaat et khׇl-asher atah osheh

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֤א יוֹאָב֙ מֵעִ֣ם דָּוִ֔ד וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח מַלְאָכִים֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י אַבְנֵ֔ר וַיָּשִׁ֥בוּ אֹת֖וֹ מִבּ֣וֹר הַסִּרָ֑ה וְדָוִ֖ד לֹ֥א יָדָֽע׃
Translated: Joab left David and sent messengers after Abner, and they brought him back from the cistern of Sirah; but David knew nothing about it.
Transliteration: vayetse yvoav meim david vayishelach maleakhiym acharey avener vayashivu otvo mivvor hasirah vedavid lo yada

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤שׇׁב אַבְנֵר֙ חֶבְר֔וֹן וַיַּטֵּ֤הוּ יוֹאָב֙ אֶל־תּ֣וֹךְ הַשַּׁ֔עַר לְדַבֵּ֥ר אִתּ֖וֹ בַּשֶּׁ֑לִי וַיַּכֵּ֤הוּ שָׁם֙ הַחֹ֔מֶשׁ וַיָּ֕מׇת בְּדַ֖ם עֲשָׂהאֵ֥ל אָחִֽיו׃
Translated: When Abner returned to Hebron, Joab took him aside within the gate to talk to him privately; there he struck him in the belly. Thus [Abner] died for shedding the blood of Asahel, Joab’s brother.
Transliteration: vayashׇv avener chevervon vayatehu yvoav el-tvokhe hashaar ledaver itvo vasheliy vayakhehu sham hachomesh vayamׇt vedam ashahel achiyv

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע דָּוִד֙ מֵאַ֣חֲרֵי כֵ֔ן וַיֹּ֗אמֶר נָקִ֨י אָנֹכִ֧י וּמַמְלַכְתִּ֛י מֵעִ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה עַד־עוֹלָ֑ם מִדְּמֵ֖י אַבְנֵ֥ר בֶּן־נֵֽר׃
Translated: Afterward, when David heard of it, he said, “Both I and my kingdom are forever innocent before G<small>OD</small> of shedding the blood of Abner son of Ner.
Transliteration: vayishema david meacharey khen vayomer nakiy anokhiy umamelakhetiy meim yehovah ad-volam midemey avener ven-ner

Hebrew: יָחֻ֙לוּ֙ עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ יוֹאָ֔ב וְאֶ֖ל כׇּל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֑יו וְֽאַל־יִכָּרֵ֣ת מִבֵּ֣ית יוֹאָ֡ב זָ֠ב וּמְצֹרָ֞ע וּמַחֲזִ֥יק בַּפֶּ֛לֶךְ וְנֹפֵ֥ל בַּחֶ֖רֶב וַחֲסַר־לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: May [the guilt] fall upon the head of Joab and all his father’s house. May the house of Joab never be without someone suffering from a discharge or an eruption, or a male who handles the spindle, or one slain by the sword, or one lacking bread.”—
Transliteration: yachulu al-rosh yvoav veel khׇl-veyt aviyv veal-yikharet miveyt yvoav zav umetsora umachaziyk vafelekhe venofel vacherev vachasar-lachem

Hebrew: וְיוֹאָב֙ וַאֲבִישַׁ֣י אָחִ֔יו הָרְג֖וּ לְאַבְנֵ֑ר עַל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֵמִ֜ית אֶת־עֲשָׂהאֵ֧ל אֲחִיהֶ֛ם בְּגִבְע֖וֹן בַּמִּלְחָמָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Now Joab and his brother Abishai had killed Abner because he had killed their brother Asahel during the battle at Gibeon.—
Transliteration: veyvoav vaaviyshay achiyv haregu leavener al asher hemiyt et-ashahel achiyhem vegivevon vamilechamah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ דָּוִ֨ד אֶל־יוֹאָ֜ב וְאֶל־כׇּל־הָעָ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֗וֹ קִרְע֤וּ בִגְדֵיכֶם֙ וְחִגְר֣וּ שַׂקִּ֔ים וְסִפְד֖וּ לִפְנֵ֣י אַבְנֵ֑ר וְהַמֶּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֔ד הֹלֵ֖ךְ אַחֲרֵ֥י הַמִּטָּֽה׃
Translated: David then ordered Joab and all the troops with him to rend their clothes, gird on sackcloth, and make lament before Abner; and King David himself walked behind the bier.
Transliteration: vayomer david el-yvoav veel-khׇl-haam asher-itvo kireu vigedeykhem vechigeru shakiym vesifedu lifeney avener vehamelekhe david holekhe acharey hamitah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבְּר֥וּ אֶת־אַבְנֵ֖ר בְּחֶבְר֑וֹן וַיִּשָּׂ֧א הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ אֶת־קוֹל֗וֹ וַיֵּבְךְּ֙ אֶל־קֶ֣בֶר אַבְנֵ֔ר וַיִּבְכּ֖וּ כׇּל־הָעָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: And so they buried Abner at Hebron; the king wept aloud by Abner’s grave, and all the troops wept.
Transliteration: vayikeveru et-avener vechevervon vayisha hamelekhe et-kvolvo vayevekhe el-kever avener vayivekhu khׇl-haam {s}

Hebrew: וַיְקֹנֵ֥ן הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ אֶל־אַבְנֵ֖ר וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הַכְּמ֥וֹת נָבָ֖ל יָמ֥וּת אַבְנֵֽר׃
Translated:
And the king intoned this dirge over Abner,
“Should Abner have died the death of a churl?
Transliteration: vayekonen hamelekhe el-avener vayomar hakhemvot naval yamut avener

Hebrew: יָדֶ֣ךָ לֹא־אֲסֻר֗וֹת וְרַגְלֶ֙יךָ֙ לֹא־לִנְחֻשְׁתַּ֣יִם הֻגָּ֔שׁוּ כִּנְפ֛וֹל לִפְנֵ֥י בְנֵֽי־עַוְלָ֖ה נָפָ֑לְתָּ וַיֹּסִ֥פוּ כׇל־הָעָ֖ם לִבְכּ֥וֹת עָלָֽיו׃
Translated:
Your hands were not bound,
Your feet were not put in fetters;
But you fell as one falls
Before treacherous men!”
And all the troops continued to weep over him.
Transliteration: yadekha lo-asurvot verageleykha lo-linechushetayiim hugashu khinefvol lifeney veney-avelah nafaleta vayosifu khׇl-haam livekhvot alayv

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א כׇל־הָעָ֗ם לְהַבְר֧וֹת אֶת־דָּוִ֛ד לֶ֖חֶם בְּע֣וֹד הַיּ֑וֹם וַיִּשָּׁבַ֨ע דָּוִ֜ד לֵאמֹ֗ר כֹּ֣ה יַֽעֲשֶׂה־לִּ֤י אֱלֹהִים֙ וְכֹ֣ה יֹסִ֔יף כִּ֣י אִם־לִפְנֵ֧י בוֹא־הַשֶּׁ֛מֶשׁ אֶטְעַם־לֶ֖חֶם א֥וֹ כׇל־מְאֽוּמָה׃
Translated: All the troops came to urge David to eat something while it was still day; but David swore, “May God do thus to me and more if I eat bread or anything else before sundown.”
Transliteration: vayavo khׇl-haam lehavervot et-david lechem vevod hayyvom vayishava david lemor khoh yaasheh-liy Elohim vekhoh yosiyf khiy im-lifeney vvo-hashemesh eteam-lechem vo khׇl-meumah

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הָעָ֣ם הִכִּ֔ירוּ וַיִּיטַ֖ב בְּעֵינֵיהֶ֑ם כְּכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֣ה הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ בְּעֵינֵ֥י כׇל־הָעָ֖ם טֽוֹב׃
Translated: All the troops took note of it and approved, just as all the troops approved everything else the king did.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-haam hikhiyru vayiytav veeyneyhem khekhol asher ashah hamelekhe veeyney khׇl-haam tvov

Hebrew: וַיֵּדְע֧וּ כׇל־הָעָ֛ם וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא כִּ֣י לֹ֤א הָֽיְתָה֙ מֵֽהַמֶּ֔לֶךְ לְהָמִ֖ית אֶת־אַבְנֵ֥ר בֶּן־נֵֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: That day all the troops and all Israel knew that it was not by the king’s will that Abner son of Ner was killed.
Transliteration: vayedeu khׇl-haam vekhׇl-yisherael vayyvom hahu khiy lo hayetah mehamelekhe lehamiyt et-avener ven-ner {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֶל־עֲבָדָ֑יו הֲל֣וֹא תֵֽדְע֔וּ כִּֽי־שַׂ֣ר וְגָד֗וֹל נָפַ֛ל הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּ֖ה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: And the king said to his soldiers, “You well know that a prince, a great man in Israel, has fallen this day.
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe el-avadayv halvo tedeu khiy-shar vegadvol nafal hayyvom hazeh veyisherael

Hebrew: וְאָנֹכִ֨י הַיּ֥וֹם רַךְ֙ וּמָשׁ֣וּחַ מֶ֔לֶךְ וְהָאֲנָשִׁ֥ים הָאֵ֛לֶּה בְּנֵ֥י צְרוּיָ֖ה קָשִׁ֣ים מִמֶּ֑נִּי יְשַׁלֵּ֧ם יְהֹוָ֛ה לְעֹשֵׂ֥ה הָרָעָ֖ה כְּרָעָתֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: And today I am weak, even though anointed king; those involved, the sons of Zeruiah, are too savage for me. May G<small>OD</small> requite the wicked for their wickedness!”
Transliteration: veanokhiy hayyvom rakhe umashucha melekhe vehaanashiym haeleh veney tseruyah kashiym mimeniy yeshalem yehovah leosheh haraah kheraatvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע בֶּן־שָׁא֗וּל כִּ֣י מֵ֤ת אַבְנֵר֙ בְּחֶבְר֔וֹן וַיִּרְפּ֖וּ יָדָ֑יו וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל נִבְהָֽלוּ׃
Translated: When [Ish-bosheth] son of Saul heard that Abner had died in Hebron, he lost heart and all Israel was alarmed.
Transliteration: vayishema ven-shaul khiy met avener vechevervon vayirefu yadayv vekhׇl-yisherael nivehalu

Hebrew: וּשְׁנֵ֣י אֲנָשִׁ֣ים שָׂרֵֽי־גְדוּדִ֣ים הָי֪וּ בֶן־שָׁא֟וּל שֵׁם֩ הָאֶחָ֨ד בַּעֲנָ֜ה וְשֵׁ֧ם הַשֵּׁנִ֣י רֵכָ֗ב בְּנֵ֛י רִמּ֥וֹן הַבְּאֵרֹתִ֖י מִבְּנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֑ן כִּ֚י גַּם־בְּאֵר֔וֹת תֵּחָשֵׁ֖ב עַל־בִּנְיָמִֽן׃
Translated: The son of Saul [had] two company commanders, one named Baanah and the other Rechab, sons of Rimmon the Beerothite—Benjaminites, since Beeroth too was considered part of Benjamin.
Transliteration: usheney anashiym sharey-gedudiym hayu ven-shaul shem haechad vaanah veshem hasheniy rekhav veney rimvon haveerotiy miveney vineyamin khiy gam-veervot techashev al-vineyamin

Hebrew: וַיִּבְרְח֥וּ הַבְּאֵרֹתִ֖ים גִּתָּ֑יְמָה וַיִּהְיוּ־שָׁ֣ם גָּרִ֔ים עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The Beerothites had fled to Gittaim, where they have sojourned to this day.
Transliteration: vayiverechu haveerotiym gitayemah vayiheyu-sham gariym ad hayyvom hazeh {s}

Hebrew: וְלִיהֽוֹנָתָן֙ בֶּן־שָׁא֔וּל בֵּ֖ן נְכֵ֣ה רַגְלָ֑יִם בֶּן־חָמֵ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֣ים הָיָ֡ה בְּבֹ֣א שְׁמֻעַת֩ שָׁא֨וּל וִיהוֹנָתָ֜ן מִֽיִּזְרְעֶ֗אל וַתִּשָּׂאֵ֤הוּ אֹֽמַנְתּוֹ֙ וַתָּנֹ֔ס וַיְהִ֞י בְּחׇפְזָ֥הּ לָנ֛וּס וַיִּפֹּ֥ל וַיִּפָּסֵ֖חַ וּשְׁמ֥וֹ מְפִיבֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: (Jonathan son of Saul had a son whose feet were crippled. He was five years old when the news about Saul and Jonathan came from Jezreel, and his nurse picked him up and fled; but as she was fleeing in haste, he fell and was lamed. His name was Mephibosheth.)
Transliteration: veliyhvonatan ven-shaul ven nekheh ragelayiim ven-chamesh shaniym hayah vevo shemuat shaul viyhvonatan miyizereel vatishaehu omanetvo vatanos vayehiy vechׇfezah lanus vayifol vayifasecha ushemvo mefiyvoshet

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לְכ֜וּ בְּנֵֽי־רִמּ֤וֹן הַבְּאֵֽרֹתִי֙ רֵכָ֣ב וּבַעֲנָ֔ה וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ כְּחֹ֣ם הַיּ֔וֹם אֶל־בֵּ֖ית אִ֣ישׁ בֹּ֑שֶׁת וְה֣וּא שֹׁכֵ֔ב אֵ֖ת מִשְׁכַּ֥ב הַֽצׇּהֳרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Rechab and Baanah, sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, started out, and they reached the home of Ish-bosheth at the heat of the day, when he was taking his midday rest.
Transliteration: vayelekhu veney-rimvon haveerotiy rekhav uvaanah vayavou khechom hayyvom el-veyt iysh voshet vehu shokhev et mishekhav hatsׇhorayiim

Hebrew: וְ֠הֵנָּ֠ה בָּ֜אוּ עַד־תּ֤וֹךְ הַבַּ֙יִת֙ לֹקְחֵ֣י חִטִּ֔ים וַיַּכֻּ֖הוּ אֶל־הַחֹ֑מֶשׁ וְרֵכָ֛ב וּבַעֲנָ֥ה אָחִ֖יו נִמְלָֽטוּ׃
Translated: So they went inside the house, as though fetching wheat, and struck him in the belly. Rechab and his brother Baanah slipped by,
Transliteration: vehenah vau ad-tvokhe havayiit lokechey chitiym vayakhuhu el-hachomesh verekhav uvaanah achiyv nimelatu

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ הַבַּ֗יִת וְהֽוּא־שֹׁכֵ֤ב עַל־מִטָּתוֹ֙ בַּחֲדַ֣ר מִשְׁכָּב֔וֹ וַיַּכֻּ֙הוּ֙ וַיְמִתֻ֔הוּ וַיָּסִ֖ירוּ אֶת־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וַיִּקְחוּ֙ אֶת־רֹאשׁ֔וֹ וַיֵּ֥לְכ֛וּ דֶּ֥רֶךְ הָעֲרָבָ֖ה כׇּל־הַלָּֽיְלָה׃
Translated: and entered the house while he was asleep on his bed in his bedchamber; and they stabbed him to death. They cut off his head and took his head and made their way all night through the Arabah.
Transliteration: vayavou havayiit vehu-shokhev al-mitatvo vachadar mishekhavvo vayakhuhu vayemituhu vayasiyru et-roshvo vayikechu et-roshvo vayelekhu derekhe haaravah khׇl-halayelah

Hebrew: וַ֠יָּבִ֠אוּ אֶת־רֹ֨אשׁ אִֽישׁ־בֹּ֥שֶׁת אֶל־דָּוִד֮ חֶבְרוֹן֒ וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ הִנֵּה־רֹ֣אשׁ אִֽישׁ־בֹּ֗שֶׁת בֶּן־שָׁאוּל֙ אֹֽיִבְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּקֵּ֖שׁ אֶת־נַפְשֶׁ֑ךָ וַיִּתֵּ֣ן יְ֠הֹוָ֠ה לַאדֹנִ֨י הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ נְקָמוֹת֙ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה מִשָּׁא֖וּל וּמִזַּרְעֽוֹ׃
Translated: They brought the head of Ish-bosheth to David in Hebron. “Here,” they said to the king, “is the head of your enemy, Ish-bosheth son of Saul, who sought your life. This day G<small>OD</small> has avenged my lord the king upon Saul and his offspring.”
Transliteration: vayaviu et-rosh iysh-voshet el-david chevervon vayomeru el-hamelekhe hineh-rosh iysh-voshet ven-shaul oyiivekha asher vikesh et-nafeshekha vayiten yehovah ladoniy hamelekhe nekamvot hayyvom hazeh mishaul umizarevo

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן דָּוִ֜ד אֶת־רֵכָ֣ב ׀ וְאֶת־בַּעֲנָ֣ה אָחִ֗יו בְּנֵ֛י רִמּ֥וֹן הַבְּאֵרֹתִ֖י וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֑ם חַי־יְהֹוָ֕ה אֲשֶׁר־פָּדָ֥ה אֶת־נַפְשִׁ֖י מִכׇּל־צָרָֽה׃
Translated: But David answered Rechab and his brother Baanah, the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, and said to them, “As G<small>OD</small> lives, who has rescued me from every trouble:
Transliteration: vayaan david et-rekhav veet-vaanah achiyv veney rimvon haveerotiy vayomer lahem chay-yehovah asher-fadah et-nafeshiy mikhׇl-tsarah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י הַמַּגִּיד֩ לִ֨י לֵאמֹ֜ר הִנֵּה־מֵ֣ת שָׁא֗וּל וְהֽוּא־הָיָ֤ה כִמְבַשֵּׂר֙ בְּעֵינָ֔יו וָאֹחֲזָ֣ה ב֔וֹ וָאֶהְרְגֵ֖הוּ בְּצִֽקְלָ֑ג אֲשֶׁ֥ר לְתִתִּי־ל֖וֹ בְּשֹׂרָֽה׃
Translated: The one who told me in Ziklag that Saul was dead thought he was bringing good news. But instead of rewarding him for the news, I seized and killed him.
Transliteration: khiy hamagiyd liy lemor hineh-met shaul vehu-hayah khimevasher veeynayv vaochazah vvo vaeheregehu vetsikelag asher letitiy-lvo veshorah

Hebrew: אַ֞ף כִּֽי־אֲנָשִׁ֣ים רְשָׁעִ֗ים הָרְג֧וּ אֶת־אִישׁ־צַדִּ֛יק בְּבֵית֖וֹ עַל־מִשְׁכָּב֑וֹ וְעַתָּ֗ה הֲל֨וֹא אֲבַקֵּ֤שׁ אֶת־דָּמוֹ֙ מִיֶּדְכֶ֔ם וּבִעַרְתִּ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִן־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: How much more, then, when wicked men have killed an innocent man in bed in his own house! I will certainly avenge his blood on you, and I will rid the earth of you.”
Transliteration: af khiy-anashiym reshaiym haregu et-iysh-tsadiyk veveytvo al-mishekhavvo veatah halvo avakesh et-damvo miyedekhem uviaretiy etekhem min-haarets

Hebrew: וַיְצַו֩ דָּוִ֨ד אֶת־הַנְּעָרִ֜ים וַיַּהַרְג֗וּם וַֽיְקַצְּצ֤וּ אֶת־יְדֵיהֶם֙ וְאֶת־רַגְלֵיהֶ֔ם וַיִּתְל֥וּ עַל־הַבְּרֵכָ֖ה בְּחֶבְר֑וֹן וְאֵ֨ת רֹ֤אשׁ אִֽישׁ־בֹּ֙שֶׁת֙ לָקָ֔חוּ וַיִּקְבְּר֥וּ בְקֶבֶר־אַבְנֵ֖ר בְּחֶבְרֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated: David gave orders to the young men, who killed them; they cut off their hands and feet and hung them up by the pool in Hebron. And they took the head of Ish-bosheth and buried it in the grave of Abner at Hebron.
Transliteration: vayetsav david et-haneariym vayaharegum vayekatsetsu et-yedeyhem veet-rageleyhem vayitelu al-haverekhah vechevervon veet rosh iysh-voshet lakachu vayikeveru vekever-avener vechevervon {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ כׇּל־שִׁבְטֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶל־דָּוִ֖ד חֶבְר֑וֹנָה וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ לֵאמֹ֔ר הִנְנ֛וּ עַצְמְךָ֥ וּֽבְשָׂרְךָ֖ אֲנָֽחְנוּ׃
Translated: All the tribes of Israel came to David at Hebron and said, “We are your own flesh and blood.
Transliteration: vayavou khׇl-shivetey yisherael el-david chevervonah vayomeru lemor hinenu atsemekha uvesharekha anachenu

Hebrew: גַּם־אֶתְמ֣וֹל גַּם־שִׁלְשׁ֗וֹם בִּֽהְי֨וֹת שָׁא֥וּל מֶ֙לֶךְ֙ עָלֵ֔ינוּ אַתָּ֗ה (הייתה מוציא) [הָיִ֛יתָ הַמּוֹצִ֥יא] וְהַמֵּבִ֖י אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה לְךָ֗ אַתָּ֨ה תִרְעֶ֤ה אֶת־עַמִּי֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאַתָּ֛ה תִּהְיֶ֥ה לְנָגִ֖יד עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Long before now, when Saul was king over us, it was you who led Israel in war; and G<small>OD</small> said to you: You shall shepherd My people Israel; you shall be ruler of Israel.”
Transliteration: gam-etemvol gam-shileshvom viheyvot shaul melekhe aleynu atah (hyyth mvtsy) [hayiyta hamvotsiy] vehameviy et-yisherael vayomer yehovah lekha atah tireeh et-amiy et-yisherael veatah tiheyeh lenagiyd al-yisherael

Hebrew: וַ֠יָּבֹ֠אוּ כׇּל־זִקְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל אֶל־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ חֶבְר֔וֹנָה וַיִּכְרֹ֣ת לָהֶם֩ הַמֶּ֨לֶךְ דָּוִ֥ד בְּרִ֛ית בְּחֶבְר֖וֹן לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּמְשְׁח֧וּ אֶת־דָּוִ֛ד לְמֶ֖לֶךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: All the elders of Israel came to the king at Hebron, and King David made a pact with them in Hebron before G<small>OD</small>. And they anointed David king over Israel.
Transliteration: vayavou khׇl-zikeney yisherael el-hamelekhe chevervonah vayikherot lahem hamelekhe david veriyt vechevervon lifeney yehovah vayimeshechu et-david lemelekhe al-yisherael {s}

Hebrew: בֶּן־שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים שָׁנָ֛ה דָּוִ֖ד בְּמׇלְכ֑וֹ אַרְבָּעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה מָלָֽךְ׃
Translated: David was thirty years old when he became king, and he reigned forty years.
Transliteration: ven-sheloshiym shanah david vemׇlekhvo arevaiym shanah malakhe

Hebrew: בְּחֶבְרוֹן֙ מָלַ֣ךְ עַל־יְהוּדָ֔ה שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִ֖ים וְשִׁשָּׁ֣ה חֳדָשִׁ֑ים וּבִירוּשָׁלַ֣͏ִם מָלַ֗ךְ שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים וְשָׁלֹשׁ֙ שָׁנָ֔ה עַ֥ל כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וִיהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: In Hebron he reigned over Judah seven years and six months, and in Jerusalem he reigned over all Israel and Judah thirty-three years.
Transliteration: vechevervon malakhe al-yehudah sheva shaniym veshishah chodashiym uviyrushala͏im malakhe sheloshiym veshalosh shanah al khׇl-yisherael viyhudah

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ וַֽאֲנָשָׁיו֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם אֶל־הַיְבֻסִ֖י יוֹשֵׁ֣ב הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר לְדָוִ֤ד לֵאמֹר֙ לֹא־תָב֣וֹא הֵ֔נָּה כִּ֣י אִם־הֱסִֽירְךָ֗ הַעִוְרִ֤ים וְהַפִּסְחִים֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹא־יָב֥וֹא דָוִ֖ד הֵֽנָּה׃
Translated: The king and his men set out for Jerusalem against the Jebusites who inhabited the region. David was told, “You will never get in here! Even the blind and the lame will turn you back.” (They meant: David will never enter here.)
Transliteration: vayelekhe hamelekhe vaanashayv yerushala͏im el-hayevusiy yvoshev haarets vayomer ledavid lemor lo-tavvo henah khiy im-hesiyrekha haiveriym vehafisechiym lemor lo-yavvo david henah

Hebrew: וַיִּלְכֹּ֣ד דָּוִ֔ד אֵ֖ת מְצֻדַ֣ת צִיּ֑וֹן הִ֖יא עִ֥יר דָּוִֽד׃
Translated: But David captured the stronghold of Zion; it is now the City of David.
Transliteration: vayilekhod david et metsudat tsiyyvon hiy iyr david

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜ד בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא כׇּל־מַכֵּ֤ה יְבֻסִי֙ וְיִגַּ֣ע בַּצִּנּ֔וֹר וְאֶת־הַפִּסְחִים֙ וְאֶת־הַ֣עִוְרִ֔ים (שנאו) [שְׂנוּאֵ֖י] נֶ֣פֶשׁ דָּוִ֑ד עַל־כֵּן֙ יֹֽאמְר֔וּ עִוֵּ֣ר וּפִסֵּ֔חַ לֹ֥א יָב֖וֹא אֶל־הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: On that occasion David said, “Those who attack the Jebusites shall reach the water channel and [strike down] the lame and the blind, who are hateful to David.” That is why they say: “No one who is blind or lame may enter the House.”
Transliteration: vayomer david vayyvom hahu khׇl-makheh yevusiy veyiga vatsinvor veet-hafisechiym veet-haiveriym (shnv) [shenuey] nefesh david al-khen yomeru iver ufisecha lo yavvo el-havayiit

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֤שֶׁב דָּוִד֙ בַּמְּצֻדָ֔ה וַיִּקְרָא־לָ֖הּ עִ֣יר דָּוִ֑ד וַיִּ֤בֶן דָּוִד֙ סָבִ֔יב מִן־הַמִּלּ֖וֹא וָבָֽיְתָה׃
Translated: David occupied the stronghold and renamed it the City of David; David also fortified the surrounding area, from the Millo inward.
Transliteration: vayeshev david vametsudah vayikera-lah iyr david vayiven david saviyv min-hamilvo vavayetah

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ דָּוִ֖ד הָל֣וֹךְ וְגָד֑וֹל וַיהֹוָ֛ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י צְבָא֖וֹת עִמּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: David kept growing stronger, for the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Hosts, was with him.
Transliteration: vayelekhe david halvokhe vegadvol vayhovah elohey tsevavot imvo {f}

Hebrew: וַ֠יִּשְׁלַ֠ח חִירָ֨ם מֶלֶךְ־צֹ֥ר מַלְאָכִים֮ אֶל־דָּוִד֒ וַעֲצֵ֣י אֲרָזִ֔ים וְחָרָשֵׁ֣י עֵ֔ץ וְחָרָשֵׁ֖י אֶ֣בֶן קִ֑יר וַיִּבְנוּ־בַ֖יִת לְדָוִֽד׃
Translated: King Hiram of Tyre sent envoys to David with cedar logs, carpenters, and stonemasons; and they built a palace for David.
Transliteration: vayishelach chiyram melekhe-tsor maleakhiym el-david vaatsey araziym vecharashey ets vecharashey even kiyr vayivenu-vayiit ledavid

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣דַע דָּוִ֔ד כִּֽי־הֱכִינ֧וֹ יְהֹוָ֛ה לְמֶ֖לֶךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְכִי֙ נִשֵּׂ֣א מַמְלַכְתּ֔וֹ בַּעֲב֖וּר עַמּ֥וֹ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus David knew that G<small>OD</small> had established him as king over Israel and had exalted his kingship for the sake of Israel—God’s people.
Transliteration: vayeda david khiy-hekhiynvo yehovah lemelekhe al-yisherael vekhiy nishe mamelakhetvo vaavur amvo yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֩ דָּוִ֨ד ע֜וֹד פִּֽלַגְשִׁ֤ים וְנָשִׁים֙ מִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם אַחֲרֵ֖י בֹּא֣וֹ מֵחֶבְר֑וֹן וַיִּוָּ֥לְדוּ ע֛וֹד לְדָוִ֖ד בָּנִ֥ים וּבָנֽוֹת׃
Translated: After he left Hebron, David took more concubines and wives in Jerusalem, and more sons and daughters were born to David.
Transliteration: vayikach david vod filageshiym venashiym miyrushala͏im acharey vovo mechevervon vayivaledu vod ledavid vaniym uvanvot

Hebrew: וְאֵ֗לֶּה שְׁמ֛וֹת הַיִּלֹּדִ֥ים ל֖וֹ בִּירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם שַׁמּ֣וּעַ וְשׁוֹבָ֔ב וְנָתָ֖ן וּשְׁלֹמֹֽה׃
Translated: These are the names of the children born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon;
Transliteration: veeleh shemvot hayilodiym lvo viyrushala͏im shamua veshvovav venatan ushelomoh

Hebrew: וְיִבְחָ֥ר וֶאֱלִישׁ֖וּעַ וְנֶ֥פֶג וְיָפִֽיעַ׃
Translated: Ibhar, Elishua, Nepheg, and Japhia;
Transliteration: veyivechar veeliyshua venefeg veyafiya

Hebrew: וֶאֱלִישָׁמָ֥ע וְאֶלְיָדָ֖ע וֶאֱלִיפָֽלֶט׃ {פ}
Translated: Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet.
Transliteration: veeliyshama veeleyada veeliyfalet {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמְע֣וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֗ים כִּֽי־מָשְׁח֨וּ אֶת־דָּוִ֤ד לְמֶ֙לֶךְ֙ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיַּעֲל֥וּ כׇל־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים לְבַקֵּ֣שׁ אֶת־דָּוִ֑ד וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע דָּוִ֔ד וַיֵּ֖רֶד אֶל־הַמְּצוּדָֽה׃
Translated: When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over Israel, the Philistines marched up in search of David; but David heard of it, and he went down to the fastness.
Transliteration: vayishemeu felishetiym khiy-mashechu et-david lemelekhe al-yisherael vayaalu khׇl-felishetiym levakesh et-david vayishema david vayered el-hametsudah

Hebrew: וּפְלִשְׁתִּ֖ים בָּ֑אוּ וַיִּנָּטְשׁ֖וּ בְּעֵ֥מֶק רְפָאִֽים׃
Translated: The Philistines came and spread out over the Valley of Rephaim.
Transliteration: ufelishetiym vau vayinateshu veemek refaiym

Hebrew:
וַיִּשְׁאַ֨ל דָּוִ֤ד בַּֽיהֹוָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הַאֶֽעֱלֶה֙ אֶל־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים הֲתִתְּנֵ֖ם בְּיָדִ֑י {פ}
וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶל־דָּוִד֙ עֲלֵ֔ה כִּֽי־נָתֹ֥ן אֶתֵּ֛ן אֶת־הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים בְּיָדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: David inquired of G<small>OD</small>, “Shall I go up against the Philistines? Will You deliver them into my hands?” And G<small>OD</small> answered David, “Go up, and I will deliver the Philistines into your hands.”
Transliteration:
vayisheal david vayhovah lemor haeeleh el-felishetiym hatitenem veyadiy {f}
vayomer yehovah el-david aleh khiy-naton eten et-hafelishetiym veyadekha

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א דָוִ֥ד בְּבַֽעַל־פְּרָצִים֮ וַיַּכֵּ֣ם שָׁ֣ם דָּוִד֒ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר פָּרַ֨ץ יְהֹוָ֧ה אֶת־אֹיְבַ֛י לְפָנַ֖י כְּפֶ֣רֶץ מָ֑יִם עַל־כֵּ֗ן קָרָ֛א שֵֽׁם־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא בַּ֥עַל פְּרָצִֽים׃
Translated: Thereupon David marched to Baal-perazim, and David defeated them there. And he said, “G<small>OD</small> has broken through my enemies before me as waters break through [a dam].” That is why that place was named Baal-perazim.
Transliteration: vayavo david vevaal-feratsiym vayakhem sham david vayomer farats yehovah et-oyevay lefanay kheferets mayiim al-khen kara shem-hamakvom hahu vaal feratsiym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַזְבוּ שָׁ֖ם אֶת־עֲצַבֵּיהֶ֑ם וַיִּשָּׂאֵ֥ם דָּוִ֖ד וַאֲנָשָֽׁיו׃ {פ}
Translated: The Philistines abandoned their idols there, and David and his men carried them off.
Transliteration: vayaazevu sham et-atsaveyhem vayishaem david vaanashayv {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּסִ֥פוּ ע֛וֹד פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים לַעֲל֑וֹת וַיִּנָּטְשׁ֖וּ בְּעֵ֥מֶק רְפָאִֽים׃
Translated: Once again the Philistines marched up and spread out over the Valley of Rephaim.
Transliteration: vayosifu vod felishetiym laalvot vayinateshu veemek refaiym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁאַ֤ל דָּוִד֙ בַּיהֹוָ֔ה וַיֹּ֖אמֶר לֹ֣א תַעֲלֶ֑ה הָסֵב֙ אֶל־אַ֣חֲרֵיהֶ֔ם וּבָ֥אתָ לָהֶ֖ם מִמּ֥וּל בְּכָאִֽים׃
Translated: David inquired of GOD, who answered, “Do not go up, but circle around behind them and confront them at the baca trees.
Transliteration: vayisheal david vayhovah vayomer lo taaleh hasev el-achareyhem uvata lahem mimul vekhaiym

Hebrew: וִ֠יהִ֠י (בשמעך) [כְּֽשׇׁמְעֲךָ֞] אֶת־ק֧וֹל צְעָדָ֛ה בְּרָאשֵׁ֥י הַבְּכָאִ֖ים אָ֣ז תֶּחֱרָ֑ץ כִּ֣י אָ֗ז יָצָ֤א יְהֹוָה֙ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ לְהַכּ֖וֹת בְּמַחֲנֵ֥ה פְלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: And when you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the baca trees, then go into action, for GOD will be going in front of you to attack the Philistine forces.”
Transliteration: viyhiy (vshmkh) [kheshׇmeakha] et-kvol tseadah verashey havekhaiym az techerats khiy az yatsa yehovah lefaneykha lehakhvot vemachaneh felishetiym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ דָּוִד֙ כֵּ֔ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֖הוּ יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיַּךְ֙ אֶת־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים מִגֶּ֖בַע עַד־בֹּאֲךָ֥ גָֽזֶר׃ {פ}
Translated: David did as G<small>OD</small> had commanded him; and he routed the Philistines from Geba all the way to Gezer.
Transliteration: vayaash david khen khaasher tsivahu yehovah vayakhe et-felishetiym migeva ad-voakha gazer {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨סֶף ע֥וֹד דָּוִ֛ד אֶת־כׇּל־בָּח֥וּר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים אָֽלֶף׃
Translated: David again assembled all the best soldiers in Israel, thirty thousand strong.
Transliteration: vayosef vod david et-khׇl-vachur veyisherael sheloshiym alef

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם ׀ וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֗ד וְכׇל־הָעָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֔וֹ מִֽבַּעֲלֵ֖י יְהוּדָ֑ה לְהַעֲל֣וֹת מִשָּׁ֗ם אֵ֚ת אֲר֣וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־נִקְרָ֣א שֵׁ֗ם שֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֧ה צְבָא֛וֹת יֹשֵׁ֥ב הַכְּרֻבִ֖ים עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: Then David and all the troops that were with him set out from Baalim of Judah to bring up from there the Ark of God to which the Name was attached, the name G<small>OD</small> of Hosts Enthroned on the Cherubim.
Transliteration: vayakׇm vayelekhe david vekhׇl-haam asher itvo mivaaley yehudah lehaalvot misham et arvon haElohim asher-nikera shem shem yehovah tsevavot yoshev hakheruviym alayv

Hebrew: וַיַּרְכִּ֜בוּ אֶת־אֲר֤וֹן הָאֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־עֲגָלָ֣ה חֲדָשָׁ֔ה וַיִּ֨שָּׂאֻ֔הוּ מִבֵּ֥ית אֲבִינָדָ֖ב אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּגִּבְעָ֑ה וְעֻזָּ֣א וְאַחְי֗וֹ בְּנֵי֙ אֲבִ֣ינָדָ֔ב נֹהֲגִ֖ים אֶת־הָעֲגָלָ֥ה חֲדָשָֽׁה׃
Translated: They loaded the Ark of God onto a new cart and conveyed it from the house of Abinadab, which was on the hill; and Abinadab’s sons, Uzza and Ahio, guided the new cart.
Transliteration: vayarekhivu et-arvon haElohim el-agalah chadashah vayishauhu miveyt aviynadav asher vagiveah veuza veacheyvo veney aviynadav nohagiym et-haagalah chadashah

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂאֻ֗הוּ מִבֵּ֤ית אֲבִֽינָדָב֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּגִּבְעָ֔ה עִ֖ם אֲר֣וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְאַחְי֕וֹ הֹלֵ֖ךְ לִפְנֵ֥י הָאָרֽוֹן׃
Translated: They conveyed it from Abinadab’s house on the hill, [Uzza walking] alongside the Ark of God and Ahio walking in front of the Ark.
Transliteration: vayishauhu miveyt aviynadav asher vagiveah im arvon haElohim veacheyvo holekhe lifeney haarvon

Hebrew: וְדָוִ֣ד ׀ וְכׇל־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל מְשַֽׂחֲקִים֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּכֹ֖ל עֲצֵ֣י בְרוֹשִׁ֑ים וּבְכִנֹּר֤וֹת וּבִנְבָלִים֙ וּבְתֻפִּ֔ים וּבִמְנַעַנְעִ֖ים וּֽבְצֶלְצֱלִֽים׃
Translated: Meanwhile, David and all the House of Israel danced before G<small>OD</small> to [the sound of] all kinds of cypress wood [instruments], with lyres, harps, hand-drums, sistrums, and cymbals.
Transliteration: vedavid vekhׇl-veyt yisherael meshachakiym lifeney yehovah vekhol atsey vervoshiym uvekhinorvot uvinevaliym uvetufiym uvimenaaneiym uvetseletseliym

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ עַד־גֹּ֣רֶן נָכ֑וֹן וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח עֻזָּ֜ה אֶל־אֲר֤וֹן הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ וַיֹּ֣אחֶז בּ֔וֹ כִּ֥י שָֽׁמְט֖וּ הַבָּקָֽר׃
Translated: But when they came to the threshing floor of Nacon, Uzzah reached out for the Ark of God and grasped it, for the oxen had stumbled.
Transliteration: vayavou ad-goren nakhvon vayishelach uzah el-arvon haElohim vayochez vvo khiy shametu havakar

Hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֤ף יְהֹוָה֙ בְּעֻזָּ֔ה וַיַּכֵּ֥הוּ שָׁ֛ם הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים עַל־הַשַּׁ֑ל וַיָּ֣מׇת שָׁ֔ם עִ֖ם אֲר֥וֹן הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> was incensed at Uzzah. And God struck him down on the spot for his indiscretion, and he died there beside the Ark of God.
Transliteration: vayichar-af yehovah veuzah vayakhehu sham haElohim al-hashal vayamׇt sham im arvon haElohim

Hebrew: וַיִּ֣חַר לְדָוִ֔ד עַל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר פָּרַ֧ץ יְהֹוָ֛ה פֶּ֖רֶץ בְּעֻזָּ֑ה וַיִּקְרָ֞א לַמָּק֤וֹם הַהוּא֙ פֶּ֣רֶץ עֻזָּ֔ה עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: David was distressed because G<small>OD</small> had inflicted a breach upon Uzzah; and that place was named Perez-uzzah, as it is still called.
Transliteration: vayichar ledavid al asher farats yehovah ferets veuzah vayikera lamakvom hahu ferets uzah ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וַיִּרָ֥א דָוִ֛ד אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אֵ֛יךְ יָב֥וֹא אֵלַ֖י אֲר֥וֹן יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: David was afraid of G<small>OD</small> that day; he said, “How can I let the Ark of G<small>OD</small> come to me?”
Transliteration: vayira david et-yehovah vayyvom hahu vayomer eykhe yavvo elay arvon yehovah

Hebrew: וְלֹא־אָבָ֣ה דָוִ֗ד לְהָסִ֥יר אֵלָ֛יו אֶת־אֲר֥וֹן יְהֹוָ֖ה עַל־עִ֣יר דָּוִ֑ד וַיַּטֵּ֣הוּ דָוִ֔ד בֵּ֥ית עֹבֵֽד־אֱדֹ֖ם הַגִּתִּֽי׃
Translated: So David would not bring the Ark of G<small>OD</small> to his place in the City of David; instead, David diverted it to the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.
Transliteration: velo-avah david lehasiyr elayv et-arvon yehovah al-iyr david vayatehu david veyt oved-edom hagitiy

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֩שֶׁב֩ אֲר֨וֹן יְהֹוָ֜ה בֵּ֣ית עֹבֵ֥ד אֱדֹ֛ם הַגִּתִּ֖י שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה חֳדָשִׁ֑ים וַיְבָ֧רֶךְ יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־עֹבֵ֥ד אֱדֹ֖ם וְאֶת־כׇּל־בֵּיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: The Ark of G<small>OD</small> remained in the house of Obed-edom the Gittite three months, and G<small>OD</small> blessed Obed-edom and his whole household.
Transliteration: vayeshev arvon yehovah veyt oved edom hagitiy sheloshah chodashiym vayevarekhe yehovah et-oved edom veet-khׇl-veytvo

Hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֗ד לַמֶּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִד֮ לֵאמֹר֒ בֵּרַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶת־בֵּ֨ית עֹבֵ֤ד אֱדֹם֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ בַּעֲב֖וּר אֲר֣וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֗ד וַיַּ֩עַל֩ אֶת־אֲר֨וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֜ים מִבֵּ֨ית עֹבֵ֥ד אֱדֹ֛ם עִ֥יר דָּוִ֖ד בְּשִׂמְחָֽה׃
Translated: It was reported to King David: “G<small>OD</small> has blessed Obed-edom’s house and all that belongs to him because of the Ark of God.” Thereupon David went and brought up the Ark of God from the house of Obed-edom to the City of David, amid rejoicing.
Transliteration: vayugad lamelekhe david lemor verakhe yehovah et-veyt oved edom veet-khׇl-asher-lvo vaavur arvon haElohim vayelekhe david vayaal et-arvon haElohim miveyt oved edom iyr david veshimechah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כִּ֧י צָעֲד֛וּ נֹשְׂאֵ֥י אֲרוֹן־יְהֹוָ֖ה שִׁשָּׁ֣ה צְעָדִ֑ים וַיִּזְבַּ֥ח שׁ֖וֹר וּמְרִֽיא׃
Translated: When the bearers of the Ark of G<small>OD</small> had moved forward six paces, he sacrificed an ox and a fatling.
Transliteration: vayehiy khiy tsaadu nosheey arvon-yehovah shishah tseadiym vayizevach shvor umeriy

Hebrew: וְדָוִ֛ד מְכַרְכֵּ֥ר בְּכׇל־עֹ֖ז לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְדָוִ֕ד חָג֖וּר אֵפ֥וֹד בָּֽד׃
Translated: David whirled with all his might before G<small>OD</small>; David was girt with a linen ephod.
Transliteration: vedavid mekharekher vekhׇl-oz lifeney yehovah vedavid chagur efvod vad

Hebrew: וְדָוִד֙ וְכׇל־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מַעֲלִ֖ים אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן יְהֹוָ֑ה בִּתְרוּעָ֖ה וּבְק֥וֹל שׁוֹפָֽר׃
Translated: Thus David and all the House of Israel brought up the Ark of G<small>OD</small> with shouts and with blasts of the horn.
Transliteration: vedavid vekhׇl-veyt yisherael maaliym et-arvon yehovah viteruah uvekvol shvofar

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ אֲר֣וֹן יְהֹוָ֔ה בָּ֖א עִ֣יר דָּוִ֑ד וּמִיכַ֨ל בַּת־שָׁא֜וּל נִשְׁקְפָ֣ה ׀ בְּעַ֣ד הַחַלּ֗וֹן וַתֵּ֨רֶא אֶת־הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ דָּוִד֙ מְפַזֵּ֤ז וּמְכַרְכֵּר֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וַתִּ֥בֶז ל֖וֹ בְּלִבָּֽהּ׃
Translated: As the Ark of G<small>OD</small> entered the City of David, Michal daughter of Saul looked out of the window and saw King David leaping and whirling before G<small>OD</small>; and she despised him for it.
Transliteration: vehayah arvon yehovah va iyr david umiykhal vat-shaul nishekefah vead hachalvon vatere et-hamelekhe david mefazez umekharekher lifeney yehovah vativez lvo velivah

Hebrew: וַיָּבִ֜אוּ אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן יְהֹוָ֗ה וַיַּצִּ֤גוּ אֹתוֹ֙ בִּמְקוֹמ֔וֹ בְּת֣וֹךְ הָאֹ֔הֶל אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָטָה־ל֖וֹ דָּוִ֑ד וַיַּ֨עַל דָּוִ֥ד עֹל֛וֹת לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה וּשְׁלָמִֽים׃
Translated: They brought in the Ark of G<small>OD</small> and set it up in its place inside the tent that David had pitched for it, and David sacrificed burnt offerings and offerings of well-being before G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayaviu et-arvon yehovah vayatsigu otvo vimekvomvo vetvokhe haohel asher natah-lvo david vayaal david olvot lifeney yehovah ushelamiym

Hebrew: וַיְכַ֣ל דָּוִ֔ד מֵהַעֲל֥וֹת הָעוֹלָ֖ה וְהַשְּׁלָמִ֑ים וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם בְּשֵׁ֖ם יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָאֽוֹת׃
Translated: When David finished sacrificing the burnt offerings and the offerings of well-being, he blessed the people in the name of G<small>OD</small> of Hosts.
Transliteration: vayekhal david mehaalvot havolah vehashelamiym vayevarekhe et-haam veshem yehovah tsevavot

Hebrew: וַיְחַלֵּ֨ק לְכׇל־הָעָ֜ם לְכׇל־הֲמ֣וֹן יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ לְמֵאִ֣ישׁ וְעַד־אִשָּׁה֒ לְאִ֗ישׁ חַלַּ֥ת לֶ֙חֶם֙ אַחַ֔ת וְאֶשְׁפָּ֣ר אֶחָ֔ד וַאֲשִׁישָׁ֖ה אֶחָ֑ת וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם אִ֥ישׁ לְבֵיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: And he distributed among all the people—the entire multitude of Israel, man and woman alike—to each a loaf of bread, a cake made in a pan, and a raisin cake. Then all the people left for their homes.
Transliteration: vayechalek lekhׇl-haam lekhׇl-hamvon yisherael lemeiysh vead-ishah leiysh chalat lechem achat veeshefar echad vaashiyshah echat vayelekhe khׇl-haam iysh leveytvo

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥שׇׁב דָּוִ֖ד לְבָרֵ֣ךְ אֶת־בֵּית֑וֹ {ס} וַתֵּצֵ֞א מִיכַ֤ל בַּת־שָׁאוּל֙ לִקְרַ֣את דָּוִ֔ד וַתֹּ֗אמֶר מַה־נִּכְבַּ֨ד הַיּ֜וֹם מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִגְלָ֤ה הַיּוֹם֙ לְעֵינֵי֙ אַמְה֣וֹת עֲבָדָ֔יו כְּהִגָּל֥וֹת נִגְל֖וֹת אַחַ֥ד הָרֵקִֽים׃
Translated: David went home to greet his household. And Michal daughter of Saul came out to meet David and said, “Didn’t the king of Israel do himself honor today—exposing himself today in the sight of the maidservants of his subjects, as one of the riffraff might expose himself!”
Transliteration: vayashׇv david levarekhe et-veytvo {s} vatetse miykhal vat-shaul likerat david vatomer mah-nikhevad hayyvom melekhe yisherael asher nigelah hayyvom leeyney amehvot avadayv khehigalvot nigelvot achad harekiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִד֮ אֶל־מִיכַל֒ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר בָּחַר־בִּ֤י מֵֽאָבִיךְ֙ וּמִכׇּל־בֵּית֔וֹ לְצַוֺּ֨ת אֹתִ֥י נָגִ֛יד עַל־עַ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְשִׂחַקְתִּ֖י לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: David answered Michal, “It was before G<small>OD</small>—who chose me instead of your father and all his family and appointed me ruler over Israel, G<small>OD</small>’s people! I will dance before G<small>OD</small>
Transliteration: vayomer david el-miykhal lifeney yehovah asher vachar-viy meaviykhe umikhׇl-veytvo letsavot otiy nagiyd al-am yehovah al-yisherael veshichaketiy lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וּנְקַלֹּ֤תִי עוֹד֙ מִזֹּ֔את וְהָיִ֥יתִי שָׁפָ֖ל בְּעֵינָ֑י וְעִם־הָֽאֲמָהוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֔רְתְּ עִמָּ֖ם אִכָּבֵֽדָה׃
Translated: and dishonor myself even more, and be low in my own esteem; but among the maidservants that you speak of I will be honored.”
Transliteration: unekalotiy vod mizot vehayiytiy shafal veeynay veim-haamahvot asher amarete imam ikhavedah

Hebrew: וּלְמִיכַל֙ בַּת־שָׁא֔וּל לֹא־הָ֥יָה לָ֖הּ יָ֑לֶד עַ֖ד י֥וֹם מוֹתָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated: So to her dying day Michal daughter of Saul had no children.
Transliteration: ulemiykhal vat-shaul lo-hayah lah yaled ad yvom mvotah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כִּֽי־יָשַׁ֥ב הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ בְּבֵית֑וֹ וַיהֹוָ֛ה הֵנִיחַֽ־ל֥וֹ מִסָּבִ֖יב מִכׇּל־אֹיְבָֽיו׃
Translated: When the king was settled in his palace and G<small>OD</small> had granted him safety from all the enemies around him,
Transliteration: vayehiy khiy-yashav hamelekhe veveytvo vayhovah heniycha-lvo misaviyv mikhׇl-oyevayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֶל־נָתָ֣ן הַנָּבִ֔יא רְאֵ֣ה נָ֔א אָנֹכִ֥י יוֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּבֵ֣ית אֲרָזִ֑ים וַֽאֲרוֹן֙ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים יֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּת֥וֹךְ הַיְרִיעָֽה׃
Translated: the king said to the prophet Nathan: “Here I am dwelling in a house of cedar, while the Ark of G<small>OD</small> abides in a tent!”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe el-natan hanaviy reeh na anokhiy yvoshev veveyt araziym vaarvon haElohim yoshev vetvokhe hayeriyah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר נָתָן֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר בִּֽלְבָבְךָ֖ לֵ֣ךְ עֲשֵׂ֑ה כִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: Nathan said to the king, “Go and do whatever you have in mind, for G<small>OD</small> is with you.”
Transliteration: vayomer natan el-hamelekhe khol asher vilevavekha lekhe asheh khiy yehovah imakhe

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י בַּלַּ֣יְלָה הַה֑וּא {ס} וַֽיְהִי֙ דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־נָתָ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: But that same night the word of G<small>OD</small> came to Nathan:
Transliteration: vayehiy valayelah hahu {s} vayehiy devar-yehovah el-natan lemor

Hebrew: לֵ֤ךְ וְאָֽמַרְתָּ֙ אֶל־עַבְדִּ֣י אֶל־דָּוִ֔ד {ס} כֹּ֖ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה הַאַתָּ֛ה תִּבְנֶה־לִּ֥י בַ֖יִת לְשִׁבְתִּֽי׃
Translated: “Go and say to My servant David: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: Are you the one to build a house for Me to dwell in?
Transliteration: lekhe veamareta el-avediy el-david {s} khoh amar yehovah haatah tiveneh-liy vayiit leshivetiy

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יָשַׁ֙בְתִּי֙ בְּבַ֔יִת לְ֠מִיּ֠וֹם הַעֲלֹתִ֞י אֶת־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם וְעַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וָאֶֽהְיֶה֙ מִתְהַלֵּ֔ךְ בְּאֹ֖הֶל וּבְמִשְׁכָּֽן׃
Translated: From the day that I brought the people of Israel out of Egypt to this day I have not dwelt in a house, but have moved about in Tent and Tabernacle.
Transliteration: khiy lo yashavetiy vevayiit lemiyyvom haalotiy et-veney yisherael mimitserayiim vead hayyvom hazeh vaeheyeh mitehalekhe veohel uvemishekhan

Hebrew: בְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶֽׁר־הִתְהַלַּ֘כְתִּי֮ בְּכׇל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ הֲדָבָ֣ר דִּבַּ֗רְתִּי אֶת־אַחַד֙ שִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוִּ֗יתִי לִרְע֛וֹת אֶת־עַמִּ֥י אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר לָ֛מָּה לֹֽא־בְנִיתֶ֥ם לִ֖י בֵּ֥ית אֲרָזִֽים׃
Translated: As I moved about wherever the Israelites went, did I ever reproach any of the tribal leaders whom I appointed to care for My people Israel: Why have you not built Me a house of cedar?
Transliteration: vekhol asher-hitehalakhetiy vekhׇl-veney yisherael hadavar divaretiy et-achad shivetey yisherael asher tsiviytiy lirevot et-amiy et-yisherael lemor lamah lo-veniytem liy veyt araziym

Hebrew: וְ֠עַתָּ֠ה כֹּה־תֹאמַ֞ר לְעַבְדִּ֣י לְדָוִ֗ד כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת אֲנִ֤י לְקַחְתִּ֙יךָ֙ מִן־הַנָּוֶ֔ה מֵאַחַ֖ר הַצֹּ֑אן לִֽהְי֣וֹת נָגִ֔יד עַל־עַמִּ֖י עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: “Further, say thus to My servant David: Thus said G<small>OD</small> of Hosts: I took you from the pasture, from following the flock, to be ruler of My people Israel,
Transliteration: veatah khoh-tomar leavediy ledavid khoh amar yehovah tsevavot aniy lekachetiykha min-hanaveh meachar hatson liheyvot nagiyd al-amiy al-yisherael

Hebrew: וָאֶהְיֶ֣ה עִמְּךָ֗ בְּכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָלַ֔כְתָּ וָאַכְרִ֥תָה אֶת־כׇּל־אֹיְבֶ֖יךָ מִפָּנֶ֑יךָ וְעָשִׂ֤תִֽי־לְךָ֙ שֵׁ֣ם גָּד֔וֹל כְּשֵׁ֥ם הַגְּדֹלִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: and I have been with you wherever you went, and have cut down all your enemies before you. Moreover, I will give you great renown like that of the greatest men on earth.
Transliteration: vaeheyeh imekha vekhol asher halakheta vaakheritah et-khׇl-oyeveykha mifaneykha veashitiy-lekha shem gadvol kheshem hagedoliym asher vaarets

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֣י מָ֠ק֠וֹם לְעַמִּ֨י לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל וּנְטַעְתִּיו֙ וְשָׁכַ֣ן תַּחְתָּ֔יו וְלֹ֥א יִרְגַּ֖ז ע֑וֹד וְלֹֽא־יֹסִ֤יפוּ בְנֵֽי־עַוְלָה֙ לְעַנּוֹת֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר בָּרִאשׁוֹנָֽה׃
Translated: I will establish a home for My people Israel and will plant them firm, so that they shall dwell secure and shall tremble no more. Iniquitous people shall not oppress them anymore as in the past,
Transliteration: veshametiy makvom leamiy leyisherael unetaetiyv veshakhan tachetayv velo yiregaz vod velo-yosiyfu veney-avelah leanvotvo khaasher varishvonah

Hebrew: וּלְמִן־הַיּ֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוִּ֤יתִי שֹֽׁפְטִים֙ עַל־עַמִּ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַהֲנִיחֹ֥תִי לְךָ֖ מִכׇּל־אֹיְבֶ֑יךָ וְהִגִּ֤יד לְךָ֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּי־בַ֖יִת יַעֲשֶׂה־לְּךָ֥ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
ever since I appointed chieftains over My people Israel. I will give you safety from all your enemies.
“GOD declares to you: GOD will establish a house for you—
Transliteration: ulemin-hayyvom asher tsiviytiy shofetiym al-amiy yisherael vahaniychotiy lekha mikhׇl-oyeveykha vehigiyd lekha yehovah khiy-vayiit yaasheh-lekha yehovah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ׀ יִמְלְא֣וּ יָמֶ֗יךָ וְשָֽׁכַבְתָּ֙ אֶת־אֲבֹתֶ֔יךָ וַהֲקִימֹתִ֤י אֶֽת־זַרְעֲךָ֙ אַחֲרֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֵצֵ֖א מִמֵּעֶ֑יךָ וַהֲכִינֹתִ֖י אֶת־מַמְלַכְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: When your days are done and you rest with your ancestors, I will raise up your offspring after you, one of your own issue, and I will establish his kingship.
Transliteration: khiy yimeleu yameykha veshakhaveta et-avoteykha vahakiymotiy et-zareakha achareykha asher eitse mimeeykha vahakhiynotiy et-mamelakhetvo

Hebrew: ה֥וּא יִבְנֶה־בַּ֖יִת לִשְׁמִ֑י וְכֹנַנְתִּ֛י אֶת־כִּסֵּ֥א מַמְלַכְתּ֖וֹ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: He shall build a house for My name, and I will establish his royal throne forever.
Transliteration: hu yiveneh-vayiit lishemiy vekhonanetiy et-khise mamelakhetvo ad-volam

Hebrew: אֲנִי֙ אֶֽהְיֶה־לּ֣וֹ לְאָ֔ב וְה֖וּא יִֽהְיֶה־לִּ֣י לְבֵ֑ן אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּהַ֣עֲוֺת֔וֹ וְהֹֽכַחְתִּיו֙ בְּשֵׁ֣בֶט אֲנָשִׁ֔ים וּבְנִגְעֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
Translated:
I will be a father to him,
And he shall be a son to Me.
When he does wrong,
I will chastise him
With the rod of mortals
And the blows of humankind.
Transliteration: aniy eheyeh-lvo leav vehu yiheyeh-liy leven asher vehaavotvo vehokhachetiyv veshevet anashiym uvenigeey veney adam

Hebrew: וְחַסְדִּ֖י לֹא־יָס֣וּר מִמֶּ֑נּוּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר הֲסִרֹ֙תִי֙ מֵעִ֣ם שָׁא֔וּל אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֲסִרֹ֖תִי מִלְּפָנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: “But I will never withdraw My favor from him as I withdrew it from Saul, whom I removed to make room for you.
Transliteration: vechasediy lo-yasur mimenu khaasher hasirotiy meim shaul asher hasirotiy milefaneykha

Hebrew: וְנֶאְמַ֨ן בֵּיתְךָ֧ וּמַֽמְלַכְתְּךָ֛ עַד־עוֹלָ֖ם לְפָנֶ֑יךָ כִּֽסְאֲךָ֔ יִהְיֶ֥ה נָכ֖וֹן עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: Your house and your kingship shall ever be secure before you; your throne shall be established forever.”
Transliteration: veneeman veytekha umamelakhetekha ad-volam lefaneykha khiseakha yiheyeh nakhvon ad-volam

Hebrew: כְּכֹל֙ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וּכְכֹ֖ל הַחִזָּי֣וֹן הַזֶּ֑ה כֵּ֛ן דִּבֶּ֥ר נָתָ֖ן אֶל־דָּוִֽד׃ {פ}
Translated: Nathan spoke to David in accordance with all these words and all this prophecy.
Transliteration: khekhol hadevariym haeleh ukhekhol hachizayvon hazeh khen diver natan el-david {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֙ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֔ד וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר מִ֣י אָנֹכִ֞י אֲדֹנָ֤י יֱהֹוִה֙ וּמִ֣י בֵיתִ֔י כִּ֥י הֲבִאֹתַ֖נִי עַד־הֲלֹֽם׃
Translated: Then King David came and sat before G<small>OD</small>, and he said, “What am I, O Sovereign G<small>OD</small>, and what is my family, that You have brought me thus far?
Transliteration: vayavo hamelekhe david vayeshev lifeney yehovah vayomer miy anokhiy adonay yehovih umiy veytiy khiy haviotaniy ad-halom

Hebrew: וַתִּקְטַן֩ ע֨וֹד זֹ֤את בְּעֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה וַתְּדַבֵּ֛ר גַּ֥ם אֶל־בֵּֽית־עַבְדְּךָ֖ לְמֵרָח֑וֹק וְזֹ֛את תּוֹרַ֥ת הָאָדָ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: Yet even this, O Sovereign G<small>OD</small>, has seemed too little to You; for You have spoken of Your servant’s house also for the future. May that be the law for the people, O Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vatiketan vod zot veeyneykha adonay yehovih vatedaver gam el-veyt-avedekha lemerachvok vezot tvorat haadam adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וּמַה־יּוֹסִ֥יף דָּוִ֛ד ע֖וֹד לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלֶ֑יךָ וְאַתָּ֛ה יָדַ֥עְתָּ אֶֽת־עַבְדְּךָ֖ אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated: What more can David say to You? You know Your servant, O Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: umah-yyvosiyf david vod ledaver eleykha veatah yadaeta et-avedekha adonay yehovih

Hebrew: בַּעֲב֤וּר דְּבָֽרְךָ֙ וּֽכְלִבְּךָ֔ עָשִׂ֕יתָ אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַגְּדוּלָּ֖ה הַזֹּ֑את לְהוֹדִ֖יעַ אֶת־עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: For Your word’s sake and of Your own accord You have wrought this great thing, and made it known to Your servant.
Transliteration: vaavur devarekha ukhelivekha ashiyta et khׇl-hagedulah hazot lehvodiya et-avedekha

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֥ן גָּדַ֖לְתָּ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֑ים כִּֽי־אֵ֣ין כָּמ֗וֹךָ וְאֵ֤ין אֱלֹהִים֙ זוּלָתֶ֔ךָ בְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־שָׁמַ֖עְנוּ בְּאׇזְנֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: You are great indeed, O Sovereign G<small>OD</small>! There is none like You and there is no other God but You, as we have always heard.
Transliteration: al-khen gadaleta yehovah Elohim khiy-eyn khamvokha veeyn Elohim zulatekha vekhol asher-shamaenu veׇzeneynu

Hebrew: וּמִ֤י כְעַמְּךָ֙ כְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל גּ֥וֹי אֶחָ֖ד בָּאָ֑רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָלְכֽוּ־אֱ֠לֹהִ֠ים לִפְדּֽוֹת־ל֨וֹ לְעָ֜ם וְלָשׂ֧וּם ל֣וֹ שֵׁ֗ם וְלַעֲשׂ֨וֹת לָכֶ֜ם הַגְּדוּלָּ֤ה וְנֹֽרָאוֹת֙ לְאַרְצֶ֔ךָ מִפְּנֵ֣י עַמְּךָ֗ אֲשֶׁ֨ר פָּדִ֤יתָ לְּךָ֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם גּוֹיִ֖ם וֵאלֹהָֽיו׃
Translated: And who is like Your people Israel, a unique nation on earth, whom God went and redeemed as a covenanted people, thus winning renown and doing great and marvelous deeds for them [and] for Your land—[driving out] nations and their gods before Your people, whom You redeemed for Yourself from Egypt.
Transliteration: umiy kheamekha kheyisherael gvoy echad vaarets asher halekhu-Elohimm lifedvot-lvo leam velashum lvo shem velaashvot lakhem hagedulah venoravot learetsekha mifeney amekha asher fadiyta lekha mimitserayiim gvoyim velohayv

Hebrew: וַתְּכ֣וֹנֵֽן לְ֠ךָ֠ אֶת־עַמְּךָ֨ יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל ׀ לְךָ֛ לְעָ֖ם עַד־עוֹלָ֑ם וְאַתָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה הָיִ֥יתָ לָהֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִֽים׃ {ס}
