Translated: You have established Your people Israel as Your very own people forever; and You, O E<small>TERNAL</small> One, have become their God.
Transliteration: vatekhvonen lekha et-amekha yisherael lekha leam ad-volam veatah yehovah hayiyta lahem lelohiym {s}

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֔ים הַדָּבָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבַּ֤רְתָּ עַֽל־עַבְדְּךָ֙ וְעַל־בֵּית֔וֹ הָקֵ֖ם עַד־עוֹלָ֑ם וַעֲשֵׂ֖ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּֽרְתָּ׃
Translated: “And now, O E<small>TERNAL</small> God, fulfill Your promise to Your servant and his house forever; and do as You have promised.
Transliteration: veatah yehovah Elohim hadavar asher divareta al-avedekha veal-veytvo hakem ad-volam vaasheh khaasher divareta

Hebrew: וְיִגְדַּ֨ל שִׁמְךָ֤ עַד־עוֹלָם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֔וֹת אֱלֹהִ֖ים עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּבֵית֙ עַבְדְּךָ֣ דָוִ֔ד יִהְיֶ֥ה נָכ֖וֹן לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: And may Your name be glorified forever, in that men will say, ‘G<small>OD</small> of Hosts is God over Israel’; and may the house of Your servant David be established before You.
Transliteration: veyigedal shimekha ad-volam lemor yehovah tsevavot Elohim al-yisherael uveyt avedekha david yiheyeh nakhvon lefaneykha

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתָּה֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה צְבָא֜וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל גָּלִ֜יתָה אֶת־אֹ֤זֶן עַבְדְּךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר בַּ֖יִת אֶבְנֶה־לָּ֑ךְ עַל־כֵּ֗ן מָצָ֤א עַבְדְּךָ֙ אֶת־לִבּ֔וֹ לְהִתְפַּלֵּ֣ל אֵלֶ֔יךָ אֶת־הַתְּפִלָּ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: Because You, O G<small>OD</small> of Hosts, the God of Israel, have revealed to Your servant that You will build a house for him, Your servant has ventured to offer this prayer to You.
Transliteration: khiy-atah yehovah tsevavot elohey yisherael galiytah et-ozen avedekha lemor vayiit eveneh-lakhe al-khen matsa avedekha et-livvo lehitefalel eleykha et-hatefilah hazot

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה אַתָּה־הוּא֙ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וּדְבָרֶ֖יךָ יִהְי֣וּ אֱמֶ֑ת וַתְּדַבֵּר֙ אֶֽל־עַבְדְּךָ֔ אֶת־הַטּוֹבָ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: And now, O Sovereign G<small>OD</small>, You are God and Your words will surely come true, and You have made this gracious promise to Your servant.
Transliteration: veatah adonay yehovih atah-hu haElohim udevareykha yiheyu emet vatedaver el-avedekha et-hatvovah hazot

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה הוֹאֵל֙ וּבָרֵךְ֙ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית עַבְדְּךָ֔ לִֽהְי֥וֹת לְעוֹלָ֖ם לְפָנֶ֑יךָ כִּֽי־אַתָּ֞ה אֲדֹנָ֤י יֱהֹוִה֙ דִּבַּ֔רְתָּ וּמִבִּרְכָ֣תְךָ֔ יְבֹרַ֥ךְ בֵּֽית־עַבְדְּךָ֖ לְעוֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Be pleased, therefore, to bless Your servant’s house, that it abide before You forever; for You, O Sovereign G<small>OD</small>, have spoken. May Your servant’s house be blessed forever by Your blessing.”
Transliteration: veatah hvoel uvarekhe et-veyt avedekha liheyvot levolam lefaneykha khiy-atah adonay yehovih divareta umivirekhatekha yevorakhe veyt-avedekha levolam {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ אַֽחֲרֵי־כֵ֔ן וַיַּ֥ךְ דָּוִ֛ד אֶת־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים וַיַּכְנִיעֵ֑ם וַיִּקַּ֥ח דָּוִ֛ד אֶת־מֶ֥תֶג הָאַמָּ֖ה מִיַּ֥ד פְּלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: Sometime afterward, David attacked the Philistines and subdued them; and David took Metheg-ammah from the Philistines.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey-khen vayakhe david et-felishetiym vayakheniyem vayikach david et-meteg haamah miyad felishetiym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣ךְ אֶת־מוֹאָ֗ב וַֽיְמַדְּדֵ֤ם בַּחֶ֙בֶל֙ הַשְׁכֵּ֣ב אוֹתָ֣ם אַ֔רְצָה וַיְמַדֵּ֤ד שְׁנֵֽי־חֲבָלִים֙ לְהָמִ֔ית וּמְלֹ֥א הַחֶ֖בֶל לְהַחֲי֑וֹת וַתְּהִ֤י מוֹאָב֙ לְדָוִ֔ד לַעֲבָדִ֖ים נֹשְׂאֵ֥י מִנְחָֽה׃
Translated: He also defeated the Moabites. He made them lie down on the ground and he measured them off with a cord; he measured out two lengths of cord for those who were to be put to death, and one length for those to be spared. And the Moabites became tributary vassals of David.
Transliteration: vayakhe et-mvoav vayemadedem vachevel hashekhev votam aretsah vayemaded sheney-chavaliym lehamiyt umelo hachevel lehachayvot vatehiy mvoav ledavid laavadiym nosheey minechah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣ךְ דָּוִ֔ד אֶת־הֲדַדְעֶ֥זֶר בֶּן־רְחֹ֖ב מֶ֣לֶךְ צוֹבָ֑ה בְּלֶכְתּ֕וֹ לְהָשִׁ֥יב יָד֖וֹ (בנהר) [בִּֽנְהַר־פְּרָֽת]׃
Translated: David defeated Hadadezer son of Rehob, king of Zobah, who was then on his way to restore his monument at the Euphrates River.
Transliteration: vayakhe david et-hadadeezer ven-rechov melekhe tsvovah velekhetvo lehashiyv yadvo (vnhr) [vinehar-ferat]

Hebrew: וַיִּלְכֹּ֨ד דָּוִ֜ד מִמֶּ֗נּוּ אֶ֤לֶף וּשְׁבַע־מֵאוֹת֙ פָּרָשִׁ֔ים וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף אִ֣ישׁ רַגְלִ֑י וַיְעַקֵּ֤ר דָּוִד֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הָרֶ֔כֶב וַיּוֹתֵ֥ר מִמֶּ֖נּוּ מֵ֥אָה רָֽכֶב׃
Translated: David captured 1,700 charioteers and 20,000 foot soldiers of his force; and David hamstrung all the chariot horses, except for 100 that he retained.
Transliteration: vayilekhod david mimenu elef usheva-mevot farashiym veesheriym elef iysh rageliy vayeaker david et-khׇl-harekhev vayyvoter mimenu meah rakhev

Hebrew: וַתָּבֹא֙ אֲרַ֣ם דַּמֶּ֔שֶׂק לַעְזֹ֕ר לַהֲדַדְעֶ֖זֶר מֶ֣לֶךְ צוֹבָ֑ה וַיַּ֤ךְ דָּוִד֙ בַּאֲרָ֔ם עֶשְׂרִֽים־וּשְׁנַ֥יִם אֶ֖לֶף אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: And when the Arameans of Damascus came to the aid of King Hadadezer of Zobah, David struck down 22,000 of the Arameans.
Transliteration: vatavo aram dameshek laezor lahadadeezer melekhe tsvovah vayakhe david vaaram esheriym-ushenayiim elef iysh

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨שֶׂם דָּוִ֤ד נְצִבִים֙ בַּאֲרַ֣ם דַּמֶּ֔שֶׂק וַתְּהִ֤י אֲרָם֙ לְדָוִ֔ד לַעֲבָדִ֖ים נוֹשְׂאֵ֣י מִנְחָ֑ה וַיֹּ֤שַׁע יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־דָּוִ֔ד בְּכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָלָֽךְ׃
Translated: David stationed garrisons in Aram of Damascus, and the Arameans became tributary vassals of David. G<small>OD</small> gave David victory wherever he went.
Transliteration: vayashem david netsiviym vaaram dameshek vatehiy aram ledavid laavadiym nvosheey minechah vayosha yehovah et-david vekhol asher halakhe

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח דָּוִ֗ד אֵ֚ת שִׁלְטֵ֣י הַזָּהָ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָי֔וּ אֶ֖ל עַבְדֵ֣י הֲדַדְעָ֑זֶר וַיְבִיאֵ֖ם יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: David took the gold shields carried by Hadadezer’s retinue and brought them to Jerusalem;
Transliteration: vayikach david et shiletey hazahav asher hayu el avedey hadadeazer vayeviyem yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וּמִבֶּ֥טַח וּמִבֵּרֹתַ֖י עָרֵ֣י הֲדַדְעָ֑זֶר לָקַ֞ח הַמֶּ֧לֶךְ דָּוִ֛ד נְחֹ֖שֶׁת הַרְבֵּ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃ {ס}
Translated: and from Betah and Berothai, towns of Hadadezer, King David took a vast amount of copper.
Transliteration: umivetach umiverotay arey hadadeazer lakach hamelekhe david nechoshet hareveh meod {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֕ע תֹּ֖עִי מֶ֣לֶךְ חֲמָ֑ת כִּ֚י הִכָּ֣ה דָוִ֔ד אֵ֖ת כׇּל־חֵ֥יל הֲדַדְעָֽזֶר׃
Translated: When King Toi of Hamath heard that David had defeated the entire army of Hadadezer,
Transliteration: vayishema toiy melekhe chamat khiy hikhah david et khׇl-cheyl hadadeazer

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח תֹּ֣עִי אֶת־יֽוֹרָם־בְּנ֣וֹ אֶל־הַמֶּֽלֶךְ־דָּ֠וִ֠ד לִשְׁאׇל־ל֨וֹ לְשָׁל֜וֹם וּֽלְבָרְכ֗וֹ עַל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִלְחַ֤ם בַּהֲדַדְעֶ֙זֶר֙ וַיַּכֵּ֔הוּ כִּי־אִ֛ישׁ מִלְחֲמ֥וֹת תֹּ֖עִי הָיָ֣ה הֲדַדְעָ֑זֶר וּבְיָד֗וֹ הָי֛וּ כְּלֵי־כֶ֥סֶף וּכְלֵי־זָהָ֖ב וּכְלֵ֥י נְחֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: Toi sent his son Joram to King David to greet him and to congratulate him on his military victory over Hadadezer—for Hadadezer had been at war with Toi. [Joram] brought with him objects of silver, gold, and copper.
Transliteration: vayishelach toiy et-yvoram-venvo el-hamelekhe-david lisheׇl-lvo leshalvom ulevarekhvo al asher nilecham vahadadeezer vayakhehu khiy-iysh milechamvot toiy hayah hadadeazer uveyadvo hayu kheley-khesef ukheley-zahav ukheley nechoshet

Hebrew: גַּם־אֹתָ֕ם הִקְדִּ֛ישׁ הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ דָּוִ֖ד לַיהֹוָ֑ה עִם־הַכֶּ֤סֶף וְהַזָּהָב֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִקְדִּ֔ישׁ מִכׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר כִּבֵּֽשׁ׃
Translated: King David dedicated these to G<small>OD</small>, along with the other silver and gold that he dedicated, [taken] from all the nations he had conquered:
Transliteration: gam-otam hikediysh hamelekhe david layhovah im-hakhesef vehazahav asher hikediysh mikhׇl-hagvoyim asher khivesh

Hebrew: מֵאֲרָ֤ם וּמִמּוֹאָב֙ וּמִבְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן וּמִפְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים וּמֵעֲמָלֵ֑ק וּמִשְּׁלַ֛ל הֲדַדְעֶ֥זֶר בֶּן־רְחֹ֖ב מֶ֥לֶךְ צוֹבָֽה׃
Translated: from Edom, Moab, and Ammon; from the Philistines and the Amalekites, and from the plunder of Hadadezer son of Rehob, king of Zobah.
Transliteration: mearam umimvoav umiveney amvon umifelishetiym umeamalek umishelal hadadeezer ven-rechov melekhe tsvovah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ דָּוִד֙ שֵׁ֔ם בְּשֻׁב֕וֹ מֵהַכּוֹת֥וֹ אֶת־אֲרָ֖ם בְּגֵיא־מֶ֑לַח שְׁמוֹנָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר אָֽלֶף׃
Translated: David gained fame when he returned from defeating Edom, in the Valley of Salt, 18,000 in all.
Transliteration: vayaash david shem veshuvvo mehakhvotvo et-aram vegey-melach shemvonah ashar alef

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨שֶׂם בֶּאֱד֜וֹם נְצִבִ֗ים בְּכׇל־אֱדוֹם֙ שָׂ֣ם נְצִבִ֔ים וַיְהִ֥י כׇל־אֱד֖וֹם עֲבָדִ֣ים לְדָוִ֑ד וַיּ֤וֹשַׁע יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־דָּוִ֔ד בְּכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָלָֽךְ׃
Translated: He stationed garrisons in Edom—he stationed garrisons in all of Edom—and all the Edomites became vassals of David. G<small>OD</small> gave David victory wherever he went.
Transliteration: vayashem veedvom netsiviym vekhׇl-edvom sham netsiviym vayehiy khׇl-edvom avadiym ledavid vayyvosha yehovah et-david vekhol asher halakhe

Hebrew: וַיִּמְלֹ֥ךְ דָּוִ֖ד עַל־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיְהִ֣י דָוִ֗ד עֹשֶׂ֛ה מִשְׁפָּ֥ט וּצְדָקָ֖ה לְכׇל־עַמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: David reigned over all Israel, and David executed true justice among all his people.
Transliteration: vayimelokhe david al-khׇl-yisherael vayehiy david osheh mishefat utsedakah lekhׇl-amvo

Hebrew: וְיוֹאָ֥ב בֶּן־צְרוּיָ֖ה עַל־הַצָּבָ֑א וִיהוֹשָׁפָ֥ט בֶּן־אֲחִיל֖וּד מַזְכִּֽיר׃
Translated: Joab son of Zeruiah was commander of the army; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was recorder;
Transliteration: veyvoav ven-tseruyah al-hatsava viyhvoshafat ven-achiylud mazekhiyr

Hebrew: וְצָד֧וֹק בֶּן־אֲחִיט֛וּב וַאֲחִימֶ֥לֶךְ בֶּן־אֶבְיָתָ֖ר כֹּהֲנִ֑ים וּשְׂרָיָ֖ה סוֹפֵֽר׃
Translated: Zadok son of Ahitub and Ahimelech son of Abiathar were priests; Seraiah was scribe;
Transliteration: vetsadvok ven-achiytuv vaachiymelekhe ven-eveyatar khohaniym usherayah svofer

Hebrew: וּבְנָיָ֙הוּ֙ בֶּן־יְה֣וֹיָדָ֔ע וְהַכְּרֵתִ֖י וְהַפְּלֵתִ֑י וּבְנֵ֥י דָוִ֖ד כֹּהֲנִ֥ים הָיֽוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Benaiah son of Jehoiada was commander of the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and David’s sons were priests.
Transliteration: uvenayahu ven-yehvoyada vehakheretiy vehafeletiy uveney david khohaniym hayu {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֔ד הֲכִ֣י יֶשׁ־ע֔וֹד אֲשֶׁ֥ר נוֹתַ֖ר לְבֵ֣ית שָׁא֑וּל וְאֶעֱשֶׂ֤ה עִמּוֹ֙ חֶ֔סֶד בַּעֲב֖וּר יְהוֹנָתָֽן׃
Translated: David inquired, “Is there anyone still left of the House of Saul with whom I can keep faith for the sake of Jonathan?”
Transliteration: vayomer david hakhiy yesh-vod asher nvotar leveyt shaul veeesheh imvo chesed vaavur yehvonatan

Hebrew: וּלְבֵ֨ית שָׁא֥וּל עֶ֙בֶד֙ וּשְׁמ֣וֹ צִיבָ֔א וַיִּקְרְאוּ־ל֖וֹ אֶל־דָּוִ֑ד וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הַמֶּ֧לֶךְ אֵלָ֛יו הַאַתָּ֥ה צִיבָ֖א וַיֹּ֥אמֶר עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: There was a servant of the House of Saul named Ziba, and they summoned him to David. “Are you Ziba?” the king asked him. “Yes, sir,” he replied.
Transliteration: uleveyt shaul eved ushemvo tsiyva vayikereu-lvo el-david vayomer hamelekhe elayv haatah tsiyva vayomer avedekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ הַאֶ֨פֶס ע֥וֹד אִישׁ֙ לְבֵ֣ית שָׁא֔וּל וְאֶעֱשֶׂ֥ה עִמּ֖וֹ חֶ֣סֶד אֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיֹּ֤אמֶר צִיבָא֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ ע֛וֹד בֵּ֥ן לִיהוֹנָתָ֖ן נְכֵ֥ה רַגְלָֽיִם׃
Translated: The king continued, “Is there any member of the House of Saul left with whom I can keep faith as pledged before God?” Ziba answered the king, “Yes, there is still a son of Jonathan whose feet are crippled.”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe haefes vod iysh leveyt shaul veeesheh imvo chesed Elohim vayomer tsiyva el-hamelekhe vod ven liyhvonatan nekheh ragelayiim

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמֶר־ל֥וֹ הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֵיפֹ֣ה ה֑וּא וַיֹּ֤אמֶר צִיבָא֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ הִנֵּה־ה֗וּא בֵּ֛ית מָכִ֥יר בֶּן־עַמִּיאֵ֖ל בְּל֥וֹ דְבָֽר׃
Translated: “Where is he?” the king asked, and Ziba said to the king, “He is in the house of Machir son of Ammiel, in Lo-debar.”
Transliteration: vayomer-lvo hamelekhe eyfoh hu vayomer tsiyva el-hamelekhe hineh-hu veyt makhiyr ven-amiyel velvo devar

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֖ח הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֑ד וַיִּקָּחֵ֗הוּ מִבֵּ֛ית מָכִ֥יר בֶּן־עַמִּיאֵ֖ל מִלּ֥וֹ דְבָֽר׃
Translated: King David had him brought from the house of Machir son of Ammiel, at Lo-debar;
Transliteration: vayishelach hamelekhe david vayikachehu miveyt makhiyr ven-amiyel milvo devar

Hebrew: וַ֠יָּבֹ֠א מְפִיבֹ֨שֶׁת בֶּן־יְהוֹנָתָ֤ן בֶּן־שָׁאוּל֙ אֶל־דָּוִ֔ד וַיִּפֹּ֥ל עַל־פָּנָ֖יו וַיִּשְׁתָּ֑חוּ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר דָּוִד֙ מְפִיבֹ֔שֶׁת וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הִנֵּ֥ה עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: and when Mephibosheth son of Jonathan son of Saul came to David, he flung himself on his face and prostrated himself. David said, “Mephibosheth!” and he replied, “At your service, sir.”
Transliteration: vayavo mefiyvoshet ven-yehvonatan ven-shaul el-david vayifol al-fanayv vayishetachu vayomer david mefiyvoshet vayomer hineh avedekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ ל֨וֹ דָוִ֜ד אַל־תִּירָ֗א כִּ֣י עָשֹׂה֩ אֶעֱשֶׂ֨ה עִמְּךָ֥ חֶ֙סֶד֙ בַּֽעֲבוּר֙ יְהוֹנָתָ֣ן אָבִ֔יךָ וַהֲשִׁבֹתִ֣י לְךָ֔ אֶֽת־כׇּל־שְׂדֵ֖ה שָׁא֣וּל אָבִ֑יךָ וְאַתָּ֗ה תֹּ֥אכַל לֶ֛חֶם עַל־שֻׁלְחָנִ֖י תָּמִֽיד׃
Translated: David said to him, “Don’t be afraid, for I will keep faith with you for the sake of your father Jonathan. I will give you back all the land of your grandfather Saul; moreover, you shall always eat at my table.”
Transliteration: vayomer lvo david al-tiyra khiy ashoh eesheh imekha chesed vaavur yehvonatan aviykha vahashivotiy lekha et-khׇl-shedeh shaul aviykha veatah tokhal lechem al-shulechaniy tamiyd

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁתַּ֕חוּ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר מֶ֣ה עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֣י פָנִ֔יתָ אֶל־הַכֶּ֥לֶב הַמֵּ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר כָּמֽוֹנִי׃
Translated: [Mephibosheth] prostrated himself again, and said, “What is your servant, that you should show regard for a dead dog like me?”
Transliteration: vayishetachu vayomer meh avedekha khiy faniyta el-hakhelev hamet asher khamvoniy

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ אֶל־צִיבָ֛א נַ֥עַר שָׁא֖וּל וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֑יו כֹּל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הָיָ֤ה לְשָׁאוּל֙ וּלְכׇל־בֵּית֔וֹ נָתַ֖תִּי לְבֶן־אֲדֹנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: The king summoned Ziba, Saul’s steward, and said to him, “I give to your master’s grandson everything that belonged to Saul and to his entire family.
Transliteration: vayikera hamelekhe el-tsiyva naar shaul vayomer elayv khol asher hayah leshaul ulekhׇl-veytvo natatiy leven-adoneykha

Hebrew: וְעָבַ֣דְתָּ לּ֣וֹ אֶֽת־הָאֲדָמָ֡ה אַתָּה֩ וּבָנֶ֨יךָ וַעֲבָדֶ֜יךָ וְהֵבֵ֗אתָ וְהָיָ֨ה לְבֶן־אֲדֹנֶ֤יךָ לֶּ֙חֶם֙ וַאֲכָל֔וֹ וּמְפִיבֹ֙שֶׁת֙ בֶּן־אֲדֹנֶ֔יךָ יֹאכַ֥ל תָּמִ֛יד לֶ֖חֶם עַל־שֻׁלְחָנִ֑י וּלְצִיבָ֗א חֲמִשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֛ר בָּנִ֖ים וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים עֲבָדִֽים׃
Translated: You and your sons and your slaves shall farm the land for him and shall bring in [its yield] to provide food for your master’s grandson to live on; but Mephibosheth, your master’s grandson, shall always eat at my table.”—Ziba had fifteen sons and twenty slaves.—
Transliteration: veavadeta lvo et-haadamah atah uvaneykha vaavadeykha veheveta vehayah leven-adoneykha lechem vaakhalvo umefiyvoshet ven-adoneykha yokhal tamiyd lechem al-shulechaniy uletsiyva chamishah ashar vaniym veesheriym avadiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר צִיבָא֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ כְּכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְצַוֶּ֜ה אֲדֹנִ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֶת־עַבְדּ֔וֹ כֵּ֖ן יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ וּמְפִיבֹ֗שֶׁת אֹכֵל֙ עַל־שֻׁלְחָנִ֔י כְּאַחַ֖ד מִבְּנֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Ziba said to the king, “Your servant will do just as my lord the king has commanded him.” “Mephibosheth shall eat at my table like one of the king’s sons.”
Transliteration: vayomer tsiyva el-hamelekhe khekhol asher yetsaveh adoniy hamelekhe et-avedvo khen yaasheh avedekha umefiyvoshet okhel al-shulechaniy kheachad miveney hamelekhe

Hebrew: וְלִמְפִיבֹ֥שֶׁת בֵּן־קָטָ֖ן וּשְׁמ֣וֹ מִיכָ֑א וְכֹל֙ מוֹשַׁ֣ב בֵּית־צִיבָ֔א עֲבָדִ֖ים לִמְפִיבֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: Mephibosheth had a young son named Mica; and all the members of Ziba’s household worked for Mephibosheth.
Transliteration: velimefiyvoshet ven-katan ushemvo miykha vekhol mvoshav veyt-tsiyva avadiym limefiyvoshet

Hebrew: וּמְפִיבֹ֗שֶׁת יֹשֵׁב֙ בִּיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם כִּ֣י עַל־שֻׁלְחַ֥ן הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ תָּמִ֖יד ה֣וּא אֹכֵ֑ל וְה֥וּא פִסֵּ֖חַ שְׁתֵּ֥י רַגְלָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Mephibosheth lived in Jerusalem, for he ate regularly at the king’s table. He was lame in both feet.
Transliteration: umefiyvoshet yoshev viyrushala͏im khiy al-shulechan hamelekhe tamiyd hu okhel vehu fisecha shetey ragelayv {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ אַחֲרֵי־כֵ֔ן וַיָּ֕מׇת מֶ֖לֶךְ בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֑וֹן וַיִּמְלֹ֛ךְ חָנ֥וּן בְּנ֖וֹ תַּחְתָּֽיו׃
Translated: Sometime afterward, the king of Ammon died, and his son Hanun succeeded him as king.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey-khen vayamׇt melekhe veney amvon vayimelokhe chanun venvo tachetayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜ד אֶעֱשֶׂה־חֶ֣סֶד ׀ עִם־חָנ֣וּן בֶּן־נָחָ֗שׁ כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ עָשָׂ֨ה אָבִ֤יו עִמָּדִי֙ חֶ֔סֶד וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח דָּוִ֧ד לְנַחֲמ֛וֹ בְּיַד־עֲבָדָ֖יו אֶל־אָבִ֑יו וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ עַבְדֵ֣י דָוִ֔ד אֶ֖רֶץ בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃
Translated: David said, “I will keep faith with Hanun son of Nahash, just as his father kept faith with me.” He sent his courtiers with a message of condolence to him over his father. But when David’s courtiers came to the land of Ammon,
Transliteration: vayomer david eesheh-chesed im-chanun ven-nachash khaasher ashah aviyv imadiy chesed vayishelach david lenachamvo veyad-avadayv el-aviyv vayavou avedey david erets veney amvon

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְרוּ֩ שָׂרֵ֨י בְנֵי־עַמּ֜וֹן אֶל־חָנ֣וּן אֲדֹנֵיהֶ֗ם הַֽמְכַבֵּ֨ד דָּוִ֤ד אֶת־אָבִ֙יךָ֙ בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ כִּֽי־שָׁלַ֥ח לְךָ֖ מְנַחֲמִ֑ים הֲ֠ל֠וֹא בַּעֲב֞וּר חֲקֹ֤ר אֶת־הָעִיר֙ וּלְרַגְּלָ֣הּ וּלְהׇפְכָ֔הּ שָׁלַ֥ח דָּוִ֛ד אֶת־עֲבָדָ֖יו אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: the Ammonite officials said to their lord Hanun, “Do you think David is really honoring your father just because he sent you consolers? Why, David has sent his courtiers to you to explore and spy out the city, and to overthrow it.”
Transliteration: vayomeru sharey veney-amvon el-chanun adoneyhem hamekhaved david et-aviykha veeyneykha khiy-shalach lekha menachamiym halvo vaavur chakor et-haiyr uleragelah ulehׇfekhah shalach david et-avadayv eleykha

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח חָנ֜וּן אֶת־עַבְדֵ֣י דָוִ֗ד וַיְגַלַּח֙ אֶת־חֲצִ֣י זְקָנָ֔ם וַיִּכְרֹ֧ת אֶת־מַדְוֵיהֶ֛ם בַּחֵ֖צִי עַ֣ד שְׁתוֹתֵיהֶ֑ם וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֵֽם׃
Translated: So Hanun seized David’s courtiers, clipped off one side of their beards and cut away half of their garments at the buttocks, and sent them off.
Transliteration: vayikach chanun et-avedey david vayegalach et-chatsiy zekanam vayikherot et-madeveyhem vachetsiy ad shetvoteyhem vayeshalechem

Hebrew: וַיַּגִּ֤דוּ לְדָוִד֙ וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח לִקְרָאתָ֔ם כִּי־הָי֥וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים נִכְלָמִ֣ים מְאֹ֑ד וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ שְׁב֣וּ בִירֵח֔וֹ עַד־יְצַמַּ֥ח זְקַנְכֶ֖ם וְשַׁבְתֶּֽם׃
Translated: When David was told about the men, he dispatched others to meet them, for they were greatly embarrassed. And the king gave orders: “Stop in Jericho until your beards grow back; then you can return.”
Transliteration: vayagidu ledavid vayishelach likeratam khiy-hayu haanashiym nikhelamiym meod vayomer hamelekhe shevu viyrechvo ad-yetsamach zekanekhem veshavetem

Hebrew: וַיִּרְאוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן כִּ֥י נִבְאֲשׁ֖וּ בְּדָוִ֑ד וַיִּשְׁלְח֣וּ בְנֵי־עַמּ֡וֹן וַיִּשְׂכְּרוּ֩ אֶת־אֲרַ֨ם בֵּית־רְח֜וֹב וְאֶת־אֲרַ֣ם צוֹבָ֗א עֶשְׂרִ֥ים אֶ֙לֶף֙ רַגְלִ֔י וְאֶת־מֶ֤לֶךְ מַֽעֲכָה֙ אֶ֣לֶף אִ֔ישׁ וְאִ֣ישׁ ט֔וֹב שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֥ר אֶ֖לֶף אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: The Ammonites realized that they had incurred the wrath of David. So the Ammonites sent agents and hired Arameans of Beth-rehob and Arameans of Zobah—20,000 foot soldiers—and the king of Maacah [with both his] 1,000 men and Tob’s contingent of 12,000 men.
Transliteration: vayireu veney amvon khiy niveashu vedavid vayishelechu veney-amvon vayishekheru et-aram veyt-rechvov veet-aram tsvova esheriym elef rageliy veet-melekhe maakhah elef iysh veiysh tvov sheneym-ashar elef iysh

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֖ע דָּוִ֑ד וַיִּשְׁלַח֙ אֶת־יוֹאָ֔ב וְאֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַצָּבָ֖א הַגִּבֹּרִֽים׃
Translated: On learning this, David sent out Joab and the entire army of mighty soldiers.
Transliteration: vayishema david vayishelach et-yvoav veet khׇl-hatsava hagivoriym

Hebrew: וַיֵּֽצְאוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן וַיַּעַרְכ֥וּ מִלְחָמָ֖ה פֶּ֣תַח הַשָּׁ֑עַר וַאֲרַ֨ם צוֹבָ֤א וּרְחוֹב֙ וְאִֽישׁ־ט֣וֹב וּמַעֲכָ֔ה לְבַדָּ֖ם בַּשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated: The Ammonites marched out and took up their battle position at the entrance of the gate, while the Arameans of Zobah and Rehob and Tob’s contingent and Maacah took their stand separately in the open.
Transliteration: vayetseu veney amvon vayaarekhu milechamah fetach hashaar vaaram tsvova urechvov veiysh-tvov umaakhah levadam vashadeh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא יוֹאָ֗ב כִּֽי־הָיְתָ֤ה אֵלָיו֙ פְּנֵ֣י הַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה מִפָּנִ֖ים וּמֵאָח֑וֹר וַיִּבְחַ֗ר מִכֹּל֙ בְּחוּרֵ֣י (בישראל) [יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל] וַֽיַּעֲרֹ֖ךְ לִקְרַ֥את אֲרָֽם׃
Translated: Joab saw that there was a battle line against him both front and rear. So he made a selection from all the best soldiers of Israel and arrayed them against the Arameans,
Transliteration: vayare yvoav khiy-hayetah elayv feney hamilechamah mifaniym umeachvor vayivechar mikhol vechurey (vyshrl) [yisherael] vayaarokhe likerat aram

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ יֶ֣תֶר הָעָ֔ם נָתַ֕ן בְּיַ֖ד אַבְשַׁ֣י אָחִ֑יו וַיַּעֲרֹ֕ךְ לִקְרַ֖את בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃
Translated: and the rest of the troops he put under the command of his brother Abishai and arrayed them against the Ammonites.
Transliteration: veet yeter haam natan veyad aveshay achiyv vayaarokhe likerat veney amvon

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אִם־תֶּחֱזַ֤ק אֲרָם֙ מִמֶּ֔נִּי וְהָיִ֥תָה לִּ֖י לִישׁוּעָ֑ה וְאִם־בְּנֵ֤י עַמּוֹן֙ יֶחֶזְק֣וּ מִמְּךָ֔ וְהָלַכְתִּ֖י לְהוֹשִׁ֥יעַֽ לָֽךְ׃
Translated: [Joab] said, “If the Arameans prove too strong for me, you come to my aid; and if the Ammonites prove too strong for you, I will come to your aid.
Transliteration: vayomer im-techezak aram mimeniy vehayitah liy liyshuah veim-veney amvon yechezeku mimekha vehalakhetiy lehvoshiya lakhe

Hebrew: חֲזַ֤ק וְנִתְחַזַּק֙ בְּעַד־עַמֵּ֔נוּ וּבְעַ֖ד עָרֵ֣י אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וַֽיהֹוָ֔ה יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה הַטּ֖וֹב בְּעֵינָֽיו׃
Translated: Let us be strong and resolute for the sake of our people and the land of our God; and accept the outcome that G<small>OD</small> deems right.”
Transliteration: chazak venitechazak vead-amenu uvead arey eloheynu vayhovah yaasheh hatvov veeynayv

Hebrew: וַיִּגַּ֣שׁ יוֹאָ֗ב וְהָעָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עִמּ֔וֹ לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה בַּאֲרָ֑ם וַיָּנֻ֖סוּ מִפָּנָֽיו׃
Translated: Joab and the troops with him marched into battle against the Arameans, who fled before him.
Transliteration: vayigash yvoav vehaam asher imvo lamilechamah vaaram vayanusu mifanayv

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֨י עַמּ֤וֹן רָאוּ֙ כִּֽי־נָ֣ס אֲרָ֔ם וַיָּנֻ֙סוּ֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י אֲבִישַׁ֔י וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ הָעִ֑יר וַיָּ֣שׇׁב יוֹאָ֗ב מֵעַל֙ בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן וַיָּבֹ֖א יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: And when the Ammonites saw that the Arameans had fled, they fled before Abishai and withdrew into the city. So Joab broke off the attack against the Ammonites, and went to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: uveney amvon rau khiy-nas aram vayanusu mifeney aviyshay vayavou haiyr vayashׇv yvoav meal veney amvon vayavo yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא אֲרָ֔ם כִּ֥י נִגַּ֖ף לִפְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֵּאָסְפ֖וּ יָֽחַד׃
Translated: When the Arameans saw that they had been routed by Israel, they regrouped their forces.
Transliteration: vayare aram khiy nigaf lifeney yisherael vayeasefu yachad

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח הֲדַדְעֶ֗זֶר וַיֹּצֵ֤א אֶת־אֲרָם֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ מֵעֵ֣בֶר הַנָּהָ֔ר וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ חֵילָ֑ם וְשׁוֹבַ֛ךְ שַׂר־צְבָ֥א הֲדַדְעֶ֖זֶר לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Hadadezer sent for and brought out the Arameans from across the Euphrates; they came to Helam, led by Shobach, Hadadezer’s army commander.
Transliteration: vayishelach hadadeezer vayotse et-aram asher meever hanahar vayavou cheylam veshvovakhe shar-tseva hadadeezer lifeneyhem {s}

Hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֣ד לְדָוִ֗ד וַיֶּאֱסֹ֤ף אֶת־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וַיַּעֲבֹ֣ר אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן וַיָּבֹ֖א חֵלָ֑אמָה וַיַּעַרְכ֤וּ אֲרָם֙ לִקְרַ֣את דָּוִ֔ד וַיִּֽלָּחֲמ֖וּ עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: David was informed of it; he assembled all Israel, crossed the Jordan, and came to Helam. The Arameans drew up their forces against David and attacked him;
Transliteration: vayugad ledavid vayeesof et-khׇl-yisherael vayaavor et-hayareden vayavo chelamah vayaarekhu aram likerat david vayilachamu imvo

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣נׇס אֲרָם֮ מִפְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וַיַּהֲרֹ֨ג דָּוִ֜ד מֵאֲרָ֗ם שְׁבַ֤ע מֵאוֹת֙ רֶ֔כֶב וְאַרְבָּעִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף פָּרָשִׁ֑ים וְאֵ֨ת שׁוֹבַ֧ךְ שַׂר־צְבָא֛וֹ הִכָּ֖ה וַיָּ֥מׇת שָֽׁם׃
Translated: but the Arameans were put to flight by Israel. David killed 700 Aramean chariot teams and 40,000 riders; he also struck down Shobach, Hadadezer’s army commander, who died there.
Transliteration: vayanׇs aram mifeney yisherael vayaharog david mearam sheva mevot rekhev vearevaiym elef farashiym veet shvovakhe shar-tsevavo hikhah vayamׇt sham

Hebrew: וַיִּרְא֨וּ כׇֽל־הַמְּלָכִ֜ים עַבְדֵ֣י הֲדַדְעֶ֗זֶר כִּ֤י נִגְּפוּ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיַּשְׁלִ֥מוּ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וַיַּעַבְד֑וּם וַיִּֽרְא֣וּ אֲרָ֔ם לְהוֹשִׁ֥יעַ ע֖וֹד אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃ {פ}
Translated: And when all the vassal kings of Hadadezer saw that they had been routed by Israel, they submitted to Israel and became their vassals. And the Arameans were afraid to help the Ammonites anymore.
Transliteration: vayireu khׇl-hamelakhiym avedey hadadeezer khiy nigefu lifeney yisherael vayashelimu et-yisherael vayaavedum vayireu aram lehvoshiya vod et-veney amvon {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ לִתְשׁוּבַ֨ת הַשָּׁנָ֜ה לְעֵ֣ת ׀ צֵ֣את הַמְּלָאכִ֗ים וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח דָּוִ֡ד אֶת־יוֹאָב֩ וְאֶת־עֲבָדָ֨יו עִמּ֜וֹ וְאֶת־כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וַיַּשְׁחִ֙תוּ֙ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן וַיָּצֻ֖רוּ עַל־רַבָּ֑ה וְדָוִ֖ד יוֹשֵׁ֥ב בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated: At the turn of the year, the season when kings go out [to battle], David sent Joab with his officers and all Israel with him, and they devastated Ammon and besieged Rabbah; David remained in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayehiy liteshuvat hashanah leet tset hamelakhiym vayishelach david et-yvoav veet-avadayv imvo veet-khׇl-yisherael vayashechitu et-veney amvon vayatsuru al-ravah vedavid yvoshev viyrushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ לְעֵ֣ת הָעֶ֗רֶב וַיָּ֨קׇם דָּוִ֜ד מֵעַ֤ל מִשְׁכָּבוֹ֙ וַיִּתְהַלֵּךְ֙ עַל־גַּ֣ג בֵּית־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַיַּ֥רְא אִשָּׁ֛ה רֹחֶ֖צֶת מֵעַ֣ל הַגָּ֑ג וְהָ֣אִשָּׁ֔ה טוֹבַ֥ת מַרְאֶ֖ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: Late one afternoon, David rose from his couch and strolled on the roof of the royal palace; and from the roof he saw a woman bathing. The woman was very beautiful,
Transliteration: vayehiy leet haerev vayakׇm david meal mishekhavvo vayitehalekhe al-gag veyt-hamelekhe vayare ishah rochetset meal hagag vehaishah tvovat mareeh meod

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח דָּוִ֔ד וַיִּדְרֹ֖שׁ לָאִשָּׁ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הֲלוֹא־זֹאת֙ בַּת־שֶׁ֣בַע בַּת־אֱלִיעָ֔ם אֵ֖שֶׁת אוּרִיָּ֥ה הַֽחִתִּֽי׃
Translated: and David sent someone to make inquiries about the woman. He reported, “She is Bathsheba daughter of Eliam [and] wife of Uriah the Hittite.”
Transliteration: vayishelach david vayiderosh laishah vayomer halvo-zot vat-sheva vat-eliyam eshet uriyah hachitiy

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֩ דָּוִ֨ד מַלְאָכִ֜ים וַיִּקָּחֶ֗הָ וַתָּב֤וֹא אֵלָיו֙ וַיִּשְׁכַּ֣ב עִמָּ֔הּ וְהִ֥יא מִתְקַדֶּ֖שֶׁת מִטֻּמְאָתָ֑הּ וַתָּ֖שׇׁב אֶל־בֵּיתָֽהּ׃
Translated: David sent messengers to fetch her; she came to him and he lay with her—she had just purified herself after her period—and she went back home.
Transliteration: vayishelach david maleakhiym vayikacheha vatavvo elayv vayishekhav imah vehiy mitekadeshet mitumeatah vatashׇv el-veytah

Hebrew: וַתַּ֖הַר הָאִשָּׁ֑ה וַתִּשְׁלַח֙ וַתַּגֵּ֣ד לְדָוִ֔ד וַתֹּ֖אמֶר הָרָ֥ה אָנֹֽכִי׃
Translated: The woman conceived, and she sent word to David, “I am pregnant.”
Transliteration: vatahar haishah vatishelach vataged ledavid vatomer harah anokhiy

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח דָּוִד֙ אֶל־יוֹאָ֔ב שְׁלַ֣ח אֵלַ֔י אֶת־אוּרִיָּ֖ה הַחִתִּ֑י וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח יוֹאָ֛ב אֶת־אוּרִיָּ֖ה אֶל־דָּוִֽד׃
Translated: Thereupon David sent a message to Joab, “Send Uriah the Hittite to me”; and Joab sent Uriah to David.
Transliteration: vayishelach david el-yvoav shelach elay et-uriyah hachitiy vayishelach yvoav et-uriyah el-david

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א אוּרִיָּ֖ה אֵלָ֑יו וַיִּשְׁאַ֣ל דָּוִ֗ד לִשְׁל֤וֹם יוֹאָב֙ וְלִשְׁל֣וֹם הָעָ֔ם וְלִשְׁל֖וֹם הַמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: When Uriah came to him, David asked him how Joab and the troops were faring and how the war was going.
Transliteration: vayavo uriyah elayv vayisheal david lishelvom yvoav velishelvom haam velishelvom hamilechamah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר דָּוִד֙ לְא֣וּרִיָּ֔ה רֵ֥ד לְבֵיתְךָ֖ וּרְחַ֣ץ רַגְלֶ֑יךָ וַיֵּצֵ֤א אֽוּרִיָּה֙ מִבֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַתֵּצֵ֥א אַחֲרָ֖יו מַשְׂאַ֥ת הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Then David said to Uriah, “Go down to your house and bathe your feet.” When Uriah left the royal palace, a present from the king followed him.
Transliteration: vayomer david leuriyah red leveytekha urechats rageleykha vayetse uriyah miveyt hamelekhe vatetse acharayv masheat hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֣ב אוּרִיָּ֗ה פֶּ֚תַח בֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אֵ֖ת כׇּל־עַבְדֵ֣י אֲדֹנָ֑יו וְלֹ֥א יָרַ֖ד אֶל־בֵּיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: But Uriah slept at the entrance of the royal palace, along with the other officers of his lord, and did not go down to his house.
Transliteration: vayishekhav uriyah fetach veyt hamelekhe et khׇl-avedey adonayv velo yarad el-veytvo

Hebrew: וַיַּגִּ֤דוּ לְדָוִד֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹא־יָרַ֥ד אוּרִיָּ֖ה אֶל־בֵּית֑וֹ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜ד אֶל־אוּרִיָּ֗ה הֲל֤וֹא מִדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אַתָּ֣ה בָ֔א מַדּ֖וּעַ לֹא־יָרַ֥דְתָּ אֶל־בֵּיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: When David was told that Uriah had not gone down to his house, he said to Uriah, “You just came from a journey; why didn’t you go down to your house?”
Transliteration: vayagidu ledavid lemor lo-yarad uriyah el-veytvo vayomer david el-uriyah halvo miderekhe atah va madua lo-yaradeta el-veytekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אוּרִיָּ֜ה אֶל־דָּוִ֗ד הָ֠אָר֠וֹן וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֨ל וִיהוּדָ֜ה יֹשְׁבִ֣ים בַּסֻּכּ֗וֹת וַאדֹנִ֨י יוֹאָ֜ב וְעַבְדֵ֤י אֲדֹנִי֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֤י הַשָּׂדֶה֙ חֹנִ֔ים וַאֲנִ֞י אָב֧וֹא אֶל־בֵּיתִ֛י לֶאֱכֹ֥ל וְלִשְׁתּ֖וֹת וְלִשְׁכַּ֣ב עִם־אִשְׁתִּ֑י חַיֶּ֙ךָ֙ וְחֵ֣י נַפְשֶׁ֔ךָ אִֽם־אֶעֱשֶׂ֖ה אֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Uriah answered David, “The Ark and Israel and Judah are located at Succoth, and my master Joab and Your Majesty’s men are camped in the open; how can I go home and eat and drink and sleep with my wife? As you live, by your very life, I will not do this!”
Transliteration: vayomer uriyah el-david haarvon veyisherael viyhudah yosheviym vasukhvot vadoniy yvoav veavedey adoniy al-feney hashadeh choniym vaaniy avvo el-veytiy leekhol velishetvot velishekhav im-ishetiy chayekha vechey nafeshekha im-eesheh et-hadavar hazeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜ד אֶל־אוּרִיָּ֗ה שֵׁ֥ב בָּזֶ֛ה גַּם־הַיּ֖וֹם וּמָחָ֣ר אֲשַׁלְּחֶ֑ךָּ וַיֵּ֨שֶׁב אוּרִיָּ֧ה בִירוּשָׁלַ֛͏ִם בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא וּמִֽמׇּחֳרָֽת׃
Translated: David said to Uriah, “Stay here today also, and tomorrow I will send you off.” So Uriah remained in Jerusalem that day. The next day,
Transliteration: vayomer david el-uriyah shev vazeh gam-hayyvom umachar ashalechekha vayeshev uriyah viyrushala͏im vayyvom hahu umimׇchorat

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָא־ל֣וֹ דָוִ֗ד וַיֹּ֧אכַל לְפָנָ֛יו וַיֵּ֖שְׁתְּ וַֽיְשַׁכְּרֵ֑הוּ וַיֵּצֵ֣א בָעֶ֗רֶב לִשְׁכַּ֤ב בְּמִשְׁכָּבוֹ֙ עִם־עַבְדֵ֣י אֲדֹנָ֔יו וְאֶל־בֵּית֖וֹ לֹ֥א יָרָֽד׃
Translated: David summoned him, and he ate and drank with him until he got him drunk; but in the evening, [Uriah] went out to sleep in the same place, with his lord’s officers; he did not go down to his home.
Transliteration: vayikera-lvo david vayokhal lefanayv vayeshete vayeshakherehu vayetse vaerev lishekhav vemishekhavvo im-avedey adonayv veel-veytvo lo yarad

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בַבֹּ֔קֶר וַיִּכְתֹּ֥ב דָּוִ֛ד סֵ֖פֶר אֶל־יוֹאָ֑ב וַיִּשְׁלַ֖ח בְּיַ֥ד אוּרִיָּֽה׃
Translated: In the morning, David wrote a letter to Joab, which he sent with Uriah.
Transliteration: vayehiy vavoker vayikhetov david sefer el-yvoav vayishelach veyad uriyah

Hebrew: וַיִּכְתֹּ֥ב בַּסֵּ֖פֶר לֵאמֹ֑ר הָב֣וּ אֶת־אוּרִיָּ֗ה אֶל־מוּל֙ פְּנֵ֤י הַמִּלְחָמָה֙ הַחֲזָקָ֔ה וְשַׁבְתֶּ֥ם מֵאַחֲרָ֖יו וְנִכָּ֥ה וָמֵֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: He wrote in the letter as follows: “Place Uriah in the front line where the fighting is fiercest; then fall back so that he may be killed.”
Transliteration: vayikhetov vasefer lemor havu et-uriyah el-mul feney hamilechamah hachazakah veshavetem meacharayv venikhah vamet {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י בִּשְׁמ֥וֹר יוֹאָ֖ב אֶל־הָעִ֑יר וַיִּתֵּן֙ אֶת־א֣וּרִיָּ֔ה אֶל־הַמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָדַ֔ע כִּ֥י אַנְשֵׁי־חַ֖יִל שָֽׁם׃
Translated: So when Joab was besieging the city, he stationed Uriah at the point where he knew that there were able warriors.
Transliteration: vayehiy vishemvor yvoav el-haiyr vayiten et-uriyah el-hamakvom asher yada khiy aneshey-chayiil sham

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨צְא֜וּ אַנְשֵׁ֤י הָעִיר֙ וַיִּלָּחֲמ֣וּ אֶת־יוֹאָ֔ב וַיִּפֹּ֥ל מִן־הָעָ֖ם מֵעַבְדֵ֣י דָוִ֑ד וַיָּ֕מׇת גַּ֖ם אוּרִיָּ֥ה הַחִתִּֽי׃
Translated: Men from the city sallied out and attacked Joab, and some of David’s officers among the troops fell; Uriah the Hittite was among those who died.
Transliteration: vayetseu aneshey haiyr vayilachamu et-yvoav vayifol min-haam meavedey david vayamׇt gam uriyah hachitiy

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֖ח יוֹאָ֑ב וַיַּגֵּ֣ד לְדָוִ֔ד אֶת־כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֖י הַמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: Joab sent a full report of the battle to David.
Transliteration: vayishelach yvoav vayaged ledavid et-khׇl-diverey hamilechamah

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֥ו אֶת־הַמַּלְאָ֖ךְ לֵאמֹ֑ר כְּכַלּוֹתְךָ֗ אֵ֛ת כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֥י הַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה לְדַבֵּ֥ר אֶל־הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: He instructed the messenger as follows: “When you finish reporting to the king all about the battle,
Transliteration: vayetsav et-hamaleakhe lemor khekhalvotekha et khׇl-diverey hamilechamah ledaver el-hamelekhe

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה אִֽם־תַּעֲלֶה֙ חֲמַ֣ת הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְאָמַ֣ר לְךָ֔ מַדּ֛וּעַ נִגַּשְׁתֶּ֥ם אֶל־הָעִ֖יר לְהִלָּחֵ֑ם הֲל֣וֹא יְדַעְתֶּ֔ם אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־יֹר֖וּ מֵעַ֥ל הַחוֹמָֽה׃
Translated: the king may get angry and say to you, ‘Why did you come so close to the city to attack it? Didn’t you know that they would shoot from the wall?
Transliteration: vehayah im-taaleh chamat hamelekhe veamar lekha madua nigashetem el-haiyr lehilachem halvo yedaetem et asher-yoru meal hachvomah

Hebrew: מִֽי־הִכָּ֞ה אֶת־אֲבִימֶ֣לֶךְ בֶּן־יְרֻבֶּ֗שֶׁת הֲלֽוֹא־אִשָּׁ֡ה הִשְׁלִ֣יכָה עָלָיו֩ פֶּ֨לַח רֶ֜כֶב מֵעַ֤ל הַחוֹמָה֙ וַיָּ֣מׇת בְּתֵבֵ֔ץ לָ֥מָּה נִגַּשְׁתֶּ֖ם אֶל־הַחוֹמָ֑ה וְאָ֣מַרְתָּ֔ גַּ֗ם עַבְדְּךָ֛ אוּרִיָּ֥ה הַחִתִּ֖י מֵֽת׃
Translated: Who struck down Abimelech son of Jerubbesheth? Was it not a woman who dropped an upper millstone on him from the wall at Thebez, from which he died? Why did you come so close to the wall?’ Then say: ‘Your servant Uriah the Hittite was among those killed.’”
Transliteration: miy-hikhah et-aviymelekhe ven-yeruveshet halvo-ishah hisheliykhah alayv felach rekhev meal hachvomah vayamׇt vetevets lamah nigashetem el-hachvomah veamareta gam avedekha uriyah hachitiy met

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ הַמַּלְאָ֑ךְ וַיָּבֹא֙ וַיַּגֵּ֣ד לְדָוִ֔ד אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר שְׁלָח֖וֹ יוֹאָֽב׃
Translated: The messenger set out; he came and told David all that Joab had sent him to say.
Transliteration: vayelekhe hamaleakhe vayavo vayaged ledavid et khׇl-asher shelachvo yvoav

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הַמַּלְאָךְ֙ אֶל־דָּוִ֔ד כִּֽי־גָבְר֤וּ עָלֵ֙ינוּ֙ הָאֲנָשִׁ֔ים וַיֵּצְא֥וּ אֵלֵ֖ינוּ הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה וַנִּהְיֶ֥ה עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם עַד־פֶּ֥תַח הַשָּֽׁעַר׃
Translated: The messenger said to David, “First their men prevailed against us and sallied out against us into the open; then we drove them back up to the entrance to the gate.
Transliteration: vayomer hamaleakhe el-david khiy-gaveru aleynu haanashiym vayetseu eleynu hashadeh vaniheyeh aleyhem ad-fetach hashaar

Hebrew: וַיֹּר֨אוּ הַמּוֹרִ֤אים אֶל־עֲבָדֶ֙יךָ֙ מֵעַ֣ל הַחוֹמָ֔ה וַיָּמ֖וּתוּ מֵעַבְדֵ֣י הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וְגַ֗ם עַבְדְּךָ֛ אוּרִיָּ֥ה הַחִתִּ֖י מֵֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: But the archers shot at your men from the wall and some of Your Majesty’s men fell; your servant Uriah the Hittite also fell.”
Transliteration: vayoru hamvoriym el-avadeykha meal hachvomah vayamutu meavedey hamelekhe vegam avedekha uriyah hachitiy met {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜ד אֶל־הַמַּלְאָ֗ךְ כֹּֽה־תֹאמַ֤ר אֶל־יוֹאָב֙ אַל־יֵרַ֤ע בְּעֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה כִּֽי־כָזֹ֥ה וְכָזֶ֖ה תֹּאכַ֣ל הֶחָ֑רֶב הַחֲזֵ֨ק מִלְחַמְתְּךָ֧ אֶל־הָעִ֛יר וְהׇרְסָ֖הּ וְחַזְּקֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: Whereupon David said to the messenger, “Give Joab this message: ‘Do not be distressed about the matter. The sword always takes its toll. Press your attack on the city and destroy it!’ Encourage him!”
Transliteration: vayomer david el-hamaleakhe khoh-tomar el-yvoav al-eira veeyneykha et-hadavar hazeh khiy-khazoh vekhazeh tokhal hecharev hachazek milechametekha el-haiyr vehׇresah vechazekehu

Hebrew: וַתִּשְׁמַע֙ אֵ֣שֶׁת אוּרִיָּ֔ה כִּי־מֵ֖ת אוּרִיָּ֣ה אִישָׁ֑הּ וַתִּסְפֹּ֖ד עַל־בַּעְלָֽהּ׃
Translated: When Uriah’s wife heard that her husband Uriah was dead, she lamented over her husband.
Transliteration: vatishema eshet uriyah khiy-met uriyah iyshah vatisefod al-vaelah

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹ֣ר הָאֵ֗בֶל וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח דָּוִ֜ד וַיַּאַסְפָ֤הּ אֶל־בֵּיתוֹ֙ וַתְּהִי־ל֣וֹ לְאִשָּׁ֔ה וַתֵּ֥לֶד ל֖וֹ בֵּ֑ן וַיֵּ֧רַע הַדָּבָ֛ר אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֥ה דָוִ֖ד בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
After the period of mourning was over, David sent and had her brought into his palace; she became his wife and she bore him a son.
But GOD was displeased with what David had done,
Transliteration: vayaavor haevel vayishelach david vayaasefah el-veytvo vatehiy-lvo leishah vateled lvo ven vayera hadavar asher-ashah david veeyney yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֧ח יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־נָתָ֖ן אֶל־דָּוִ֑ד וַיָּבֹ֣א אֵלָ֗יו וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ שְׁנֵ֣י אֲנָשִׁ֗ים הָיוּ֙ בְּעִ֣יר אֶחָ֔ת אֶחָ֥ד עָשִׁ֖יר וְאֶחָ֥ד רָֽאשׁ׃
Translated: and G<small>OD</small> sent Nathan to David. He came to him and said, “There were two men in the same city, one rich and one poor.
Transliteration: vayishelach yehovah et-natan el-david vayavo elayv vayomer lvo sheney anashiym hayu veiyr echat echad ashiyr veechad rash

Hebrew: לְעָשִׁ֗יר הָיָ֛ה צֹ֥אן וּבָקָ֖ר הַרְבֵּ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: The rich one had very large flocks and herds,
Transliteration: leashiyr hayah tson uvakar hareveh meod

Hebrew: וְלָרָ֣שׁ אֵֽין־כֹּ֗ל כִּי֩ אִם־כִּבְשָׂ֨ה אַחַ֤ת קְטַנָּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר קָנָ֔ה וַיְחַיֶּ֕הָ וַתִּגְדַּ֥ל עִמּ֛וֹ וְעִם־בָּנָ֖יו יַחְדָּ֑ו מִפִּתּ֨וֹ תֹאכַ֜ל וּמִכֹּס֤וֹ תִשְׁתֶּה֙ וּבְחֵיק֣וֹ תִשְׁכָּ֔ב וַתְּהִי־ל֖וֹ כְּבַֽת׃
Translated: but the poor one had only one little ewe lamb that he had bought. He tended it and it grew up together with him and his children: it used to share his morsel of bread, drink from his cup, and nestle in his bosom; it was like a daughter to him.
Transliteration: velarash eyn-khol khiy im-khiveshah achat ketanah asher kanah vayechayeha vatigedal imvo veim-vanayv yachedav mifitvo tokhal umikhosvo tisheteh uvecheykvo tishekhav vatehiy-lvo khevat

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣בֹא הֵ֘לֶךְ֮ לְאִ֣ישׁ הֶעָשִׁיר֒ וַיַּחְמֹ֗ל לָקַ֤חַת מִצֹּאנוֹ֙ וּמִבְּקָר֔וֹ לַעֲשׂ֕וֹת לָאֹרֵ֖חַ הַבָּא־ל֑וֹ וַיִּקַּ֗ח אֶת־כִּבְשַׂת֙ הָאִ֣ישׁ הָרָ֔אשׁ וַֽיַּעֲשֶׂ֔הָ לָאִ֖ישׁ הַבָּ֥א אֵלָֽיו׃
Translated: One day, a traveler came to the rich man, but he was loath to take anything from his own flocks or herds to prepare a meal for the guest who had come to him; so he took the poor man’s lamb and prepared it for the man who had come to him.”
Transliteration: vayavo helekhe leiysh heashiyr vayachemol lakachat mitsonvo umivekarvo laashvot laorecha hava-lvo vayikach et-khiveshat haiysh harash vayaasheha laiysh hava elayv

Hebrew: וַיִּחַר־אַ֥ף דָּוִ֛ד בָּאִ֖ישׁ מְאֹ֑ד וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־נָתָ֔ן חַי־יְהֹוָ֕ה כִּ֣י בֶן־מָ֔וֶת הָאִ֖ישׁ הָעֹשֶׂ֥ה זֹֽאת׃
Translated: David flew into a rage against the man, and said to Nathan, “As G<small>OD</small> lives, the man who did this deserves to die!
Transliteration: vayichar-af david vaiysh meod vayomer el-natan chay-yehovah khiy ven-mavet haiysh haosheh zot

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַכִּבְשָׂ֖ה יְשַׁלֵּ֣ם אַרְבַּעְתָּ֑יִם עֵ֗קֶב אֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשָׂה֙ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה וְעַ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־חָמָֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: He must pay for the lamb four times over, because he did such a thing and showed no pity.”
Transliteration: veet-hakhiveshah yeshalem arevaetayiim ekev asher ashah et-hadavar hazeh veal asher lo-chamal {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר נָתָ֛ן אֶל־דָּוִ֖ד אַתָּ֣ה הָאִ֑ישׁ {ס} כֹּה־אָמַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אָנֹכִ֞י מְשַׁחְתִּ֤יךָֽ לְמֶ֙לֶךְ֙ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָנֹכִ֥י הִצַּלְתִּ֖יךָ מִיַּ֥ד שָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: And Nathan said to David, “That man is you! Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: ‘It was I who anointed you king over Israel and it was I who rescued you from the hand of Saul.
Transliteration: vayomer natan el-david atah haiysh {s} khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael anokhiy meshachetiykha lemelekhe al-yisherael veanokhiy hitsaletiykha miyad shaul

Hebrew: וָאֶתְּנָ֨ה לְךָ֜ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית אֲדֹנֶ֗יךָ וְאֶת־נְשֵׁ֤י אֲדֹנֶ֙יךָ֙ בְּחֵיקֶ֔ךָ וָאֶתְּנָ֣ה לְךָ֔ אֶת־בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וִיהוּדָ֑ה וְאִ֨ם־מְעָ֔ט וְאֹסִ֥פָה לְּךָ֖ כָּהֵ֥נָּה וְכָהֵֽנָּה׃
Translated: I gave you your master’s house and possession of your master’s wives; and I gave you the House of Israel and Judah; and if that were not enough, I would give you twice as much more.
Transliteration: vaetenah lekha et-veyt adoneykha veet-neshey adoneykha vecheykekha vaetenah lekha et-veyt yisherael viyhudah veim-meat veosifah lekha khahenah vekhahenah

Hebrew: מַדּ֜וּעַ בָּזִ֣יתָ ׀ אֶת־דְּבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת הָרַע֮ (בעינו) [בְּעֵינַי֒] אֵ֣ת אוּרִיָּ֤ה הַחִתִּי֙ הִכִּ֣יתָ בַחֶ֔רֶב וְאֶ֨ת־אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ לָקַ֥חְתָּ לְּךָ֖ לְאִשָּׁ֑ה וְאֹת֣וֹ הָרַ֔גְתָּ בְּחֶ֖רֶב בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃
Translated: Why then have you flouted G<small>OD</small>’s command—and done what displeases Me? You have put Uriah the Hittite to the sword; you took his wife and made her your wife and had him killed by the sword of the Ammonites.
Transliteration: madua vaziyta et-devar yehovah laashvot hara (vynv) [veeynay] et uriyah hachitiy hikhiyta vacherev veet-ishetvo lakacheta lekha leishah veotvo harageta vecherev veney amvon

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה לֹא־תָס֥וּר חֶ֛רֶב מִבֵּיתְךָ֖ עַד־עוֹלָ֑ם עֵ֚קֶב כִּ֣י בְזִתָ֔נִי וַתִּקַּ֗ח אֶת־אֵ֙שֶׁת֙ אוּרִיָּ֣ה הַחִתִּ֔י לִהְי֥וֹת לְךָ֖ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: Therefore the sword shall never depart from your House—because you spurned Me by taking the wife of Uriah the Hittite and making her your wife.’
Transliteration: veatah lo-tasur cherev miveytekha ad-volam ekev khiy vezitaniy vatikach et-eshet uriyah hachitiy liheyvot lekha leishah {s}

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה הִנְנִי֩ מֵקִ֨ים עָלֶ֤יךָ רָעָה֙ מִבֵּיתֶ֔ךָ וְלָקַחְתִּ֤י אֶת־נָשֶׁ֙יךָ֙ לְעֵינֶ֔יךָ וְנָתַתִּ֖י לְרֵעֶ֑יךָ וְשָׁכַב֙ עִם־נָשֶׁ֔יךָ לְעֵינֵ֖י הַשֶּׁ֥מֶשׁ הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: Thus said G<small>OD</small>: ‘I will make a calamity rise against you from within your own house; I will take your wives and give them to another man before your very eyes and he shall sleep with your wives under this very sun.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah hineniy mekiym aleykha raah miveytekha velakachetiy et-nasheykha leeyneykha venatatiy lereeykha veshakhav im-nasheykha leeyney hashemesh hazot

Hebrew: כִּ֥י אַתָּ֖ה עָשִׂ֣יתָ בַסָּ֑תֶר וַאֲנִ֗י אֶֽעֱשֶׂה֙ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה נֶ֥גֶד כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְנֶ֥גֶד הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃ {ס}
Translated: You acted in secret, but I will make this happen in the sight of all Israel and in broad daylight.’”
Transliteration: khiy atah ashiyta vasater vaaniy eesheh et-hadavar hazeh neged khׇl-yisherael veneged hashamesh {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר דָּוִד֙ אֶל־נָתָ֔ן חָטָ֖אתִי לַיהֹוָ֑ה {ס} וַיֹּ֨אמֶר נָתָ֜ן אֶל־דָּוִ֗ד גַּם־יְהֹוָ֛ה הֶעֱבִ֥יר חַטָּאתְךָ֖ לֹ֥א תָמֽוּת׃
Translated: David said to Nathan, “I stand guilty before G<small>OD</small>!” And Nathan replied to David, “G<small>OD</small> has remitted your sin; you shall not die.
Transliteration: vayomer david el-natan chatatiy layhovah {s} vayomer natan el-david gam-yehovah heeviyr chatatekha lo tamut

Hebrew: אֶ֗פֶס כִּֽי־נִאֵ֤ץ נִאַ֙צְתָּ֙ אֶת־אֹיְבֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה בַּדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּ֑ה גַּ֗ם הַבֵּ֛ן הַיִּלּ֥וֹד לְךָ֖ מ֥וֹת יָמֽוּת׃
Translated: However, since you have spurned the enemies of G<small>OD</small> by this deed, even the child about to be born to you shall die.”
Transliteration: efes khiy-niets niatseta et-oyevey yehovah vadavar hazeh gam haven hayilvod lekha mvot yamut

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ נָתָ֖ן אֶל־בֵּית֑וֹ וַיִּגֹּ֣ף יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶת־הַיֶּ֜לֶד אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָלְדָ֧ה אֵשֶׁת־אוּרִיָּ֛ה לְדָוִ֖ד וַיֵּאָנַֽשׁ׃
Translated: Nathan went home, and G<small>OD</small> afflicted the child that Uriah’s wife had borne to David, and it became critically ill.
Transliteration: vayelekhe natan el-veytvo vayigof yehovah et-hayeled asher yaledah eshet-uriyah ledavid vayeanash

Hebrew: וַיְבַקֵּ֥שׁ דָּוִ֛ד אֶת־הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּעַ֣ד הַנָּ֑עַר וַיָּ֤צׇם דָּוִד֙ צ֔וֹם וּבָ֥א וְלָ֖ן וְשָׁכַ֥ב אָֽרְצָה׃
Translated: David entreated God for the boy; David fasted, and he went in and spent the night lying on the ground.
Transliteration: vayevakesh david et-haElohim vead hanaar vayatsׇm david tsvom uva velan veshakhav aretsah

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֜מוּ זִקְנֵ֤י בֵיתוֹ֙ עָלָ֔יו לַהֲקִימ֖וֹ מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְלֹ֣א אָבָ֔ה וְלֹא־בָרָ֥א אִתָּ֖ם לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: The senior servants of his household tried to induce him to get up from the ground; but he refused, nor would he partake of food with them.
Transliteration: vayakumu zikeney veytvo alayv lahakiymvo min-haarets velo avah velo-vara itam lachem

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֛י בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י וַיָּ֣מׇת הַיָּ֑לֶד וַיִּֽרְאוּ֩ עַבְדֵ֨י דָוִ֜ד לְהַגִּ֥יד ל֣וֹ ׀ כִּי־מֵ֣ת הַיֶּ֗לֶד כִּ֤י אָֽמְרוּ֙ הִנֵּה֩ בִֽהְי֨וֹת הַיֶּ֜לֶד חַ֗י דִּבַּ֤רְנוּ אֵלָיו֙ וְלֹא־שָׁמַ֣ע בְּקוֹלֵ֔נוּ וְאֵ֨יךְ נֹאמַ֥ר אֵלָ֛יו מֵ֥ת הַיֶּ֖לֶד וְעָשָׂ֥ה רָעָֽה׃
Translated: On the seventh day the child died. David’s servants were afraid to tell David that the child was dead; for they said, “We spoke to him when the child was alive and he wouldn’t listen to us; how can we tell him that the child is dead? He might do something terrible.”
Transliteration: vayehiy vayyvom hasheviyiy vayamׇt hayaled vayireu avedey david lehagiyd lvo khiy-met hayeled khiy ameru hineh viheyvot hayeled chay divarenu elayv velo-shama vekvolenu veeykhe nomar elayv met hayeled veashah raah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא דָּוִ֗ד כִּ֤י עֲבָדָיו֙ מִֽתְלַחֲשִׁ֔ים וַיָּ֥בֶן דָּוִ֖ד כִּ֣י מֵ֣ת הַיָּ֑לֶד וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֧ד אֶל־עֲבָדָ֛יו הֲמֵ֥ת הַיֶּ֖לֶד וַיֹּ֥אמְרוּ מֵֽת׃
Translated: When David saw his servants talking in whispers, David understood that the child was dead; David asked his servants, “Is the child dead?” “Yes,” they replied.
Transliteration: vayare david khiy avadayv mitelachashiym vayaven david khiy met hayaled vayomer david el-avadayv hamet hayeled vayomeru met

Hebrew: וַיָּ֩קׇם֩ דָּוִ֨ד מֵהָאָ֜רֶץ וַיִּרְחַ֣ץ וַיָּ֗סֶךְ וַיְחַלֵּף֙ שִׂמְלֹתָ֔ו וַיָּבֹ֥א בֵית־יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיִּשְׁתָּ֑חוּ וַיָּבֹא֙ אֶל־בֵּית֔וֹ וַיִּשְׁאַ֕ל וַיָּשִׂ֥ימוּ ל֛וֹ לֶ֖חֶם וַיֹּאכַֽל׃
Translated: Thereupon David rose from the ground; he bathed and anointed himself, and he changed his clothes. He went into the House of G<small>OD</small> and prostrated himself. Then he went home and asked for food, which they set before him, and he ate.
Transliteration: vayakׇm david mehaarets vayirechats vayasekhe vayechalef shimelotav vayavo veyt-yehovah vayishetachu vayavo el-veytvo vayisheal vayashiymu lvo lechem vayokhal

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ עֲבָדָיו֙ אֵלָ֔יו מָה־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֑יתָה בַּעֲב֞וּר הַיֶּ֤לֶד חַי֙ צַ֣מְתָּ וַתֵּ֔בְךְּ וְכַֽאֲשֶׁר֙ מֵ֣ת הַיֶּ֔לֶד קַ֖מְתָּ וַתֹּ֥אכַל לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: His courtiers asked him, “Why have you acted in this manner? While the child was alive, you fasted and wept; but now that the child is dead, you rise and take food!”
Transliteration: vayomeru avadayv elayv mah-hadavar hazeh asher ashiytah vaavur hayeled chay tsameta vatevekhe vekhaasher met hayeled kameta vatokhal lachem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר בְּעוֹד֙ הַיֶּ֣לֶד חַ֔י צַ֖מְתִּי וָאֶבְכֶּ֑ה כִּ֤י אָמַ֙רְתִּי֙ מִ֣י יוֹדֵ֔עַ (יחנני) [וְחַנַּ֥נִי] יְהֹוָ֖ה וְחַ֥י הַיָּֽלֶד׃
Translated: He replied, “While the child was still alive, I fasted and wept because I thought: ‘Who knows? G<small>OD</small> may have pity on me, and the child may live.’
Transliteration: vayomer vevod hayeled chay tsametiy vaevekheh khiy amaretiy miy yvodea (ychnny) [vechananiy] yehovah vechay hayaled

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה ׀ מֵ֗ת לָ֤מָּה זֶּה֙ אֲנִ֣י צָ֔ם הַאוּכַ֥ל לַהֲשִׁיב֖וֹ ע֑וֹד אֲנִי֙ הֹלֵ֣ךְ אֵלָ֔יו וְה֖וּא לֹא־יָשׁ֥וּב אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: But now that he is dead, why should I fast? Can I bring him back again? I shall go to him, but he will never come back to me.”
Transliteration: veatah met lamah zeh aniy tsam haukhal lahashiyvvo vod aniy holekhe elayv vehu lo-yashuv elay

Hebrew: וַיְנַחֵ֣ם דָּוִ֗ד אֵ֚ת בַּת־שֶׁ֣בַע אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וַיָּבֹ֥א אֵלֶ֖יהָ וַיִּשְׁכַּ֣ב עִמָּ֑הּ וַתֵּ֣לֶד בֵּ֗ן (ויקרא) [וַתִּקְרָ֤א] אֶת־שְׁמוֹ֙ שְׁלֹמֹ֔ה וַיהֹוָ֖ה אֲהֵבֽוֹ׃
Translated: David consoled his wife Bathsheba; he went to her and lay with her. She bore a son and she named him Solomon. G<small>OD</small> favored him,
Transliteration: vayenachem david et vat-sheva ishetvo vayavo eleyha vayishekhav imah vateled ven (vykr) [vatikera] et-shemvo shelomoh vayhovah ahevvo

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֗ח בְּיַד֙ נָתָ֣ן הַנָּבִ֔יא וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶת־שְׁמ֖וֹ יְדִ֣ידְיָ֑הּ בַּעֲב֖וּר יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: sending a message through the prophet Nathan; and he was named Jedidiah at G<small>OD</small>’s behest.
Transliteration: vayishelach veyad natan hanaviy vayikera et-shemvo yediydeyah vaavur yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּלָּ֣חֶם יוֹאָ֔ב בְּרַבַּ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֑וֹן וַיִּלְכֹּ֖ד אֶת־עִ֥יר הַמְּלוּכָֽה׃
Translated: Joab attacked Rabbah of Ammon and captured the royal city.
Transliteration: vayilachem yvoav veravat veney amvon vayilekhod et-iyr hamelukhah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח יוֹאָ֛ב מַלְאָכִ֖ים אֶל־דָּוִ֑ד וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ נִלְחַ֣מְתִּי בְרַבָּ֔ה גַּם־לָכַ֖דְתִּי אֶת־עִ֥יר הַמָּֽיִם׃
Translated: Joab sent messengers to David and said, “I have attacked Rabbah and I have already captured the water city.
Transliteration: vayishelach yvoav maleakhiym el-david vayomer nilechametiy veravah gam-lakhadetiy et-iyr hamayiim

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה אֱסֹף֙ אֶת־יֶ֣תֶר הָעָ֔ם וַחֲנֵ֥ה עַל־הָעִ֖יר וְלׇכְדָ֑הּ פֶּן־אֶלְכֹּ֤ד אֲנִי֙ אֶת־הָעִ֔יר וְנִקְרָ֥א שְׁמִ֖י עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Now muster the rest of the troops and besiege the city and capture it; otherwise I will capture the city myself, and my name will be connected with it.”
Transliteration: veatah esof et-yeter haam vachaneh al-haiyr velׇkhedah fen-elekhod aniy et-haiyr venikera shemiy aleyha

Hebrew: וַיֶּאֱסֹ֥ף דָּוִ֛ד אֶת־כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ רַבָּ֑תָה וַיִּלָּ֥חֶם בָּ֖הּ וַֽיִּלְכְּדָֽהּ׃
Translated: David mustered all the troops and marched on Rabbah, and he attacked it and captured it.
Transliteration: vayeesof david et-khׇl-haam vayelekhe ravatah vayilachem vah vayilekhedah

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח אֶת־עֲטֶֽרֶת־מַלְכָּם֩ מֵעַ֨ל רֹאשׁ֜וֹ וּמִשְׁקָלָ֨הּ כִּכַּ֤ר זָהָב֙ וְאֶ֣בֶן יְקָרָ֔ה וַתְּהִ֖י עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ דָּוִ֑ד וּשְׁלַ֥ל הָעִ֛יר הוֹצִ֖יא הַרְבֵּ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: The crown was taken from the head of their king and it was placed on David’s head—it weighed a talent of gold, and [on it] were precious stones. He also carried off a vast amount of booty from the city.
Transliteration: vayikach et-ateret-malekham meal roshvo umishekalah khikhar zahav veeven yekarah vatehiy al-rosh david ushelal haiyr hvotsiy hareveh meod

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הָעָ֨ם אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֜הּ הוֹצִ֗יא וַיָּ֣שֶׂם בַּ֠מְּגֵרָ֠ה וּבַחֲרִצֵ֨י הַבַּרְזֶ֜ל וּֽבְמַגְזְרֹ֣ת הַבַּרְזֶ֗ל וְהֶעֱבִ֤יר אוֹתָם֙ (במלכן) [בַּמַּלְבֵּ֔ן] וְכֵ֣ן יַעֲשֶׂ֔ה לְכֹ֖ל עָרֵ֣י בְנֵֽי־עַמּ֑וֹן וַיָּ֧שׇׁב דָּוִ֛ד וְכׇל־הָעָ֖ם יְרֽוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {פ}
Translated: He led out the people who lived there and set them to work with saws, iron threshing boards, and iron axes, or assigned them to brickmaking; David did this to all the towns of Ammon. Then David and all the troops returned to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: veet-haam asher-vah hvotsiy vayashem vamegerah uvacharitsey havarezel uvemagezerot havarezel veheeviyr votam (vmlkhn) [vamaleven] vekhen yaasheh lekhol arey veney-amvon vayashׇv david vekhׇl-haam yerushala͏im {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י אַחֲרֵי־כֵ֗ן וּלְאַבְשָׁל֧וֹם בֶּן־דָּוִ֛ד אָח֥וֹת יָפָ֖ה וּשְׁמָ֣הּ תָּמָ֑ר וַיֶּאֱהָבֶ֖הָ אַמְנ֥וֹן בֶּן־דָּוִֽד׃
Translated: This happened sometime afterward: Absalom son of David had a beautiful sister named Tamar, and Amnon son of David became infatuated with her.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey-khen uleaveshalvom ven-david achvot yafah ushemah tamar vayeehaveha amenvon ven-david

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨צֶר לְאַמְנ֜וֹן לְהִתְחַלּ֗וֹת בַּֽעֲבוּר֙ תָּמָ֣ר אֲחֹת֔וֹ כִּ֥י בְתוּלָ֖ה הִ֑יא וַיִּפָּלֵא֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י אַמְנ֔וֹן לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת לָ֖הּ מְאֽוּמָה׃
Translated: Amnon was so distraught because of his [half-]sister Tamar that he became sick; for she was a virgin, and it seemed impossible to Amnon to do anything to her.
Transliteration: vayetser leamenvon lehitechalvot vaavur tamar achotvo khiy vetulah hiy vayifale veeyney amenvon laashvot lah meumah

Hebrew: וּלְאַמְנ֣וֹן רֵ֗עַ וּשְׁמוֹ֙ יֽוֹנָדָ֔ב בֶּן־שִׁמְעָ֖ה אֲחִ֣י דָוִ֑ד וְי֣וֹנָדָ֔ב אִ֥ישׁ חָכָ֖ם מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: Amnon had a friend named Jonadab, the son of David’s brother Shimah; Jonadab was a very clever man.
Transliteration: uleamenvon rea ushemvo yvonadav ven-shimeah achiy david veyvonadav iysh chakham meod

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ מַדּ֣וּעַ אַ֠תָּ֠ה כָּ֣כָה דַּ֤ל בֶּן־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ בַּבֹּ֣קֶר בַּבֹּ֔קֶר הֲל֖וֹא תַּגִּ֣יד לִ֑י וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ אַמְנ֔וֹן אֶת־תָּמָ֗ר אֲח֛וֹת אַבְשָׁלֹ֥ם אָחִ֖י אֲנִ֥י אֹהֵֽב׃
Translated: He asked him, “Why are you so dejected, O prince, morning after morning? Tell me!” Amnon replied, “I am in love with Tamar, the sister of my brother Absalom!”
Transliteration: vayomer lvo madua atah khakhah dal ven-hamelekhe vavoker vavoker halvo tagiyd liy vayomer lvo amenvon et-tamar achvot aveshalom achiy aniy ohev

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ יְה֣וֹנָדָ֔ב שְׁכַ֥ב עַל־מִשְׁכָּבְךָ֖ וְהִתְחָ֑ל וּבָ֧א אָבִ֣יךָ לִרְאוֹתֶ֗ךָ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֵלָ֡יו תָּ֣בֹא נָא֩ תָמָ֨ר אֲחוֹתִ֜י וְתַבְרֵ֣נִי לֶ֗חֶם וְעָשְׂתָ֤ה לְעֵינַי֙ אֶת־הַבִּרְיָ֔ה לְמַ֙עַן֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶרְאֶ֔ה וְאָכַלְתִּ֖י מִיָּדָֽהּ׃
Translated: Jonadab said to him, “Lie down in your bed and pretend you are sick. When your father comes to see you, say to him, ‘Let my sister Tamar come and give me something to eat. Let her prepare the food in front of me, so that I may look on, and let her serve it to me.’”
Transliteration: vayomer lvo yehvonadav shekhav al-mishekhavekha vehitechal uva aviykha lirevotekha veamareta elayv tavo na tamar achvotiy vetavereniy lechem veashetah leeynay et-havireyah lemaan asher ereeh veakhaletiy miyadah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכַּ֥ב אַמְנ֖וֹן וַיִּתְחָ֑ל וַיָּבֹ֨א הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ לִרְאוֹת֗וֹ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אַמְנ֤וֹן אֶל־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ תָּבוֹא־נָ֞א תָּמָ֣ר אֲחֹתִ֗י וּתְלַבֵּ֤ב לְעֵינַי֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י לְבִב֔וֹת וְאֶבְרֶ֖ה מִיָּדָֽהּ׃
Translated: Amnon lay down and pretended to be sick. The king came to see him, and Amnon said to the king, “Let my sister Tamar come and prepare a couple of cakes in front of me, and let her bring them to me.”
Transliteration: vayishekhav amenvon vayitechal vayavo hamelekhe lirevotvo vayomer amenvon el-hamelekhe tavvo-na tamar achotiy utelavev leeynay shetey levivvot veevereh miyadah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח דָּוִ֛ד אֶל־תָּמָ֖ר הַבַּ֣יְתָה לֵאמֹ֑ר לְכִ֣י נָ֗א בֵּ֚ית אַמְנ֣וֹן אָחִ֔יךְ וַעֲשִׂי־ל֖וֹ הַבִּרְיָֽה׃
Translated: David sent a message to Tamar in the palace, “Please go to the house of your brother Amnon and prepare some food for him.”
Transliteration: vayishelach david el-tamar havayetah lemor lekhiy na veyt amenvon achiykhe vaashiy-lvo havireyah

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֣לֶךְ תָּמָ֗ר בֵּ֛ית אַמְנ֥וֹן אָחִ֖יהָ וְה֣וּא שֹׁכֵ֑ב וַתִּקַּ֨ח אֶת־הַבָּצֵ֤ק (ותלוש) [וַתָּ֙לׇשׁ֙] וַתְּלַבֵּ֣ב לְעֵינָ֔יו וַתְּבַשֵּׁ֖ל אֶת־הַלְּבִבֽוֹת׃
Translated: Tamar went to the house of her brother Amnon, who was in bed. She took dough and kneaded it into cakes in front of him, and cooked the cakes.
Transliteration: vatelekhe tamar veyt amenvon achiyha vehu shokhev vatikach et-havatsek (vtlvsh) [vatalׇsh] vatelavev leeynayv vatevashel et-halevivvot

Hebrew: וַתִּקַּ֤ח אֶת־הַמַּשְׂרֵת֙ וַתִּצֹ֣ק לְפָנָ֔יו וַיְמָאֵ֖ן לֶאֱכ֑וֹל וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אַמְנ֗וֹן הוֹצִ֤יאוּ כׇל־אִישׁ֙ מֵעָלַ֔י וַיֵּצְא֥וּ כׇל־אִ֖ישׁ מֵעָלָֽיו׃
Translated: She took the pan and set out [the cakes], but Amnon refused to eat and ordered everyone to withdraw. After everyone else had withdrawn,
Transliteration: vatikach et-hamasheret vatitsok lefanayv vayemaen leekhvol vayomer amenvon hvotsiyu khׇl-iysh mealay vayetseu khׇl-iysh mealayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אַמְנ֜וֹן אֶל־תָּמָ֗ר הָבִ֤יאִי הַבִּרְיָה֙ הַחֶ֔דֶר וְאֶבְרֶ֖ה מִיָּדֵ֑ךְ וַתִּקַּ֣ח תָּמָ֗ר אֶת־הַלְּבִבוֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔תָה וַתָּבֵ֛א לְאַמְנ֥וֹן אָחִ֖יהָ הֶחָֽדְרָה׃
Translated: Amnon said to Tamar, “Bring the food inside and feed me.” Tamar took the cakes she had made and brought them to her brother inside.
Transliteration: vayomer amenvon el-tamar haviyiy havireyah hacheder veevereh miyadekhe vatikach tamar et-halevivvot asher ashatah vatave leamenvon achiyha hechaderah

Hebrew: וַתַּגֵּ֥שׁ אֵלָ֖יו לֶאֱכֹ֑ל וַיַּֽחֲזֶק־בָּהּ֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָ֔הּ בּ֛וֹאִי שִׁכְבִ֥י עִמִּ֖י אֲחוֹתִֽי׃
Translated: But when she served them to him, he caught hold of her and said to her, “Come lie with me, sister.”
Transliteration: vatagesh elayv leekhol vayachazek-vah vayomer lah vvoiy shikheviy imiy achvotiy

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ אַל־אָחִי֙ אַל־תְּעַנֵּ֔נִי כִּ֛י לֹא־יֵעָשֶׂ֥ה כֵ֖ן בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אַֽל־תַּעֲשֵׂ֖ה אֶת־הַנְּבָלָ֥ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: But she said to him, “Don’t, brother. Don’t force me. Such things are not done in Israel! Don’t do such a vile thing!
Transliteration: vatomer lvo al-achiy al-teaneniy khiy lo-eiasheh khen veyisherael al-taasheh et-hanevalah hazot

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י אָ֤נָה אוֹלִיךְ֙ אֶת־חֶרְפָּתִ֔י וְאַתָּ֗ה תִּֽהְיֶ֛ה כְּאַחַ֥ד הַנְּבָלִ֖ים בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְעַתָּה֙ דַּבֶּר־נָ֣א אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ כִּ֛י לֹ֥א יִמְנָעֵ֖נִי מִמֶּֽךָּ׃
Translated: Where will I carry my shame? And you, you will be like any of the scoundrels in Israel! Please, speak to the king; he will not refuse me to you.”
Transliteration: vaaniy anah voliykhe et-cherefatiy veatah tiheyeh kheachad hanevaliym veyisherael veatah daver-na el-hamelekhe khiy lo yimenaeniy mimekha

Hebrew: וְלֹ֥א אָבָ֖ה לִשְׁמֹ֣עַ בְּקוֹלָ֑הּ וַיֶּחֱזַ֤ק מִמֶּ֙נָּה֙ וַיְעַנֶּ֔הָ וַיִּשְׁכַּ֖ב אֹתָֽהּ׃
Translated: But he would not listen to her; he overpowered her and lay with her by force.
Transliteration: velo avah lishemoa vekvolah vayechezak mimenah vayeaneha vayishekhav otah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂנָאֶ֣הָ אַמְנ֗וֹן שִׂנְאָה֙ גְּדוֹלָ֣ה מְאֹ֔ד כִּ֣י גְדוֹלָ֗ה הַשִּׂנְאָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שְׂנֵאָ֔הּ מֵאַהֲבָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֲהֵבָ֑הּ וַיֹּֽאמֶר־לָ֥הּ אַמְנ֖וֹן ק֥וּמִי לֵֽכִי׃
Translated: Then Amnon felt a very great loathing for her; indeed, his loathing for her was greater than the passion he had felt for her. And Amnon said to her, “Get out!”
Transliteration: vayishenaeha amenvon shineah gedvolah meod khiy gedvolah hashineah asher sheneah meahavah asher ahevah vayomer-lah amenvon kumiy lekhiy

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ אַל־אוֹדֹ֞ת הָרָעָ֤ה הַגְּדוֹלָה֙ הַזֹּ֔את מֵאַחֶ֛רֶת אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֥יתָ עִמִּ֖י לְשַׁלְּחֵ֑נִי וְלֹ֥א אָבָ֖ה לִשְׁמֹ֥עַֽ לָֽהּ׃
Translated: She pleaded with him, “Please don’t commit this wrong; to send me away would be even worse than the first wrong you committed against me.” But he would not listen to her.
Transliteration: vatomer lvo al-vodot haraah hagedvolah hazot meacheret asher-ashiyta imiy leshalecheniy velo avah lishemoa lah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֗א אֶֽת־נַעֲרוֹ֙ מְשָׁ֣רְת֔וֹ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר שִׁלְחוּ־נָ֥א אֶת־זֹ֛את מֵעָלַ֖י הַח֑וּצָה וּנְעֹ֥ל הַדֶּ֖לֶת אַחֲרֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: He summoned his young attendant and said, “Get that woman out of my presence, and bar the door behind her.”—
Transliteration: vayikera et-naarvo mesharetvo vayomer shilechu-na et-zot mealay hachutsah uneol hadelet achareyha

Hebrew: וְעָלֶ֙יהָ֙ כְּתֹ֣נֶת פַּסִּ֔ים כִּי֩ כֵ֨ן תִּלְבַּ֧שְׁןָ בְנוֹת־הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ הַבְּתוּלֹ֖ת מְעִילִ֑ים וַיֹּצֵ֨א אוֹתָ֤הּ מְשָֽׁרְתוֹ֙ הַח֔וּץ וְנָעַ֥ל הַדֶּ֖לֶת אַחֲרֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: She was wearing an ornamented tunic, for maiden princesses were customarily dressed in such garments.—His attendant took her outside and barred the door after her.
Transliteration: vealeyha khetonet fasiym khiy khen tilevashena venvot-hamelekhe havetulot meiyliym vayotse votah mesharetvo hachuts venaal hadelet achareyha

Hebrew: וַתִּקַּ֨ח תָּמָ֥ר אֵ֙פֶר֙ עַל־רֹאשָׁ֔הּ וּכְתֹ֧נֶת הַפַּסִּ֛ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָלֶ֖יהָ קָרָ֑עָה וַתָּ֤שֶׂם יָדָהּ֙ עַל־רֹאשָׁ֔הּ וַתֵּ֥לֶךְ הָל֖וֹךְ וְזָעָֽקָה׃
Translated: Tamar put dust on her head and rent the ornamented tunic she was wearing; she put her hands on her head, and walked away, screaming loudly as she went.
Transliteration: vatikach tamar efer al-roshah ukhetonet hafasiym asher aleyha karaah vatashem yadah al-roshah vatelekhe halvokhe vezaakah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלֶ֜יהָ אַבְשָׁל֣וֹם אָחִ֗יהָ הַאֲמִינ֣וֹן אָחִ֘יךְ֮ הָיָ֣ה עִמָּךְ֒ וְעַתָּ֞ה אֲחוֹתִ֤י הַחֲרִ֙ישִׁי֙ אָחִ֣יךְ ה֔וּא אַל־תָּשִׁ֥יתִי אֶת־לִבֵּ֖ךְ לַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וַתֵּ֤שֶׁב תָּמָר֙ וְשֹׁ֣מֵמָ֔ה בֵּ֖ית אַבְשָׁל֥וֹם אָחִֽיהָ׃
Translated: Her brother Absalom said to her, “Was it your brother Amnon who did this to you? For the present, sister, keep quiet about it; he is your brother. Don’t brood over the matter.” And Tamar remained in her brother Absalom’s house, forlorn.
Transliteration: vayomer eleyha aveshalvom achiyha haamiynvon achiykhe hayah imakhe veatah achvotiy hachariyshiy achiykhe hu al-tashiytiy et-livekhe ladavar hazeh vateshev tamar veshomemah veyt aveshalvom achiyha

Hebrew: וְהַמֶּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֔ד שָׁמַ֕ע אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וַיִּ֥חַר ל֖וֹ מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: When King David heard about all this, he was greatly upset.
Transliteration: vehamelekhe david shama et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh vayichar lvo meod

Hebrew: וְלֹא־דִבֶּ֧ר אַבְשָׁל֛וֹם עִם־אַמְנ֖וֹן לְמֵרָ֣ע וְעַד־ט֑וֹב כִּֽי־שָׂנֵ֤א אַבְשָׁלוֹם֙ אֶת־אַמְנ֔וֹן עַל־דְּבַר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עִנָּ֔ה אֵ֖ת תָּמָ֥ר אֲחֹתֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: Absalom didn’t utter a word to Amnon, good or bad; but Absalom hated Amnon because he had violated his sister Tamar.
Transliteration: velo-diver aveshalvom im-amenvon lemera vead-tvov khiy-shane aveshalvom et-amenvon al-devar asher inah et tamar achotvo {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ לִשְׁנָתַ֣יִם יָמִ֔ים וַיִּהְי֤וּ גֹֽזְזִים֙ לְאַבְשָׁל֔וֹם בְּבַ֥עַל חָצ֖וֹר אֲשֶׁ֣ר עִם־אֶפְרָ֑יִם וַיִּקְרָ֥א אַבְשָׁל֖וֹם לְכׇל־בְּנֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Two years later, when Absalom was having his flocks sheared at Baal-hazor near Ephraim, Absalom invited all the king’s sons.
Transliteration: vayehiy lishenatayiim yamiym vayiheyu gozeziym leaveshalvom vevaal chatsvor asher im-eferayiim vayikera aveshalvom lekhׇl-veney hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א אַבְשָׁלוֹם֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הִנֵּה־נָ֥א גֹזְזִ֖ים לְעַבְדֶּ֑ךָ יֵלֶךְ־נָ֥א הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ וַעֲבָדָ֖יו עִם־עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: And Absalom came to the king and said, “Your servant is having his flocks sheared. Would Your Majesty and your retinue accompany your servant?”
Transliteration: vayavo aveshalvom el-hamelekhe vayomer hineh-na gozeziym leavedekha eilekhe-na hamelekhe vaavadayv im-avedekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אֶל־אַבְשָׁל֗וֹם אַל־בְּנִי֙ אַל־נָ֤א נֵלֵךְ֙ כֻּלָּ֔נוּ וְלֹ֥א נִכְבַּ֖ד עָלֶ֑יךָ וַיִּפְרׇץ־בּ֛וֹ וְלֹא־אָבָ֥ה לָלֶ֖כֶת וַֽיְבָרְכֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: But the king answered Absalom, “No, my son. We must not all come, or we’ll be a burden to you.” He urged him, but he would not go, and he said good-bye to him.
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe el-aveshalvom al-veniy al-na nelekhe khulanu velo nikhevad aleykha vayiferׇts-vvo velo-avah lalekhet vayevarekhehu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אַבְשָׁל֔וֹם וָלֹ֕א יֵלֶךְ־נָ֥א אִתָּ֖נוּ אַמְנ֣וֹן אָחִ֑י וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ לָ֥מָּה יֵלֵ֖ךְ עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: Thereupon Absalom said, “In that case, let my brother Amnon come with us,” to which the king replied, “He shall not go with you.”
Transliteration: vayomer aveshalvom valo eilekhe-na itanu amenvon achiy vayomer lvo hamelekhe lamah eilekhe imakhe

Hebrew: וַיִּפְרׇץ־בּ֖וֹ אַבְשָׁל֑וֹם וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח אִתּוֹ֙ אֶת־אַמְנ֔וֹן וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־בְּנֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: But Absalom urged him, and he sent with him Amnon and all the other princes.
Transliteration: vayiferׇts-vvo aveshalvom vayishelach itvo et-amenvon veet khׇl-veney hamelekhe {s}

Hebrew: וַיְצַו֩ אַבְשָׁל֨וֹם אֶת־נְעָרָ֜יו לֵאמֹ֗ר רְא֣וּ נָ֠א כְּט֨וֹב לֵב־אַמְנ֤וֹן בַּיַּ֙יִן֙ וְאָמַרְתִּ֨י אֲלֵיכֶ֜ם הַכּ֧וּ אֶת־אַמְנ֛וֹן וַהֲמִתֶּ֥ם אֹת֖וֹ אַל־תִּירָ֑אוּ הֲל֗וֹא כִּ֤י אָֽנֹכִי֙ צִוִּ֣יתִי אֶתְכֶ֔ם חִזְק֖וּ וִֽהְי֥וּ לִבְנֵי־חָֽיִל׃
Translated: Now Absalom gave his attendants these orders: “Watch, and when Amnon is merry with wine and I tell you to strike down Amnon, kill him! Don’t be afraid, for it is I who give you the order. Act with determination, like brave men!”
Transliteration: vayetsav aveshalvom et-nearayv lemor reu na khetvov lev-amenvon vayayiin veamaretiy aleykhem hakhu et-amenvon vahamitem otvo al-tiyrau halvo khiy anokhiy tsiviytiy etekhem chizeku viheyu liveney-chayiil

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֞וּ נַעֲרֵ֤י אַבְשָׁלוֹם֙ לְאַמְנ֔וֹן כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֖ה אַבְשָׁל֑וֹם וַיָּקֻ֣מוּ ׀ כׇּל־בְּנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ וַֽיִּרְכְּב֛וּ אִ֥ישׁ עַל־פִּרְדּ֖וֹ וַיָּנֻֽסוּ׃
Translated: Absalom’s attendants did to Amnon as Absalom had ordered; whereupon all the other princes mounted their mules and fled.
Transliteration: vayaashu naarey aveshalvom leamenvon khaasher tsivah aveshalvom vayakumu khׇl-veney hamelekhe vayirekhevu iysh al-firedvo vayanusu

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ הֵ֣מָּה בַדֶּ֔רֶךְ וְהַשְּׁמֻעָ֣ה בָ֔אָה אֶל־דָּוִ֖ד לֵאמֹ֑ר הִכָּ֤ה אַבְשָׁלוֹם֙ אֶת־כׇּל־בְּנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְלֹא־נוֹתַ֥ר מֵהֶ֖ם אֶחָֽד׃ {פ}
Translated: They were still on the road when a rumor reached David that Absalom had killed all the princes, and that not one of them had survived.
Transliteration: vayehiy hemah vaderekhe vehashemuah vaah el-david lemor hikhah aveshalvom et-khׇl-veney hamelekhe velo-nvotar mehem echad {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֧קׇם הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ וַיִּקְרַ֥ע אֶת־בְּגָדָ֖יו וַיִּשְׁכַּ֣ב אָ֑רְצָה וְכׇל־עֲבָדָ֥יו נִצָּבִ֖ים קְרֻעֵ֥י בְגָדִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: At this, David rent his garment and lay down on the ground, and all his courtiers stood by with their clothes rent.
Transliteration: vayakׇm hamelekhe vayikera et-vegadayv vayishekhav aretsah vekhׇl-avadayv nitsaviym keruey vegadiym {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֡עַן יוֹנָדָ֣ב ׀ בֶּן־שִׁמְעָ֨ה אֲחִי־דָוִ֜ד וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אַל־יֹאמַ֤ר אֲדֹנִי֙ אֵ֣ת כׇּל־הַנְּעָרִ֤ים בְּנֵֽי־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ הֵמִ֔יתוּ כִּֽי־אַמְנ֥וֹן לְבַדּ֖וֹ מֵ֑ת כִּֽי־עַל־פִּ֤י אַבְשָׁלוֹם֙ הָיְתָ֣ה שׂוּמָ֔ה מִיּוֹם֙ עַנֹּת֔וֹ אֵ֖ת תָּמָ֥ר אֲחֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: But Jonadab, the son of David’s brother Shimah, said, “My lord must not think that all the young princes have been killed. Only Amnon is dead; for this has been decided by Absalom ever since his sister Tamar was violated.
Transliteration: vayaan yvonadav ven-shimeah achiy-david vayomer al-yomar adoniy et khׇl-haneariym veney-hamelekhe hemiytu khiy-amenvon levadvo met khiy-al-fiy aveshalvom hayetah shumah miyyvom anotvo et tamar achotvo

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֡ה אַל־יָשֵׂם֩ אֲדֹנִ֨י הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ אֶל־לִבּוֹ֙ דָּבָ֣ר לֵאמֹ֔ר כׇּל־בְּנֵ֥י הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ מֵ֑תוּ כִּֽי־(אם)־אַמְנ֥וֹן לְבַדּ֖וֹ מֵֽת׃ {פ}
Translated: So my lord the king must not think for a moment that all the princes are dead; Amnon alone is dead.”
Transliteration: veatah al-yashem adoniy hamelekhe el-livvo davar lemor khׇl-veney hamelekhe metu khiy-(m)-amenvon levadvo met {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּבְרַ֖ח אַבְשָׁל֑וֹם וַיִּשָּׂ֞א הַנַּ֤עַר הַצֹּפֶה֙ אֶת־עֵינָ֔ו וַיַּ֗רְא וְהִנֵּ֨ה עַם־רַ֜ב הֹלְכִ֥ים מִדֶּ֛רֶךְ אַחֲרָ֖יו מִצַּ֥ד הָהָֽר׃
Translated:
Meanwhile Absalom had fled.
The watchman on duty looked up and saw a large crowd coming from the road to his rear, from the side of the hill.
Transliteration: vayiverach aveshalvom vayisha hanaar hatsofeh et-eynav vayare vehineh am-rav holekhiym miderekhe acharayv mitsad hahar

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יֽוֹנָדָב֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ הִנֵּ֥ה בְנֵי־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ בָּ֑אוּ כִּדְבַ֥ר עַבְדְּךָ֖ כֵּ֥ן הָיָֽה׃
Translated: Jonadab said to the king, “See, the princes have come! It is just as your servant said.”
Transliteration: vayomer yvonadav el-hamelekhe hineh veney-hamelekhe vau khidevar avedekha khen hayah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ כְּכַלֹּת֣וֹ לְדַבֵּ֗ר וְהִנֵּ֤ה בְנֵֽי־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ בָּ֔אוּ וַיִּשְׂא֥וּ קוֹלָ֖ם וַיִּבְכּ֑וּ וְגַם־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ וְכׇל־עֲבָדָ֔יו בָּכ֕וּ בְּכִ֖י גָּד֥וֹל מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: As he finished speaking, the princes came in and broke into weeping; and David and all his courtiers wept bitterly, too.
Transliteration: vayehiy khekhalotvo ledaver vehineh veney-hamelekhe vau vayisheu kvolam vayivekhu vegam-hamelekhe vekhׇl-avadayv vakhu vekhiy gadvol meod

Hebrew: וְאַבְשָׁל֣וֹם בָּרַ֔ח וַיֵּ֛לֶךְ אֶל־תַּלְמַ֥י בֶּן־[עַמִּיה֖וּד] (עמיחור) מֶ֣לֶךְ גְּשׁ֑וּר וַיִּתְאַבֵּ֥ל עַל־בְּנ֖וֹ כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: Absalom had fled, and he came to Talmai son of Ammihud, king of Geshur. And [King David] mourned over his son a long time.
Transliteration: veaveshalvom varach vayelekhe el-talemay ven-[amiyhud] (mychvr) melekhe geshur vayiteavel al-venvo khׇl-hayamiym

Hebrew: וְאַבְשָׁל֥וֹם בָּרַ֖ח וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ גְּשׁ֑וּר וַֽיְהִי־שָׁ֖ם שָׁלֹ֥שׁ שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: Absalom, who had fled to Geshur, remained there three years.
Transliteration: veaveshalvom varach vayelekhe geshur vayehiy-sham shalosh shaniym

Hebrew: וַתְּכַל֙ דָּוִ֣ד הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ לָצֵ֖את אֶל־אַבְשָׁל֑וֹם כִּי־נִחַ֥ם עַל־אַמְנ֖וֹן כִּי־מֵֽת׃ {ס}
Translated: And King David was pining away for Absalom, for [the king] had gotten over Amnon’s death.
Transliteration: vatekhal david hamelekhe latset el-aveshalvom khiy-nicham al-amenvon khiy-met {s}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֖דַע יוֹאָ֣ב בֶּן־צְרֻיָ֑ה כִּי־לֵ֥ב הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ עַל־אַבְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: Joab son of Zeruiah could see that the king’s mind was on Absalom;
Transliteration: vayeda yvoav ven-tseruyah khiy-lev hamelekhe al-aveshalvom

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יוֹאָב֙ תְּק֔וֹעָה וַיִּקַּ֥ח מִשָּׁ֖ם אִשָּׁ֣ה חֲכָמָ֑ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵ֠לֶ֠יהָ הִֽתְאַבְּלִי־נָ֞א וְלִבְשִׁי־נָ֣א בִגְדֵי־אֵ֗בֶל וְאַל־תָּס֙וּכִי֙ שֶׁ֔מֶן וְהָיִ֕ית כְּאִשָּׁ֗ה זֶ֚ה יָמִ֣ים רַבִּ֔ים מִתְאַבֶּ֖לֶת עַל־מֵֽת׃
Translated: so Joab sent to Tekoa and brought from there a woman who was wise. He said to her, “Pretend you are in mourning; put on mourning clothes and don’t anoint yourself with oil; and act like a woman who has grieved a long time over a departed one.
Transliteration: vayishelach yvoav tekvoah vayikach misham ishah chakhamah vayomer eleyha hiteaveliy-na veliveshiy-na vigedey-evel veal-tasukhiy shemen vehayiyt kheishah zeh yamiym raviym miteavelet al-met

Hebrew: וּבָאת֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְדִבַּ֥רְתְּ אֵלָ֖יו כַּדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וַיָּ֧שֶׂם יוֹאָ֛ב אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים בְּפִֽיהָ׃
Translated: Go to the king and say to him thus and thus.” And Joab told her what to say.
Transliteration: uvat el-hamelekhe vedivarete elayv khadavar hazeh vayashem yvoav et-hadevariym vefiyha

Hebrew: וַ֠תֹּ֠אמֶר הָאִשָּׁ֤ה הַתְּקֹעִית֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַתִּפֹּ֧ל עַל־אַפֶּ֛יהָ אַ֖רְצָה וַתִּשְׁתָּ֑חוּ וַתֹּ֖אמֶר הוֹשִׁ֥עָה הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: The Tekoite woman came to the king, flung herself face down to the ground, and prostrated herself. She cried out, “Help, O king!”
Transliteration: vatomer haishah hatekoiyt el-hamelekhe vatifol al-afeyha aretsah vatishetachu vatomer hvoshiah hamelekhe {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמֶר־לָ֥הּ הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ מַה־לָּ֑ךְ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר אֲבָ֛ל אִשָּֽׁה־אַלְמָנָ֥ה אָ֖נִי וַיָּ֥מׇת אִישִֽׁי׃
Translated: The king asked her, “What troubles you?” And she answered, “Alas, I am a widow, my husband is dead.
Transliteration: vayomer-lah hamelekhe mah-lakhe vatomer aval ishah-alemanah aniy vayamׇt iyshiy

Hebrew: וּלְשִׁפְחָֽתְךָ֙ שְׁנֵ֣י בָנִ֔ים וַיִּנָּצ֤וּ שְׁנֵיהֶם֙ בַּשָּׂדֶ֔ה וְאֵ֥ין מַצִּ֖יל בֵּינֵיהֶ֑ם וַיַּכּ֧וֹ הָאֶחָ֛ד אֶת־הָאֶחָ֖ד וַיָּ֥מֶת אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Your maidservant had two sons. The two of them came to blows out in the fields where there was no one to stop them, and one of them struck the other and killed him.
Transliteration: uleshifechatekha sheney vaniym vayinatsu sheneyhem vashadeh veeyn matsiyl veyneyhem vayakhvo haechad et-haechad vayamet otvo

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּה֩ קָ֨מָה כׇֽל־הַמִּשְׁפָּחָ֜ה עַל־שִׁפְחָתֶ֗ךָ וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ תְּנִ֣י ׀ אֶת־מַכֵּ֣ה אָחִ֗יו וּנְמִתֵ֙הוּ֙ בְּנֶ֤פֶשׁ אָחִיו֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָרָ֔ג וְנַשְׁמִ֖ידָה גַּ֣ם אֶת־הַיּוֹרֵ֑שׁ וְכִבּ֗וּ אֶת־גַּֽחַלְתִּי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִשְׁאָ֔רָה לְבִלְתִּ֧י (שום) [שִׂים־]לְאִישִׁ֛י שֵׁ֥ם וּשְׁאֵרִ֖ית עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Then the whole clan confronted your maidservant and said, ‘Hand over the one who killed his brother, that we may put him to death for the slaying of his brother, even though we wipe out the heir.’ Thus they would quench the last ember remaining to me, and leave my husband without name or remnant upon the earth.”
Transliteration: vehineh kamah khׇl-hamishefachah al-shifechatekha vayomeru teniy et-makheh achiyv unemitehu venefesh achiyv asher harag venashemiydah gam et-hayyvoresh vekhivu et-gachaletiy asher nishearah leviletiy (shvm) [shiym-]leiyshiy shem usheeriyt al-feney haadamah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ אֶל־הָאִשָּׁ֖ה לְכִ֣י לְבֵיתֵ֑ךְ וַאֲנִ֖י אֲצַוֶּ֥ה עָלָֽיִךְ׃
Translated: The king said to the woman, “Go home. I will issue an order in your behalf.”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe el-haishah lekhiy leveytekhe vaaniy atsaveh alayiikhe

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֜אמֶר הָאִשָּׁ֤ה הַתְּקוֹעִית֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ עָלַ֞י אֲדֹנִ֥י הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ הֶעָוֺ֖ן וְעַל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֑י וְהַמֶּ֥לֶךְ וְכִסְא֖וֹ נָקִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: And the Tekoite woman said to the king, “My lord king, may the guilt be on me and on my ancestral house; Your Majesty and his throne are guiltless.”
Transliteration: vatomer haishah hatekvoiyt el-hamelekhe alay adoniy hamelekhe heavon veal-veyt aviy vehamelekhe vekhisevo nakiy {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ הַֽמְדַבֵּ֤ר אֵלַ֙יִךְ֙ וַהֲבֵאת֣וֹ אֵלַ֔י וְלֹא־יֹסִ֥יף ע֖וֹד לָגַ֥עַת בָּֽךְ׃
Translated: The king said, “If anyone says anything more to you, have him brought to me, and he will never trouble you again.”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe hamedaver elayiikhe vahavetvo elay velo-yosiyf vod lagaat vakhe

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֩אמֶר֩ יִזְכׇּר־נָ֨א הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ (מהרבית) [מֵהַרְבַּ֞ת] גֹּאֵ֤ל הַדָּם֙ לְשַׁחֵ֔ת וְלֹ֥א יַשְׁמִ֖ידוּ אֶת־בְּנִ֑י וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ חַי־יְהֹוָ֔ה אִם־יִפֹּ֛ל מִשַּׂעֲרַ֥ת בְּנֵ֖ךְ אָֽרְצָה׃
Translated: She replied, “Let Your Majesty be mindful of the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God and restrain the blood avenger bent on destruction, so that my son may not be killed.” And he said, “As G<small>OD</small> lives, not a hair of your son shall fall to the ground.”
Transliteration: vatomer yizekhׇr-na hamelekhe et-yehovah eloheykha (mhrvyt) [meharevat] goel hadam leshachet velo yashemiydu et-veniy vayomer chay-yehovah im-yifol mishaarat venekhe aretsah

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה תְּדַבֶּר־נָ֧א שִׁפְחָתְךָ֛ אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֥י הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ דָּבָ֑ר וַיֹּ֖אמֶר דַּבֵּֽרִי׃ {ס}
Translated: Then the woman said, “Please let your maidservant say another word to my lord the king.” “Speak on,” said the king.
Transliteration: vatomer haishah tedaver-na shifechatekha el-adoniy hamelekhe davar vayomer daveriy {s}

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הָאִשָּׁ֔ה וְלָ֧מָּה חָשַׁ֛בְתָּה כָּזֹ֖את עַל־עַ֣ם אֱלֹהִ֑ים וּמִדַּבֵּ֨ר הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ הַדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ כְּאָשֵׁ֔ם לְבִלְתִּ֛י הָשִׁ֥יב הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֶֽת־נִדְּחֽוֹ׃
Translated: And the woman said, “Why then have you planned the like against God’s people? In making this pronouncement, Your Majesty condemns himself in that Your Majesty does not bring back his own banished one.
Transliteration: vatomer haishah velamah chashavetah khazot al-am Elohim umidaver hamelekhe hadavar hazeh kheashem leviletiy hashiyv hamelekhe et-nidechvo

Hebrew: כִּי־מ֣וֹת נָמ֔וּת וְכַמַּ֙יִם֙ הַנִּגָּרִ֣ים אַ֔רְצָה אֲשֶׁ֖ר לֹ֣א יֵאָסֵ֑פוּ וְלֹֽא־יִשָּׂ֤א אֱלֹהִים֙ נֶ֔פֶשׁ וְחָשַׁב֙ מַחֲשָׁב֔וֹת לְבִלְתִּ֛י יִדַּ֥ח מִמֶּ֖נּוּ נִדָּֽח׃
Translated: We must all die; we are like water that is poured out on the ground and cannot be gathered up. God will not take away the life of one who makes plans so that no one may be kept banished.
Transliteration: khiy-mvot namut vekhamayiim hanigariym aretsah asher lo eiasefu velo-yisha Elohim nefesh vechashav machashavvot leviletiy yidach mimenu nidach

Hebrew: וְ֠עַתָּ֠ה אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֜אתִי לְדַבֵּ֨ר אֶל־הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ אֲדֹנִי֙ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה כִּ֥י יֵרְאֻ֖נִי הָעָ֑ם וַתֹּ֤אמֶר שִׁפְחָתְךָ֙ אֲדַבְּרָה־נָּ֣א אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אוּלַ֛י יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֶת־דְּבַ֥ר אֲמָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: And the reason I have come to say these things to the king, my lord, is that the people have frightened me. Your maidservant thought I would speak to Your Majesty; perhaps Your Majesty would act on his handmaid’s plea.
Transliteration: veatah asher-vatiy ledaver el-hamelekhe adoniy et-hadavar hazeh khiy eireuniy haam vatomer shifechatekha adaverah-na el-hamelekhe ulay yaasheh hamelekhe et-devar amatvo

Hebrew: כִּ֚י יִשְׁמַ֣ע הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ לְהַצִּ֥יל אֶת־אֲמָת֖וֹ מִכַּ֣ף הָאִ֑ישׁ לְהַשְׁמִ֨יד אֹתִ֤י וְאֶת־בְּנִי֙ יַ֔חַד מִֽנַּחֲלַ֖ת אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: For Your Majesty would surely agree to deliver his handmaid from the hands of anyone [who would seek to] cut off both me and my son from the heritage of God.
Transliteration: khiy yishema hamelekhe lehatsiyl et-amatvo mikhaf haiysh lehashemiyd otiy veet-veniy yachad minachalat Elohim

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ שִׁפְחָ֣תְךָ֔ יִֽהְיֶה־נָּ֛א דְּבַר־אֲדֹנִ֥י הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ לִמְנֻחָ֑ה כִּ֣י ׀ כְּמַלְאַ֣ךְ הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים כֵּ֣ן אֲדֹנִ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ לִשְׁמֹ֙עַ֙ הַטּ֣וֹב וְהָרָ֔ע וַיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ יְהִ֥י עִמָּֽךְ׃ {פ}
Translated: Your maidservant thought, ‘Let the word of my lord the king provide comfort; for my lord the king is like an angel of God, understanding everything, good and bad.’ May the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God be with you.”
Transliteration: vatomer shifechatekha yiheyeh-na devar-adoniy hamelekhe limenuchah khiy khemaleakhe haElohim khen adoniy hamelekhe lishemoa hatvov vehara vayhovah eloheykha yehiy imakhe {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַן הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־הָ֣אִשָּׁ֔ה אַל־נָ֨א תְכַחֲדִ֤י מִמֶּ֙נִּי֙ דָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י שֹׁאֵ֣ל אֹתָ֑ךְ וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה יְדַבֶּר־נָ֖א אֲדֹנִ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: In reply, the king said to the woman, “Do not withhold from me anything I ask you!” The woman answered, “Let my lord the king speak.”
Transliteration: vayaan hamelekhe vayomer el-haishah al-na tekhachadiy mimeniy davar asher anokhiy shoel otakhe vatomer haishah yedaver-na adoniy hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ הֲיַ֥ד יוֹאָ֛ב אִתָּ֖ךְ בְּכׇל־זֹ֑את וַתַּ֣עַן הָאִשָּׁ֣ה וַתֹּ֡אמֶר חֵי־נַפְשְׁךָ֩ אֲדֹנִ֨י הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אִם־אִ֣שׁ ׀ לְהֵמִ֣ין וּלְהַשְׂמִ֗יל מִכֹּ֤ל אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּר֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ כִּֽי־עַבְדְּךָ֤ יוֹאָב֙ ה֣וּא צִוָּ֔נִי וְה֗וּא שָׂ֚ם בְּפִ֣י שִׁפְחָֽתְךָ֔ אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: The king asked, “Is Joab in league with you in all this?” The woman replied, “As you live, my lord the king, it is just as my lord the king says. Yes, your servant Joab was the one who instructed me, and it was he who told your maidservant everything she was to say.
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe hayad yvoav itakhe vekhׇl-zot vataan haishah vatomer chey-nafeshekha adoniy hamelekhe im-ish lehemiyn ulehashemiyl mikhol asher-diver adoniy hamelekhe khiy-avedekha yvoav hu tsivaniy vehu sham vefiy shifechatekha et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh

Hebrew: לְבַעֲב֤וּר סַבֵּב֙ אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י הַדָּבָ֔ר עָשָׂ֛ה עַבְדְּךָ֥ יוֹאָ֖ב אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וַאדֹנִ֣י חָכָ֗ם כְּחׇכְמַת֙ מַלְאַ֣ךְ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים לָדַ֖עַת אֶֽת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּאָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
Translated: It was to conceal the real purpose of the matter that your servant Joab did this thing. My lord is as wise as an angel of God, and he knows all that goes on in the land.”
Transliteration: levaavur savev et-feney hadavar ashah avedekha yvoav et-hadavar hazeh vadoniy chakham khechׇkhemat maleakhe haElohim ladaat et-khׇl-asher vaarets {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֶל־יוֹאָ֔ב הִנֵּה־נָ֥א עָשִׂ֖יתִי אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה וְלֵ֛ךְ הָשֵׁ֥ב אֶת־הַנַּ֖עַר אֶת־אַבְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: Then the king said to Joab, “I will do this thing. Go and bring back my boy Absalom.”
