Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe el-yvoav hineh-na ashiytiy et-hadavar hazeh velekhe hashev et-hanaar et-aveshalvom

Hebrew: וַיִּפֹּל֩ יוֹאָ֨ב אֶל־פָּנָ֥יו אַ֛רְצָה וַיִּשְׁתַּ֖חוּ וַיְבָ֣רֶךְ אֶת־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יוֹאָ֡ב הַיּוֹם֩ יָדַ֨ע עַבְדְּךָ֜ כִּי־מָצָ֨אתִי חֵ֤ן בְּעֵינֶ֙יךָ֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֥ה הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֶת־דְּבַ֥ר (עבדו) [עַבְדֶּֽךָ]׃
Translated: Joab flung himself face down on the ground and prostrated himself. Joab blessed the king and said, “Today your servant knows that he has found favor with you, my lord king, for Your Majesty has granted his servant’s request.”
Transliteration: vayifol yvoav el-fanayv aretsah vayishetachu vayevarekhe et-hamelekhe vayomer yvoav hayyvom yada avedekha khiy-matsatiy chen veeyneykha adoniy hamelekhe asher-ashah hamelekhe et-devar (vdv) [avedekha]

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥קׇם יוֹאָ֖ב וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ גְּשׁ֑וּרָה וַיָּבֵ֥א אֶת־אַבְשָׁל֖וֹם יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated: And Joab went at once to Geshur and brought Absalom to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayakׇm yvoav vayelekhe geshurah vayave et-aveshalvom yerushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ יִסֹּ֣ב אֶל־בֵּית֔וֹ וּפָנַ֖י לֹ֣א יִרְאֶ֑ה וַיִּסֹּ֤ב אַבְשָׁלוֹם֙ אֶל־בֵּית֔וֹ וּפְנֵ֥י הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ לֹ֥א רָאָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: But the king said, “Let him go directly to his house and not present himself to me.” So Absalom went directly to his house and did not present himself to the king.
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe yisov el-veytvo ufanay lo yireeh vayisov aveshalvom el-veytvo ufeney hamelekhe lo raah {s}

Hebrew: וּכְאַבְשָׁל֗וֹם לֹֽא־הָיָ֧ה אִישׁ־יָפֶ֛ה בְּכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְהַלֵּ֣ל מְאֹ֑ד מִכַּ֤ף רַגְלוֹ֙ וְעַ֣ד קׇדְקֳד֔וֹ לֹא־הָ֥יָה ב֖וֹ מֽוּם׃
Translated: No other man in Israel was as admired for his beauty as Absalom; from the sole of his foot to the crown of his head he was without blemish.
Transliteration: ukheaveshalvom lo-hayah iysh-yafeh vekhׇl-yisherael lehalel meod mikhaf ragelvo vead kׇdekodvo lo-hayah vvo mum

Hebrew: וּֽבְגַלְּחוֹ֮ אֶת־רֹאשׁוֹ֒ וְֽ֠הָיָ֠ה מִקֵּ֨ץ יָמִ֤ים <small>׀</small> לַיָּמִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יְגַלֵּ֔חַ כִּי־כָבֵ֥ד עָלָ֖יו וְגִלְּח֑וֹ וְשָׁקַל֙ אֶת־שְׂעַ֣ר רֹאשׁ֔וֹ מָאתַ֥יִם שְׁקָלִ֖ים בְּאֶ֥בֶן הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: When he cut his hair—he had to have it cut every year, for it grew too heavy for him—the hair of his head weighed two hundred shekels by the royal weight.
Transliteration: uvegalechvo et-roshvo vehayah mikets yamiym <small></small> layamiym asher yegalecha khiy-khaved alayv vegilechvo veshakal et-shear roshvo matayiim shekaliym veeven hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיִּוָּלְד֤וּ לְאַבְשָׁלוֹם֙ שְׁלוֹשָׁ֣ה בָנִ֔ים וּבַ֥ת אַחַ֖ת וּשְׁמָ֣הּ תָּמָ֑ר הִ֣יא הָֽיְתָ֔ה אִשָּׁ֖ה יְפַ֥ת מַרְאֶֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Absalom had three sons and a daughter whose name was Tamar; she was a beautiful woman.
Transliteration: vayivaledu leaveshalvom shelvoshah vaniym uvat achat ushemah tamar hiy hayetah ishah yefat mareeh {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֧שֶׁב אַבְשָׁל֛וֹם בִּירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם שְׁנָתַ֣יִם יָמִ֑ים וּפְנֵ֥י הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ לֹ֥א רָאָֽה׃
Translated: Absalom lived in Jerusalem two years without appearing before the king.
Transliteration: vayeshev aveshalvom viyrushala͏im shenatayiim yamiym ufeney hamelekhe lo raah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח אַבְשָׁל֜וֹם אֶל־יוֹאָ֗ב לִשְׁלֹ֤חַ אֹתוֹ֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְלֹ֥א אָבָ֖ה לָב֣וֹא אֵלָ֑יו וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח עוֹד֙ שֵׁנִ֔ית וְלֹ֥א אָבָ֖ה לָבֽוֹא׃
Translated: Then Absalom sent for Joab, in order to send him to the king; but Joab would not come to him. He sent for him a second time, but he would not come.
Transliteration: vayishelach aveshalvom el-yvoav lishelocha otvo el-hamelekhe velo avah lavvo elayv vayishelach vod sheniyt velo avah lavvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֶל־עֲבָדָ֜יו רְאוּ֩ חֶלְקַ֨ת יוֹאָ֤ב אֶל־יָדִי֙ וְלוֹ־שָׁ֣ם שְׂעֹרִ֔ים לְכ֖וּ (והוצתיה) [וְהַצִּית֣וּהָ] בָאֵ֑שׁ וַיַּצִּ֜תוּ עַבְדֵ֧י אַבְשָׁל֛וֹם אֶת־הַחֶלְקָ֖ה בָּאֵֽשׁ׃ {פ}
Translated: So [Absalom] said to his servants, “Look, Joab’s field is next to mine, and he has barley there. Go and set it on fire.” And Absalom’s servants set the field on fire.
Transliteration: vayomer el-avadayv reu chelekat yvoav el-yadiy velvo-sham sheoriym lekhu (vhvtstyh) [vehatsiytuha] vaesh vayatsitu avedey aveshalvom et-hachelekah vaesh {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם יוֹאָ֔ב וַיָּבֹ֥א אֶל־אַבְשָׁל֖וֹם הַבָּ֑יְתָה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו לָ֣מָּה הִצִּ֧יתוּ עֲבָדֶ֛יךָ אֶת־הַחֶלְקָ֥ה אֲשֶׁר־לִ֖י בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: Joab came at once to Absalom’s house and said to him, “Why did your servants set fire to my field?”
Transliteration: vayakׇm yvoav vayavo el-aveshalvom havayetah vayomer elayv lamah hitsiytu avadeykha et-hachelekah asher-liy vaesh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אַבְשָׁל֣וֹם אֶל־יוֹאָ֡ב הִנֵּ֣ה שָׁלַ֣חְתִּי אֵלֶ֣יךָ <small>׀</small> לֵאמֹ֡ר בֹּ֣א הֵ֠נָּה וְאֶשְׁלְחָה֩ אֹתְךָ֨ אֶל־הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ לֵאמֹ֗ר לָ֤מָּה בָּ֙אתִי֙ מִגְּשׁ֔וּר ט֥וֹב לִ֖י עֹ֣ד אֲנִי־שָׁ֑ם וְעַתָּ֗ה אֶרְאֶה֙ פְּנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְאִם־יֶשׁ־בִּ֥י עָוֺ֖ן וֶהֱמִתָֽנִי׃
Translated: Absalom replied to Joab, “I sent for you to come here; I wanted to send you to the king to say [on my behalf]: ‘Why did I leave Geshur? I would be better off if I were still there. Now let me appear before the king; and if I am guilty of anything, let him put me to death!’”
Transliteration: vayomer aveshalvom el-yvoav hineh shalachetiy eleykha <small></small> lemor vo henah veeshelechah otekha el-hamelekhe lemor lamah vatiy migeshur tvov liy od aniy-sham veatah ereeh feney hamelekhe veim-yesh-viy avon vehemitaniy

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א יוֹאָ֣ב אֶל־הַמֶּ֘לֶךְ֮ וַיַּגֶּד־לוֹ֒ וַיִּקְרָ֤א אֶל־אַבְשָׁלוֹם֙ וַיָּבֹ֣א אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַיִּשְׁתַּ֨חוּ ל֧וֹ עַל־אַפָּ֛יו אַ֖רְצָה לִפְנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיִּשַּׁ֥ק הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ לְאַבְשָׁלֽוֹם׃ {ס}
Translated: Joab went to the king and reported to him; whereupon he summoned Absalom. He came to the king and flung himself face down to the ground before the king. And the king kissed Absalom.
Transliteration: vayavo yvoav el-hamelekhe vayaged-lvo vayikera el-aveshalvom vayavo el-hamelekhe vayishetachu lvo al-afayv aretsah lifeney hamelekhe vayishak hamelekhe leaveshalvom {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ מֵאַ֣חֲרֵי כֵ֔ן וַיַּ֤עַשׂ לוֹ֙ אַבְשָׁל֔וֹם מֶרְכָּבָ֖ה וְסֻסִ֑ים וַחֲמִשִּׁ֥ים אִ֖ישׁ רָצִ֥ים לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: Sometime afterward, Absalom provided himself with a chariot, horses, and fifty outrunners.
Transliteration: vayehiy meacharey khen vayaash lvo aveshalvom merekhavah vesusiym vachamishiym iysh ratsiym lefanayv

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁכִּים֙ אַבְשָׁל֔וֹם וְעָמַ֕ד עַל־יַ֖ד דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַשָּׁ֑עַר וַיְהִ֡י כׇּל־הָאִ֣ישׁ אֲשֶֽׁר־יִֽהְיֶה־לּוֹ־רִיב֩ לָב֨וֹא אֶל־הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ לַמִּשְׁפָּ֗ט וַיִּקְרָ֨א אַבְשָׁל֤וֹם אֵלָיו֙ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר אֵֽי־מִזֶּ֥ה עִיר֙ אַ֔תָּה וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מֵאַחַ֥ד שִׁבְטֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: Absalom used to rise early and stand by the road to the city gates; and whenever someone had a case that was to come before the king for judgment, Absalom would call out, “What town are you from?” And when the answer came, “Your servant is from such and such a tribe in Israel,”
Transliteration: vehishekhiym aveshalvom veamad al-yad derekhe hashaar vayehiy khׇl-haiysh asher-yiheyeh-lvo-riyv lavvo el-hamelekhe lamishefat vayikera aveshalvom elayv vayomer ey-mizeh iyr atah vayomer meachad shivetey-yisherael avedekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ אַבְשָׁל֔וֹם רְאֵ֥ה דְבָרֶ֖יךָ טוֹבִ֣ים וּנְכֹחִ֑ים וְשֹׁמֵ֥עַ אֵין־לְךָ֖ מֵאֵ֥ת הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: Absalom would say, “It is clear that your claim is right and just, but there is no one assigned to you by the king to hear it.”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv aveshalvom reeh devareykha tvoviym unekhochiym veshomea eyn-lekha meet hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אַבְשָׁל֔וֹם מִֽי־יְשִׂמֵ֥נִי שֹׁפֵ֖ט בָּאָ֑רֶץ וְעָלַ֗י יָב֛וֹא כׇּל־אִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶֽׁר־יִֽהְיֶה־לּוֹ־רִ֥יב וּמִשְׁפָּ֖ט וְהִצְדַּקְתִּֽיו׃
Translated: And Absalom went on, “If only I were appointed judge in the land and everyone with a legal dispute came before me, I would see that they got their rights.”
Transliteration: vayomer aveshalvom miy-yeshimeniy shofet vaarets vealay yavvo khׇl-iysh asher-yiheyeh-lvo-riyv umishefat vehitsedaketiyv

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ בִּקְרׇב־אִ֔ישׁ לְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֺ֖ת ל֑וֹ וְשָׁלַ֧ח אֶת־יָד֛וֹ וְהֶחֱזִ֥יק ל֖וֹ וְנָ֥שַׁק לֽוֹ׃
Translated: And if a man approached to bow to him, [Absalom] would extend his hand and take hold of him and kiss him.
Transliteration: vehayah vikerׇv-iysh lehishetachavot lvo veshalach et-yadvo vehecheziyk lvo venashak lvo

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ אַבְשָׁל֜וֹם כַּדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ לְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁר־יָבֹ֥אוּ לַמִּשְׁפָּ֖ט אֶל־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיְגַנֵּב֙ אַבְשָׁל֔וֹם אֶת־לֵ֖ב אַנְשֵׁ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: Absalom did this to every Israelite who came to the king for judgment. Thus Absalom won away the hearts of Israel’s citizens.
Transliteration: vayaash aveshalvom khadavar hazeh lekhׇl-yisherael asher-yavou lamishefat el-hamelekhe vayeganev aveshalvom et-lev aneshey yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י מִקֵּ֖ץ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אַבְשָׁלוֹם֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אֵ֣לְכָה נָּ֗א וַאֲשַׁלֵּ֛ם אֶת־נִדְרִ֛י אֲשֶׁר־נָדַ֥רְתִּי לַיהֹוָ֖ה בְּחֶבְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: After a period of forty years had gone by, Absalom said to the king, “Let me go to Hebron and fulfill a vow that I made to G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayehiy mikets arevaiym shanah vayomer aveshalvom el-hamelekhe elekhah na vaashalem et-nideriy asher-nadaretiy layhovah vechevervon

Hebrew: כִּי־נֵ֙דֶר֙ נָדַ֣ר עַבְדְּךָ֔ בְּשִׁבְתִּ֥י בִגְשׁ֛וּר בַּאֲרָ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר אִם־[יָשׁ֨וֹב] (ישיב) יְשִׁיבֵ֤נִי יְהֹוָה֙ יְר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם וְעָבַדְתִּ֖י אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: For your servant made a vow when I lived in Geshur of Aram: If G<small>OD</small> ever brings me back to Jerusalem, I will worship G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: khiy-neder nadar avedekha veshivetiy vigeshur vaaram lemor im-[yashvov] (yshyv) yeshiyveniy yehovah yerushala͏im veavadetiy et-yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמֶר־ל֥וֹ הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ לֵ֣ךְ בְּשָׁל֑וֹם וַיָּ֖קׇם וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ חֶבְרֽוֹנָה׃ {פ}
Translated: The king said to him, “Go in peace”; and so he set out for Hebron.
Transliteration: vayomer-lvo hamelekhe lekhe veshalvom vayakׇm vayelekhe chevervonah {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח אַבְשָׁלוֹם֙ מְרַגְּלִ֔ים בְּכׇל־שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר כְּשׇׁמְעֲכֶם֙ אֶת־ק֣וֹל הַשֹּׁפָ֔ר וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֕ם מָלַ֥ךְ אַבְשָׁל֖וֹם בְּחֶבְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: But Absalom sent agents to all the tribes of Israel to say, “When you hear the blast of the horn, announce that Absalom has become king in Hebron.”
Transliteration: vayishelach aveshalvom merageliym vekhׇl-shivetey yisherael lemor kheshׇmeakhem et-kvol hashofar vaamaretem malakhe aveshalvom vechevervon

Hebrew: וְאֶת־אַבְשָׁל֗וֹם הָלְכ֞וּ מָאתַ֤יִם אִישׁ֙ מִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם קְרֻאִ֖ים וְהֹלְכִ֣ים לְתֻמָּ֑ם וְלֹ֥א יָדְע֖וּ כׇּל־דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: Two hundred Jerusalemites accompanied Absalom; they were invited and went in good faith, suspecting nothing.
Transliteration: veet-aveshalvom halekhu matayiim iysh miyrushala͏im keruiym veholekhiym letumam velo yadeu khׇl-davar

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח אַ֠בְשָׁל֠וֹם אֶת־אֲחִיתֹ֨פֶל הַגִּילֹנִ֜י יוֹעֵ֣ץ דָּוִ֗ד מֵֽעִירוֹ֙ מִגִּלֹ֔ה בְּזׇבְח֖וֹ אֶת־הַזְּבָחִ֑ים וַיְהִ֤י הַקֶּ֙שֶׁר֙ אַמִּ֔ץ וְהָעָ֛ם הוֹלֵ֥ךְ וָרָ֖ב אֶת־אַבְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: Absalom also sent [to fetch] Ahithophel the Gilonite, David’s counselor, from his town, Giloh, when the sacrifices were to be offered. The conspiracy gained strength, and the people supported Absalom in increasing numbers.
Transliteration: vayishelach aveshalvom et-achiytofel hagiyloniy yvoets david meiyrvo migiloh vezׇvechvo et-hazevachiym vayehiy hakesher amits vehaam hvolekhe varav et-aveshalvom

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֙ הַמַּגִּ֔יד אֶל־דָּוִ֖ד לֵאמֹ֑ר הָיָ֛ה לֶב־אִ֥ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אַחֲרֵ֥י אַבְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: Someone came and told David, “The loyalty of Israel’s force has veered toward Absalom.”
Transliteration: vayavo hamagiyd el-david lemor hayah lev-iysh yisherael acharey aveshalvom

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּ֠וִ֠ד לְכׇל־עֲבָדָ֨יו אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֤וֹ בִירוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ ק֣וּמוּ וְנִבְרָ֔חָה כִּ֛י לֹא־תִֽהְיֶה־לָּ֥נוּ פְלֵיטָ֖ה מִפְּנֵ֣י אַבְשָׁלֹ֑ם מַהֲר֣וּ לָלֶ֗כֶת פֶּן־יְמַהֵ֤ר וְהִשִּׂגָ֙נוּ֙ וְהִדִּ֤יחַ עָלֵ֙ינוּ֙ אֶת־הָ֣רָעָ֔ה וְהִכָּ֥ה הָעִ֖יר לְפִי־חָֽרֶב׃
Translated: Whereupon David said to all the courtiers who were with him in Jerusalem, “Let us flee at once, or none of us will escape from Absalom. We must get away quickly, or he will soon overtake us and bring down disaster upon us and put the city to the sword.”
Transliteration: vayomer david lekhׇl-avadayv asher-itvo viyrushala͏im kumu veniverachah khiy lo-tiheyeh-lanu feleytah mifeney aveshalom maharu lalekhet fen-yemaher vehishiganu vehidiycha aleynu et-haraah vehikhah haiyr lefiy-charev

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ עַבְדֵֽי־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֶל־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ כְּכֹ֧ל אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֛ר אֲדֹנִ֥י הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ הִנֵּ֥ה עֲבָדֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: The king’s courtiers said to the king, “Whatever our lord the king decides, your servants are ready.”
Transliteration: vayomeru avedey-hamelekhe el-hamelekhe khekhol asher-yivechar adoniy hamelekhe hineh avadeykha

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֥א הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ וְכׇל־בֵּית֖וֹ בְּרַגְלָ֑יו וַיַּעֲזֹ֣ב הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ אֵ֣ת עֶ֧שֶׂר נָשִׁ֛ים פִּֽלַגְשִׁ֖ים לִשְׁמֹ֥ר הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: So the king left, followed by his entire household, except for ten concubines whom the king left to mind the palace.
Transliteration: vayetse hamelekhe vekhׇl-veytvo veragelayv vayaazov hamelekhe et esher nashiym filageshiym lishemor havayiit

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֥א הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ וְכׇל־הָעָ֖ם בְּרַגְלָ֑יו וַיַּעַמְד֖וּ בֵּ֥ית הַמֶּרְחָֽק׃
Translated: The king left, followed by all the people, and they stopped at the last house.
Transliteration: vayetse hamelekhe vekhׇl-haam veragelayv vayaamedu veyt hamerechak

Hebrew: וְכׇל־עֲבָדָיו֙ עֹבְרִ֣ים עַל־יָד֔וֹ וְכׇל־הַכְּרֵתִ֖י וְכׇל־הַפְּלֵתִ֑י וְכׇֽל־הַגִּתִּ֞ים שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֣וֹת אִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֤אוּ בְרַגְלוֹ֙ מִגַּ֔ת עֹבְרִ֖ים עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: All his followers marched past him, including all the Cherethites and all the Pelethites; and all six hundred Gittites, who had accompanied him from Gath, also marched by the king.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-avadayv overiym al-yadvo vekhׇl-hakheretiy vekhׇl-hafeletiy vekhׇl-hagitiym shesh-mevot iysh asher-vau veragelvo migat overiym al-feney hamelekhe {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֶל־אִתַּ֣י הַגִּתִּ֔י לָ֧מָּה תֵלֵ֛ךְ גַּם־אַתָּ֖ה אִתָּ֑נוּ שׁ֣וּב וְשֵׁ֤ב עִם־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ כִּי־נׇכְרִ֣י אַ֔תָּה וְגַם־גֹּלֶ֥ה אַתָּ֖ה לִמְקוֹמֶֽךָ׃
Translated: And the king said to Ittai the Gittite, “Why should you too go with us? Go back and stay with the [new] king, for you are a foreigner and you are also an exile from your country.
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe el-itay hagitiy lamah telekhe gam-atah itanu shuv veshev im-hamelekhe khiy-nׇkheriy atah vegam-goleh atah limekvomekha

Hebrew: תְּמ֣וֹל ׀ בּוֹאֶ֗ךָ וְהַיּ֞וֹם (אנועך) [אֲנִֽיעֲךָ֤] עִמָּ֙נוּ֙ לָלֶ֔כֶת וַאֲנִ֣י הוֹלֵ֔ךְ עַ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִ֖י הוֹלֵ֑ךְ שׁ֣וּב וְהָשֵׁ֧ב אֶת־אַחֶ֛יךָ עִמָּ֖ךְ חֶ֥סֶד וֶאֱמֶֽת׃
Translated: You came only yesterday; should I make you wander about with us today, when I myself must go wherever I can? Go back, and take your kin with you, [in] true faithfulness.”
Transliteration: temvol vvoekha vehayyvom (nvkh) [aniyakha] imanu lalekhet vaaniy hvolekhe al asher-aniy hvolekhe shuv vehashev et-acheykha imakhe chesed veemet

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַן אִתַּ֛י אֶת־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר חַי־יְהֹוָ֗ה וְחֵי֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ כִּ֠י (אם) בִּמְק֞וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִהְיֶה־שָּׁ֣ם ׀ אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ אִם־לְמָ֙וֶת֙ אִם־לְחַיִּ֔ים כִּי־שָׁ֖ם יִהְיֶ֥ה עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: Ittai replied to the king, “As G<small>OD</small> lives and as my lord the king lives, wherever my lord the king may be, there your servant will be, whether for death or for life!”
Transliteration: vayaan itay et-hamelekhe vayomar chay-yehovah vechey adoniy hamelekhe khiy (m) vimekvom asher yiheyeh-sham adoniy hamelekhe im-lemavet im-lechayiym khiy-sham yiheyeh avedekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר דָּוִ֛ד אֶל־אִתַּ֖י לֵ֣ךְ וַעֲבֹ֑ר וַֽיַּעֲבֹ֞ר אִתַּ֤י הַגִּתִּי֙ וְכׇל־אֲנָשָׁ֔יו וְכׇל־הַטַּ֖ף אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: And David said to Ittai, “Then march by.” And Ittai the Gittite and all his men and all the dependents who were with him marched by.
Transliteration: vayomer david el-itay lekhe vaavor vayaavor itay hagitiy vekhׇl-anashayv vekhׇl-hataf asher itvo

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הָאָ֗רֶץ בּוֹכִים֙ ק֣וֹל גָּד֔וֹל וְכׇל־הָעָ֖ם עֹבְרִ֑ים וְהַמֶּ֗לֶךְ עֹבֵר֙ בְּנַ֣חַל קִדְר֔וֹן וְכׇל־הָעָם֙ עֹבְרִ֔ים עַל־פְּנֵי־דֶ֖רֶךְ אֶת־הַמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: The whole countryside wept aloud as the troops marched by. The king crossed the Kidron Valley, and all the troops crossed by the road to the wilderness.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-haarets vvokhiym kvol gadvol vekhׇl-haam overiym vehamelekhe over venachal kidervon vekhׇl-haam overiym al-feney-derekhe et-hamidevar

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֨ה גַם־צָד֜וֹק וְכׇֽל־הַלְוִיִּ֣ם אִתּ֗וֹ נֹֽשְׂאִים֙ אֶת־אֲרוֹן֙ בְּרִ֣ית הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וַיַּצִּ֙קוּ֙ אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וַיַּ֖עַל אֶבְיָתָ֑ר עַד־תֹּ֥ם כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם לַעֲב֥וֹר מִן־הָעִֽיר׃ {ס}
Translated: Then Zadok appeared, with all the Levites carrying the Ark of the Covenant of God; and they set down the Ark of God until all the people had finished marching out of the city. Abiathar also came up.
Transliteration: vehineh gam-tsadvok vekhׇl-haleviyim itvo nosheiym et-arvon veriyt haElohim vayatsiku et-arvon haElohim vayaal eveyatar ad-tom khׇl-haam laavvor min-haiyr {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ לְצָד֔וֹק הָשֵׁ֛ב אֶת־אֲר֥וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים הָעִ֑יר אִם־אֶמְצָ֥א חֵן֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וֶהֱשִׁבַ֕נִי וְהִרְאַ֥נִי אֹת֖וֹ וְאֶת־נָוֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: But the king said to Zadok, “Take the Ark of God back to the city. If I find favor with G<small>OD</small>, I will be brought back to see it and its abode.
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe letsadvok hashev et-arvon haElohim haiyr im-emetsa chen veeyney yehovah veheshivaniy vehireaniy otvo veet-navehu

Hebrew: וְאִם֙ כֹּ֣ה יֹאמַ֔ר לֹ֥א חָפַ֖צְתִּי בָּ֑ךְ הִנְנִ֕י יַעֲשֶׂה־לִּ֕י כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר ט֥וֹב בְּעֵינָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: And if [God] should say, ‘I do not want you,’ I am ready; I accept what [God] deems right.”
Transliteration: veim khoh yomar lo chafatsetiy vakhe hineniy yaasheh-liy khaasher tvov veeynayv {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֶל־צָד֣וֹק הַכֹּהֵ֔ן הֲרוֹאֶ֣ה אַתָּ֔ה שֻׁ֥בָה הָעִ֖יר בְּשָׁל֑וֹם וַאֲחִימַ֨עַץ בִּנְךָ֜ וִיהוֹנָתָ֧ן בֶּן־אֶבְיָתָ֛ר שְׁנֵ֥י בְנֵיכֶ֖ם אִתְּכֶֽם׃
Translated: And the king said to the priest Zadok, “Do you understand? You return to the safety of the city with your two sons, your own son Ahimaaz and Abiathar’s son Jonathan.
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe el-tsadvok hakhohen harvoeh atah shuvah haiyr veshalvom vaachiymaats vinekha viyhvonatan ven-eveyatar sheney veneykhem itekhem

Hebrew: רְאוּ֙ אָנֹכִ֣י מִתְמַהְמֵ֔הַּ (בעברות) [בְּעַֽרְב֖וֹת] הַמִּדְבָּ֑ר עַ֣ד בּ֥וֹא דָבָ֛ר מֵעִמָּכֶ֖ם לְהַגִּ֥יד לִֽי׃
Translated: Look, I shall linger in the steppes of the wilderness until word comes from you to inform me.”
Transliteration: reu anokhiy mitemahemeha (vvrvt) [vearevvot] hamidevar ad vvo davar meimakhem lehagiyd liy

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨שֶׁב צָד֧וֹק וְאֶבְיָתָ֛ר אֶת־אֲר֥וֹן הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַיֵּשְׁב֖וּ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: Zadok and Abiathar brought the Ark of God back to Jerusalem, and they stayed there.
Transliteration: vayashev tsadvok veeveyatar et-arvon haElohim yerushala͏im vayeshevu sham

Hebrew: וְדָוִ֡ד עֹלֶה֩ בְמַעֲלֵ֨ה הַזֵּיתִ֜ים עֹלֶ֣ה ׀ וּבוֹכֶ֗ה וְרֹ֥אשׁ לוֹ֙ חָפ֔וּי וְה֖וּא הֹלֵ֣ךְ יָחֵ֑ף וְכׇל־הָעָ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֗וֹ חָפוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ רֹאשׁ֔וֹ וְעָל֥וּ עָלֹ֖ה וּבָכֹֽה׃
Translated: David meanwhile went up the slope of the [Mount of] Olives, weeping as he went; his head was covered and he walked barefoot. And all the people who were with him covered their heads and wept as they went up.
Transliteration: vedavid oleh vemaaleh hazeytiym oleh uvvokheh verosh lvo chafuy vehu holekhe yachef vekhׇl-haam asher-itvo chafu iysh roshvo vealu aloh uvakhoh

Hebrew: וְדָוִד֙ הִגִּ֣יד לֵאמֹ֔ר אֲחִיתֹ֥פֶל בַּקֹּשְׁרִ֖ים עִם־אַבְשָׁל֑וֹם וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֔ד סַכֶּל־נָ֛א אֶת־עֲצַ֥ת אֲחִיתֹ֖פֶל יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: David [was] told that Ahithophel was among the conspirators with Absalom, and he prayed, “Please, O G<small>OD</small>, frustrate Ahithophel’s counsel!”
Transliteration: vedavid higiyd lemor achiytofel vakosheriym im-aveshalvom vayomer david sakhel-na et-atsat achiytofel yehovah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י דָוִד֙ בָּ֣א עַד־הָרֹ֔אשׁ אֲשֶֽׁר־יִשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֥ה שָׁ֖ם לֵאלֹהִ֑ים וְהִנֵּ֤ה לִקְרָאתוֹ֙ חוּשַׁ֣י הָאַרְכִּ֔י קָר֙וּעַ֙ כֻּתׇּנְתּ֔וֹ וַאֲדָמָ֖ה עַל־רֹאשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated: When David reached the top, where people would prostrate themselves to God, Hushai the Archite was there to meet him, with his robe torn and with earth on his head.
Transliteration: vayehiy david va ad-harosh asher-yishetachaveh sham lelohiym vehineh likeratvo chushay haarekhiy karua khutׇnetvo vaadamah al-roshvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֖וֹ דָּוִ֑ד אִ֚ם עָבַ֣רְתָּ אִתִּ֔י וְהָיִ֥תָ עָלַ֖י לְמַשָּֽׂא׃
Translated: David said to him, “If you march on with me, you will be a burden to me.
Transliteration: vayomer lvo david im avareta itiy vehayita alay lemasha

Hebrew: וְאִם־הָעִ֣יר תָּשׁ֗וּב וְאָמַרְתָּ֤ לְאַבְשָׁלוֹם֙ עַבְדְּךָ֨ אֲנִ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֶֽהְיֶ֔ה עֶ֣בֶד אָבִ֤יךָ וַֽאֲנִי֙ מֵאָ֔ז וְעַתָּ֖ה וַאֲנִ֣י עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ וְהֵפַרְתָּ֣ה לִ֔י אֵ֖ת עֲצַ֥ת אֲחִיתֹֽפֶל׃
Translated: But if you go back to the city and say to Absalom, ‘I will be your servant, O king; I was your father’s servant formerly, and now I will be yours,’ then you can nullify Ahithophel’s counsel for me.
Transliteration: veim-haiyr tashuv veamareta leaveshalvom avedekha aniy hamelekhe eheyeh eved aviykha vaaniy meaz veatah vaaniy avedekha vehefaretah liy et atsat achiytofel

Hebrew: וַהֲל֤וֹא עִמְּךָ֙ שָׁ֔ם צָד֥וֹק וְאֶבְיָתָ֖ר הַכֹּהֲנִ֑ים וְהָיָ֗ה כׇּל־הַדָּבָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר תִּשְׁמַע֙ מִבֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ תַּגִּ֕יד לְצָד֥וֹק וּלְאֶבְיָתָ֖ר הַכֹּהֲנִֽים׃
Translated: You will have the priests Zadok and Abiathar there, and you can report everything that you hear in the king’s palace to the priests Zadok and Abiathar.
Transliteration: vahalvo imekha sham tsadvok veeveyatar hakhohaniym vehayah khׇl-hadavar asher tishema miveyt hamelekhe tagiyd letsadvok uleeveyatar hakhohaniym

Hebrew: הִנֵּה־שָׁ֤ם עִמָּם֙ שְׁנֵ֣י בְנֵיהֶ֔ם אֲחִימַ֣עַץ לְצָד֔וֹק וִיהוֹנָתָ֖ן לְאֶבְיָתָ֑ר וּשְׁלַחְתֶּ֤ם בְּיָדָם֙ אֵלַ֔י כׇּל־דָּבָ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּשְׁמָֽעוּ׃
Translated: Also, their two sons are there with them, Zadok’s son Ahimaaz and Abiathar’s son Jonathan; and through them you can report to me everything you hear.”
Transliteration: hineh-sham imam sheney veneyhem achiymaats letsadvok viyhvonatan leeveyatar ushelachetem veyadam elay khׇl-davar asher tishemau

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א חוּשַׁ֛י רֵעֶ֥ה דָוִ֖ד הָעִ֑יר וְאַ֨בְשָׁל֔וֹם יָב֖וֹא יְרֽוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated: And so Hushai, the friend of David, reached the city as Absalom was entering Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayavo chushay reeh david haiyr veaveshalvom yavvo yerushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: וְדָוִ֗ד עָבַ֤ר מְעַט֙ מֵֽהָרֹ֔אשׁ וְהִנֵּ֥ה צִיבָ֛א נַ֥עַר מְפִיבֹ֖שֶׁת לִקְרָאת֑וֹ וְצֶ֨מֶד חֲמֹרִ֜ים חֲבֻשִׁ֗ים וַעֲלֵיהֶם֩ מָאתַ֨יִם לֶ֜חֶם וּמֵאָ֧ה צִמּוּקִ֛ים וּמֵ֥אָה קַ֖יִץ וְנֵ֥בֶל יָֽיִן׃
Translated: David had passed a little beyond the summit when Ziba the servant of Mephibosheth came toward him with a pair of saddled donkeys carrying two hundred loaves of bread, one hundred cakes of raisin, one hundred cakes of figs, and a jar of wine.
Transliteration: vedavid avar meat meharosh vehineh tsiyva naar mefiyvoshet likeratvo vetsemed chamoriym chavushiym vaaleyhem matayiim lechem umeah tsimukiym umeah kayiits venevel yayiin

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ אֶל־צִיבָ֖א מָה־אֵ֣לֶּה לָּ֑ךְ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר צִ֠יבָ֠א הַחֲמוֹרִ֨ים לְבֵית־הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ לִרְכֹּ֗ב (ולהלחם) [וְהַלֶּ֤חֶם] וְהַקַּ֙יִץ֙ לֶאֱכ֣וֹל הַנְּעָרִ֔ים וְהַיַּ֕יִן לִשְׁתּ֥וֹת הַיָּעֵ֖ף בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: The king asked Ziba, “What are you doing with these?” Ziba answered, “The donkeys are for Your Majesty’s family to ride on, the bread and figs are for the attendants to eat, and the wine is to be drunk by any who are exhausted in the wilderness.”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe el-tsiyva mah-eleh lakhe vayomer tsiyva hachamvoriym leveyt-hamelekhe lirekhov (vlhlchm) [vehalechem] vehakayiits leekhvol haneariym vehayayiin lishetvot hayaef vamidevar

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְאַיֵּ֖ה בֶּן־אֲדֹנֶ֑יךָ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר צִיבָ֜א אֶל־הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ הִנֵּה֙ יוֹשֵׁ֣ב בִּירוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם כִּ֣י אָמַ֔ר הַיּ֗וֹם יָשִׁ֤יבוּ לִי֙ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֵ֖ת מַמְלְכ֥וּת אָבִֽי׃
Translated: “And where is your master’s son?” the king asked. “He is staying in Jerusalem,” Ziba replied to the king, “for he thinks that the House of Israel will now give him back the throne of his grandfather.”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe veayeh ven-adoneykha vayomer tsiyva el-hamelekhe hineh yvoshev viyrushala͏im khiy amar hayyvom yashiyvu liy veyt yisherael et mamelekhut aviy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ לְצִבָ֔א הִנֵּ֣ה לְךָ֔ כֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר לִמְפִיבֹ֑שֶׁת וַיֹּ֤אמֶר צִיבָא֙ הִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֵ֔יתִי אֶמְצָא־חֵ֥ן בְּעֵינֶ֖יךָ אֲדֹנִ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: The king said to Ziba, “Then all that belongs to Mephibosheth is now yours!” And Ziba replied, “I bow low. Your Majesty is most gracious to me.”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe letsiva hineh lekha khol asher limefiyvoshet vayomer tsiyva hishetachaveytiy emetsa-chen veeyneykha adoniy hamelekhe

Hebrew: וּבָ֛א הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ דָּוִ֖ד עַד־בַּחוּרִ֑ים וְהִנֵּ֣ה מִשָּׁם֩ אִ֨ישׁ יוֹצֵ֜א מִמִּשְׁפַּ֣חַת בֵּית־שָׁא֗וּל וּשְׁמוֹ֙ שִׁמְעִ֣י בֶן־גֵּרָ֔א יֹצֵ֥א יָצ֖וֹא וּמְקַלֵּֽל׃
Translated: As King David was approaching Bahurim, a member of Saul’s clan—a man named Shimei son of Gera—came out from there, hurling insults as he came.
Transliteration: uva hamelekhe david ad-vachuriym vehineh misham iysh yvotse mimishefachat veyt-shaul ushemvo shimeiy ven-gera yotse yatsvo umekalel

Hebrew: וַיְסַקֵּ֤ל בָּֽאֲבָנִים֙ אֶת־דָּוִ֔ד וְאֶת־כׇּל־עַבְדֵ֖י הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֑ד וְכׇל־הָעָם֙ וְכׇל־הַגִּבֹּרִ֔ים מִימִינ֖וֹ וּמִשְּׂמֹאלֽוֹ׃
Translated: He threw stones at David and all King David’s courtiers, while all the troops and all the warriors were at his right and his left.
Transliteration: vayesakel vaavaniym et-david veet-khׇl-avedey hamelekhe david vekhׇl-haam vekhׇl-hagivoriym miymiynvo umishemolvo

Hebrew: וְכֹה־אָמַ֥ר שִׁמְעִ֖י בְּקַֽלְל֑וֹ צֵ֥א צֵ֛א אִ֥ישׁ הַדָּמִ֖ים וְאִ֥ישׁ הַבְּלִיָּֽעַל׃
Translated: And these are the insults that Shimei hurled: “Get out, get out, you criminal, you villain!
Transliteration: vekhoh-amar shimeiy vekalelvo tse tse iysh hadamiym veiysh haveliyaal

Hebrew: הֵשִׁיב֩ עָלֶ֨יךָ יְהֹוָ֜ה כֹּ֣ל ׀ דְּמֵ֣י בֵית־שָׁא֗וּל אֲשֶׁ֤ר מָלַ֙כְתָּ֙ תַּחְתָּ֔ו וַיִּתֵּ֤ן יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־הַמְּלוּכָ֔ה בְּיַ֖ד אַבְשָׁל֣וֹם בְּנֶ֑ךָ וְהִנְּךָ֙ בְּרָ֣עָתֶ֔ךָ כִּ֛י אִ֥ישׁ דָּמִ֖ים אָֽתָּה׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> is paying you back for all your crimes against the family of Saul, whose throne you seized. G<small>OD</small> is handing over the throne to your son Absalom; you are in trouble because you are a criminal!”
Transliteration: heshiyv aleykha yehovah khol demey veyt-shaul asher malakheta tachetav vayiten yehovah et-hamelukhah veyad aveshalvom venekha vehinekha veraatekha khiy iysh damiym atah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֲבִישַׁ֤י בֶּן־צְרוּיָה֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ לָ֣מָּה יְקַלֵּ֞ל הַכֶּ֤לֶב הַמֵּת֙ הַזֶּ֔ה אֶת־אֲדֹנִ֖י הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ אֶעְבְּרָה־נָּ֖א וְאָסִ֥ירָה אֶת־רֹאשֽׁוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: Abishai son of Zeruiah said to the king, “Why let that dead dog abuse my lord the king? Let me go over and cut off his head!”
Transliteration: vayomer aviyshay ven-tseruyah el-hamelekhe lamah yekalel hakhelev hamet hazeh et-adoniy hamelekhe eeverah-na veasiyrah et-roshvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ מַה־לִּ֥י וְלָכֶ֖ם בְּנֵ֣י צְרֻיָ֑ה (כי) [כֹּ֣ה] יְקַלֵּ֗ל (וכי) [כִּ֤י] יְהֹוָה֙ אָ֤מַר לוֹ֙ קַלֵּ֣ל אֶת־דָּוִ֔ד וּמִ֣י יֹאמַ֔ר מַדּ֖וּעַ עָשִׂ֥יתָה כֵּֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: But the king said, “What has this to do with you, you sons of Zeruiah? He is abusing [me] only because G<small>OD</small> told him to abuse David; and who is to say, ‘Why did You do that?’”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe mah-liy velakhem veney tseruyah (khy) [khoh] yekalel (vkhy) [khiy] yehovah amar lvo kalel et-david umiy yomar madua ashiytah khen {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֤ד אֶל־אֲבִישַׁי֙ וְאֶל־כׇּל־עֲבָדָ֔יו הִנֵּ֥ה בְנִ֛י אֲשֶׁר־יָצָ֥א מִמֵּעַ֖י מְבַקֵּ֣שׁ אֶת־נַפְשִׁ֑י וְאַ֨ף כִּֽי־עַתָּ֜ה בֶּן־הַיְמִינִ֗י הַנִּ֤חוּ לוֹ֙ וִֽיקַלֵּ֔ל כִּ֥י אָמַר־ל֖וֹ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: David said further to Abishai and all the courtiers, “If my son, my own issue, seeks to kill me, how much more the Benjaminite! Let him go on hurling abuse, for G<small>OD</small> has told him to.
Transliteration: vayomer david el-aviyshay veel-khׇl-avadayv hineh veniy asher-yatsa mimeay mevakesh et-nafeshiy veaf khiy-atah ven-hayemiyniy hanichu lvo viykalel khiy amar-lvo yehovah

Hebrew: אוּלַ֛י יִרְאֶ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה (בעוני) [בְּעֵינִ֑י] וְהֵשִׁ֨יב יְהֹוָ֥ה לִי֙ טוֹבָ֔ה תַּ֥חַת קִלְלָת֖וֹ הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Perhaps G<small>OD</small> will look upon my punishment and recompense me for the abuse [Shimei] has uttered today.”
Transliteration: ulay yireeh yehovah (vvny) [veeyniy] veheshiyv yehovah liy tvovah tachat kilelatvo hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֧לֶךְ דָּוִ֛ד וַאֲנָשָׁ֖יו בַּדָּ֑רֶךְ {ס} וְשִׁמְעִ֡י הֹלֵךְ֩ בְּצֵ֨לַע הָהָ֜ר לְעֻמָּת֗וֹ הָלוֹךְ֙ וַיְקַלֵּ֔ל וַיְסַקֵּ֤ל בָּאֲבָנִים֙ לְעֻמָּת֔וֹ וְעִפַּ֖ר בֶּעָפָֽר׃ {פ}
Translated: David and his men continued on their way, while Shimei walked alongside on the slope of the hill, insulting him as he walked, and throwing stones at him and flinging dirt.
Transliteration: vayelekhe david vaanashayv vadarekhe {s} veshimeiy holekhe vetsela hahar leumatvo halvokhe vayekalel vayesakel vaavaniym leumatvo veifar veafar {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ וְכׇל־הָעָ֥ם אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֖וֹ עֲיֵפִ֑ים וַיִּנָּפֵ֖שׁ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: The king and all who accompanied him arrived exhausted, and he rested there.
Transliteration: vayavo hamelekhe vekhׇl-haam asher-itvo aeifiym vayinafesh sham

Hebrew: וְאַבְשָׁל֗וֹם וְכׇל־הָעָם֙ אִ֣ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בָּ֖אוּ יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וַאֲחִיתֹ֖פֶל אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Meanwhile Absalom and all the troops, Israel’s force, arrived in Jerusalem, together with Ahithophel.
Transliteration: veaveshalvom vekhׇl-haam iysh yisherael vau yerushala͏im vaachiytofel itvo

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁר־בָּ֞א חוּשַׁ֧י הָאַרְכִּ֛י רֵעֶ֥ה דָוִ֖ד אֶל־אַבְשָׁל֑וֹם וַיֹּ֤אמֶר חוּשַׁי֙ אֶל־אַבְשָׁל֔וֹם יְחִ֥י הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ יְחִ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: When Hushai the Archite, David’s friend, came before Absalom, Hushai said to Absalom, “Long live the king! Long live the king!”
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher-va chushay haarekhiy reeh david el-aveshalvom vayomer chushay el-aveshalvom yechiy hamelekhe yechiy hamelekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אַבְשָׁלוֹם֙ אֶל־חוּשַׁ֔י זֶ֥ה חַסְדְּךָ֖ אֶת־רֵעֶ֑ךָ לָ֥מָּה לֹא־הָלַ֖כְתָּ אֶת־רֵעֶֽךָ׃
Translated: But Absalom said to Hushai, “Is this your loyalty to your friend? Why didn’t you go with your friend?”
Transliteration: vayomer aveshalvom el-chushay zeh chasedekha et-reekha lamah lo-halakheta et-reekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר חוּשַׁי֮ אֶל־אַבְשָׁלֹם֒ לֹ֕א כִּי֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר בָּחַ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה וְהָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה וְכׇל־אִ֣ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל (לא) [ל֥וֹ] אֶהְיֶ֖ה וְאִתּ֥וֹ אֵשֵֽׁב׃
Translated: “Not at all!” Hushai replied. “I am for the one whom G<small>OD</small> and these troops and all the rest of Israel’s force has chosen, and I will stay with him.
Transliteration: vayomer chushay el-aveshalom lo khiy asher vachar yehovah vehaam hazeh vekhׇl-iysh yisherael (l) [lvo] eheyeh veitvo eshev

Hebrew: וְהַשֵּׁנִ֗ית לְמִי֙ אֲנִ֣י אֶעֱבֹ֔ד הֲל֖וֹא לִפְנֵ֣י בְנ֑וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר עָבַ֙דְתִּי֙ לִפְנֵ֣י אָבִ֔יךָ כֵּ֖ן אֶהְיֶ֥ה לְפָנֶֽיךָ׃ {פ}
Translated: Furthermore, whom should I serve, if not David’s son? As I was in your father’s service, so I will be in yours.”
Transliteration: vehasheniyt lemiy aniy eevod halvo lifeney venvo khaasher avadetiy lifeney aviykha khen eheyeh lefaneykha {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אַבְשָׁל֖וֹם אֶל־אֲחִיתֹ֑פֶל הָב֥וּ לָכֶ֛ם עֵצָ֖ה מַֽה־נַּעֲשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: Absalom then said to Ahithophel, “What do you advise us to do?”
Transliteration: vayomer aveshalvom el-achiytofel havu lakhem etsah mah-naasheh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲחִיתֹ֙פֶל֙ אֶל־אַבְשָׁלֹ֔ם בּ֚וֹא אֶל־פִּֽלַגְשֵׁ֣י אָבִ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִנִּ֖יחַ לִשְׁמ֣וֹר הַבָּ֑יִת וְשָׁמַ֤ע כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ כִּֽי־נִבְאַ֣שְׁתָּ אֶת־אָבִ֔יךָ וְחָ֣זְק֔וּ יְדֵ֖י כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתָּֽךְ׃
Translated: And Ahithophel said to Absalom, “Have intercourse with your father’s concubines, whom he left to mind the palace; and when all Israel hears that you have dared the wrath of your father, all who support you will be encouraged.”
Transliteration: vayomer achiytofel el-aveshalom vvo el-filageshey aviykha asher hiniycha lishemvor havayiit veshama khׇl-yisherael khiy-niveasheta et-aviykha vechazeku yedey khׇl-asher itakhe

Hebrew: וַיַּטּ֧וּ לְאַבְשָׁל֛וֹם הָאֹ֖הֶל עַל־הַגָּ֑ג וַיָּבֹ֤א אַבְשָׁלוֹם֙ אֶל־פִּֽלַגְשֵׁ֣י אָבִ֔יו לְעֵינֵ֖י כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: So they pitched a tent for Absalom on the roof, and Absalom lay with his father’s concubines with the full knowledge of all Israel.—
Transliteration: vayatu leaveshalvom haohel al-hagag vayavo aveshalvom el-filageshey aviyv leeyney khׇl-yisherael

Hebrew: וַעֲצַ֣ת אֲחִיתֹ֗פֶל אֲשֶׁ֤ר יָעַץ֙ בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר יִשְׁאַל־[אִ֖ישׁ] בִּדְבַ֣ר הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים כֵּ֚ן כׇּל־עֲצַ֣ת אֲחִיתֹ֔פֶל גַּם־לְדָוִ֖ד גַּ֥ם לְאַבְשָׁלֹֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: In those days, the advice that Ahithophel gave was accepted like an oracle sought from God; that is how all the advice of Ahithophel was esteemed both by David and by Absalom.
Transliteration: vaatsat achiytofel asher yaats vayamiym hahem khaasher yisheal-[iysh] videvar haElohim khen khׇl-atsat achiytofel gam-ledavid gam leaveshalom {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲחִיתֹ֖פֶל אֶל־אַבְשָׁל֑וֹם אֶבְחֲרָ֣ה נָּ֗א שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֥ר אֶ֙לֶף֙ אִ֔ישׁ וְאָק֛וּמָה וְאֶרְדְּפָ֥ה אַֽחֲרֵי־דָוִ֖ד הַלָּֽיְלָה׃
Translated: And Ahithophel said to Absalom, “Let me pick twelve thousand men and set out tonight in pursuit of David.
Transliteration: vayomer achiytofel el-aveshalvom evecharah na sheneym-ashar elef iysh veakumah veeredefah acharey-david halayelah

Hebrew: וְאָב֣וֹא עָלָ֗יו וְה֤וּא יָגֵ֙עַ֙ וּרְפֵ֣ה יָדַ֔יִם וְהַחֲרַדְתִּ֣י אֹת֔וֹ וְנָ֖ס כׇּל־הָעָ֣ם אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֑וֹ וְהִכֵּיתִ֥י אֶת־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ לְבַדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: I will come upon him when he is weary and disheartened, and I will throw him into a panic; and when all the troops with him flee, I will kill the king alone.
Transliteration: veavvo alayv vehu yagea urefeh yadayiim vehacharadetiy otvo venas khׇl-haam asher-itvo vehikheytiy et-hamelekhe levadvo

Hebrew: וְאָשִׁ֥יבָה כׇל־הָעָ֖ם אֵלֶ֑יךָ כְּשׁ֣וּב הַכֹּ֔ל הָאִישׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אַתָּ֣ה מְבַקֵּ֔שׁ כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם יִהְיֶ֥ה שָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: And I will bring back all the people to you; when all have come back [except] the man you are after, all the people will be at peace.”
Transliteration: veashiyvah khׇl-haam eleykha kheshuv hakhol haiysh asher atah mevakesh khׇl-haam yiheyeh shalvom

Hebrew: וַיִּישַׁ֥ר הַדָּבָ֖ר בְּעֵינֵ֣י אַבְשָׁלֹ֑ם וּבְעֵינֵ֖י כׇּל־זִקְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: The advice pleased Absalom and all the elders of Israel.
Transliteration: vayiyshar hadavar veeyney aveshalom uveeyney khׇl-zikeney yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אַבְשָׁל֔וֹם קְרָ֣א נָ֔א גַּ֖ם לְחוּשַׁ֣י הָאַרְכִּ֑י וְנִשְׁמְעָ֥ה מַה־בְּפִ֖יו גַּם־הֽוּא׃
Translated: But Absalom said, “Summon Hushai the Archite as well, so we can hear what he too has to say.”
Transliteration: vayomer aveshalvom kera na gam lechushay haarekhiy venishemeah mah-vefiyv gam-hu

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א חוּשַׁי֮ אֶל־אַבְשָׁלוֹם֒ וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ אַבְשָׁל֨וֹם אֵלָ֜יו לֵאמֹ֗ר כַּדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ דִּבֶּ֣ר אֲחִיתֹ֔פֶל הֲנַעֲשֶׂ֖ה אֶת־דְּבָר֑וֹ אִם־אַ֖יִן אַתָּ֥ה דַבֵּֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: Hushai came to Absalom, and Absalom said to him, “This is what Ahithophel has advised. Shall we follow his advice? If not, what do you say?”
Transliteration: vayavo chushay el-aveshalvom vayomer aveshalvom elayv lemor khadavar hazeh diver achiytofel hanaasheh et-devarvo im-ayiin atah daver {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר חוּשַׁ֖י אֶל־אַבְשָׁל֑וֹם לֹֽא־טוֹבָ֧ה הָעֵצָ֛ה אֲשֶׁר־יָעַ֥ץ אֲחִיתֹ֖פֶל בַּפַּ֥עַם הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: Hushai said to Absalom, “This time the advice that Ahithophel has given is not good.
Transliteration: vayomer chushay el-aveshalvom lo-tvovah haetsah asher-yaats achiytofel vafaam hazot

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר חוּשַׁ֗י אַתָּ֣ה יָ֠דַ֠עְתָּ אֶת־אָבִ֨יךָ וְאֶת־אֲנָשָׁ֜יו כִּ֧י גִבֹּרִ֣ים הֵ֗מָּה וּמָרֵ֥י נֶ֙פֶשׁ֙ הֵ֔מָּה כְּדֹ֥ב שַׁכּ֖וּל בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה וְאָבִ֙יךָ֙ אִ֣ישׁ מִלְחָמָ֔ה וְלֹ֥א יָלִ֖ין אֶת־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: You know,” Hushai continued, “that your father and his men are courageous fighters, and they are as desperate as a bear in the wild robbed of her whelps. Your father is an experienced soldier, and he will not spend the night with the troops;
Transliteration: vayomer chushay atah yadaeta et-aviykha veet-anashayv khiy givoriym hemah umarey nefesh hemah khedov shakhul vashadeh veaviykha iysh milechamah velo yaliyn et-haam

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֨ה עַתָּ֤ה הֽוּא־נֶחְבָּא֙ בְּאַחַ֣ת הַפְּחָתִ֔ים א֖וֹ בְּאַחַ֣ד הַמְּקוֹמֹ֑ת וְהָיָ֗ה כִּנְפֹ֤ל בָּהֶם֙ בַּתְּחִלָּ֔ה וְשָׁמַ֤ע הַשֹּׁמֵ֙עַ֙ וְאָמַ֔ר הָֽיְתָה֙ מַגֵּפָ֔ה בָּעָ֕ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר אַחֲרֵ֥י אַבְשָׁלֹֽם׃
Translated: even now he must be hiding in one of the pits or in some other place. And if any of them fall at the first attack, whoever hears of it will say, ‘A disaster has struck the troops that follow Absalom’;
Transliteration: hineh atah hu-necheva veachat hafechatiym vo veachad hamekvomot vehayah khinefol vahem vatechilah veshama hashomea veamar hayetah magefah vaam asher acharey aveshalom

Hebrew: וְה֣וּא גַם־בֶּן־חַ֗יִל אֲשֶׁ֥ר לִבּ֛וֹ כְּלֵ֥ב הָאַרְיֵ֖ה הִמֵּ֣ס יִמָּ֑ס כִּֽי־יֹדֵ֤עַ כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ כִּי־גִבּ֣וֹר אָבִ֔יךָ וּבְנֵי־חַ֖יִל אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: and even if he is a warrior with the heart of a lion, he will be shaken—for all Israel knows that your father and the soldiers with him are courageous fighters.
Transliteration: vehu gam-ven-chayiil asher livvo khelev haareeih himes yimas khiy-yodea khׇl-yisherael khiy-givvor aviykha uveney-chayiil asher itvo

Hebrew: כִּ֣י יָעַ֗צְתִּי הֵ֠אָסֹ֠ף יֵאָסֵ֨ף עָלֶ֤יךָ כׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִדָּן֙ וְעַד־בְּאֵ֣ר שֶׁ֔בַע כַּח֥וֹל אֲשֶׁר־עַל־הַיָּ֖ם לָרֹ֑ב וּפָנֶ֥יךָ הֹלְכִ֖ים בַּקְרָֽב׃
Translated: So I advise that all Israel from Dan to Beer-sheba—as numerous as the sands of the sea—be called up to join you, and that you yourself march into battle.
Transliteration: khiy yaatsetiy heasof eiasef aleykha khׇl-yisherael midan vead-veer sheva khachvol asher-al-hayam larov ufaneykha holekhiym vakerav

Hebrew: וּבָ֣אנוּ אֵלָ֗יו (באחת) [בְּאַחַ֤ד] הַמְּקוֹמֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִמְצָ֣א שָׁ֔ם וְנַ֣חְנוּ עָלָ֔יו כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר יִפֹּ֥ל הַטַּ֖ל עַל־הָאֲדָמָ֑ה וְלֹא־נ֥וֹתַר בּ֛וֹ וּבְכׇל־הָאֲנָשִׁ֥ים אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֖וֹ גַּם־אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: When we come upon him in whatever place he may be, we’ll descend on him [as thick] as dew falling on the ground; and no one will survive, neither he nor any of the men with him.
Transliteration: uvanu elayv (vcht) [veachad] hamekvomot asher nimetsa sham venachenu alayv khaasher yifol hatal al-haadamah velo-nvotar vvo uvekhׇl-haanashiym asher-itvo gam-echad

Hebrew: וְאִם־אֶל־עִיר֙ יֵאָסֵ֔ף וְהִשִּׂ֧יאוּ כׇֽל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶל־הָעִ֥יר הַהִ֖יא חֲבָלִ֑ים וְסָחַ֤בְנוּ אֹתוֹ֙ עַד־הַנַּ֔חַל עַ֛ד אֲשֶֽׁר־לֹֽא־נִמְצָ֥א שָׁ֖ם גַּם־צְרֽוֹר׃ {פ}
Translated: And if he withdraws into a city, all Israel will bring ropes to that city and drag its stones as far as the riverbed, until not even a pebble of it is left.”
Transliteration: veim-el-iyr eiasef vehishiyu khׇl-yisherael el-haiyr hahiy chavaliym vesachavenu otvo ad-hanachal ad asher-lo-nimetsa sham gam-tservor {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אַבְשָׁלוֹם֙ וְכׇל־אִ֣ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל טוֹבָ֗ה עֲצַת֙ חוּשַׁ֣י הָאַרְכִּ֔י מֵעֲצַ֖ת אֲחִיתֹ֑פֶל {ס} וַיהֹוָ֣ה צִוָּ֗ה לְהָפֵ֞ר אֶת־עֲצַ֤ת אֲחִיתֹ֙פֶל֙ הַטּוֹבָ֔ה לְבַעֲב֗וּר הָבִ֧יא יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־אַבְשָׁל֖וֹם אֶת־הָרָעָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Absalom and all of Israel’s force agreed that the advice of Hushai the Archite was better than that of Ahithophel.—G<small>OD</small> had decreed that Ahithophel’s sound advice be nullified, in order that G<small>OD</small> might bring ruin upon Absalom.
Transliteration: vayomer aveshalvom vekhׇl-iysh yisherael tvovah atsat chushay haarekhiy meatsat achiytofel {s} vayhovah tsivah lehafer et-atsat achiytofel hatvovah levaavur haviy yehovah el-aveshalvom et-haraah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר חוּשַׁ֗י אֶל־צָד֤וֹק וְאֶל־אֶבְיָתָר֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים כָּזֹ֣את וְכָזֹ֗את יָעַ֤ץ אֲחִיתֹ֙פֶל֙ אֶת־אַבְשָׁלֹ֔ם וְאֵ֖ת זִקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְכָזֹ֥את וְכָזֹ֖את יָעַ֥צְתִּי אָֽנִי׃
Translated: Then Hushai told the priests Zadok and Abiathar, “This is what Ahithophel advised Absalom and the elders of Israel; this is what I advised.
Transliteration: vayomer chushay el-tsadvok veel-eveyatar hakhohaniym khazot vekhazot yaats achiytofel et-aveshalom veet zikeney yisherael vekhazot vekhazot yaatsetiy aniy

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֡ה שִׁלְח֣וּ מְהֵרָה֩ וְהַגִּ֨ידוּ לְדָוִ֜ד לֵאמֹ֗ר אַל־תָּ֤לֶן הַלַּ֙יְלָה֙ בְּעַֽרְב֣וֹת הַמִּדְבָּ֔ר וְגַ֖ם עָב֣וֹר תַּעֲב֑וֹר פֶּ֚ן יְבֻלַּ֣ע לַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וּלְכׇל־הָעָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Now send at once and tell David, ‘Do not spend the night at the fords of the wilderness, but cross over at once; otherwise the king and all the troops with him will be annihilated.’”
Transliteration: veatah shilechu meherah vehagiydu ledavid lemor al-talen halayelah vearevvot hamidevar vegam avvor taavvor fen yevula lamelekhe ulekhׇl-haam asher itvo

Hebrew: וִיהוֹנָתָ֨ן וַאֲחִימַ֜עַץ עֹמְדִ֣ים בְּעֵין־רֹגֵ֗ל וְהָלְכָ֤ה הַשִּׁפְחָה֙ וְהִגִּ֣ידָה לָהֶ֔ם וְהֵם֙ יֵֽלְכ֔וּ וְהִגִּ֖ידוּ לַמֶּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֑ד כִּ֣י לֹ֥א יוּכְל֛וּ לְהֵרָא֖וֹת לָב֥וֹא הָעִֽירָה׃
Translated: Jonathan and Ahimaaz were staying at En-rogel, and a maidservant would go and bring them word and they in turn would go and inform King David. For they themselves dared not be seen entering the city.
Transliteration: viyhvonatan vaachiymaats omediym veeyn-rogel vehalekhah hashifechah vehigiydah lahem vehem eilekhu vehigiydu lamelekhe david khiy lo yukhelu leheravot lavvo haiyrah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤רְא אֹתָם֙ נַ֔עַר וַיַּגֵּ֖ד לְאַבְשָׁלֹ֑ם וַיֵּלְכוּ֩ שְׁנֵיהֶ֨ם מְהֵרָ֜ה וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ ׀ אֶל־בֵּֽית־אִ֣ישׁ בְּבַחוּרִ֗ים וְל֥וֹ בְאֵ֛ר בַּחֲצֵר֖וֹ וַיֵּ֥רְדוּ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: But a boy saw them and informed Absalom. They left at once and came to the house of a man in Bahurim who had a well in his courtyard. They got down into it,
Transliteration: vayare otam naar vayaged leaveshalom vayelekhu sheneyhem meherah vayavou el-veyt-iysh vevachuriym velvo veer vachatservo vayeredu sham

Hebrew: וַתִּקַּ֣ח הָאִשָּׁ֗ה וַתִּפְרֹ֤שׂ אֶת־הַמָּסָךְ֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הַבְּאֵ֔ר וַתִּשְׁטַ֥ח עָלָ֖יו הָרִפ֑וֹת וְלֹ֥א נוֹדַ֖ע דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: and the wife took a cloth, spread it over the mouth of the well, and scattered groats on top of it, so that nothing would be noticed.
Transliteration: vatikach haishah vatiferosh et-hamasakhe al-feney haveer vatishetach alayv harifvot velo nvoda davar

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ עַבְדֵי֩ אַבְשָׁל֨וֹם אֶֽל־הָאִשָּׁ֜ה הַבַּ֗יְתָה וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ אַיֵּ֗ה אֲחִימַ֙עַץ֙ וִיה֣וֹנָתָ֔ן וַתֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ הָאִשָּׁ֔ה עָבְר֖וּ מִיכַ֣ל הַמָּ֑יִם וַיְבַקְשׁוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א מָצָ֔אוּ וַיָּשֻׁ֖בוּ יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {ס}
Translated: When Absalom’s servants came to the woman at the house and asked where Ahimaaz and Jonathan were, the woman told them that they had crossed a bit beyond the water. They searched, but found nothing; and they returned to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayavou avedey aveshalvom el-haishah havayetah vayomeru ayeh achiymaats viyhvonatan vatomer lahem haishah averu miykhal hamayiim vayevakeshu velo matsau vayashuvu yerushala͏im {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ אַחֲרֵ֣י לֶכְתָּ֗ם וַֽיַּעֲלוּ֙ מֵֽהַבְּאֵ֔ר וַיֵּ֣לְכ֔וּ וַיַּגִּ֖דוּ לַמֶּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֑ד וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֶל־דָּוִ֗ד ק֣וּמוּ וְעִבְר֤וּ מְהֵרָה֙ אֶת־הַמַּ֔יִם כִּי־כָ֛כָה יָעַ֥ץ עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם אֲחִיתֹֽפֶל׃
Translated: After they were gone, [Ahimaaz and Jonathan] came up from the well and went and informed King David. They said to David, “Go and cross the water quickly, for Ahithophel has advised thus and thus concerning you.”
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey lekhetam vayaalu mehaveer vayelekhu vayagidu lamelekhe david vayomeru el-david kumu veiveru meherah et-hamayiim khiy-khakhah yaats aleykhem achiytofel

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם דָּוִ֗ד וְכׇל־הָעָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֔וֹ וַיַּעַבְר֖וּ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן עַד־א֣וֹר הַבֹּ֗קֶר עַד־אַחַד֙ לֹ֣א נֶעְדָּ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־עָבַ֖ר אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: David and all the troops with him promptly crossed the Jordan, and by daybreak not one was left who had not crossed the Jordan.
Transliteration: vayakׇm david vekhׇl-haam asher itvo vayaaveru et-hayareden ad-vor havoker ad-achad lo needar asher lo-avar et-hayareden

Hebrew: וַאֲחִיתֹ֣פֶל רָאָ֗ה כִּ֣י לֹ֣א נֶעֶשְׂתָה֮ עֲצָתוֹ֒ וַיַּחֲבֹ֣שׁ אֶֽת־הַחֲמ֗וֹר וַיָּ֜קׇם וַיֵּ֤לֶךְ אֶל־בֵּיתוֹ֙ אֶל־עִיר֔וֹ וַיְצַ֥ו אֶל־בֵּית֖וֹ וַיֵּחָנַ֑ק וַיָּ֕מׇת וַיִּקָּבֵ֖ר בְּקֶ֥בֶר אָבִֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated: When Ahithophel saw that his advice had not been followed, he saddled his donkey and went home to his native town. He set his affairs in order, and then he hanged himself. He was buried in his ancestral tomb.
Transliteration: vaachiytofel raah khiy lo neeshetah atsatvo vayachavosh et-hachamvor vayakׇm vayelekhe el-veytvo el-iyrvo vayetsav el-veytvo vayechanak vayamׇt vayikaver vekever aviyv {s}

Hebrew: וְדָוִ֖ד בָּ֣א מַחֲנָ֑יְמָה וְאַבְשָׁלֹ֗ם עָבַר֙ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן ה֕וּא וְכׇל־אִ֥ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: David had reached Mahanaim when Absalom, and Israel’s entire force with him, crossed the Jordan.
Transliteration: vedavid va machanayemah veaveshalom avar et-hayareden hu vekhׇl-iysh yisherael imvo

Hebrew: וְאֶת־עֲמָשָׂ֗א שָׂ֧ם אַבְשָׁלֹ֛ם תַּ֥חַת יוֹאָ֖ב עַל־הַצָּבָ֑א וַעֲמָשָׂ֣א בֶן־אִ֗ישׁ וּשְׁמוֹ֙ יִתְרָ֣א הַיִּשְׂרְאֵלִ֔י אֲשֶׁר־בָּא֙ אֶל־אֲבִיגַ֣ל בַּת־נָחָ֔שׁ אֲח֥וֹת צְרוּיָ֖ה אֵ֥ם יוֹאָֽב׃
Translated: Absalom had appointed Amasa army commander in place of Joab; Amasa was the son of a man named Ithra the Israelite, who had married Abigal, daughter of Nahash and sister of Joab’s mother Zeruiah.
Transliteration: veet-amasha sham aveshalom tachat yvoav al-hatsava vaamasha ven-iysh ushemvo yitera hayishereeliy asher-va el-aviygal vat-nachash achvot tseruyah em yvoav

Hebrew: וַיִּ֤חַן יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְאַבְשָׁלֹ֔ם אֶ֖רֶץ הַגִּלְעָֽד׃ {ס}
Translated: The Israelites and Absalom encamped in the district of Gilead.
Transliteration: vayichan yisherael veaveshalom erets hagilead {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כְּב֥וֹא דָוִ֖ד מַחֲנָ֑יְמָה וְשֹׁבִ֨י בֶן־נָחָ֜שׁ מֵרַבַּ֣ת בְּנֵי־עַמּ֗וֹן וּמָכִ֤יר בֶּן־עַמִּיאֵל֙ מִלֹּ֣א דְבָ֔ר וּבַרְזִלַּ֥י הַגִּלְעָדִ֖י מֵרֹגְלִֽים׃
Translated: When David reached Mahanaim, Shobi son of Nahash from Rabbath-ammon, Machir son of Ammiel from Lo-debar, and Barzillai the Gileadite from Rogelim
Transliteration: vayehiy khevvo david machanayemah veshoviy ven-nachash meravat veney-amvon umakhiyr ven-amiyel milo devar uvarezilay hagileadiy merogeliym

Hebrew: מִשְׁכָּ֤ב וְסַפּוֹת֙ וּכְלִ֣י יוֹצֵ֔ר וְחִטִּ֥ים וּשְׂעֹרִ֖ים וְקֶ֣מַח וְקָלִ֑י וּפ֥וֹל וַעֲדָשִׁ֖ים וְקָלִֽי׃
Translated: presented couches, basins, and earthenware; also wheat, barley, flour, parched grain, beans, lentils, parched grain,
Transliteration: mishekhav vesafvot ukheliy yvotser vechitiym usheoriym vekemach vekaliy ufvol vaadashiym vekaliy

Hebrew: וּדְבַ֣שׁ וְחֶמְאָ֗ה וְצֹאן֙ וּשְׁפ֣וֹת בָּקָ֔ר הִגִּ֧ישׁוּ לְדָוִ֛ד וְלָעָ֥ם אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֖וֹ לֶאֱכ֑וֹל כִּ֣י אָמְר֔וּ הָעָ֗ם רָעֵ֛ב וְעָיֵ֥ף וְצָמֵ֖א בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: honey, curds, a flock, and cheese from the herd for David and the troops with him to eat. For they knew that the troops must have grown hungry, faint, and thirsty in the wilderness.
Transliteration: udevash vechemeah vetson ushefvot vakar higiyshu ledavid velaam asher-itvo leekhvol khiy ameru haam raev veaeif vetsame vamidevar {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּפְקֹ֣ד דָּוִ֔ד אֶת־הָעָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֑וֹ וַיָּ֣שֶׂם עֲלֵיהֶ֔ם שָׂרֵ֥י אֲלָפִ֖ים וְשָׂרֵ֥י מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: David mustered the troops who were with him and set over them captains of thousands and captains of hundreds.
Transliteration: vayifekod david et-haam asher itvo vayashem aleyhem sharey alafiym vesharey mevot

Hebrew: וַיְשַׁלַּ֨ח דָּוִ֜ד אֶת־הָעָ֗ם הַשְּׁלִשִׁ֤ית בְּיַד־יוֹאָב֙ וְ֠הַשְּׁלִשִׁ֠ית בְּיַ֨ד אֲבִישַׁ֤י בֶּן־צְרוּיָה֙ אֲחִ֣י יוֹאָ֔ב וְהַ֨שְּׁלִשִׁ֔ת בְּיַ֖ד אִתַּ֣י הַגִּתִּ֑י {ס} וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם יָצֹ֥א אֵצֵ֛א גַּם־אֲנִ֖י עִמָּכֶֽם׃
Translated: David sent out the troops, one-third under the command of Joab, one-third under the command of Joab’s brother Abishai son of Zeruiah, and one-third under the command of Ittai the Gittite. And David said to the troops, “I myself will march out with you.”
Transliteration: vayeshalach david et-haam hashelishiyt veyad-yvoav vehashelishiyt veyad aviyshay ven-tseruyah achiy yvoav vehashelishit veyad itay hagitiy {s} vayomer hamelekhe el-haam yatso etse gam-aniy imakhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הָעָ֜ם לֹ֣א תֵצֵ֗א כִּי֩ אִם־נֹ֨ס נָנ֜וּס לֹֽא־יָשִׂ֧ימוּ אֵלֵ֣ינוּ לֵ֗ב וְאִם־יָמֻ֤תוּ חֶצְיֵ֙נוּ֙ לֹא־יָשִׂ֤ימוּ אֵלֵ֙ינוּ֙ לֵ֔ב כִּֽי־עַתָּ֥ה כָמֹ֖נוּ עֲשָׂרָ֣ה אֲלָפִ֑ים וְעַתָּ֣ה ט֔וֹב כִּֽי־תִֽהְיֶה־לָּ֥נוּ מֵעִ֖יר (לעזיר) [לַעְזֽוֹר]׃ {ס}
Translated: But the troops replied, “No! For if some of us flee, the rest will not be concerned about us; even if half of us should die, the others will not be concerned about us. But you are worth ten thousand of us. Therefore, it is better for you to support us from the town.”
Transliteration: vayomer haam lo tetse khiy im-nos nanus lo-yashiymu eleynu lev veim-yamutu chetseeinu lo-yashiymu eleynu lev khiy-atah khamonu asharah alafiym veatah tvov khiy-tiheyeh-lanu meiyr (lzyr) [laezvor] {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם֙ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אֲשֶׁר־יִיטַ֥ב בְּעֵינֵיכֶ֖ם אֶעֱשֶׂ֑ה וַיַּעֲמֹ֤ד הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֶל־יַ֣ד הַשַּׁ֔עַר וְכׇל־הָעָם֙ יָֽצְא֔וּ לְמֵא֖וֹת וְלַאֲלָפִֽים׃
Translated:
And the king said to them, “I will do whatever you think best.”
So the king stood beside the gate as all the troops marched out by their hundreds and thousands.
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem hamelekhe asher-yiytav veeyneykhem eesheh vayaamod hamelekhe el-yad hashaar vekhׇl-haam yatseu lemevot velaalafiym

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו הַמֶּ֡לֶךְ אֶת־י֠וֹאָ֠ב וְאֶת־אֲבִישַׁ֤י וְאֶת־אִתַּי֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לְאַט־לִ֖י לַנַּ֣עַר לְאַבְשָׁל֑וֹם וְכׇל־הָעָ֣ם שָׁמְע֗וּ בְּצַוֺּ֥ת הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ אֶת־כׇּל־הַשָּׂרִ֖ים עַל־דְּבַ֥ר אַבְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: The king gave orders to Joab, Abishai, and Ittai: “Deal gently with my boy Absalom, for my sake.” All the troops heard the king give the order about Absalom to all the officers.
Transliteration: vayetsav hamelekhe et-yvoav veet-aviyshay veet-itay lemor leat-liy lanaar leaveshalvom vekhׇl-haam shameu vetsavot hamelekhe et-khׇl-hashariym al-devar aveshalvom

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֥א הָעָ֛ם הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה לִקְרַ֣את יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַתְּהִ֥י הַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה בְּיַ֥עַר אֶפְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: The troops marched out into the open to confront the Israelites, and the battle was fought in the forest of Ephraim.
Transliteration: vayetse haam hashadeh likerat yisherael vatehiy hamilechamah veyaar eferayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּנָּ֤גְפוּ שָׁם֙ עַ֣ם יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לִפְנֵ֖י עַבְדֵ֣י דָוִ֑ד וַתְּהִי־שָׁ֞ם הַמַּגֵּפָ֧ה גְדוֹלָ֛ה בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא עֶשְׂרִ֥ים אָֽלֶף׃
Translated: The Israelite troops were routed by David’s followers, and a great slaughter took place there that day—twenty thousand men.
Transliteration: vayinagefu sham am yisherael lifeney avedey david vatehiy-sham hamagefah gedvolah vayyvom hahu esheriym alef

Hebrew: וַתְּהִי־שָׁ֧ם הַמִּלְחָמָ֛ה (נפצות) [נָפ֖וֹצֶת] עַל־פְּנֵ֣י כׇל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיֶּ֤רֶב הַיַּ֙עַר֙ לֶאֱכֹ֣ל בָּעָ֔ם מֵאֲשֶׁ֥ר אָכְלָ֛ה הַחֶ֖רֶב בַּיּ֥וֹם הַהֽוּא׃
Translated: The battle spread out over that whole region, and the forest devoured more troops that day than the sword.
Transliteration: vatehiy-sham hamilechamah (nftsvt) [nafvotset] al-feney khׇl-haarets vayerev hayaar leekhol vaam measher akhelah hacherev vayyvom hahu

Hebrew: וַיִּקָּרֵא֙ אַבְשָׁל֔וֹם לִפְנֵ֖י עַבְדֵ֣י דָוִ֑ד וְאַבְשָׁל֞וֹם רֹכֵ֣ב עַל־הַפֶּ֗רֶד וַיָּבֹ֣א הַפֶּ֡רֶד תַּ֣חַת שׂ֩וֹבֶךְ֩ הָאֵלָ֨ה הַגְּדוֹלָ֜ה וַיֶּחֱזַ֧ק רֹאשׁ֣וֹ בָאֵלָ֗ה וַיֻּתַּן֙ בֵּ֤ין הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ וּבֵ֣ין הָאָ֔רֶץ וְהַפֶּ֥רֶד אֲשֶׁר־תַּחְתָּ֖יו עָבָֽר׃
Translated: Absalom encountered some of David’s followers. Absalom was riding on a mule, and as the mule passed under the tangled branches of a great terebinth, his hair got caught in the terebinth; he was held between heaven and earth as the mule under him kept going.
Transliteration: vayikare aveshalvom lifeney avedey david veaveshalvom rokhev al-hafered vayavo hafered tachat shvovekhe haelah hagedvolah vayechezak roshvo vaelah vayutan veyn hashamayiim uveyn haarets vehafered asher-tachetayv avar

Hebrew: וַיַּרְא֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֶחָ֔ד וַיַּגֵּ֖ד לְיוֹאָ֑ב וַיֹּ֗אמֶר הִנֵּה֙ רָאִ֣יתִי אֶת־אַבְשָׁלֹ֔ם תָּל֖וּי בָּאֵלָֽה׃
Translated: One of the men saw it and told Joab, “I have just seen Absalom hanging from a terebinth.”
Transliteration: vayare iysh echad vayaged leyvoav vayomer hineh raiytiy et-aveshalom taluy vaelah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יוֹאָ֗ב לָאִישׁ֙ הַמַּגִּ֣יד ל֔וֹ וְהִנֵּ֣ה רָאִ֔יתָ וּמַדּ֛וּעַ לֹא־הִכִּית֥וֹ שָׁ֖ם אָ֑רְצָה וְעָלַ֗י לָ֤תֶת לְךָ֙ עֲשָׂ֣רָה כֶ֔סֶף וַחֲגֹרָ֖ה אֶחָֽת׃
Translated: Joab said to the one who told him, “You saw it! Why didn’t you kill him then and there? I would have owed you ten shekels of silver and a belt.”
Transliteration: vayomer yvoav laiysh hamagiyd lvo vehineh raiyta umadua lo-hikhiytvo sham aretsah vealay latet lekha asharah khesef vachagorah echat

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הָאִישׁ֙ אֶל־יוֹאָ֔ב (ולא) [וְל֨וּ] אָנֹכִ֜י שֹׁקֵ֤ל עַל־כַּפַּי֙ אֶ֣לֶף כֶּ֔סֶף לֹא־אֶשְׁלַ֥ח יָדִ֖י אֶל־בֶּן־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ כִּ֣י בְאׇזְנֵ֜ינוּ צִוָּ֣ה הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ אֹ֠תְךָ֠ וְאֶת־אֲבִישַׁ֤י וְאֶת־אִתַּי֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר שִׁמְרוּ־מִ֕י בַּנַּ֖עַר בְּאַבְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: But the man answered Joab, “Even if I had a thousand shekels of silver in my hands, I would not raise a hand against the king’s son. For the king charged you and Abishai and Ittai in our hearing, ‘Watch over my boy Absalom, for my sake.’
Transliteration: vayomer haiysh el-yvoav (vl) [velu] anokhiy shokel al-khafay elef khesef lo-eshelach yadiy el-ven-hamelekhe khiy veׇzeneynu tsivah hamelekhe otekha veet-aviyshay veet-itay lemor shimeru-miy vanaar veaveshalvom

Hebrew: אֽוֹ־עָשִׂ֤יתִי (בנפשו) [בְנַפְשִׁי֙] שֶׁ֔קֶר וְכׇל־דָּבָ֖ר לֹא־יִכָּחֵ֣ד מִן־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וְאַתָּ֖ה תִּתְיַצֵּ֥ב מִנֶּֽגֶד׃
Translated: If I betrayed myself—and nothing is hidden from the king—you would have stood aloof.”
Transliteration: vo-ashiytiy (vnfshv) [venafeshiy] sheker vekhׇl-davar lo-yikhached min-hamelekhe veatah titeyatsev mineged

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יוֹאָ֔ב לֹא־כֵ֖ן אֹחִ֣ילָה לְפָנֶ֑יךָ וַיִּקַּח֩ שְׁלֹשָׁ֨ה שְׁבָטִ֜ים בְּכַפּ֗וֹ וַיִּתְקָעֵם֙ בְּלֵ֣ב אַבְשָׁל֔וֹם עוֹדֶ֥נּוּ חַ֖י בְּלֵ֥ב הָאֵלָֽה׃
Translated: Joab replied, “Then I will not wait for you.” He took three darts in his hand and drove them into Absalom’s chest. [Absalom] was still alive in the thick growth of the terebinth,
Transliteration: vayomer yvoav lo-khen ochiylah lefaneykha vayikach sheloshah shevatiym vekhafvo vayitekaem velev aveshalvom vodenu chay velev haelah

Hebrew: וַיָּסֹ֙בּוּ֙ עֲשָׂרָ֣ה נְעָרִ֔ים נֹשְׂאֵ֖י כְּלֵ֣י יוֹאָ֑ב וַיַּכּ֥וּ אֶת־אַבְשָׁל֖וֹם וַיְמִתֻֽהוּ׃
Translated: when ten of Joab’s young arms-bearers closed in and struck at Absalom until he died.
Transliteration: vayasovu asharah neariym nosheey kheley yvoav vayakhu et-aveshalvom vayemituhu

Hebrew: וַיִּתְקַ֤ע יוֹאָב֙ בַּשֹּׁפָ֔ר וַיָּ֣שׇׁב הָעָ֔ם מִרְדֹ֖ף אַחֲרֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּֽי־חָשַׂ֥ךְ יוֹאָ֖ב אֶת־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: Then Joab sounded the horn, and the troops gave up their pursuit of the Israelites; for Joab held the troops in check.
Transliteration: vayiteka yvoav vashofar vayashׇv haam miredof acharey yisherael khiy-chashakhe yvoav et-haam

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֣וּ אֶת־אַבְשָׁל֗וֹם וַיַּשְׁלִ֨כוּ אֹת֤וֹ בַיַּ֙עַר֙ אֶל־הַפַּ֣חַת הַגָּד֔וֹל וַיַּצִּ֧בוּ עָלָ֛יו גַּל־אֲבָנִ֖ים גָּד֣וֹל מְאֹ֑ד וְכׇ֨ל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל נָ֖סוּ אִ֥ישׁ לְאֹהָלָֽו׃
Translated: They took Absalom and flung him into a large pit in the forest, and they piled up a very great heap of stones over it. Then all the Israelites fled to their homes.—
Transliteration: vayikechu et-aveshalvom vayashelikhu otvo vayaar el-hafachat hagadvol vayatsivu alayv gal-avaniym gadvol meod vekhׇl-yisherael nasu iysh leohalav

Hebrew: וְאַבְשָׁלֹ֣ם לָקַ֗ח וַיַּצֶּב־ל֤וֹ בְחַיָּו֙ אֶת־מַצֶּ֙בֶת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּעֵֽמֶק־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ כִּ֤י אָמַר֙ אֵֽין־לִ֣י בֵ֔ן בַּעֲב֖וּר הַזְכִּ֣יר שְׁמִ֑י וַיִּקְרָ֤א לַמַּצֶּ֙בֶת֙ עַל־שְׁמ֔וֹ וַיִּקָּ֤רֵא לָהּ֙ יַ֣ד אַבְשָׁל֔וֹם עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Now Absalom, in his lifetime, had taken the pillar that is in the Valley of the King and set it up for himself; for he said, “I have no son to keep my name alive.” He had named the pillar after himself, and it has been called Absalom’s Monument to this day.
Transliteration: veaveshalom lakach vayatsev-lvo vechayav et-matsevet asher veemek-hamelekhe khiy amar eyn-liy ven vaavur hazekhiyr shemiy vayikera lamatsevet al-shemvo vayikare lah yad aveshalvom ad hayyvom hazeh {s}

Hebrew: וַאֲחִימַ֤עַץ בֶּן־צָדוֹק֙ אָמַ֔ר אָר֣וּצָה נָּ֔א וַאֲבַשְּׂרָ֖ה אֶת־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ כִּֽי־שְׁפָט֥וֹ יְהֹוָ֖ה מִיַּ֥ד אֹיְבָֽיו׃
Translated: Ahimaaz son of Zadok said, “Let me run and report to the king that G<small>OD</small> has vindicated him against his enemies.”
Transliteration: vaachiymaats ven-tsadvok amar arutsah na vaavasherah et-hamelekhe khiy-shefatvo yehovah miyad oyevayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר ל֣וֹ יוֹאָ֗ב לֹא֩ אִ֨ישׁ בְּשֹׂרָ֤ה אַתָּה֙ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה וּבִשַּׂרְתָּ֖ בְּי֣וֹם אַחֵ֑ר וְהַיּ֤וֹם הַזֶּה֙ לֹ֣א תְבַשֵּׂ֔ר כִּֽי־עַל־[כֵּ֥ן] בֶּן־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ מֵֽת׃
Translated: But Joab said to him, “You shall not be the one to bring tidings today. You may bring tidings some other day, but you’ll not bring any today; for the king’s son is dead!”
Transliteration: vayomer lvo yvoav lo iysh veshorah atah hayyvom hazeh uvishareta veyvom acher vehayyvom hazeh lo tevasher khiy-al-[khen] ven-hamelekhe met

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יוֹאָב֙ לַכּוּשִׁ֔י לֵ֛ךְ הַגֵּ֥ד לַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֲשֶׁ֣ר רָאִ֑יתָה וַיִּשְׁתַּ֧חוּ כוּשִׁ֛י לְיוֹאָ֖ב וַיָּרֹֽץ׃
Translated: And Joab said to a Cushite, “Go tell the king what you have seen.” The Cushite bowed to Joab and ran off.
Transliteration: vayomer yvoav lakhushiy lekhe haged lamelekhe asher raiytah vayishetachu khushiy leyvoav vayarots

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨סֶף ע֜וֹד אֲחִימַ֤עַץ בֶּן־צָדוֹק֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶל־יוֹאָ֔ב וִ֣יהִי מָ֔ה אָרֻֽצָה־נָּ֥א גַם־אָ֖נִי אַחֲרֵ֣י הַכּוּשִׁ֑י וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יוֹאָ֗ב לָֽמָּה־זֶּ֞ה אַתָּ֥ה רָץ֙ בְּנִ֔י וּלְכָ֖ה אֵין־בְּשׂוֹרָ֥ה מֹצֵֽאת׃
Translated: But Ahimaaz son of Zadok again said to Joab, “No matter what, let me run, too, behind the Cushite.” Joab asked, “Why should you run, my boy, when you have no news worth telling?”
Transliteration: vayosef vod achiymaats ven-tsadvok vayomer el-yvoav viyhiy mah arutsah-na gam-aniy acharey hakhushiy vayomer yvoav lamah-zeh atah rats veniy ulekhah eyn-veshvorah motset

Hebrew: וִיהִי־מָ֣ה אָר֔וּץ וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֖וֹ ר֑וּץ וַיָּ֤רׇץ אֲחִימַ֙עַץ֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַכִּכָּ֔ר וַֽיַּעֲבֹ֖ר אֶת־הַכּוּשִֽׁי׃
Translated: “I am going to run anyway.” “Then run,” he said. So Ahimaaz ran by way of the Plain, and he passed the Cushite.
Transliteration: viyhiy-mah aruts vayomer lvo ruts vayarׇts achiymaats derekhe hakhikhar vayaavor et-hakhushiy

Hebrew: וְדָוִ֥ד יוֹשֵׁ֖ב בֵּין־שְׁנֵ֣י הַשְּׁעָרִ֑ים וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ הַצֹּפֶ֜ה אֶל־גַּ֤ג הַשַּׁ֙עַר֙ אֶל־הַ֣חוֹמָ֔ה וַיִּשָּׂ֤א אֶת־עֵינָיו֙ וַיַּ֔רְא וְהִנֵּה־אִ֖ישׁ רָ֥ץ לְבַדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: David was sitting between the two gates. The watchman on the roof of the gate walked over to the city wall. He looked up and saw a man running alone.
Transliteration: vedavid yvoshev veyn-sheney hasheariym vayelekhe hatsofeh el-gag hashaar el-hachvomah vayisha et-eynayv vayare vehineh-iysh rats levadvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֤א הַצֹּפֶה֙ וַיַּגֵּ֣ד לַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אִם־לְבַדּ֖וֹ בְּשׂוֹרָ֣ה בְּפִ֑יו וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ הָל֖וֹךְ וְקָרֵֽב׃
Translated: The watchman called down and told the king; and the king said, “If he is alone, he has news to report.” As he was coming nearer,
Transliteration: vayikera hatsofeh vayaged lamelekhe vayomer hamelekhe im-levadvo veshvorah vefiyv vayelekhe halvokhe vekarev

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא הַצֹּפֶה֮ אִישׁ־אַחֵ֣ר רָץ֒ וַיִּקְרָ֤א הַצֹּפֶה֙ אֶל־הַשֹּׁעֵ֔ר וַיֹּ֕אמֶר הִנֵּה־אִ֖ישׁ רָ֣ץ לְבַדּ֑וֹ וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ גַּם־זֶ֥ה מְבַשֵּֽׂר׃
Translated: the watchman saw another man running; and he called out to the gatekeeper, “There is another man running alone.” And the king said, “That one, too, brings news.”
Transliteration: vayare hatsofeh iysh-acher rats vayikera hatsofeh el-hashoer vayomer hineh-iysh rats levadvo vayomer hamelekhe gam-zeh mevasher

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הַצֹּפֶ֔ה אֲנִ֤י רֹאֶה֙ אֶת־מְרוּצַ֣ת הָרִאשׁ֔וֹן כִּמְרֻצַ֖ת אֲחִימַ֣עַץ בֶּן־צָד֑וֹק וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אִֽישׁ־ט֣וֹב זֶ֔ה וְאֶל־בְּשׂוֹרָ֥ה טוֹבָ֖ה יָבֽוֹא׃
Translated: The watchman said, “I can see that the first one runs like Ahimaaz son of Zadok”; to which the king replied, “He is a good man, and he comes with good news.”
Transliteration: vayomer hatsofeh aniy roeh et-merutsat harishvon khimerutsat achiymaats ven-tsadvok vayomer hamelekhe iysh-tvov zeh veel-veshvorah tvovah yavvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א אֲחִימַ֗עַץ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֶל־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ שָׁל֔וֹם וַיִּשְׁתַּ֧חוּ לַמֶּ֛לֶךְ לְאַפָּ֖יו אָ֑רְצָה {ס} וַיֹּ֗אמֶר בָּרוּךְ֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ אֲשֶׁ֤ר סִגַּר֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֲנָשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־נָשְׂא֥וּ אֶת־יָדָ֖ם בַּאדֹנִ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: Ahimaaz called out and said to the king, “All is well!” He bowed low with his face to the ground and said, “Praised be the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God, who has delivered up those involved—who raised their hand against my lord the king.”
Transliteration: vayikera achiymaats vayomer el-hamelekhe shalvom vayishetachu lamelekhe leafayv aretsah {s} vayomer varukhe yehovah eloheykha asher sigar et-haanashiym asher-nasheu et-yadam vadoniy hamelekhe {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ שָׁל֥וֹם לַנַּ֖עַר לְאַבְשָׁל֑וֹם וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲחִימַ֡עַץ רָאִ֩יתִי֩ הֶהָמ֨וֹן הַגָּד֜וֹל לִ֠שְׁלֹ֠חַ אֶת־עֶ֨בֶד הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ יוֹאָב֙ וְאֶת־עַבְדֶּ֔ךָ וְלֹ֥א יָדַ֖עְתִּי מָֽה׃
Translated: The king asked, “Is my boy Absalom safe?” And Ahimaaz answered, “I saw a large crowd when Your Majesty’s servant Joab was sending your servant off, but I don’t know what it was about.”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe shalvom lanaar leaveshalvom vayomer achiymaats raiytiy hehamvon hagadvol lishelocha et-eved hamelekhe yvoav veet-avedekha velo yadaetiy mah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ סֹ֖ב הִתְיַצֵּ֣ב כֹּ֑ה וַיִּסֹּ֖ב וַֽיַּעֲמֹֽד׃
Translated: The king said, “Step aside and stand over there”; he stepped aside and waited.
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe sov hiteyatsev khoh vayisov vayaamod

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֥ה הַכּוּשִׁ֖י בָּ֑א וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הַכּוּשִׁ֗י יִתְבַּשֵּׂר֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ כִּֽי־שְׁפָטְךָ֤ יְהֹוָה֙ הַיּ֔וֹם מִיַּ֖ד כׇּל־הַקָּמִ֥ים עָלֶֽיךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: Just then the Cushite came up; and the Cushite said, “Let my lord the king be informed that G<small>OD</small> has vindicated you today against all who rebelled against you!”
Transliteration: vehineh hakhushiy va vayomer hakhushiy yitevasher adoniy hamelekhe khiy-shefatekha yehovah hayyvom miyad khׇl-hakamiym aleykha {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֶל־הַכּוּשִׁ֔י הֲשָׁל֥וֹם לַנַּ֖עַר לְאַבְשָׁל֑וֹם וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הַכּוּשִׁ֗י יִהְי֤וּ כַנַּ֙עַר֙ אֹֽיְבֵי֙ אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־קָ֥מוּ עָלֶ֖יךָ לְרָעָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The king asked the Cushite, “Is my boy Absalom safe?” And the Cushite replied, “May the enemies of my lord the king and all who rose against you to do you harm fare like that young man!”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe el-hakhushiy hashalvom lanaar leaveshalvom vayomer hakhushiy yiheyu khanaar oyevey adoniy hamelekhe vekhol asher-kamu aleykha leraah {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּרְגַּ֣ז הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ וַיַּ֛עַל עַל־עֲלִיַּ֥ת הַשַּׁ֖עַר וַיֵּ֑בְךְּ וְכֹ֣ה ׀ אָמַ֣ר בְּלֶכְתּ֗וֹ בְּנִ֤י אַבְשָׁלוֹם֙ בְּנִ֣י בְנִ֣י אַבְשָׁל֔וֹם מִֽי־יִתֵּ֤ן מוּתִי֙ אֲנִ֣י תַחְתֶּ֔יךָ אַבְשָׁל֖וֹם בְּנִ֥י בְנִֽי׃
Translated: The king was shaken. He went up to the upper chamber of the gateway and wept, moaning these words as he went, “My son Absalom! O my son, my son Absalom! If only I had died instead of you! O Absalom, my son, my son!”
Transliteration: vayiregaz hamelekhe vayaal al-aliyat hashaar vayevekhe vekhoh amar velekhetvo veniy aveshalvom veniy veniy aveshalvom miy-yiten mutiy aniy tacheteykha aveshalvom veniy veniy

Hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֖ד לְיוֹאָ֑ב הִנֵּ֨ה הַמֶּ֧לֶךְ בֹּכֶ֛ה וַיִּתְאַבֵּ֖ל עַל־אַבְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: Joab was told that the king was weeping and mourning over Absalom.
Transliteration: vayugad leyvoav hineh hamelekhe vokheh vayiteavel al-aveshalvom

Hebrew: וַתְּהִ֨י הַתְּשֻׁעָ֜ה בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֛וּא לְאֵ֖בֶל לְכׇל־הָעָ֑ם כִּֽי־שָׁמַ֣ע הָעָ֗ם בַּיּ֤וֹם הַהוּא֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר נֶעֱצַ֥ב הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ עַל־בְּנֽוֹ׃
Translated: And the victory that day was turned into mourning for all the troops, for that day the troops heard that the king was grieving over his son.
Transliteration: vatehiy hateshuah vayyvom hahu leevel lekhׇl-haam khiy-shama haam vayyvom hahu lemor neetsav hamelekhe al-venvo

Hebrew: וַיִּתְגַּנֵּ֥ב הָעָ֛ם בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא לָב֣וֹא הָעִ֑יר כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר יִתְגַּנֵּ֗ב הָעָם֙ הַנִּכְלָמִ֔ים בְּנוּסָ֖ם בַּמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: The troops stole into town that day like troops ashamed after running away in battle.
Transliteration: vayiteganev haam vayyvom hahu lavvo haiyr khaasher yiteganev haam hanikhelamiym venusam vamilechamah

Hebrew: וְהַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ לָאַ֣ט אֶת־פָּנָ֔יו וַיִּזְעַ֥ק הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ ק֣וֹל גָּד֑וֹל בְּנִי֙ אַבְשָׁל֔וֹם אַבְשָׁל֖וֹם בְּנִ֥י בְנִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: The king covered his face and the king kept crying aloud, “O my son Absalom! O Absalom, my son, my son!”
Transliteration: vehamelekhe laat et-fanayv vayizeak hamelekhe kvol gadvol veniy aveshalvom aveshalvom veniy veniy {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א יוֹאָ֛ב אֶל־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ הַבָּ֑יִת וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ הֹבַ֨שְׁתָּ הַיּ֜וֹם אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י כׇל־עֲבָדֶ֗יךָ הַֽמְמַלְּטִ֤ים אֶֽת־נַפְשְׁךָ֙ הַיּ֔וֹם וְאֵ֨ת נֶ֤פֶשׁ בָּנֶ֙יךָ֙ וּבְנֹתֶ֔יךָ וְנֶ֣פֶשׁ נָשֶׁ֔יךָ וְנֶ֖פֶשׁ פִּלַגְשֶֽׁיךָ׃
Translated: Joab came to the king in his quarters and said, “Today you have humiliated all your followers, who this day saved your life, and the lives of your sons and daughters, and the lives of your wives and concubines,
Transliteration: vayavo yvoav el-hamelekhe havayiit vayomer hovasheta hayyvom et-feney khׇl-avadeykha hamemaletiym et-nafeshekha hayyvom veet nefesh vaneykha uvenoteykha venefesh nasheykha venefesh filagesheykha

Hebrew: לְאַֽהֲבָה֙ אֶת־שֹׂ֣נְאֶ֔יךָ וְלִשְׂנֹ֖א אֶת־אֹהֲבֶ֑יךָ כִּ֣י ׀ הִגַּ֣דְתָּ הַיּ֗וֹם כִּ֣י אֵ֤ין לְךָ֙ שָׂרִ֣ים וַעֲבָדִ֔ים כִּ֣י ׀ יָדַ֣עְתִּי הַיּ֗וֹם כִּ֠י (לא) [ל֣וּ] אַבְשָׁל֥וֹם חַי֙ וְכֻלָּ֤נוּ הַיּוֹם֙ מֵתִ֔ים כִּי־אָ֖ז יָשָׁ֥ר בְּעֵינֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: by showing love for those who hate you and hate for those who love you. For you have made clear today that the officers and servicemen mean nothing to you. I am sure that if Absalom were alive today and the rest of us dead, you would have preferred it.
Transliteration: leahavah et-shoneeykha velisheno et-ohaveykha khiy higadeta hayyvom khiy eyn lekha shariym vaavadiym khiy yadaetiy hayyvom khiy (l) [lu] aveshalvom chay vekhulanu hayyvom metiym khiy-az yashar veeyneykha

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֙ ק֣וּם צֵ֔א וְדַבֵּ֖ר עַל־לֵ֣ב עֲבָדֶ֑יךָ {ס} כִּי֩ בַיהֹוָ֨ה נִשְׁבַּ֜עְתִּי כִּֽי־אֵינְךָ֣ יוֹצֵ֗א אִם־יָלִ֨ין אִ֤ישׁ אִתְּךָ֙ הַלַּ֔יְלָה וְרָעָ֧ה לְךָ֣ זֹ֗את מִכׇּל־הָרָעָה֙ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֣אָה עָלֶ֔יךָ מִנְּעֻרֶ֖יךָ עַד־עָֽתָּה׃ {ס}
Translated: Now arise, come out and placate your followers! For I swear by G<small>OD</small> that if you do not come out, not a single man will remain with you overnight; and that would be a greater disaster for you than any disaster that has befallen you from your youth until now.”
Transliteration: veatah kum tse vedaver al-lev avadeykha {s} khiy vayhovah nishevaetiy khiy-eynekha yvotse im-yaliyn iysh itekha halayelah veraah lekha zot mikhׇl-haraah asher-vaah aleykha mineureykha ad-atah {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥קׇם הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ וַיֵּ֣שֶׁב בַּשָּׁ֑עַר וּֽלְכׇל־הָעָ֞ם הִגִּ֣ידוּ לֵאמֹ֗ר הִנֵּ֤ה הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ יוֹשֵׁ֣ב בַּשַּׁ֔עַר וַיָּבֹ֤א כׇל־הָעָם֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְיִ֨שְׂרָאֵ֔ל נָ֖ס אִ֥ישׁ לְאֹהָלָֽיו׃ {ס}
Translated:
So the king arose and sat down in the gateway; and when all the troops were told that the king was sitting in the gateway, all the troops presented themselves to the king.
Now the Israelites had fled to their homes.
Transliteration: vayakׇm hamelekhe vayeshev vashaar ulekhׇl-haam higiydu lemor hineh hamelekhe yvoshev vashaar vayavo khׇl-haam lifeney hamelekhe veyisherael nas iysh leohalayv {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י כׇל־הָעָם֙ נָד֔וֹן בְּכׇל־שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ הִצִּילָ֣נוּ ׀ מִכַּ֣ף אֹיְבֵ֗ינוּ וְה֤וּא מִלְּטָ֙נוּ֙ מִכַּ֣ף פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים וְעַתָּ֛ה בָּרַ֥ח מִן־הָאָ֖רֶץ מֵעַ֥ל אַבְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: All the people throughout the tribes of Israel were arguing: Some said, “The king saved us from the hands of our enemies, and he delivered us from the hands of the Philistines; and just now he had to flee the country because of Absalom.
Transliteration: vayehiy khׇl-haam nadvon vekhׇl-shivetey yisherael lemor hamelekhe hitsiylanu mikhaf oyeveynu vehu miletanu mikhaf felishetiym veatah varach min-haarets meal aveshalvom

Hebrew: וְאַבְשָׁלוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר מָשַׁ֣חְנוּ עָלֵ֔ינוּ מֵ֖ת בַּמִּלְחָמָ֑ה וְעַתָּ֗ה לָמָ֥ה אַתֶּ֛ם מַחֲרִשִׁ֖ים לְהָשִׁ֥יב אֶת־הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: But Absalom, whom we anointed over us, has died in battle; why then do you sit idle instead of escorting the king back?”
Transliteration: veaveshalvom asher mashachenu aleynu met vamilechamah veatah lamah atem macharishiym lehashiyv et-hamelekhe {s}

Hebrew: וְהַמֶּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֗ד שָׁ֠לַ֠ח אֶל־צָד֨וֹק וְאֶל־אֶבְיָתָ֥ר הַכֹּהֲנִים֮ לֵאמֹר֒ דַּבְּר֞וּ אֶל־זִקְנֵ֤י יְהוּדָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לָ֤מָּה תִֽהְיוּ֙ אַחֲרֹנִ֔ים לְהָשִׁ֥יב אֶת־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֶל־בֵּית֑וֹ וּדְבַר֙ כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בָּ֥א אֶל־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֶל־בֵּיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: The talk of all Israel reached the king in his quarters. So King David sent this message to the priests Zadok and Abiathar: “Speak to the elders of Judah and say, ‘Why should you be the last to bring the king back to his palace?
Transliteration: vehamelekhe david shalach el-tsadvok veel-eveyatar hakhohaniym lemor daveru el-zikeney yehudah lemor lamah tiheyu acharoniym lehashiyv et-hamelekhe el-veytvo udevar khׇl-yisherael va el-hamelekhe el-veytvo

Hebrew: אַחַ֣י אַתֶּ֔ם עַצְמִ֥י וּבְשָׂרִ֖י אַתֶּ֑ם וְלָ֧מָּה תִֽהְי֛וּ אַחֲרֹנִ֖ים לְהָשִׁ֥יב אֶת־הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: You are my kin, my own flesh and blood! Why should you be the last to escort the king back?’
Transliteration: achay atem atsemiy uveshariy atem velamah tiheyu acharoniym lehashiyv et-hamelekhe

Hebrew: וְלַֽעֲמָשָׂא֙ תֹּֽמְר֔וּ הֲל֛וֹא עַצְמִ֥י וּבְשָׂרִ֖י אָ֑תָּה כֹּ֣ה יַעֲשֶׂה־לִּ֤י אֱלֹהִים֙ וְכֹ֣ה יוֹסִ֔יף אִם־לֹ֠א שַׂר־צָבָ֞א תִּהְיֶ֧ה לְפָנַ֛י כׇּל־הַיָּמִ֖ים תַּ֥חַת יוֹאָֽב׃
Translated: And to Amasa say this, ‘You are my own flesh and blood. May God do thus and more to me if you do not become my army commander permanently in place of Joab!’”
Transliteration: velaamasha tomeru halvo atsemiy uveshariy atah khoh yaasheh-liy Elohim vekhoh yvosiyf im-lo shar-tsava tiheyeh lefanay khׇl-hayamiym tachat yvoav

Hebrew: וַיַּ֛ט אֶת־לְבַ֥ב כׇּל־אִישׁ־יְהוּדָ֖ה כְּאִ֣ישׁ אֶחָ֑ד וַֽיִּשְׁלְחוּ֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ שׁ֥וּב אַתָּ֖ה וְכׇל־עֲבָדֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: So [Amasa] swayed the hearts of Judah’s entire contingent without opposition; and they sent a message to the king: “Come back with all your followers.”
Transliteration: vayat et-levav khׇl-iysh-yehudah kheiysh echad vayishelechu el-hamelekhe shuv atah vekhׇl-avadeykha

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣שׇׁב הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַיָּבֹ֖א עַד־הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן וִיהוּדָ֞ה בָּ֣א הַגִּלְגָּ֗לָה לָלֶ֙כֶת֙ לִקְרַ֣את הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ לְהַעֲבִ֥יר אֶת־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: The king started back and arrived at the Jordan; and the Judahites went to Gilgal to meet the king and to conduct the king across the Jordan.
Transliteration: vayashׇv hamelekhe vayavo ad-hayareden viyhudah va hagilegalah lalekhet likerat hamelekhe lehaaviyr et-hamelekhe et-hayareden

Hebrew: וַיְמַהֵ֗ר שִׁמְעִ֤י בֶן־גֵּרָא֙ בֶּן־הַיְמִינִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֖ר מִבַּחוּרִ֑ים וַיֵּ֙רֶד֙ עִם־אִ֣ישׁ יְהוּדָ֔ה לִקְרַ֖את הַמֶּ֥לֶךְ דָּוִֽד׃
Translated: Shimei son of Gera, the Benjaminite from Bahurim, hurried down with Judah’s contingent to meet King David,
Transliteration: vayemaher shimeiy ven-gera ven-hayemiyniy asher mivachuriym vayered im-iysh yehudah likerat hamelekhe david

Hebrew: וְאֶ֨לֶף אִ֣ישׁ עִמּוֹ֮ מִבִּנְיָמִן֒ וְצִיבָ֗א נַ֚עַר בֵּ֣ית שָׁא֔וּל וַחֲמֵ֨שֶׁת עָשָׂ֥ר בָּנָ֛יו וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים עֲבָדָ֖יו אִתּ֑וֹ וְצָלְח֥וּ הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן לִפְנֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: accompanied by a thousand Benjaminites. And Ziba, the servant of the House of Saul, together with his fifteen sons and twenty slaves, rushed down to the Jordan ahead of the king
Transliteration: veelef iysh imvo mivineyamin vetsiyva naar veyt shaul vachameshet ashar vanayv veesheriym avadayv itvo vetsalechu hayareden lifeney hamelekhe

Hebrew: וְעָבְרָ֣ה הָעֲבָרָ֗ה לַֽעֲבִיר֙ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְלַעֲשׂ֥וֹת הַטּ֖וֹב בְּעֵינָ֑ו וְשִׁמְעִ֣י בֶן־גֵּרָ֗א נָפַל֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ בְּעׇבְר֖וֹ בַּיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: while the crossing was being made, to escort the king’s family over, and to do whatever he wished. Shimei son of Gera flung himself before the king as he was about to cross the Jordan.
Transliteration: veaverah haavarah laaviyr et-veyt hamelekhe velaashvot hatvov veeynav veshimeiy ven-gera nafal lifeney hamelekhe veׇvervo vayareden

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶל־הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ אַל־יַחֲשָׁב־לִ֣י אֲדֹנִי֮ עָוֺן֒ וְאַל־תִּזְכֹּ֗ר אֵ֚ת אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֶעֱוָ֣ה עַבְדְּךָ֔ בַּיּ֕וֹם אֲשֶׁר־יָׄצָ֥אׄ אֲדֹנִֽי־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ מִירוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם לָשׂ֥וּם הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֶל־לִבּֽוֹ׃
Translated: He said to the king, “Let not my lord hold me guilty, and do not remember the wrong your servant committed on the day my lord the king left Jerusalem; let Your Majesty give it no thought.
Transliteration: vayomer el-hamelekhe al-yachashav-liy adoniy avon veal-tizekhor et asher heevah avedekha vayyvom asher-yatsa adoniy-hamelekhe miyrushala͏im lashum hamelekhe el-livvo

Hebrew: כִּ֚י יָדַ֣ע עַבְדְּךָ֔ כִּ֖י אֲנִ֣י חָטָ֑אתִי וְהִנֵּה־בָ֣אתִי הַיּ֗וֹם רִאשׁוֹן֙ לְכׇל־בֵּ֣ית יוֹסֵ֔ף לָרֶ֕דֶת לִקְרַ֖את אֲדֹנִ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: For your servant knows that he has sinned; so here I have come down today, the first of all the House of Joseph, to meet my lord the king.”
Transliteration: khiy yada avedekha khiy aniy chatatiy vehineh-vatiy hayyvom rishvon lekhׇl-veyt yvosef laredet likerat adoniy hamelekhe {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן אֲבִישַׁ֤י בֶּן־צְרוּיָה֙ וַיֹּ֔אמֶר הֲתַ֣חַת זֹ֔את לֹ֥א יוּמַ֖ת שִׁמְעִ֑י כִּ֥י קִלֵּ֖ל אֶת־מְשִׁ֥יחַ יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Thereupon Abishai son of Zeruiah spoke up, “Shouldn’t Shimei be put to death for that—insulting G<small>OD</small>’s anointed?”
Transliteration: vayaan aviyshay ven-tseruyah vayomer hatachat zot lo yumat shimeiy khiy kilel et-meshiycha yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר דָּוִ֗ד מַה־לִּ֤י וְלָכֶם֙ בְּנֵ֣י צְרוּיָ֔ה כִּֽי־תִֽהְיוּ־לִ֥י הַיּ֖וֹם לְשָׂטָ֑ן הַיּ֗וֹם י֤וּמַת אִישׁ֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֚י הֲל֣וֹא יָדַ֔עְתִּי כִּ֥י הַיּ֖וֹם אֲנִי־מֶ֥לֶךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: But David said, “What has this to do with you, you sons of Zeruiah, that you should cross me today? Should even a single Israelite be put to death today? Don’t I know that today I am again king over Israel?”
Transliteration: vayomer david mah-liy velakhem veney tseruyah khiy-tiheyu-liy hayyvom leshatan hayyvom yumat iysh veyisherael khiy halvo yadaetiy khiy hayyvom aniy-melekhe al-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ אֶל־שִׁמְעִ֖י לֹ֣א תָמ֑וּת וַיִּשָּׁ֥בַֽע ל֖וֹ הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: Then the king said to Shimei, “You shall not die”; and the king gave him his oath.
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe el-shimeiy lo tamut vayishava lvo hamelekhe {s}

Hebrew: וּמְפִבֹ֙שֶׁת֙ בֶּן־שָׁא֔וּל יָרַ֖ד לִקְרַ֣את הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וְלֹא־עָשָׂ֨ה רַגְלָ֜יו וְלֹא־עָשָׂ֣ה שְׂפָמ֗וֹ וְאֶת־בְּגָדָיו֙ לֹ֣א כִבֵּ֔ס לְמִן־הַיּוֹם֙ לֶ֣כֶת הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ עַד־הַיּ֖וֹם אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֥א בְשָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: Mephibosheth, the grandson of Saul, also came down to meet the king. He had not pared his toenails, or trimmed his mustache, or washed his clothes from the day that the king left until the day he returned safe.
Transliteration: umefivoshet ven-shaul yarad likerat hamelekhe velo-ashah ragelayv velo-ashah shefamvo veet-vegadayv lo khives lemin-hayyvom lekhet hamelekhe ad-hayyvom asher-va veshalvom

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֛י כִּי־בָ֥א יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם לִקְרַ֣את הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ לָ֛מָּה לֹא־הָלַ֥כְתָּ עִמִּ֖י מְפִיבֹֽשֶׁת׃
Translated: When he came [from] Jerusalem to meet the king, the king asked him, “Why didn’t you come with me, Mephibosheth?”
Transliteration: vayehiy khiy-va yerushala͏im likerat hamelekhe vayomer lvo hamelekhe lamah lo-halakheta imiy mefiyvoshet

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֕ר אֲדֹנִ֥י הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ עַבְדִּ֣י רִמָּ֑נִי כִּי־אָמַ֨ר עַבְדְּךָ֜ אֶחְבְּשָׁה־לִּי֩ הַחֲמ֨וֹר וְאֶרְכַּ֤ב עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ וְאֵלֵ֣ךְ אֶת־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ כִּ֥י פִסֵּ֖חַ עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: He replied, “My lord the king, my own servant deceived me. Your servant planned to saddle his donkey and ride on it and go with Your Majesty—for your servant is lame.
Transliteration: vayomar adoniy hamelekhe avediy rimaniy khiy-amar avedekha echeveshah-liy hachamvor veerekhav aleyha veelekhe et-hamelekhe khiy fisecha avedekha

Hebrew: וַיְרַגֵּ֣ל בְּעַבְדְּךָ֔ אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֖י הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַֽאדֹנִ֤י הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ כְּמַלְאַ֣ךְ הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וַעֲשֵׂ֥ה הַטּ֖וֹב בְּעֵינֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: [Ziba] has slandered your servant to my lord the king. But my lord the king is like an angel of G<small>OD</small>; do as you see fit.
Transliteration: vayeragel veavedekha el-adoniy hamelekhe vadoniy hamelekhe khemaleakhe haElohim vaasheh hatvov veeyneykha

Hebrew: כִּי֩ לֹ֨א הָיָ֜ה כׇּל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֗י כִּ֤י אִם־אַנְשֵֽׁי־מָ֙וֶת֙ לַאדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַתָּ֙שֶׁת֙ אֶֽת־עַבְדְּךָ֔ בְּאֹכְלֵ֖י שֻׁלְחָנֶ֑ךָ וּמַה־יֶּשׁ־לִ֥י עוֹד֙ צְדָקָ֔ה וְלִזְעֹ֥ק ע֖וֹד אֶל־הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {פ}
Translated: For all the members of my father’s family deserved only death from my lord the king; yet you set your servant among those who ate at your table. What right have I to appeal further to Your Majesty?”
Transliteration: khiy lo hayah khׇl-veyt aviy khiy im-aneshey-mavet ladoniy hamelekhe vatashet et-avedekha veokheley shulechanekha umah-yesh-liy vod tsedakah velizeok vod el-hamelekhe {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ לָ֛מָּה תְּדַבֵּ֥ר ע֖וֹד דְּבָרֶ֑יךָ אָמַ֕רְתִּי אַתָּ֣ה וְצִיבָ֔א תַּחְלְק֖וּ אֶת־הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated: The king said to him, “You need not speak further. I decree that you and Ziba shall divide the property.”
Transliteration: vayomer lvo hamelekhe lamah tedaver vod devareykha amaretiy atah vetsiyva tacheleku et-hashadeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מְפִיבֹ֙שֶׁת֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ גַּ֥ם אֶת־הַכֹּ֖ל יִקָּ֑ח אַ֠חֲרֵי אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֞א אֲדֹנִ֥י הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ בְּשָׁל֖וֹם אֶל־בֵּיתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: And Mephibosheth said to the king, “Let him take it all, as long as my lord the king has come home safe.”
Transliteration: vayomer mefiyvoshet el-hamelekhe gam et-hakhol yikach acharey asher-va adoniy hamelekhe veshalvom el-veytvo {s}

Hebrew: וּבַרְזִלַּי֙ הַגִּלְעָדִ֔י יָרַ֖ד מֵרֹֽגְלִ֑ים וַיַּעֲבֹ֤ר אֶת־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן לְשַׁלְּח֖וֹ אֶת־[הַיַּרְדֵּֽן] (בירדן)׃
Translated: Barzillai the Gileadite had come down from Rogelim and passed on to the Jordan with the king, to see him off at the Jordan.
Transliteration: uvarezilay hagileadiy yarad merogeliym vayaavor et-hamelekhe hayareden leshalechvo et-[hayareden] (vyrdn)

Hebrew: וּבַרְזִלַּי֙ זָקֵ֣ן מְאֹ֔ד בֶּן־שְׁמֹנִ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וְהֽוּא־כִלְכַּ֤ל אֶת־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ בְּשִׁיבָת֣וֹ בְמַחֲנַ֔יִם כִּי־אִ֛ישׁ גָּד֥וֹל ה֖וּא מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: Barzillai was very old, eighty years of age; and he had provided the king with food during his stay at Mahanaim, for he was a very wealthy man.
