Transliteration: uvarezilay zaken meod ven-shemoniym shanah vehu-khilekhal et-hamelekhe veshiyvatvo vemachanayiim khiy-iysh gadvol hu meod

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֶל־בַּרְזִלָּ֑י אַתָּה֙ עֲבֹ֣ר אִתִּ֔י וְכִלְכַּלְתִּ֥י אֹתְךָ֛ עִמָּדִ֖י בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: The king said to Barzillai, “Cross over with me, and I will provide for you in Jerusalem at my side.”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe el-varezilay atah avor itiy vekhilekhaletiy otekha imadiy viyrushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר בַּרְזִלַּ֖י אֶל־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ כַּמָּ֗ה יְמֵי֙ שְׁנֵ֣י חַיַּ֔י כִּי־אֶעֱלֶ֥ה אֶת־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: But Barzillai said to the king, “How many years are left to me that I should go up with Your Majesty to Jerusalem?
Transliteration: vayomer varezilay el-hamelekhe khamah yemey sheney chayay khiy-eeleh et-hamelekhe yerushala͏im

Hebrew: בֶּן־שְׁמֹנִ֣ים שָׁנָה֩ אָנֹכִ֨י הַיּ֜וֹם הַאֵדַ֣ע ׀ בֵּֽין־ט֣וֹב לְרָ֗ע אִם־יִטְעַ֤ם עַבְדְּךָ֙ אֶת־אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֹכַל֙ וְאֶת־אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶשְׁתֶּ֔ה אִם־אֶשְׁמַ֣ע ע֔וֹד בְּק֖וֹל שָׁרִ֣ים וְשָׁר֑וֹת וְלָ֩מָּה֩ יִֽהְיֶ֨ה עַבְדְּךָ֥ עוֹד֙ לְמַשָּׂ֔א אֶל־אֲדֹנִ֖י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: I am now eighty years old. Can I tell the difference between good and bad? Can your servant taste what he eats and drinks? Can I still listen to the singing of men and women? Why then should your servant continue to be a burden to my lord the king?
Transliteration: ven-shemoniym shanah anokhiy hayyvom haeda veyn-tvov lera im-yiteam avedekha et-asher okhal veet-asher esheteh im-eshema vod vekvol shariym vesharvot velamah yiheyeh avedekha vod lemasha el-adoniy hamelekhe

Hebrew: כִּמְעַ֞ט יַעֲבֹ֧ר עַבְדְּךָ֛ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן אֶת־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וְלָ֙מָּה֙ יִגְמְלֵ֣נִי הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ הַגְּמוּלָ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: Your servant could barely cross the Jordan with Your Majesty! Why should Your Majesty reward me so generously?
Transliteration: khimeat yaavor avedekha et-hayareden et-hamelekhe velamah yigemeleniy hamelekhe hagemulah hazot

Hebrew: יָשׇׁב־נָ֤א עַבְדְּךָ֙ וְאָמֻ֣ת בְּעִירִ֔י עִ֛ם קֶ֥בֶר אָבִ֖י וְאִמִּ֑י וְהִנֵּ֣ה ׀ עַבְדְּךָ֣ כִמְהָ֗ם יַֽעֲבֹר֙ עִם־אֲדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וַעֲשֵׂה־ל֕וֹ אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־ט֖וֹב בְּעֵינֶֽיךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: Let your servant go back, and let me die in my own town, near the graves of my father and mother. But here is your servant Chimham; let him cross with my lord the king, and do for him as you see fit.”
Transliteration: yashׇv-na avedekha veamut veiyriy im kever aviy veimiy vehineh avedekha khimeham yaavor im-adoniy hamelekhe vaasheh-lvo et asher-tvov veeyneykha {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ אִתִּי֙ יַעֲבֹ֣ר כִּמְהָ֔ם וַאֲנִי֙ אֶֽעֱשֶׂה־לּ֔וֹ אֶת־הַטּ֖וֹב בְּעֵינֶ֑יךָ וְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־תִּבְחַ֥ר עָלַ֖י אֶעֱשֶׂה־לָּֽךְ׃
Translated: And the king said, “Chimham shall cross with me, and I will do for him as you see fit; and anything you want me to do, I will do for you.”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe itiy yaavor khimeham vaaniy eesheh-lvo et-hatvov veeyneykha vekhol asher-tivechar alay eesheh-lakhe

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹ֧ר כׇּל־הָעָ֛ם אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן וְהַמֶּ֣לֶךְ עָבָ֑ר וַיִּשַּׁ֨ק הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ לְבַרְזִלַּי֙ וַיְבָ֣רְכֵ֔הוּ וַיָּ֖שׇׁב לִמְקֹמֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: All the troops crossed the Jordan; and when the king was ready to cross, the king kissed Barzillai and bade him farewell; and [Barzillai] returned to his home.
Transliteration: vayaavor khׇl-haam et-hayareden vehamelekhe avar vayishak hamelekhe levarezilay vayevarekhehu vayashׇv limekomvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹ֤ר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ הַגִּלְגָּ֔לָה וְכִמְהָ֖ן עָבַ֣ר עִמּ֑וֹ וְכׇל־עַ֤ם יְהוּדָה֙ (ויעברו) [הֶעֱבִ֣ירוּ] אֶת־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ וְגַ֕ם חֲצִ֖י עַ֥ם יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The king passed on to Gilgal, with Chimham accompanying him; and all the Judahite soldiers and part of the Israelite army escorted the king across.
Transliteration: vayaavor hamelekhe hagilegalah vekhimehan avar imvo vekhׇl-am yehudah (vyvrv) [heeviyru] et-hamelekhe vegam chatsiy am yisherael

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֛ה כׇּל־אִ֥ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בָּאִ֣ים אֶל־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֶל־הַמֶּ֡לֶךְ מַדּ֩וּעַ֩ גְּנָב֨וּךָ אַחֵ֜ינוּ אִ֣ישׁ יְהוּדָ֗ה וַיַּעֲבִ֨רוּ אֶת־הַמֶּ֤לֶךְ וְאֶת־בֵּיתוֹ֙ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן וְכׇל־אַנְשֵׁ֥י דָוִ֖ד עִמּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: Then Israel’s entire contingent came to the king—and said to the king, “Why did our kindred, Judah’s contingent, steal you away and escort the king and his family across the Jordan, along with all David’s men?”
Transliteration: vehineh khׇl-iysh yisherael vaiym el-hamelekhe vayomeru el-hamelekhe madua genavukha acheynu iysh yehudah vayaaviru et-hamelekhe veet-veytvo et-hayareden vekhׇl-aneshey david imvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֩עַן֩ כׇּל־אִ֨ישׁ יְהוּדָ֜ה עַל־אִ֣ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל כִּֽי־קָר֤וֹב הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֵלַ֔י וְלָ֤מָּה זֶּה֙ חָרָ֣ה לְךָ֔ עַל־הַדָּבָ֖ר הַזֶּ֑ה הֶאָכ֤וֹל אָכַ֙לְנוּ֙ מִן־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אִם־נִשֵּׂ֥את נִשָּׂ֖א לָֽנוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Judah’s side replied to Israel’s side, “Because the king is our relative! Why should this upset you? Have we consumed anything that belongs to the king? Has he given us any gifts?”
Transliteration: vayaan khׇl-iysh yehudah al-iysh yisherael khiy-karvov hamelekhe elay velamah zeh charah lekha al-hadavar hazeh heakhvol akhalenu min-hamelekhe im-nishet nisha lanu {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַן אִֽישׁ־יִשְׂרָאֵל֩ אֶת־אִ֨ישׁ יְהוּדָ֜ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר עֶשֶׂר־יָד֨וֹת לִ֣י בַמֶּ֘לֶךְ֮ וְגַם־בְּדָוִד֮ אֲנִ֣י מִמְּךָ֒ וּמַדּ֙וּעַ֙ הֱקִלֹּתַ֔נִי וְלֹא־הָיָ֨ה דְבָרִ֥י רִאשׁ֛וֹן לִ֖י לְהָשִׁ֣יב אֶת־מַלְכִּ֑י וַיִּ֙קֶשׁ֙ דְּבַר־אִ֣ישׁ יְהוּדָ֔ה מִדְּבַ֖ר אִ֥ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: But Israel’s side answered Judah’s side, “We have ten shares in the king, and in David, too, we have more than you. Why then have you slighted us? Were we not the first to propose that our king be brought back?” However, Judah’s side prevailed over Israel’s side.
Transliteration: vayaan iysh-yisherael et-iysh yehudah vayomer esher-yadvot liy vamelekhe vegam-vedavid aniy mimekha umadua hekilotaniy velo-hayah devariy rishvon liy lehashiyv et-malekhiy vayikesh devar-iysh yehudah midevar iysh yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֨ם נִקְרָ֜א אִ֣ישׁ בְּלִיַּ֗עַל וּשְׁמ֛וֹ שֶׁ֥בַע בֶּן־בִּכְרִ֖י אִ֣ישׁ יְמִינִ֑י וַיִּתְקַ֣ע בַּשֹּׁפָ֗ר וַ֠יֹּ֠אמֶר אֵֽין־לָ֨נוּ חֵ֜לֶק בְּדָוִ֗ד וְלֹ֤א נַחֲלָה־לָ֙נוּ֙ בְּבֶן־יִשַׁ֔י אִ֥ישׁ לְאֹהָלָ֖יו יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
A scoundrel named Sheba son of Bichri, a Benjaminite, happened to be there. He sounded the horn and proclaimed:
“We have no portion in David,
No share in Jesse’s son!
Back to your homes, O Israel!”
Transliteration: vesham nikera iysh veliyaal ushemvo sheva ven-vikheriy iysh yemiyniy vayiteka vashofar vayomer eyn-lanu chelek vedavid velo nachalah-lanu veven-yishay iysh leohalayv yisherael

Hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַל כׇּל־אִ֤ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מֵאַחֲרֵ֣י דָוִ֔ד אַחֲרֵ֖י שֶׁ֣בַע בֶּן־בִּכְרִ֑י וְאִ֤ישׁ יְהוּדָה֙ דָּבְק֣וּ בְמַלְכָּ֔ם מִן־הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן וְעַד־יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: Israel’s entire contingent left David and followed Sheba son of Bichri; but Judah’s contingent accompanied their king from the Jordan to Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vayaal khׇl-iysh yisherael meacharey david acharey sheva ven-vikheriy veiysh yehudah daveku vemalekham min-hayareden vead-yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א דָוִ֣ד אֶל־בֵּיתוֹ֮ יְרוּשָׁלַ֒͏ִם֒ וַיִּקַּ֣ח הַמֶּ֡לֶךְ אֵ֣ת עֶשֶׂר־נָשִׁ֣ים ׀ פִּלַגְשִׁ֡ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִנִּ֩יחַ֩ לִשְׁמֹ֨ר הַבַּ֜יִת וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֤ם בֵּית־מִשְׁמֶ֙רֶת֙ וַֽיְכַלְכְּלֵ֔ם וַאֲלֵיהֶ֖ם לֹא־בָ֑א וַתִּהְיֶ֧ינָה צְרֻר֛וֹת עַד־י֥וֹם מֻתָ֖ן אַלְמְנ֥וּת חַיּֽוּת׃ {ס}
Translated: David went to his palace in Jerusalem, and the king took the ten concubines he had left to mind the palace and put them in a guarded place; he provided for them, but he did not cohabit with them. They remained in seclusion until the day they died, in living widowhood.
Transliteration: vayavo david el-veytvo yerushala͏im vayikach hamelekhe et esher-nashiym filageshiym asher hiniycha lishemor havayiit vayitenem veyt-mishemeret vayekhalekhelem vaaleyhem lo-va vatiheyeynah tserurvot ad-yvom mutan alemenut chayyut {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֶל־עֲמָשָׂ֔א הַזְעֶק־לִ֥י אֶת־אִישׁ־יְהוּדָ֖ה שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֑ים וְאַתָּ֖ה פֹּ֥ה עֲמֹֽד׃
Translated: The king said to Amasa, “Call up Judah’s force to my standard, and report here three days from now.”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe el-amasha hazeek-liy et-iysh-yehudah sheloshet yamiym veatah foh amod

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ עֲמָשָׂ֖א לְהַזְעִ֣יק אֶת־יְהוּדָ֑ה (וייחר) [וַיּ֕וֹחֶר] מִן־הַמּוֹעֵ֖ד אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְעָדֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: Amasa went to call up Judah, but he took longer than the time set for him.
Transliteration: vayelekhe amasha lehazeiyk et-yehudah (vyychr) [vayyvocher] min-hamvoed asher yeadvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר דָּוִד֙ אֶל־אֲבִישַׁ֔י עַתָּ֗ה יֵ֧רַֽע לָ֛נוּ שֶׁ֥בַע בֶּן־בִּכְרִ֖י מִן־אַבְשָׁל֑וֹם אַ֠תָּ֠ה קַ֞ח אֶת־עַבְדֵ֤י אֲדֹנֶ֙יךָ֙ וּרְדֹ֣ף אַחֲרָ֔יו פֶּן־מָ֥צָא ל֛וֹ עָרִ֥ים בְּצֻר֖וֹת וְהִצִּ֥יל עֵינֵֽנוּ׃
Translated: And David said to Abishai, “Now Sheba son of Bichri will cause us more trouble than Absalom. So take your lord’s servants and pursue him, before he finds fortified towns and eludes us.”
Transliteration: vayomer david el-aviyshay atah eira lanu sheva ven-vikheriy min-aveshalvom atah kach et-avedey adoneykha uredof acharayv fen-matsa lvo ariym vetsurvot vehitsiyl eynenu

Hebrew: וַיֵּצְא֤וּ אַחֲרָיו֙ אַנְשֵׁ֣י יוֹאָ֔ב וְהַכְּרֵתִ֥י וְהַפְּלֵתִ֖י וְכׇל־הַגִּבֹּרִ֑ים וַיֵּֽצְאוּ֙ מִיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם לִרְדֹּ֕ף אַחֲרֵ֖י שֶׁ֥בַע בֶּן־בִּכְרִֽי׃
Translated: Joab’s men, the Cherethites and Pelethites, and all the warriors marched out behind him. They left Jerusalem in pursuit of Sheba son of Bichri.
Transliteration: vayetseu acharayv aneshey yvoav vehakheretiy vehafeletiy vekhׇl-hagivoriym vayetseu miyrushala͏im liredof acharey sheva ven-vikheriy

Hebrew: הֵ֗ם עִם־הָאֶ֤בֶן הַגְּדוֹלָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּגִבְע֔וֹן וַעֲמָשָׂ֖א בָּ֣א לִפְנֵיהֶ֑ם וְיוֹאָ֞ב חָג֣וּר ׀ מִדּ֣וֹ לְבֻשׁ֗וֹ וְעָלָ֞ו חֲג֥וֹר חֶ֙רֶב֙ מְצֻמֶּ֤דֶת עַל־מׇתְנָיו֙ בְּתַעְרָ֔הּ וְה֥וּא יָצָ֖א וַתִּפֹּֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: They were near the great stone in Gibeon when Amasa appeared before them. Joab was wearing his military dress, with his sword girded over it and fastened around his waist in its sheath; and, as he stepped forward, it fell out.
Transliteration: hem im-haeven hagedvolah asher vegivevon vaamasha va lifeneyhem veyvoav chagur midvo levushvo vealav chagvor cherev metsumedet al-mׇtenayv vetaerah vehu yatsa vatifol {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יוֹאָב֙ לַעֲמָשָׂ֔א הֲשָׁל֥וֹם אַתָּ֖ה אָחִ֑י וַתֹּ֜חֶז יַד־יְמִ֥ין יוֹאָ֛ב בִּזְקַ֥ן עֲמָשָׂ֖א לִנְשׇׁק־לֽוֹ׃
Translated: Joab said to Amasa, “How are you, brother?” and with his right hand Joab took hold of Amasa’s beard as if to kiss him.
Transliteration: vayomer yvoav laamasha hashalvom atah achiy vatochez yad-yemiyn yvoav vizekan amasha lineshׇk-lvo

Hebrew: וַעֲמָשָׂ֨א לֹא־נִשְׁמַ֜ר בַּחֶ֣רֶב ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּיַד־יוֹאָ֗ב וַיַּכֵּ֩הוּ֩ בָ֨הּ אֶל־הַחֹ֜מֶשׁ וַיִּשְׁפֹּ֨ךְ מֵעָ֥יו אַ֛רְצָה וְלֹא־שָׁ֥נָה ל֖וֹ וַיָּמֹ֑ת וְיוֹאָב֙ וַאֲבִישַׁ֣י אָחִ֔יו רָדַ֕ף אַחֲרֵ֖י שֶׁ֥בַע בֶּן־בִּכְרִֽי׃
Translated:
Amasa was not on his guard against the sword in Joab’s [left] hand, and [Joab] drove it into his belly so that his entrails poured out on the ground and he died; he did not need to strike him a second time.
Joab and his brother Abishai then set off in pursuit of Sheba son of Bichri,
Transliteration: vaamasha lo-nishemar vacherev asher veyad-yvoav vayakhehu vah el-hachomesh vayishefokhe meayv aretsah velo-shanah lvo vayamot veyvoav vaaviyshay achiyv radaf acharey sheva ven-vikheriy

Hebrew: וְאִישׁ֙ עָמַ֣ד עָלָ֔יו מִֽנַּעֲרֵ֖י יוֹאָ֑ב וַיֹּ֗אמֶר מִי֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר חָפֵ֧ץ בְּיוֹאָ֛ב וּמִ֥י אֲשֶׁר־לְדָוִ֖ד אַחֲרֵ֥י יוֹאָֽב׃
Translated: while one of Joab’s henchmen stood by the corpse and called out, “Whoever favors Joab, and whoever is on David’s side, follow Joab!”
Transliteration: veiysh amad alayv minaarey yvoav vayomer miy asher chafets veyvoav umiy asher-ledavid acharey yvoav

Hebrew: וַעֲמָשָׂ֛א מִתְגֹּלֵ֥ל בַּדָּ֖ם בְּת֣וֹךְ הַֽמְסִלָּ֑ה וַיַּ֨רְא הָאִ֜ישׁ כִּֽי־עָמַ֣ד כׇּל־הָעָ֗ם וַיַּסֵּב֩ אֶת־עֲמָשָׂ֨א מִן־הַֽמְסִלָּ֤ה הַשָּׂדֶה֙ וַיַּשְׁלֵ֤ךְ עָלָיו֙ בֶּ֔גֶד כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר רָאָ֔ה כׇּל־הַבָּ֥א עָלָ֖יו וְעָמָֽד׃
Translated: Amasa lay in the middle of the road, drenched in his blood; and the man saw that everyone stopped. And when he saw that all the people were stopping, he dragged Amasa from the road into the field and covered him with a garment.
Transliteration: vaamasha mitegolel vadam vetvokhe hamesilah vayare haiysh khiy-amad khׇl-haam vayasev et-amasha min-hamesilah hashadeh vayashelekhe alayv veged khaasher raah khׇl-hava alayv veamad

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הֹגָ֖ה מִן־הַֽמְסִלָּ֑ה עָבַ֤ר כׇּל־אִישׁ֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י יוֹאָ֔ב לִרְדֹּ֕ף אַחֲרֵ֖י שֶׁ֥בַע בֶּן־בִּכְרִֽי׃
Translated: Once he was removed from the road, everybody continued to follow Joab in pursuit of Sheba son of Bichri.
Transliteration: khaasher hogah min-hamesilah avar khׇl-iysh acharey yvoav liredof acharey sheva ven-vikheriy

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲבֹ֞ר בְּכׇל־שִׁבְטֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אָבֵ֛לָה וּבֵ֥ית מַעֲכָ֖ה וְכׇל־הַבֵּרִ֑ים {ס} (ויקלהו) [וַיִּקָּ֣הֲל֔וּ] וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ אַף־אַחֲרָֽיו׃
Translated: [Sheba] had passed through all the tribes of Israel up to Abel of Beth-maacah; and all the Beerites assembled and followed him inside.
Transliteration: vayaavor vekhׇl-shivetey yisherael avelah uveyt maakhah vekhׇl-haveriym {s} (vyklhv) [vayikahalu] vayavou af-acharayv

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ וַיָּצֻ֣רוּ עָלָ֗יו בְּאָבֵ֙לָה֙ בֵּ֣ית הַֽמַּעֲכָ֔ה וַיִּשְׁפְּכ֤וּ סֹֽלְלָה֙ אֶל־הָעִ֔יר וַֽתַּעֲמֹ֖ד בַּחֵ֑ל וְכׇל־הָעָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֶת־יוֹאָ֔ב מַשְׁחִיתִ֖ם לְהַפִּ֥יל הַחוֹמָֽה׃
Translated:
[Joab’s men] came and besieged him in Abel of Beth-maacah; they threw up a siege mound against the city and it stood against the rampart.
All the troops with Joab were engaged in battering the wall,
Transliteration: vayavou vayatsuru alayv veavelah veyt hamaakhah vayishefekhu solelah el-haiyr vataamod vachel vekhׇl-haam asher et-yvoav mashechiytim lehafiyl hachvomah

Hebrew: וַתִּקְרָ֛א אִשָּׁ֥ה חֲכָמָ֖ה מִן־הָעִ֑יר שִׁמְע֤וּ שִׁמְעוּ֙ אִמְרוּ־נָ֣א אֶל־יוֹאָ֔ב קְרַ֣ב עַד־הֵ֔נָּה וַאֲדַבְּרָ֖ה אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: when a woman who was wise shouted from the city, “Listen! Listen! Tell Joab to come over here so I can talk to him.”
Transliteration: vatikera ishah chakhamah min-haiyr shimeu shimeu imeru-na el-yvoav kerav ad-henah vaadaverah eleykha

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרַ֣ב אֵלֶ֔יהָ וַתֹּ֧אמֶר הָאִשָּׁ֛ה הַאַתָּ֥ה יוֹאָ֖ב וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אָ֑נִי וַתֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ שְׁמַע֙ דִּבְרֵ֣י אֲמָתֶ֔ךָ וַיֹּ֖אמֶר שֹׁמֵ֥עַ אָנֹֽכִי׃
Translated: He approached her, and the woman asked, “Are you Joab?” “Yes,” he answered; and she said to him, “Listen to what your handmaid has to say.” “I’m listening,” he replied.
Transliteration: vayikerav eleyha vatomer haishah haatah yvoav vayomer aniy vatomer lvo shema diverey amatekha vayomer shomea anokhiy

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֖אמֶר לֵאמֹ֑ר דַּבֵּ֨ר יְדַבְּר֤וּ בָרִֽאשֹׁנָה֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר שָׁא֧וֹל יְשָׁאֲל֛וּ בְּאָבֵ֖ל וְכֵ֥ן הֵתַֽמּוּ׃
Translated: And she continued, “In olden times people used to say, ‘Let them inquire of Abel,’ and that was the end of the matter.
Transliteration: vatomer lemor daver yedaveru varishonah lemor shavol yeshaalu veavel vekhen hetamu

Hebrew: אָנֹכִ֕י שְׁלֻמֵ֖י אֱמוּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אַתָּ֣ה מְבַקֵּ֗שׁ לְהָמִ֨ית עִ֤יר וְאֵם֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לָ֥מָּה תְבַלַּ֖ע נַחֲלַ֥ת יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: I am one of those who seek the welfare of the faithful in Israel. But you seek to bring death upon a mother city in Israel! Why should you destroy G<small>OD</small>’s possession?”
Transliteration: anokhiy shelumey emuney yisherael atah mevakesh lehamiyt iyr veem veyisherael lamah tevala nachalat yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַן יוֹאָ֖ב וַיֹּאמַ֑ר חָלִ֤ילָה חָלִ֙ילָה֙ לִ֔י אִם־אֲבַלַּ֖ע וְאִם־אַשְׁחִֽית׃
Translated: Joab replied, “Far be it, far be it from me to destroy or to ruin!
Transliteration: vayaan yvoav vayomar chaliylah chaliylah liy im-avala veim-ashechiyt

Hebrew: לֹא־כֵ֣ן הַדָּבָ֗ר כִּ֡י אִישׁ֩ מֵהַ֨ר אֶפְרַ֜יִם שֶׁ֧בַע בֶּן־בִּכְרִ֣י שְׁמ֗וֹ נָשָׂ֤א יָדוֹ֙ בַּמֶּ֣לֶךְ בְּדָוִ֔ד תְּנוּ־אֹת֣וֹ לְבַדּ֔וֹ וְאֵלְכָ֖ה מֵעַ֣ל הָעִ֑יר וַתֹּ֤אמֶר הָאִשָּׁה֙ אֶל־יוֹאָ֔ב הִנֵּ֥ה רֹאשׁ֛וֹ מֻשְׁלָ֥ךְ אֵלֶ֖יךָ בְּעַ֥ד הַחוֹמָֽה׃
Translated: Not at all! But a certain man from the hill country of Ephraim, named Sheba son of Bichri, has rebelled against King David. Just hand him alone over to us, and I will withdraw from the city.” The woman assured Joab, “His head shall be thrown over the wall to you.”
Transliteration: lo-khen hadavar khiy iysh mehar eferayiim sheva ven-vikheriy shemvo nasha yadvo vamelekhe vedavid tenu-otvo levadvo veelekhah meal haiyr vatomer haishah el-yvoav hineh roshvo mushelakhe eleykha vead hachvomah

Hebrew: וַתָּבוֹא֩ הָאִשָּׁ֨ה אֶל־כׇּל־הָעָ֜ם בְּחׇכְמָתָ֗הּ וַֽיִּכְרְת֞וּ אֶת־רֹ֨אשׁ שֶׁ֤בַע בֶּן־בִּכְרִי֙ וַיַּשְׁלִ֣כוּ אֶל־יוֹאָ֔ב וַיִּתְקַע֙ בַּשֹּׁפָ֔ר וַיָּפֻ֥צוּ מֵעַל־הָעִ֖יר אִ֣ישׁ לְאֹהָלָ֑יו וְיוֹאָ֛ב שָׁ֥ב יְרוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם אֶל־הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: The woman came to all the people with her wise plan; and they cut off the head of Sheba son of Bichri and threw it down to Joab. He then sounded the horn; those attacking the city dispersed to their homes, and Joab returned to the king in Jerusalem.
Transliteration: vatavvo haishah el-khׇl-haam vechׇkhematah vayikheretu et-rosh sheva ven-vikheriy vayashelikhu el-yvoav vayiteka vashofar vayafutsu meal-haiyr iysh leohalayv veyvoav shav yerushala͏im el-hamelekhe {s}

Hebrew: וְיוֹאָ֕ב אֶ֥ל כׇּל־הַצָּבָ֖א יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּבְנָיָה֙ בֶּן־יְה֣וֹיָדָ֔ע עַל־(הכרי) [הַכְּרֵתִ֖י] וְעַל־הַפְּלֵתִֽי׃
Translated: Joab was commander of the whole army [of] Israel; Benaiah son of Jehoiada was commander of the Cherethites and the Pelethites;
Transliteration: veyvoav el khׇl-hatsava yisherael uvenayah ven-yehvoyada al-(hkhry) [hakheretiy] veal-hafeletiy

Hebrew: וַאֲדֹרָ֖ם עַל־הַמַּ֑ס וִיהוֹשָׁפָ֥ט בֶּן־אֲחִיל֖וּד הַמַּזְכִּֽיר׃
Translated: Adoram was in charge of forced labor; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was recorder;
Transliteration: vaadoram al-hamas viyhvoshafat ven-achiylud hamazekhiyr

Hebrew: (ושיא) [וּשְׁוָ֖א] סֹפֵ֑ר וְצָד֥וֹק וְאֶבְיָתָ֖ר כֹּהֲנִֽים׃
Translated: Sheva was scribe; and Zadok and Abiathar were priests.
Transliteration: (vshy) [usheva] sofer vetsadvok veeveyatar khohaniym

Hebrew: וְגַ֗ם עִירָא֙ הַיָּ֣אִרִ֔י הָיָ֥ה כֹהֵ֖ן לְדָוִֽד׃ {ס}
Translated: Ira the Jairite also served David as priest.
Transliteration: vegam iyra hayairiy hayah khohen ledavid {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י רָעָב֩ בִּימֵ֨י דָוִ֜ד שָׁלֹ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֗ים שָׁנָה֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י שָׁנָ֔ה וַיְבַקֵּ֥שׁ דָּוִ֖ד אֶת־פְּנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה {ס} וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶל־שָׁאוּל֙ וְאֶל־בֵּ֣ית הַדָּמִ֔ים עַ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־הֵמִ֖ית אֶת־הַגִּבְעֹנִֽים׃
Translated: There was a famine during the reign of David, year after year for three years. David inquired of G<small>OD</small>, and G<small>OD</small> replied, “It is because of the bloodguilt of Saul and [his] house, for he put some Gibeonites to death.”
Transliteration: vayehiy raav viymey david shalosh shaniym shanah acharey shanah vayevakesh david et-feney yehovah {s} vayomer yehovah el-shaul veel-veyt hadamiym al asher-hemiyt et-hagiveoniym

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֥א הַמֶּ֛לֶךְ לַגִּבְעֹנִ֖ים וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וְהַגִּבְעֹנִ֞ים לֹ֣א מִבְּנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל הֵ֗מָּה כִּ֚י אִם־מִיֶּ֣תֶר הָאֱמֹרִ֔י וּבְנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ נִשְׁבְּע֣וּ לָהֶ֔ם וַיְבַקֵּ֤שׁ שָׁאוּל֙ לְהַכֹּתָ֔ם בְּקַנֹּאת֥וֹ לִבְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וִיהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: The king summoned the Gibeonites and spoke to them.—Now the Gibeonites were not of Israelite stock, but a remnant of the Amorites, to whom the Israelites had given an oath; and Saul had tried to wipe them out in his zeal for the people of Israel and Judah.—
Transliteration: vayikera hamelekhe lagiveoniym vayomer aleyhem vehagiveoniym lo miveney yisherael hemah khiy im-miyeter haemoriy uveney yisherael nisheveu lahem vayevakesh shaul lehakhotam vekanotvo liveney-yisherael viyhudah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר דָּוִד֙ אֶל־הַגִּבְעֹנִ֔ים מָ֥ה אֶעֱשֶׂ֖ה לָכֶ֑ם וּבַמָּ֣ה אֲכַפֵּ֔ר וּבָרְכ֖וּ אֶת־נַחֲלַ֥ת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: David asked the Gibeonites, “What shall I do for you? How shall I make expiation, so that you may bless G<small>OD</small>’s own people?”
Transliteration: vayomer david el-hagiveoniym mah eesheh lakhem uvamah akhafer uvarekhu et-nachalat yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמְרוּ ל֣וֹ הַגִּבְעֹנִ֗ים אֵֽין־[לָ֜נוּ] (לי) כֶּ֤סֶף וְזָהָב֙ עִם־שָׁא֣וּל וְעִם־בֵּית֔וֹ וְאֵֽין־לָ֥נוּ אִ֖ישׁ לְהָמִ֣ית בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֹּ֛אמֶר מָה־אַתֶּ֥ם אֹמְרִ֖ים אֶעֱשֶׂ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: The Gibeonites answered him, “We have no claim for silver or gold against Saul and his household; and we have no claim on the life of anyone else in Israel.” And [David] responded, “Whatever you say I will do for you.”
Transliteration: vayomeru lvo hagiveoniym eyn-[lanu] (ly) khesef vezahav im-shaul veim-veytvo veeyn-lanu iysh lehamiyt veyisherael vayomer mah-atem omeriym eesheh lakhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ הָאִישׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר כִּלָּ֔נוּ וַאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּמָּה־לָ֑נוּ נִשְׁמַ֕דְנוּ מֵהִתְיַצֵּ֖ב בְּכׇל־גְּבֻ֥ל יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Thereupon they said to the king, “The man who massacred us and planned to exterminate us, so that we should not survive in all the territory of Israel—
Transliteration: vayomeru el-hamelekhe haiysh asher khilanu vaasher dimah-lanu nishemadenu mehiteyatsev vekhׇl-gevul yisherael

Hebrew:
(ינתן) [יֻתַּן־]לָ֜נוּ שִׁבְעָ֤ה אֲנָשִׁים֙ מִבָּנָ֔יו וְהוֹקַֽעֲנוּם֙ לַיהֹוָ֔ה בְּגִבְעַ֥ת שָׁא֖וּל בְּחִ֣יר יְהֹוָ֑ה {פ}
וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֲנִ֥י אֶתֵּֽן׃
Translated: let seven of his male issue be handed over to us, and we will impale them before G<small>OD</small> in Gibeah of Saul, the chosen of G<small>OD</small>.” And the king replied, “I will do so.”
Transliteration:
(yntn) [yutan-]lanu shiveah anashiym mivanayv vehvokaanum layhovah vegiveat shaul vechiyr yehovah {f}
vayomer hamelekhe aniy eten

Hebrew: וַיַּחְמֹ֣ל הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ עַל־מְפִיבֹ֖שֶׁת בֶּן־יְהוֹנָתָ֣ן בֶּן־שָׁא֑וּל עַל־שְׁבֻעַ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בֵּינֹתָ֔ם בֵּ֣ין דָּוִ֔ד וּבֵ֖ין יְהוֹנָתָ֥ן בֶּן־שָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: The king spared Mephibosheth son of Jonathan son of Saul, because of the oath before G<small>OD</small> between the two, between David and Jonathan son of Saul.
Transliteration: vayachemol hamelekhe al-mefiyvoshet ven-yehvonatan ven-shaul al-shevuat yehovah asher veynotam veyn david uveyn yehvonatan ven-shaul

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח הַמֶּ֡לֶךְ אֶת־שְׁ֠נֵ֠י בְּנֵ֨י רִצְפָּ֤ה בַת־אַיָּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָלְדָ֣ה לְשָׁא֔וּל אֶת־אַרְמֹנִ֖י וְאֶת־מְפִבֹ֑שֶׁת וְאֶת־חֲמֵ֗שֶׁת בְּנֵי֙ מִיכַ֣ל בַּת־שָׁא֔וּל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָלְדָ֛ה לְעַדְרִיאֵ֥ל בֶּן־בַּרְזִלַּ֖י הַמְּחֹלָתִֽי׃
Translated: Instead, the king took Armoni and Mephibosheth, the two sons that Rizpah daughter of Aiah bore to Saul, and the five sons that Merab daughter of Saul bore to Adriel son of Barzillai the Meholathite,
Transliteration: vayikach hamelekhe et-sheney veney ritsefah vat-ayah asher yaledah leshaul et-aremoniy veet-mefivoshet veet-chameshet veney miykhal vat-shaul asher yaledah leaderiyel ven-varezilay hamecholatiy

Hebrew: וַֽיִּתְּנֵ֞ם בְּיַ֣ד הַגִּבְעֹנִ֗ים וַיֹּקִיעֻ֤ם בָּהָר֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וַיִּפְּל֥וּ (שבעתים) [שְׁבַעְתָּ֖ם] יָ֑חַד (והם) [וְהֵ֨מָּה] הֻמְת֜וּ בִּימֵ֤י קָצִיר֙ בָּרִ֣אשֹׁנִ֔ים (תחלת) [בִּתְחִלַּ֖ת] קְצִ֥יר שְׂעֹרִֽים׃
Translated: and he handed them over to the Gibeonites. They impaled them on the mountain before G<small>OD</small>; all seven of them perished at the same time. They were put to death in the first days of the harvest, the beginning of the barley harvest.
Transliteration: vayitenem veyad hagiveoniym vayokiyum vahar lifeney yehovah vayifelu (shvtym) [shevaetam] yachad (vhm) [vehemah] humetu viymey katsiyr varishoniym (tchlt) [vitechilat] ketsiyr sheoriym

Hebrew: וַתִּקַּ֣ח רִצְפָּה֩ בַת־אַיָּ֨ה אֶת־הַשַּׂ֜ק וַתַּטֵּ֨הוּ לָ֤הּ אֶל־הַצּוּר֙ מִתְּחִלַּ֣ת קָצִ֔יר עַ֛ד נִתַּךְ־מַ֥יִם עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם מִן־הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְלֹֽא־נָתְנָה֩ ע֨וֹף הַשָּׁמַ֜יִם לָנ֤וּחַ עֲלֵיהֶם֙ יוֹמָ֔ם וְאֶת־חַיַּ֥ת הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה לָֽיְלָה׃
Translated: Then Rizpah daughter of Aiah took sackcloth and spread it on a rock for herself, and she stayed there from the beginning of the harvest until rain from the sky fell on the bodies; she did not let the birds of the sky settle on them by day or the wild beasts [approach] by night.
Transliteration: vatikach ritsefah vat-ayah et-hashak vatatehu lah el-hatsur mitechilat katsiyr ad nitakhe-mayiim aleyhem min-hashamayiim velo-natenah vof hashamayiim lanucha aleyhem yvomam veet-chayat hashadeh layelah

Hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֖ד לְדָוִ֑ד אֵ֧ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשְׂתָ֛ה רִצְפָּ֥ה בַת־אַיָּ֖ה פִּלֶ֥גֶשׁ שָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: David was told what Saul’s concubine Rizpah daughter of Aiah had done.
Transliteration: vayugad ledavid et asher-ashetah ritsefah vat-ayah filegesh shaul

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣לֶךְ דָּוִ֗ד וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־עַצְמ֤וֹת שָׁאוּל֙ וְאֶת־עַצְמוֹת֙ יְהוֹנָתָ֣ן בְּנ֔וֹ מֵאֵ֕ת בַּעֲלֵ֖י יָבֵ֣ישׁ גִּלְעָ֑ד אֲשֶׁר֩ גָּנְב֨וּ אֹתָ֜ם מֵרְחֹ֣ב בֵּֽית־שַׁ֗ן אֲשֶׁ֨ר (תלום שם הפלשתים) [תְּלָא֥וּם שָׁ֙מָּה֙ פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים] בְּי֨וֹם הַכּ֧וֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּ֛ים אֶת־שָׁא֖וּל בַּגִּלְבֹּֽעַ׃
Translated: And David went and took the bones of Saul and of his son Jonathan from the citizens of Jabesh-gilead, who had made off with them from the public square of Beth-shan, where the Philistines had hung them up on the day the Philistines killed Saul at Gilboa.
Transliteration: vayelekhe david vayikach et-atsemvot shaul veet-atsemvot yehvonatan venvo meet vaaley yaveysh gilead asher ganevu otam merechov veyt-shan asher (tlvm shm hflshtym) [telaum shamah felishetiym] veyvom hakhvot felishetiym et-shaul vagilevoa

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַל מִשָּׁם֙ אֶת־עַצְמ֣וֹת שָׁא֔וּל וְאֶת־עַצְמ֖וֹת יְהוֹנָתָ֣ן בְּנ֑וֹ וַיַּ֣אַסְפ֔וּ אֶת־עַצְמ֖וֹת הַמּוּקָעִֽים׃
Translated: He brought up the bones of Saul and of his son Jonathan from there; and he gathered the bones of those who had been impaled.
Transliteration: vayaal misham et-atsemvot shaul veet-atsemvot yehvonatan venvo vayaasefu et-atsemvot hamukaiym

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבְּר֣וּ אֶת־עַצְמוֹת־שָׁא֣וּל וִיהוֹנָֽתָן־בְּ֠נ֠וֹ בְּאֶ֨רֶץ בִּנְיָמִ֜ן בְּצֵלָ֗ע בְּקֶ֙בֶר֙ קִ֣ישׁ אָבִ֔יו וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֔וּ כֹּ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֖ה הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַיֵּעָתֵ֧ר אֱלֹהִ֛ים לָאָ֖רֶץ אַחֲרֵי־כֵֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: And they buried the bones of Saul and of his son Jonathan in Zela, in the territory of Benjamin, in the tomb of his father Kish. And when all that the king had commanded was done, God responded to the plea of the land thereafter.
Transliteration: vayikeveru et-atsemvot-shaul viyhvonatan-venvo veerets vineyamin vetsela vekever kiysh aviyv vayaashu khol asher-tsivah hamelekhe vayeater Elohim laarets acharey-khen {f}

Hebrew: וַתְּהִי־ע֧וֹד מִלְחָמָ֛ה לַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֵּ֨רֶד דָּוִ֜ד וַעֲבָדָ֥יו עִמּ֛וֹ וַיִּלָּחֲמ֥וּ אֶת־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים וַיָּ֥עַף דָּוִֽד׃
Translated: Again war broke out between the Philistines and Israel, and David and the men with him went down and fought the Philistines; David grew weary,
Transliteration: vatehiy-vod milechamah lafelishetiym et-yisherael vayered david vaavadayv imvo vayilachamu et-felishetiym vayaaf david

Hebrew: (וישבו) [וְיִשְׁבִּ֨י] בְנֹ֜ב אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ בִּילִידֵ֣י הָרָפָ֗ה וּמִשְׁקַ֤ל קֵינוֹ֙ שְׁלֹ֤שׁ מֵאוֹת֙ מִשְׁקַ֣ל נְחֹ֔שֶׁת וְה֖וּא חָג֣וּר חֲדָשָׁ֑ה וַיֹּ֖אמֶר לְהַכּ֥וֹת אֶת־דָּוִֽד׃
Translated: and Ishbi-benob tried to kill David.—He was a descendant of the Raphah; his bronze spear weighed three hundred shekels and he wore new armor.—
Transliteration: (vyshvv) [veyisheviy] venov asher viyliydey harafah umishekal keynvo shelosh mevot mishekal nechoshet vehu chagur chadashah vayomer lehakhvot et-david

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲזׇר־לוֹ֙ אֲבִישַׁ֣י בֶּן־צְרוּיָ֔ה וַיַּ֥ךְ אֶת־הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֖י וַיְמִתֵ֑הוּ אָ֣ז נִשְׁבְּעוּ֩ אַנְשֵֽׁי־דָוִ֨ד ל֜וֹ לֵאמֹ֗ר לֹא־תֵצֵ֨א ע֤וֹד אִתָּ֙נוּ֙ לַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וְלֹ֥א תְכַבֶּ֖ה אֶת־נֵ֥ר יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: But Abishai son of Zeruiah came to his aid; he attacked the Philistine and killed him. It was then that David’s men declared to him on oath, “You shall not go with us into battle anymore, lest you extinguish the lamp of Israel!”
Transliteration: vayaazׇr-lvo aviyshay ven-tseruyah vayakhe et-hafelishetiy vayemitehu az nisheveu aneshey-david lvo lemor lo-tetse vod itanu lamilechamah velo tekhaveh et-ner yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ אַֽחֲרֵי־כֵ֔ן וַתְּהִי־ע֧וֹד הַמִּלְחָמָ֛ה בְּג֖וֹב עִם־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים אָ֣ז הִכָּ֗ה סִבְּכַי֙ הַחֻ֣שָׁתִ֔י אֶת־סַ֕ף אֲשֶׁ֖ר בִּילִדֵ֥י הָרָפָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: After this, fighting broke out again with the Philistines, at Gob; that was when Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Saph, a descendant of the Raphah.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey-khen vatehiy-vod hamilechamah vegvov im-felishetiym az hikhah sivekhay hachushatiy et-saf asher viylidey harafah {s}

Hebrew: וַתְּהִי־ע֧וֹד הַמִּלְחָמָ֛ה בְּג֖וֹב עִם־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַיַּ֡ךְ אֶלְחָנָן֩ בֶּן־יַעְרֵ֨י אֹרְגִ֜ים בֵּ֣ית הַלַּחְמִ֗י אֵ֚ת גׇּלְיָ֣ת הַגִּתִּ֔י וְעֵ֣ץ חֲנִית֔וֹ כִּמְנ֖וֹר אֹרְגִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: Again there was fighting with the Philistines at Gob; and Elhanan son of Jaare-oregim the Bethlehemite killed Goliath the Gittite, whose spear had a shaft like a weaver’s bar.
Transliteration: vatehiy-vod hamilechamah vegvov im-felishetiym vayakhe elechanan ven-yaerey oregiym veyt halachemiy et gׇleyat hagitiy veets chaniytvo khimenvor oregiym {s}

Hebrew: וַתְּהִי־ע֥וֹד מִלְחָמָ֖ה בְּגַ֑ת וַיְהִ֣י ׀ אִ֣ישׁ (מדין) [מָד֗וֹן] וְאֶצְבְּעֹ֣ת יָדָיו֩ וְאֶצְבְּעֹ֨ת רַגְלָ֜יו שֵׁ֣שׁ וָשֵׁ֗שׁ עֶשְׂרִ֤ים וְאַרְבַּע֙ מִסְפָּ֔ר וְגַם־ה֖וּא יֻלַּ֥ד לְהָרָפָֽה׃
Translated: Once again there was fighting, at Gath. There was a giant of a man who had six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot, twenty-four in all; he too was descended from the Raphah.
Transliteration: vatehiy-vod milechamah vegat vayehiy iysh (mdyn) [madvon] veetseveot yadayv veetseveot ragelayv shesh vashesh esheriym veareva misefar vegam-hu yulad leharafah

Hebrew: וַיְחָרֵ֖ף אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיַּכֵּ֙הוּ֙ יְה֣וֹנָתָ֔ן בֶּן־[שִׁמְעָ֖ה] (שמעי) אֲחִ֥י דָוִֽד׃
Translated: When he taunted Israel, Jonathan, the son of David’s brother Shimei, killed him.
Transliteration: vayecharef et-yisherael vayakhehu yehvonatan ven-[shimeah] (shmy) achiy david

Hebrew: אֶת־אַרְבַּ֥עַת אֵ֛לֶּה יֻלְּד֥וּ לְהָרָפָ֖ה בְּגַ֑ת וַיִּפְּל֥וּ בְיַד־דָּוִ֖ד וּבְיַ֥ד עֲבָדָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Those four were descended from the Raphah in Gath, and they fell by the hands of David and his men.
Transliteration: et-arevaat eleh yuledu leharafah vegat vayifelu veyad-david uveyad avadayv {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר דָּוִד֙ לַיהֹוָ֔ה אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֖י הַשִּׁירָ֣ה הַזֹּ֑את בְּיוֹם֩ הִצִּ֨יל יְהֹוָ֥ה אֹת֛וֹ מִכַּ֥ף כׇּל־אֹיְבָ֖יו וּמִכַּ֥ף שָׁאֽוּל׃
Translated: David addressed the words of this song to G<small>OD</small>, after G<small>OD</small> had saved him from the hands of all his enemies and from the hands of Saul.
Transliteration: vayedaver david layhovah et-diverey hashiyrah hazot veyvom hitsiyl yehovah otvo mikhaf khׇl-oyevayv umikhaf shaul

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֑ר יְהֹוָ֛ה סַֽלְעִ֥י וּמְצֻדָתִ֖י וּמְפַלְטִי־לִֽי׃
Translated:
He said:
O ETERNAL One, my crag, my fortress, my deliverer!
Transliteration: vayomar yehovah saleiy umetsudatiy umefaletiy-liy

Hebrew: אֱלֹהֵ֥י צוּרִ֖י אֶחֱסֶה־בּ֑וֹ מָגִנִּ֞י וְקֶ֣רֶן יִשְׁעִ֗י מִשְׂגַּבִּי֙ וּמְנוּסִ֔י מֹשִׁעִ֕י מֵחָמָ֖ס תֹּשִׁעֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
O God, the rock in which I take shelter:
My shield, my mighty champion, my haven and refuge!
My savior, You who rescue me from violence!
Transliteration: elohey tsuriy echeseh-vvo maginiy vekeren yisheiy mishegaviy umenusiy moshiiy mechamas toshieniy

Hebrew: מְהֻלָּ֖ל אֶקְרָ֣א יְהֹוָ֑ה וּמֵאֹיְבַ֖י אִוָּשֵֽׁעַ׃
Translated:
All praise! I called on GOD
And was delivered from my enemies.
Transliteration: mehulal ekera yehovah umeoyevay ivashea

Hebrew: כִּ֥י אֲפָפֻ֖נִי מִשְׁבְּרֵי־מָ֑וֶת נַחֲלֵ֥י בְלִיַּ֖עַל יְבַעֲתֻֽנִי׃
Translated:
For the breakers of Death encompassed me,
The torrents of Belial terrified me;
Transliteration: khiy afafuniy misheverey-mavet nachaley veliyaal yevaatuniy

Hebrew: חֶבְלֵ֥י שְׁא֖וֹל סַבֻּ֑נִי קִדְּמֻ֖נִי מֹ֥קְשֵׁי מָֽוֶת׃
Translated:
The ropes of Sheol encircled me,
The snares of Death engulfed me.
Transliteration: cheveley shevol savuniy kidemuniy mokeshey mavet

Hebrew: בַּצַּר־לִי֙ אֶקְרָ֣א יְהֹוָ֔ה וְאֶל־אֱלֹהַ֖י אֶקְרָ֑א וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע מֵהֵֽיכָלוֹ֙ קוֹלִ֔י וְשַׁוְעָתִ֖י בְּאׇזְנָֽיו׃
Translated:
In my anguish I called on the ETERNAL,
Cried out to my God,
Who from a heavenly abode heard my voice,
Whose ears received my cry.
Transliteration: vatsar-liy ekera yehovah veel-elohay ekera vayishema meheykhalvo kvoliy veshaveatiy veׇzenayv

Hebrew: (ותגעש) [וַיִּתְגָּעַ֤שׁ] וַתִּרְעַשׁ֙ הָאָ֔רֶץ מוֹסְד֥וֹת הַשָּׁמַ֖יִם יִרְגָּ֑זוּ וַיִּֽתְגָּעֲשׁ֖וּ כִּי־חָ֥רָה לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Then the earth rocked and quaked,
The foundations of heaven shook—
Rocked by divine indignation.
Transliteration: (vtgsh) [vayitegaash] vatireash haarets mvosedvot hashamayiim yiregazu vayitegaashu khiy-charah lvo

Hebrew: עָלָ֤ה עָשָׁן֙ בְּאַפּ֔וֹ וְאֵ֥שׁ מִפִּ֖יו תֹּאכֵ֑ל גֶּחָלִ֖ים בָּעֲר֥וּ מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
Smoke went up from God’s nostrils—
Devouring fire from God’s mouth;
Live coals blazing forth.
Transliteration: alah ashan veafvo veesh mifiyv tokhel gechaliym vaaru mimenu

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥ט שָׁמַ֖יִם וַיֵּרַ֑ד וַעֲרָפֶ֖ל תַּ֥חַת רַגְלָֽיו׃
Translated:
[God] bent the sky and came down,
Thick cloud beneath divine feet.
Transliteration: vayet shamayiim vayerad vaarafel tachat ragelayv

Hebrew: וַיִּרְכַּ֥ב עַל־כְּר֖וּב וַיָּעֹ֑ף וַיֵּרָ֖א עַל־כַּנְפֵי־רֽוּחַ׃
Translated:
[God] mounted a cherub and flew,
And was seen on the wings of the wind.
Transliteration: vayirekhav al-kheruv vayaof vayera al-khanefey-rucha

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥שֶׁת חֹ֛שֶׁךְ סְבִיבֹתָ֖יו סֻכּ֑וֹת חַֽשְׁרַת־מַ֖יִם עָבֵ֥י שְׁחָקִֽים׃
Translated:
Pavilions of darkness all around,
Dripping clouds, huge thunderheads;
Transliteration: vayashet choshekhe seviyvotayv sukhvot chasherat-mayiim avey shechakiym

Hebrew: מִנֹּ֖גַהּ נֶגְדּ֑וֹ בָּעֲר֖וּ גַּחֲלֵי־אֵֽשׁ׃
Translated:
In the divine brilliance
Blazed fiery coals.
Transliteration: minogah negedvo vaaru gachaley-esh

Hebrew: יַרְעֵ֥ם מִן־שָׁמַ֖יִם יְהֹוָ֑ה וְעֶלְי֖וֹן יִתֵּ֥ן קוֹלֽוֹ׃
Translated:
GOD thundered from heaven,
The Most High gave forth voice—
Transliteration: yareem min-shamayiim yehovah veeleyvon yiten kvolvo

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֥ח חִצִּ֖ים וַיְפִיצֵ֑ם בָּרָ֖ק (ויהמם) [וַיָּהֹֽם]׃
Translated:
Letting shafts fly, and scattering them;
Lightning, and routing them.
Transliteration: vayishelach chitsiym vayefiytsem varak (vyhmm) [vayahom]

Hebrew: וַיֵּֽרָאוּ֙ אֲפִ֣קֵי יָ֔ם יִגָּל֖וּ מֹסְד֣וֹת תֵּבֵ֑ל בְּגַעֲרַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה מִנִּשְׁמַ֖ת ר֥וּחַ אַפּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The bed of the sea was exposed,
The foundations of the world were laid bare
By the ETERNAL’s mighty roaring,
At the blast of God’s breath.
Transliteration: vayerau afikey yam yigalu mosedvot tevel vegaarat yehovah minishemat rucha afvo

Hebrew: יִשְׁלַ֥ח מִמָּר֖וֹם יִקָּחֵ֑נִי יַֽמְשֵׁ֖נִי מִמַּ֥יִם רַבִּֽים׃
Translated:
Reaching down from on high, [God] took me,
Drawing me out of the mighty waters—
Transliteration: yishelach mimarvom yikacheniy yamesheniy mimayiim raviym

Hebrew: יַצִּילֵ֕נִי מֵאֹיְבִ֖י עָ֑ז מִשֹּׂ֣נְאַ֔י כִּ֥י אָמְצ֖וּ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
Translated:
Rescuing me from my fierce enemy,
From foes too strong for me.
Transliteration: yatsiyleniy meoyeviy az mishoneay khiy ametsu mimeniy

Hebrew: יְקַדְּמֻ֖נִי בְּי֣וֹם אֵידִ֑י וַיְהִ֧י יְהֹוָ֛ה מִשְׁעָ֖ן לִֽי׃
Translated:
They attacked me on my day of calamity,
But GOD was my support.
Transliteration: yekademuniy veyvom eydiy vayehiy yehovah mishean liy

Hebrew: וַיֹּצֵ֥א לַמֶּרְחָ֖ב אֹתִ֑י יְחַלְּצֵ֖נִי כִּי־חָ֥פֵֽץ בִּֽי׃
Translated:
Bringing me out to freedom,
Pleased with me enough to rescue me.
Transliteration: vayotse lamerechav otiy yechaletseniy khiy-chafets viy

Hebrew: יִגְמְלֵ֥נִי יְהֹוָ֖ה כְּצִדְקָתִ֑י כְּבֹ֥ר יָדַ֖י יָשִׁ֥יב לִֽי׃
Translated:
GOD rewarded me according to my merit,
Requiting the cleanness of my hands—
Transliteration: yigemeleniy yehovah khetsidekatiy khevor yaday yashiyv liy

Hebrew: כִּ֥י שָׁמַ֖רְתִּי דַּרְכֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְלֹ֥א רָשַׁ֖עְתִּי מֵאֱלֹהָֽי׃
Translated:
For I have kept to the ways of GOD
And have not been guilty before my God;
Transliteration: khiy shamaretiy darekhey yehovah velo rashaetiy meelohay

Hebrew: כִּ֥י כׇל־מִשְׁפָּטָ֖ו לְנֶגְדִּ֑י וְחֻקֹּתָ֖יו לֹא־אָס֥וּר מִמֶּֽנָּה׃
Translated:
For I am mindful of all God’s rules
And have not departed from God’s laws.
Transliteration: khiy khׇl-mishefatav lenegediy vechukotayv lo-asur mimenah

Hebrew: וָאֶהְיֶ֥ה תָמִ֖ים ל֑וֹ וָאֶשְׁתַּמְּרָ֖ה מֵעֲוֺנִֽי׃
Translated:
I have been blameless before [God],
And have guarded myself against sinning—
Transliteration: vaeheyeh tamiym lvo vaeshetamerah meavoniy

Hebrew: וַיָּ֧שֶׁב יְהֹוָ֛ה לִ֖י כְּצִדְקָתִ֑י כְּבֹרִ֖י לְנֶ֥גֶד עֵינָֽיו׃
Translated:
And GOD has requited my merit
According to my evident cleanness.
Transliteration: vayashev yehovah liy khetsidekatiy khevoriy leneged eynayv

Hebrew: עִם־חָסִ֖יד תִּתְחַסָּ֑ד עִם־גִּבּ֥וֹר תָּמִ֖ים תִּתַּמָּֽם׃
Translated:
With the loyal, You deal loyally;
With the blameless hero, blamelessly.
Transliteration: im-chasiyd titechasad im-givvor tamiym titamam

Hebrew: עִם־נָבָ֖ר תִּתָּבָ֑ר וְעִם־עִקֵּ֖שׁ תִּתַּפָּֽל׃
Translated:
With the pure, You act in purity,
And with the perverse, You are wily.
Transliteration: im-navar titavar veim-ikesh titafal

Hebrew: וְאֶת־עַ֥ם עָנִ֖י תּוֹשִׁ֑יעַ וְעֵינֶ֥יךָ עַל־רָמִ֖ים תַּשְׁפִּֽיל׃
Translated:
To lowly folk You give victory,
And You look with scorn on the haughty.
Transliteration: veet-am aniy tvoshiya veeyneykha al-ramiym tashefiyl

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתָּ֥ה נֵירִ֖י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיהֹוָ֖ה יַגִּ֥יהַּ חׇשְׁכִּֽי׃
Translated:
You, O ETERNAL One, are my lamp;
GOD lights up my darkness.
Transliteration: khiy-atah neyriy yehovah vayhovah yagiyha chׇshekhiy

Hebrew: כִּ֥י בְכָ֖ה אָר֣וּץ גְּד֑וּד בֵּאלֹהַ֖י אֲדַלֶּג־שֽׁוּר׃
Translated:
With You, I can rush a barrier;
With my God, I can scale a wall.
Transliteration: khiy vekhah aruts gedud velohay adaleg-shur

Hebrew: הָאֵ֖ל תָּמִ֣ים דַּרְכּ֑וֹ אִמְרַ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ צְרוּפָ֔ה מָגֵ֣ן ה֔וּא לְכֹ֖ל הַחֹסִ֥ים בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
The way of God is perfect,
The word of the ETERNAL is pure.
[God] shields all who seek refuge.
Transliteration: hael tamiym darekhvo imerat yehovah tserufah magen hu lekhol hachosiym vvo

Hebrew: כִּ֥י מִי־אֵ֖ל מִבַּלְעֲדֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וּמִ֥י צ֖וּר מִֽבַּלְעֲדֵ֥י אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated:
Truly, who is a god except the ETERNAL,
Who is a rock except our God?—
Transliteration: khiy miy-el mivaleadey yehovah umiy tsur mivaleadey eloheynu

Hebrew: הָאֵ֥ל מָעוּזִּ֖י חָ֑יִל וַיַּתֵּ֥ר תָּמִ֖ים (דרכו) [דַּרְכִּֽי]׃
Translated:
The God, my mighty stronghold,
Who kept my path secure;
Transliteration: hael mauziy chayiil vayater tamiym (drkhv) [darekhiy]

Hebrew: מְשַׁוֶּ֥ה (רגליו) [רַגְלַ֖י] כָּאַיָּל֑וֹת וְעַ֥ל בָּמֹתַ֖י יַעֲמִדֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Who made my legs like a deer’s,
And set me firmly on the heights;
Transliteration: meshaveh (rglyv) [ragelay] khaayalvot veal vamotay yaamideniy

Hebrew: מְלַמֵּ֥ד יָדַ֖י לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה וְנִחַ֥ת קֶשֶׁת־נְחוּשָׁ֖ה זְרֹעֹתָֽי׃
Translated:
Who trained my hands for battle—
My arms can bend a bow of bronze!
Transliteration: melamed yaday lamilechamah venichat keshet-nechushah zerootay

Hebrew: וַתִּתֶּן־לִ֖י מָגֵ֣ן יִשְׁעֶ֑ךָ וַעֲנֹתְךָ֖ תַּרְבֵּֽנִי׃
Translated:
You have granted me the shield of Your protection
And Your providence has made me great.
Transliteration: vatiten-liy magen yisheekha vaanotekha tareveniy

Hebrew: תַּרְחִ֥יב צַעֲדִ֖י תַּחְתֵּ֑נִי וְלֹ֥א מָעֲד֖וּ קַרְסֻלָּֽי׃
Translated:
You have let me stride on freely;
My feet have not slipped.
Transliteration: tarechiyv tsaadiy tacheteniy velo maadu karesulay

Hebrew: אֶרְדְּפָ֥ה אֹיְבַ֖י וָאַשְׁמִידֵ֑ם וְלֹ֥א אָשׁ֖וּב עַד־כַּלּוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
I pursued my enemies and wiped them out,
I did not turn back till I destroyed them.
Transliteration: eredefah oyevay vaashemiydem velo ashuv ad-khalvotam

Hebrew: וָאֲכַלֵּ֥ם וָאֶמְחָצֵ֖ם וְלֹ֣א יְקוּמ֑וּן וַֽיִּפְּל֖וּ תַּ֥חַת רַגְלָֽי׃
Translated:
I destroyed them, I struck them down;
They rose no more, they lay at my feet.
Transliteration: vaakhalem vaemechatsem velo yekumun vayifelu tachat ragelay

Hebrew: וַתַּזְרֵ֥נִי חַ֖יִל לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה תַּכְרִ֥יעַ קָמַ֖י תַּחְתֵּֽנִי׃
Translated:
You have girded me with strength for battle,
Brought low my adversaries before me,
Transliteration: vatazereniy chayiil lamilechamah takheriya kamay tacheteniy

Hebrew: וְאֹ֣יְבַ֔י תַּ֥תָּה לִּ֖י עֹ֑רֶף מְשַׂנְאַ֖י וָאַצְמִיתֵֽם׃
Translated:
Made my enemies turn tail before me,
My foes—and I wiped them out.
Transliteration: veoyevay tatah liy oref meshaneay vaatsemiytem

Hebrew: יִשְׁע֖וּ וְאֵ֣ין מֹשִׁ֑יעַ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה וְלֹ֥א עָנָֽם׃
Translated:
They looked, but there was none to deliver;
To GOD, who did not answer them.
Transliteration: yisheu veeyn moshiya el-yehovah velo anam

Hebrew: וְאֶשְׁחָקֵ֖ם כַּעֲפַר־אָ֑רֶץ כְּטִיט־חוּצ֥וֹת אֲדִקֵּ֖ם אֶרְקָעֵֽם׃
Translated:
I pounded them like dust of the earth,
Stamped, crushed them like dirt of the streets.
Transliteration: veeshechakem khaafar-arets khetiyt-chutsvot adikem erekaem

Hebrew: וַֽתְּפַלְּטֵ֔נִי מֵרִיבֵ֖י עַמִּ֑י תִּשְׁמְרֵ֙נִי֙ לְרֹ֣אשׁ גּוֹיִ֔ם עַ֥ם לֹא־יָדַ֖עְתִּי יַעַבְדֻֽנִי׃
Translated:
You have rescued me from the strife of peoples,
Kept me to be at the head of nations;
Peoples I knew not must serve me.
Transliteration: vatefaleteniy meriyvey amiy tishemereniy lerosh gvoyim am lo-yadaetiy yaaveduniy

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י נֵכָ֖ר יִתְכַּחֲשׁוּ־לִ֑י לִשְׁמ֥וֹעַ אֹ֖זֶן יִשָּׁ֥מְעוּ לִֽי׃
Translated:
Foreign peoples cringe before me,
Are submissive at the mere report of me.
Transliteration: veney nekhar yitekhachashu-liy lishemvoa ozen yishameu liy

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י נֵכָ֖ר יִבֹּ֑לוּ וְיַחְגְּר֖וּ מִמִּסְגְּרוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
Foreign peoples lose courage
And come trembling out of their strongholds.
Transliteration: veney nekhar yivolu veyachegeru mimisegervotam

Hebrew: חַי־יְהֹוָ֖ה וּבָר֣וּךְ צוּרִ֑י וְיָרֻ֕ם אֱלֹהֵ֖י צ֥וּר יִשְׁעִֽי׃
Translated:
The ETERNAL lives! Blessed is my rock!
Exalted be God, the rock
Who gives me victory;
Transliteration: chay-yehovah uvarukhe tsuriy veyarum elohey tsur yisheiy

Hebrew: הָאֵ֕ל הַנֹּתֵ֥ן נְקָמֹ֖ת לִ֑י וּמֹרִ֥יד עַמִּ֖ים תַּחְתֵּֽנִי׃
Translated:
The God who has vindicated me
And made peoples subject to me,
Transliteration: hael hanoten nekamot liy umoriyd amiym tacheteniy

Hebrew: וּמוֹצִיאִ֖י מֵאֹֽיְבָ֑י וּמִקָּמַי֙ תְּר֣וֹמְמֵ֔נִי מֵאִ֥ישׁ חֲמָסִ֖ים תַּצִּילֵֽנִי׃
Translated:
Who rescued me from my enemies,
Who raised me clear of my adversaries,
Saved me from the lawless opposition!
Transliteration: umvotsiyiy meoyevay umikamay tervomemeniy meiysh chamasiym tatsiyleniy

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֛ן אוֹדְךָ֥ יְהֹוָ֖ה בַּגּוֹיִ֑ם וּלְשִׁמְךָ֖ אֲזַמֵּֽר׃
Translated:
For this I sing Your praise, ETERNAL One, among the nations
And hymn Your name:
Transliteration: al-khen vodekha yehovah vagvoyim uleshimekha azamer

Hebrew: (מגדיל) [מִגְדּ֖וֹל] יְשׁוּע֣וֹת מַלְכּ֑וֹ וְעֹֽשֶׂה־חֶ֧סֶד לִמְשִׁיח֛וֹ לְדָוִ֥ד וּלְזַרְע֖וֹ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
Tower of victory to Your king,
Keeping faith with Your anointed,
With David and his offspring evermore.
Transliteration: (mgdyl) [migedvol] yeshuvot malekhvo veosheh-chesed limeshiychvo ledavid ulezarevo ad-volam {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה דִּבְרֵ֥י דָוִ֖ד הָאַחֲרֹנִ֑ים נְאֻ֧ם דָּוִ֣ד בֶּן־יִשַׁ֗י וּנְאֻ֤ם הַגֶּ֙בֶר֙ הֻ֣קַם עָ֔ל מְשִׁ֙יחַ֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יַעֲקֹ֔ב וּנְעִ֖ים זְמִר֥וֹת יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
These are the last words of David:
The utterance of David son of Jesse,
The utterance of the man set on high,
The anointed of the God of Jacob,
The favorite of the songs of Israel:
Transliteration: veeleh diverey david haacharoniym neum david ven-yishay uneum hagever hukam al meshiycha elohey yaakov uneiym zemirvot yisherael

Hebrew: ר֥וּחַ יְהֹוָ֖ה דִּבֶּר־בִּ֑י וּמִלָּת֖וֹ עַל־לְשׁוֹנִֽי׃
Translated:
The spirit of GOD has spoken through me,
God’s message is on my tongue;
Transliteration: rucha yehovah diver-viy umilatvo al-leshvoniy

Hebrew: אָמַר֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לִ֥י דִבֶּ֖ר צ֣וּר יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מוֹשֵׁל֙ בָּאָדָ֔ם צַדִּ֕יק מוֹשֵׁ֖ל יִרְאַ֥ת אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated:
The God of Israel has spoken,
The Rock of Israel said concerning me:
“He who rules over people justly,
He who rules in awe of God
Transliteration: amar elohey yisherael liy diver tsur yisherael mvoshel vaadam tsadiyk mvoshel yireat Elohim

Hebrew: וּכְא֥וֹר בֹּ֖קֶר יִזְרַח־שָׁ֑מֶשׁ בֹּ֚קֶר לֹ֣א עָב֔וֹת מִנֹּ֥גַהּ מִמָּטָ֖ר דֶּ֥שֶׁא מֵאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
Is like the light of morning at sunrise,
A morning without clouds—
Through sunshine and rain
[Bringing] vegetation out of the earth.”
Transliteration: ukhevor voker yizerach-shamesh voker lo avvot minogah mimatar deshe mearets

Hebrew: כִּי־לֹא־כֵ֥ן בֵּיתִ֖י עִם־אֵ֑ל כִּי֩ בְרִ֨ית עוֹלָ֜ם שָׂ֣ם לִ֗י עֲרוּכָ֤ה בַכֹּל֙ וּשְׁמֻרָ֔ה כִּי־כׇל־יִשְׁעִ֥י וְכׇל־חֵ֖פֶץ כִּי־לֹ֥א יַצְמִֽיחַ׃
Translated:
Is not my House established before God?
For I have been granted an eternal pact,
Drawn up in full and secured.
Will [God] not cause all my success
And [my] every desire to blossom?
Transliteration: khiy-lo-khen veytiy im-el khiy veriyt volam sham liy arukhah vakhol ushemurah khiy-khׇl-yisheiy vekhׇl-chefets khiy-lo yatsemiycha

Hebrew: וּבְלִיַּ֕עַל כְּק֥וֹץ מֻנָ֖ד כֻּלָּ֑הַם כִּי־לֹ֥א בְיָ֖ד יִקָּֽחוּ׃
Translated:
But the wicked shall all
Be raked aside like thorns;
For no one will take them in his hand.
Transliteration: uveliyaal khekvots munad khulaham khiy-lo veyad yikachu

Hebrew: וְאִישׁ֙ יִגַּ֣ע בָּהֶ֔ם יִמָּלֵ֥א בַרְזֶ֖ל וְעֵ֣ץ חֲנִ֑ית וּבָאֵ֕שׁ שָׂר֥וֹף יִשָּׂרְפ֖וּ בַּשָּֽׁבֶת׃ {פ}
Translated:
Whoever touches them
Must arm himself with iron
And the shaft of a spear;
And they must be burned up on the spot.
Transliteration: veiysh yiga vahem yimale varezel veets chaniyt uvaesh sharvof yisharefu vashavet {f}

Hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה שְׁמ֥וֹת הַגִּבֹּרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְדָוִ֑ד יֹשֵׁ֨ב בַּשֶּׁ֜בֶת תַּחְכְּמֹנִ֣י ׀ רֹ֣אשׁ הַשָּׁלִשִׁ֗י ה֚וּא עֲדִינ֣וֹ (העצנו) [הָֽעֶצְנִ֔י] עַל־שְׁמֹנֶ֥ה מֵא֛וֹת חָלָ֖ל בְּפַ֥עַם (אחד) [אֶחָֽת]׃ {ס}
Translated: These are the names of David’s warriors: Josheb-basshebeth, a Tahchemonite, the chief officer—he is Adino the Eznite; [he wielded his spear] against eight hundred and slew them on one occasion.
Transliteration: eleh shemvot hagivoriym asher ledavid yoshev vashevet tachekhemoniy rosh hashalishiy hu adiynvo (htsnv) [haetseniy] al-shemoneh mevot chalal vefaam (chd) [echat] {s}

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרָ֛ו אֶלְעָזָ֥ר בֶּן־[דֹּד֖וֹ] (דדי) בֶּן־אֲחֹחִ֑י בִּשְׁלֹשָׁ֨ה (גברים) [הַגִּבֹּרִ֜ים] עִם־דָּוִ֗ד בְּחָרְפָ֤ם בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּים֙ נֶאֶסְפוּ־שָׁ֣ם לַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וַֽיַּעֲל֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Next to him was Eleazar son of Dodo son of Ahohi. He was one of the three warriors with David when they defied the Philistines gathered there for battle. Israel’s force retreated,
Transliteration: veacharav eleazar ven-[dodvo] (ddy) ven-achochiy visheloshah (gvrym) [hagivoriym] im-david vecharefam vafelishetiym neesefu-sham lamilechamah vayaalu iysh yisherael

Hebrew: ה֣וּא קָם֩ וַיַּ֨ךְ בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּ֜ים עַ֣ד ׀ כִּֽי־יָגְעָ֣ה יָד֗וֹ וַתִּדְבַּ֤ק יָדוֹ֙ אֶל־הַחֶ֔רֶב וַיַּ֧עַשׂ יְהֹוָ֛ה תְּשׁוּעָ֥ה גְדוֹלָ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וְהָעָ֛ם יָשֻׁ֥בוּ אַחֲרָ֖יו אַךְ־לְפַשֵּֽׁט׃ {ס}
Translated: but he held his ground. He struck down Philistines until his arm grew tired and his hand stuck to his sword; and G<small>OD</small> wrought a great victory that day. Then the troops came back to him—but only to strip [the slain].
Transliteration: hu kam vayakhe vafelishetiym ad khiy-yageah yadvo vatidevak yadvo el-hacherev vayaash yehovah teshuah gedvolah vayyvom hahu vehaam yashuvu acharayv akhe-lefashet {s}

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרָ֛יו שַׁמָּ֥ה בֶן־אָגֵ֖א הָרָרִ֑י וַיֵּאָסְפ֨וּ פְלִשְׁתִּ֜ים לַחַיָּ֗ה וַתְּהִי־שָׁ֞ם חֶלְקַ֤ת הַשָּׂדֶה֙ מְלֵאָ֣ה עֲדָשִׁ֔ים וְהָעָ֥ם נָ֖ס מִפְּנֵ֥י פְלִשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: Next to him was Shammah son of Age the Ararite. The Philistines had gathered in force where there was a plot of ground full of lentils; and the troops fled from the Philistines.
Transliteration: veacharayv shamah ven-age harariy vayeasefu felishetiym lachayah vatehiy-sham chelekat hashadeh meleah adashiym vehaam nas mifeney felishetiym

Hebrew: וַיִּתְיַצֵּ֤ב בְּתוֹךְ־הַחֶלְקָה֙ וַיַּצִּילֶ֔הָ וַיַּ֖ךְ אֶת־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים וַיַּ֥עַשׂ יְהֹוָ֖ה תְּשׁוּעָ֥ה גְדוֹלָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: But [Shammah] took his stand in the middle of the plot and defended it, and he routed the Philistines. Thus G<small>OD</small> wrought a great victory.
Transliteration: vayiteyatsev vetvokhe-hachelekah vayatsiyleha vayakhe et-felishetiym vayaash yehovah teshuah gedvolah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֵּרְד֨וּ (שלשים) [שְׁלֹשָׁ֜ה] מֵהַשְּׁלֹשִׁ֣ים רֹ֗אשׁ וַיָּבֹ֤אוּ אֶל־קָצִיר֙ אֶל־דָּוִ֔ד אֶל־מְעָרַ֖ת עֲדֻלָּ֑ם וְחַיַּ֣ת פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים חֹנָ֖ה בְּעֵ֥מֶק רְפָאִֽים׃
Translated: Once, during the harvest, three of the thirty chiefs went down to David at the cave of Adullam, while a force of Philistines was encamped in the Valley of Rephaim.
Transliteration: vayeredu (shlshym) [sheloshah] mehasheloshiym rosh vayavou el-katsiyr el-david el-mearat adulam vechayat felishetiym chonah veemek refaiym

Hebrew: וְדָוִ֖ד אָ֣ז בַּמְּצוּדָ֑ה וּמַצַּ֣ב פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים אָ֖ז בֵּ֥ית לָֽחֶם׃
Translated: David was then in the stronghold, and a Philistine garrison was then at Bethlehem.
Transliteration: vedavid az vametsudah umatsav felishetiym az veyt lachem

Hebrew: וַיִּתְאַוֶּ֥ה דָוִ֖ד וַיֹּאמַ֑ר מִ֚י יַשְׁקֵ֣נִי מַ֔יִם מִבֹּ֥אר בֵּֽית־לֶ֖חֶם אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּשָּֽׁעַר׃ {ס}
Translated: David felt a craving and said, “If only I could get a drink of water from the cistern that is by the gate of Bethlehem!”
Transliteration: vayiteaveh david vayomar miy yashekeniy mayiim mivor veyt-lechem asher vashaar {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּבְקְעוּ֩ שְׁלֹ֨שֶׁת הַגִּבֹּרִ֜ים בְּמַחֲנֵ֣ה פְלִשְׁתִּ֗ים וַיִּֽשְׁאֲבוּ־מַ֙יִם֙ מִבֹּ֤אר בֵּֽית־לֶ֙חֶם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּשַּׁ֔עַר וַיִּשְׂא֖וּ וַיָּבִ֣אוּ אֶל־דָּוִ֑ד וְלֹ֤א אָבָה֙ לִשְׁתּוֹתָ֔ם וַיַּסֵּ֥ךְ אֹתָ֖ם לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: So the three warriors got through the Philistine camp and drew water from the cistern that is by the gate of Bethlehem, and they carried it back. But when they brought it to David he would not drink it, and he poured it out as a libation to G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayivekeu sheloshet hagivoriym vemachaneh felishetiym vayisheavu-mayiim mivor veyt-lechem asher vashaar vayisheu vayaviu el-david velo avah lishetvotam vayasekhe otam layhovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֡אמֶר חָלִ֩ילָה֩ לִּ֨י יְהֹוָ֜ה מֵעֲשֹׂ֣תִי זֹ֗את הֲדַ֤ם הָאֲנָשִׁים֙ הַהֹלְכִ֣ים בְּנַפְשׁוֹתָ֔ם וְלֹ֥א אָבָ֖ה לִשְׁתּוֹתָ֑ם אֵ֣לֶּה עָשׂ֔וּ שְׁלֹ֖שֶׁת הַגִּבֹּרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: For he said, “G<small>OD</small> forbid that I should do this! Can [I drink] the blood of the men who went at the risk of their lives?” So he would not drink it. Such were the exploits of the three warriors.
Transliteration: vayomer chaliylah liy yehovah meashotiy zot hadam haanashiym haholekhiym venafeshvotam velo avah lishetvotam eleh ashu sheloshet hagivoriym {s}

Hebrew: וַאֲבִישַׁ֞י אֲחִ֣י ׀ יוֹאָ֣ב בֶּן־צְרוּיָ֗ה ה֚וּא רֹ֣אשׁ (השלשי) [הַשְּׁלֹשָׁ֔ה] וְהוּא֙ עוֹרֵ֣ר אֶת־חֲנִית֔וֹ עַל־שְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת חָלָ֑ל וְלוֹ־שֵׁ֖ם בַּשְּׁלֹשָֽׁה׃
Translated: Abishai, the brother of Joab son of Zeruiah, was head of another three. He once wielded his spear against three hundred and slew them.
Transliteration: vaaviyshay achiy yvoav ven-tseruyah hu rosh (hshlshy) [hasheloshah] vehu vorer et-chaniytvo al-shelosh mevot chalal velvo-shem vasheloshah

Hebrew: מִן־הַשְּׁלֹשָׁה֙ הֲכִ֣י נִכְבָּ֔ד וַיְהִ֥י לָהֶ֖ם לְשָׂ֑ר וְעַד־הַשְּׁלֹשָׁ֖ה לֹא־בָֽא׃ {ס}
Translated: He won a name among the three; since he was the most highly regarded among the three, he became their leader. However, he did not attain to the three.
Transliteration: min-hasheloshah hakhiy nikhevad vayehiy lahem leshar vead-hasheloshah lo-va {s}

Hebrew: וּבְנָיָ֨הוּ בֶן־יְהוֹיָדָ֧ע בֶּן־אִֽישׁ־[חַ֛יִל] (חי) רַב־פְּעָלִ֖ים מִֽקַּבְצְאֵ֑ל ה֣וּא הִכָּ֗ה אֵ֣ת שְׁנֵ֤י אֲרִאֵל֙ מוֹאָ֔ב וְ֠ה֠וּא יָרַ֞ד וְהִכָּ֧ה אֶֽת־[הָאֲרִ֛י] (האריה) בְּת֥וֹךְ הַבֹּ֖אר בְּי֥וֹם הַשָּֽׁלֶג׃
Translated: Benaiah son of Jehoiada, from Kabzeel, was a brave soldier who performed great deeds. He killed the two [sons] of Ariel of Moab. Once, on a snowy day, he went down into a pit and killed a lion.
Transliteration: uvenayahu ven-yehvoyada ven-iysh-[chayiil] (chy) rav-fealiym mikavetseel hu hikhah et sheney ariel mvoav vehu yarad vehikhah et-[haariy] (hryh) vetvokhe havor veyvom hashaleg

Hebrew: וְהֽוּא־הִכָּה֩ אֶת־אִ֨ישׁ מִצְרִ֜י (אשר) [אִ֣ישׁ] מַרְאֶ֗ה וּבְיַ֤ד הַמִּצְרִי֙ חֲנִ֔ית וַיֵּ֥רֶד אֵלָ֖יו בַּשָּׁ֑בֶט וַיִּגְזֹ֤ל אֶֽת־הַחֲנִית֙ מִיַּ֣ד הַמִּצְרִ֔י וַיַּהַרְגֵ֖הוּ בַּחֲנִיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: He also killed an Egyptian, a huge man. The Egyptian had a spear in his hand, yet [Benaiah] went down against him with a club, wrenched the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand, and killed him with his own spear.
Transliteration: vehu-hikhah et-iysh mitseriy (shr) [iysh] mareeh uveyad hamitseriy chaniyt vayered elayv vashavet vayigezol et-hachaniyt miyad hamitseriy vayaharegehu vachaniytvo

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה עָשָׂ֔ה בְּנָיָ֖הוּ בֶּן־יְהוֹיָדָ֑ע וְלוֹ־שֵׁ֖ם בִּשְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה הַגִּבֹּרִֽים׃
Translated: Such were the exploits of Benaiah son of Jehoiada; and he won a name among the three warriors.
Transliteration: eleh ashah venayahu ven-yehvoyada velvo-shem visheloshah hagivoriym

Hebrew: מִן־הַשְּׁלֹשִׁ֣ים נִכְבָּ֔ד וְאֶל־הַשְּׁלֹשָׁ֖ה לֹא־בָ֑א וַיְשִׂמֵ֥הוּ דָוִ֖ד אֶל־מִשְׁמַעְתּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: He was highly regarded among the thirty, but he did not attain to the three. David put him in charge of his bodyguard.
Transliteration: min-hasheloshiym nikhevad veel-hasheloshah lo-va vayeshimehu david el-mishemaetvo {s}

Hebrew: עֲשָׂהאֵ֥ל אֲחִֽי־יוֹאָ֖ב בַּשְּׁלֹשִׁ֑ים אֶלְחָנָ֥ן בֶּן־דֹּד֖וֹ בֵּ֥ית לָֽחֶם׃ {ס}
Translated: Among the thirty were Asahel, the brother of Joab; Elhanan son of Dodo [from] Bethlehem,
Transliteration: ashahel achiy-yvoav vasheloshiym elechanan ven-dodvo veyt lachem {s}

Hebrew: שַׁמָּה֙ הַחֲרֹדִ֔י {ס} אֱלִיקָ֖א הַחֲרֹדִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Shammah the Harodite, Elika the Harodite,
Transliteration: shamah hacharodiy {s} eliyka hacharodiy {s}

Hebrew: חֶ֚לֶץ הַפַּלְטִ֔י {ס} עִירָ֥א בֶן־עִקֵּ֖שׁ {ס} הַתְּקוֹעִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Helez the Paltite, Ira son of Ikkesh from Tekoa,
Transliteration: chelets hafaletiy {s} iyra ven-ikesh {s} hatekvoiy {s}

Hebrew: אֲבִיעֶ֙זֶר֙ הָעַנְּתֹתִ֔י {ס} מְבֻנַּ֖י הַחֻשָׁתִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Abiezer of Anathoth, Mebunnai the Hushathite,
Transliteration: aviyezer haanetotiy {s} mevunay hachushatiy {s}

Hebrew: צַלְמוֹן֙ הָאֲחֹחִ֔י {ס} מַהְרַ֖י הַנְּטֹפָתִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Zalmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite,
Transliteration: tsalemvon haachochiy {s} maheray hanetofatiy {s}

Hebrew: חֵ֥לֶב בֶּֽן־בַּעֲנָ֖ה הַנְּטֹפָתִ֑י {ס} אִתַּי֙ בֶּן־רִיבַ֔י מִגִּבְעַ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י בִנְיָמִֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Heleb son of Baanah the Netophathite, Ittai son of Ribai from Gibeah of the Benjaminites,
Transliteration: chelev ven-vaanah hanetofatiy {s} itay ven-riyvay migiveat veney vineyamin {s}

Hebrew: בְּנָיָ֙הוּ֙ פִּרְעָ֣תֹנִ֔י {ס} הִדַּ֖י מִנַּ֥חֲלֵי גָֽעַשׁ׃ {ס}
Translated: Benaiah of Pirathon, Hiddai of Nahale-gaash,
Transliteration: venayahu fireatoniy {s} hiday minachaley gaash {s}

Hebrew: אֲבִֽי־עַלְבוֹן֙ הָעַרְבָתִ֔י {ס} עַזְמָ֖וֶת הַבַּרְחֻמִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Abi-albon the Arbathite, Azmaveth the Barhumite,
Transliteration: aviy-alevvon haarevatiy {s} azemavet havarechumiy {s}

Hebrew: אֶלְיַחְבָּא֙ הַשַּׁ֣עַלְבֹנִ֔י {ס} בְּנֵ֥י יָשֵׁ֖ן יְהוֹנָתָֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Eliahba of Shaalbon, sons of Jashen, Jonathan,
Transliteration: eleyacheva hashaalevoniy {s} veney yashen yehvonatan {s}

Hebrew: שַׁמָּה֙ הַהֲרָרִ֔י {ס} אֲחִיאָ֥ם בֶּן־שָׁרָ֖ר הָארָרִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Shammah the Ararite, Ahiam son of Sharar the Ararite,
Transliteration: shamah haharariy {s} achiyam ven-sharar harariy {s}

Hebrew: אֱלִיפֶ֥לֶט בֶּן־אֲחַסְבַּ֖י בֶּן־הַמַּעֲכָתִ֑י {ס} אֱלִיעָ֥ם בֶּן־אֲחִיתֹ֖פֶל הַגִּלֹנִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Eliphelet son of Ahasbai son of the Maacathite, Eliam son of Ahithophel the Gilonite,
Transliteration: eliyfelet ven-achasevay ven-hamaakhatiy {s} eliyam ven-achiytofel hagiloniy {s}

Hebrew: (חצרו) [חֶצְרַי֙] הַֽכַּרְמְלִ֔י {ס} פַּעֲרַ֖י הָאַרְבִּֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Hezrai the Carmelite, Paarai the Arbite,
Transliteration: (chtsrv) [chetseray] hakharemeliy {s} faaray haareviy {s}

Hebrew: יִגְאָ֤ל בֶּן־נָתָן֙ מִצֹּבָ֔ה {ס} בָּנִ֖י הַגָּדִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Igal son of Nathan from Zobah, Bani the Gadite,
Transliteration: yigeal ven-natan mitsovah {s} vaniy hagadiy {s}

Hebrew: צֶ֖לֶק הָעַמֹּנִ֑י {ס} נַחְרַי֙ הַבְּאֵ֣רֹתִ֔י (נשאי) [נֹשֵׂ֕א] כְּלֵ֖י יוֹאָ֥ב בֶּן־צְרֻיָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Beerothite—the arms-bearer of Joab son of Zeruiah—
Transliteration: tselek haamoniy {s} nacheray haveerotiy (nshy) [noshe] kheley yvoav ven-tseruyah {s}

Hebrew: עִירָא֙ הַיִּתְרִ֔י {ס} גָּרֵ֖ב הַיִּתְרִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
Transliteration: iyra hayiteriy {s} garev hayiteriy {s}

Hebrew: אֽוּרִיָּה֙ הַחִתִּ֔י כֹּ֖ל שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וְשִׁבְעָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Uriah the Hittite: thirty-seven in all.
Transliteration: uriyah hachitiy khol sheloshiym veshiveah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙סֶף֙ אַף־יְהֹוָ֔ה לַחֲר֖וֹת בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיָּ֨סֶת אֶת־דָּוִ֤ד בָּהֶם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לֵ֛ךְ מְנֵ֥ה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְאֶת־יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small>’s anger again flared up against Israel; and [God] incited David against them, saying, “Go and number Israel and Judah.”
Transliteration: vayosef af-yehovah lacharvot veyisherael vayaset et-david vahem lemor lekhe meneh et-yisherael veet-yehudah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אֶל־יוֹאָ֣ב ׀ שַׂר־הַחַ֣יִל אֲשֶׁר־אִתּ֗וֹ שֽׁוּט־נָ֞א בְּכׇל־שִׁבְטֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִדָּן֙ וְעַד־בְּאֵ֣ר שֶׁ֔בַע וּפִקְד֖וּ אֶת־הָעָ֑ם וְיָ֣דַעְתִּ֔י אֵ֖ת מִסְפַּ֥ר הָעָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: The king said to Joab, his army commander, “Make the rounds of all the tribes of Israel, from Dan to Beer-sheba, and take a census of the people, so that I may know the size of the population.”
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe el-yvoav shar-hachayiil asher-itvo shut-na vekhׇl-shivetey yisherael midan vead-veer sheva ufikedu et-haam veyadaetiy et misefar haam {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יוֹאָ֜ב אֶל־הַמֶּ֗לֶךְ וְיוֹסֵ֣ף יְהֹוָה֩ אֱלֹהֶ֨יךָ אֶל־הָעָ֜ם כָּהֵ֤ם <small>׀</small> וְכָהֵם֙ מֵאָ֣ה פְעָמִ֔ים וְעֵינֵ֥י אֲדֹנִֽי־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ רֹא֑וֹת וַאדֹנִ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ לָ֥מָּה חָפֵ֖ץ בַּדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Joab answered the king, “May the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God increase the number of the people a hundredfold, while your own eyes see it! But why should my lord king want this?”
Transliteration: vayomer yvoav el-hamelekhe veyvosef yehovah eloheykha el-haam khahem <small></small> vekhahem meah feamiym veeyney adoniy-hamelekhe rovot vadoniy hamelekhe lamah chafets vadavar hazeh

Hebrew: וַיֶּחֱזַ֤ק דְּבַר־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ אֶל־יוֹאָ֔ב וְעַ֖ל שָׂרֵ֣י הֶחָ֑יִל וַיֵּצֵ֨א יוֹאָ֜ב וְשָׂרֵ֤י הַחַ֙יִל֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ לִפְקֹ֥ד אֶת־הָעָ֖ם אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: However, the king’s command to Joab and to the officers of the army remained firm; and Joab and the officers of the army set out, at the king’s behest, to take a census of the people of Israel.
Transliteration: vayechezak devar-hamelekhe el-yvoav veal sharey hechayiil vayetse yvoav vesharey hachayiil lifeney hamelekhe lifekod et-haam et-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיַּעַבְר֖וּ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן וַיַּחֲנ֣וּ בַעֲרוֹעֵ֗ר יְמִ֥ין הָעִ֛יר אֲשֶׁ֛ר בְּתוֹךְ־הַנַּ֥חַל הַגָּ֖ד וְאֶל־יַעְזֵֽר׃
Translated: They crossed the Jordan and encamped at Aroer, on the right side of the town, which is in the middle of the wadi of Gad, and [went on] to Jazer.
Transliteration: vayaaveru et-hayareden vayachanu vaarvoer yemiyn haiyr asher vetvokhe-hanachal hagad veel-yaezer

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ הַגִּלְעָ֔דָה וְאֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ תַּחְתִּ֖ים חׇדְשִׁ֑י וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ דָּ֣נָה יַּ֔עַן וְסָבִ֖יב אֶל־צִידֽוֹן׃
Translated: They continued to Gilead and to the region of Tahtim-hodshi, and they came to Dan-jaan and around to Sidon.
Transliteration: vayavou hagileadah veel-erets tachetiym chׇdeshiy vayavou danah yaan vesaviyv el-tsiydvon

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ מִבְצַר־צֹ֔ר וְכׇל־עָרֵ֥י הַחִוִּ֖י וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֑י וַיֵּ֥צְא֛וּ אֶל־נֶ֥גֶב יְהוּדָ֖ה בְּאֵ֥ר שָֽׁבַע׃
Translated: They went onto the fortress of Tyre and all the towns of the Hivites and Canaanites, and finished at Beer-sheba in southern Judah.
Transliteration: vayavou mivetsar-tsor vekhׇl-arey hachiviy vehakhenaaniy vayetseu el-negev yehudah veer shava

Hebrew: וַיָּשֻׁ֖טוּ בְּכׇל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ מִקְצֵ֨ה תִשְׁעָ֧ה חֳדָשִׁ֛ים וְעֶשְׂרִ֥ים י֖וֹם יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
Translated: They traversed the whole country, and then they came back to Jerusalem at the end of nine months and twenty days.
Transliteration: vayashutu vekhׇl-haarets vayavou miketseh tisheah chodashiym veesheriym yvom yerushala͏im

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֥ן יוֹאָ֛ב אֶת־מִסְפַּ֥ר מִפְקַד־הָעָ֖ם אֶל־הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַתְּהִ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֡ל שְֽׁמֹנֶה֩ מֵא֨וֹת אֶ֤לֶף אִֽישׁ־חַ֙יִל֙ שֹׁ֣לֵֽף חֶ֔רֶב וְאִ֣ישׁ יְהוּדָ֔ה חֲמֵשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֖לֶף אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: Joab reported to the king the number of the people that had been recorded: in Israel there were 800,000 soldiers ready to draw the sword, and Judah’s contingent numbered 500,000.
Transliteration: vayiten yvoav et-misefar mifekad-haam el-hamelekhe vatehiy yisherael shemoneh mevot elef iysh-chayiil sholef cherev veiysh yehudah chamesh-mevot elef iysh

Hebrew:
וַיַּ֤ךְ לֵב־דָּוִד֙ אֹת֔וֹ אַחֲרֵי־כֵ֖ן סָפַ֣ר אֶת־הָעָ֑ם {פ}
וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜ד אֶל־יְהֹוָ֗ה חָטָ֤אתִֽי מְאֹד֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֔יתִי וְעַתָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֗ה הַֽעֲבֶר־נָא֙ אֶת־עֲוֺ֣ן עַבְדְּךָ֔ כִּ֥י נִסְכַּ֖לְתִּי מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: But afterward David reproached himself for having numbered the people. And David said to G<small>OD</small>, “I have sinned grievously in what I have done. Please, O G<small>OD</small>, remit the guilt of Your servant, for I have acted foolishly.”
Transliteration:
vayakhe lev-david otvo acharey-khen safar et-haam {f}
vayomer david el-yehovah chatatiy meod asher ashiytiy veatah yehovah haaver-na et-avon avedekha khiy nisekhaletiy meod

Hebrew:
וַיָּ֥קׇם דָּוִ֖ד בַּבֹּ֑קֶר {פ}
וּדְבַר־יְהֹוָ֗ה הָיָה֙ אֶל־גָּ֣ד הַנָּבִ֔יא חֹזֵ֥ה דָוִ֖ד לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: When David rose in the morning, the word of G<small>OD</small> had come to the prophet Gad, David’s seer:
Transliteration:
vayakׇm david vavoker {f}
udevar-yehovah hayah el-gad hanaviy chozeh david lemor

Hebrew: הָל֞וֹךְ וְדִבַּרְתָּ֣ אֶל־דָּוִ֗ד כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה שָׁלֹ֕שׁ אָנֹכִ֖י נוֹטֵ֣ל עָלֶ֑יךָ בְּחַר־לְךָ֥ אַחַת־מֵהֶ֖ם וְאֶעֱשֶׂה־לָּֽךְ׃
Translated: “Go and tell David, ‘Thus said G<small>OD</small>: I hold three things over you; choose one of them, and I will bring it upon you.’”
Transliteration: halvokhe vedivareta el-david khoh amar yehovah shalosh anokhiy nvotel aleykha vechar-lekha achat-mehem veeesheh-lakhe

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא־גָ֥ד אֶל־דָּוִ֖ד וַיַּגֶּד־ל֑וֹ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֡וֹ הֲתָב֣וֹא לְךָ֣ שֶׁבַע־שָׁנִ֣ים ׀ רָעָ֣ב ׀ בְּאַרְצֶ֡ךָ אִם־שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה חֳ֠דָשִׁ֠ים נֻסְךָ֨ לִפְנֵי־צָרֶ֜יךָ וְה֣וּא רֹדְפֶ֗ךָ וְאִם־הֱ֠י֠וֹת שְׁלֹ֨שֶׁת יָמִ֥ים דֶּ֙בֶר֙ בְּאַרְצֶ֔ךָ עַתָּה֙ דַּ֣ע וּרְאֵ֔ה מָה־אָשִׁ֥יב שֹׁלְחִ֖י דָּבָֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: Gad came to David and told him; he asked, “Shall a seven-year famine come upon you in the land, or shall you be in flight from your adversaries for three months while they pursue you, or shall there be three days of pestilence in your land? Now consider carefully what reply I shall take back to the One who sent me.”
Transliteration: vayavo-gad el-david vayaged-lvo vayomer lvo hatavvo lekha sheva-shaniym raav vearetsekha im-sheloshah chodashiym nusekha lifeney-tsareykha vehu rodefekha veim-heyvot sheloshet yamiym dever vearetsekha atah da ureeh mah-ashiyv sholechiy davar {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר דָּוִ֛ד אֶל־גָּ֖ד צַר־לִ֣י מְאֹ֑ד נִפְּלָה־נָּ֤א בְיַד־יְהֹוָה֙ כִּֽי־רַבִּ֣ים רַחֲמָ֔ו וּבְיַד־אָדָ֖ם אַל־אֶפֹּֽלָה׃
Translated: David said to Gad, “I am in great distress. Let us fall into the hands of G<small>OD</small>, whose compassion is great; and let me not fall into human hands.”
Transliteration: vayomer david el-gad tsar-liy meod nifelah-na veyad-yehovah khiy-raviym rachamav uveyad-adam al-efolah

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֨ן יְהֹוָ֥ה דֶּ֙בֶר֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מֵהַבֹּ֖קֶר וְעַד־עֵ֣ת מוֹעֵ֑ד וַיָּ֣מׇת מִן־הָעָ֗ם מִדָּן֙ וְעַד־בְּאֵ֣ר שֶׁ֔בַע שִׁבְעִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> sent a pestilence upon Israel from morning until the set time; and 70,000 of the people died, from Dan to Beer-sheba.
Transliteration: vayiten yehovah dever veyisherael mehavoker vead-et mvoed vayamׇt min-haam midan vead-veer sheva shiveiym elef iysh

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֩ יָד֨וֹ הַמַּלְאָ֥ךְ ׀ יְֽרוּשָׁלַ֘͏ִם֮ לְשַׁחֲתָהּ֒ וַיִּנָּ֤חֶם יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־הָ֣רָעָ֔ה וַ֠יֹּ֠אמֶר לַמַּלְאָ֞ךְ הַמַּשְׁחִ֤ית בָּעָם֙ רַ֔ב עַתָּ֖ה הֶ֣רֶף יָדֶ֑ךָ וּמַלְאַ֤ךְ יְהֹוָה֙ הָיָ֔ה עִם־גֹּ֖רֶן (האורנה) [הָֽאֲרַ֥וְנָה] הַיְבֻסִֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: But when the angel extended a hand against Jerusalem to destroy it, G<small>OD</small> renounced further punishment and said to the angel who was destroying the people, “Enough! Stay your hand!” The angel of G<small>OD</small> was then by the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.
Transliteration: vayishelach yadvo hamaleakhe yerushala͏im leshachatah vayinachem yehovah el-haraah vayomer lamaleakhe hamashechiyt vaam rav atah heref yadekha umaleakhe yehovah hayah im-goren (hvrnh) [haaravenah] hayevusiy {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ דָּוִ֨ד אֶל־יְהֹוָ֜ה בִּרְאֹת֣וֹ ׀ אֶֽת־הַמַּלְאָ֣ךְ ׀ הַמַּכֶּ֣ה בָעָ֗ם וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ הִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֤י חָטָ֙אתִי֙ וְאָנֹכִ֣י הֶעֱוֵ֔יתִי וְאֵ֥לֶּה הַצֹּ֖אן מֶ֣ה עָשׂ֑וּ תְּהִ֨י נָ֥א יָדְךָ֛ בִּ֖י וּבְבֵ֥ית אָבִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: When David saw the angel who was striking down the people, he said to G<small>OD</small>, “I alone am guilty, I alone have done wrong; but these poor sheep, what have they done? Let Your hand fall upon me and my father’s house!”
Transliteration: vayomer david el-yehovah vireotvo et-hamaleakhe hamakheh vaam vayomer hineh anokhiy chatatiy veanokhiy heeveytiy veeleh hatson meh ashu tehiy na yadekha viy uveveyt aviy {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא־גָ֥ד אֶל־דָּוִ֖ד בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ עֲלֵה֙ הָקֵ֤ם לַֽיהֹוָה֙ מִזְבֵּ֔חַ בְּגֹ֖רֶן (ארניה) [אֲרַ֥וְנָה] הַיְבֻסִֽי׃
Translated: Gad came to David the same day and said to him, “Go and set up an altar to G<small>OD</small> on the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.”
Transliteration: vayavo-gad el-david vayyvom hahu vayomer lvo aleh hakem layhovah mizevecha vegoren (rnyh) [aravenah] hayevusiy

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַל דָּוִד֙ כִּדְבַר־גָּ֔ד כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: David went up, following Gad’s instructions, as G<small>OD</small> had commanded.
Transliteration: vayaal david khidevar-gad khaasher tsivah yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁקֵ֣ף אֲרַ֗וְנָה וַיַּ֤רְא אֶת־הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ וְאֶת־עֲבָדָ֔יו עֹבְרִ֖ים עָלָ֑יו וַיֵּצֵ֣א אֲרַ֔וְנָה וַיִּשְׁתַּ֧חוּ לַמֶּ֛לֶךְ אַפָּ֖יו אָֽרְצָה׃
Translated: Araunah looked out and saw the king and his courtiers approaching him. So Araunah went out and bowed low to the king, with his face to the ground.
Transliteration: vayashekef aravenah vayare et-hamelekhe veet-avadayv overiym alayv vayetse aravenah vayishetachu lamelekhe afayv aretsah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲרַ֔וְנָה מַדּ֛וּעַ בָּ֥א אֲדֹנִֽי־הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ אֶל־עַבְדּ֑וֹ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר דָּוִ֜ד לִקְנ֧וֹת מֵעִמְּךָ֣ אֶת־הַגֹּ֗רֶן לִבְנ֤וֹת מִזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה וְתֵעָצַ֥ר הַמַּגֵּפָ֖ה מֵעַ֥ל הָעָֽם׃
Translated: And Araunah asked, “Why has my lord the king come to his servant?” David replied, “To buy the threshing floor from you, that I may build an altar to G<small>OD</small> and that the plague against the people may be checked.”
Transliteration: vayomer aravenah madua va adoniy-hamelekhe el-avedvo vayomer david likenvot meimekha et-hagoren livenvot mizevecha layhovah veteatsar hamagefah meal haam

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲרַ֙וְנָה֙ אֶל־דָּוִ֔ד יִקַּ֥ח וְיַ֛עַל אֲדֹנִ֥י הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ הַטּ֣וֹב בְּעֵינָ֑ו רְאֵה֙ הַבָּקָ֣ר לָעֹלָ֔ה וְהַמֹּרִגִּ֛ים וּכְלֵ֥י הַבָּקָ֖ר לָעֵצִֽים׃
Translated: And Araunah said to David, “Let my lord the king take it and offer up whatever he sees fit. Here are oxen for a burnt offering, and the threshing boards and the gear of the oxen for wood.
Transliteration: vayomer aravenah el-david yikach veyaal adoniy hamelekhe hatvov veeynav reeh havakar laolah vehamorigiym ukheley havakar laetsiym

Hebrew: הַכֹּ֗ל נָתַ֛ן אֲרַ֥וְנָה הַמֶּ֖לֶךְ לַמֶּ֑לֶךְ {ס} וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲרַ֙וְנָה֙ אֶל־הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ יִרְצֶֽךָ׃
Translated: All this, O king, Araunah gives to Your Majesty. And may the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God,” Araunah added, “respond to you with favor!”
Transliteration: hakhol natan aravenah hamelekhe lamelekhe {s} vayomer aravenah el-hamelekhe yehovah eloheykha yiretsekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר הַמֶּ֜לֶךְ אֶל־אֲרַ֗וְנָה לֹ֚א כִּֽי־קָנ֨וֹ אֶקְנֶ֤ה מֵאֽוֹתְךָ֙ בִּמְחִ֔יר וְלֹ֧א אַעֲלֶ֛ה לַיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהַ֖י עֹל֣וֹת חִנָּ֑ם וַיִּ֨קֶן דָּוִ֤ד אֶת־הַגֹּ֙רֶן֙ וְאֶת־הַבָּקָ֔ר בְּכֶ֖סֶף שְׁקָלִ֥ים חֲמִשִּֽׁים׃
Translated: But the king replied to Araunah, “No, I will buy them from you at a price. I cannot sacrifice to the E<small>TERNAL</small> my God burnt offerings that have cost me nothing.” So David bought the threshing floor and the oxen for fifty shekels of silver.
Transliteration: vayomer hamelekhe el-aravenah lo khiy-kanvo ekeneh mevotekha vimechiyr velo aaleh layhovah elohay olvot chinam vayiken david et-hagoren veet-havakar vekhesef shekaliym chamishiym

Hebrew: וַיִּ֩בֶן֩ שָׁ֨ם דָּוִ֤ד מִזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ לַיהֹוָ֔ה וַיַּ֥עַל עֹל֖וֹת וּשְׁלָמִ֑ים וַיֵּעָתֵ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ לָאָ֔רֶץ וַתֵּעָצַ֥ר הַמַּגֵּפָ֖ה מֵעַ֥ל יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: And David built there an altar to G<small>OD</small> and sacrificed burnt offerings and offerings of well-being. G<small>OD</small> responded to the plea for the land, and the plague against Israel was checked.
Transliteration: vayiven sham david mizevecha layhovah vayaal olvot ushelamiym vayeater yehovah laarets vateatsar hamagefah meal yisherael
